Original: Mog:I can feel it. There's a warrior nearby, kupo.
Dialogue: I can feel it. There's a warrior nearby, kupo.

Original: Hope:Is that him?
Dialogue: Is that him?

Original: ???:(A kid...and a girl with cat ears?)
Dialogue: (A kid...and a girl with cat ears?)

Original: Y'shtola:Do not be alarmed. We are not your foe.
Dialogue: Do not be alarmed. We are not your foe.

Original: ???:So you're the ones I keep hearing about.
Dialogue: So you're the ones I keep hearing about.

Original: Vivi:You've heard about us, Mister?
Dialogue: You've heard about us, Mister?

Original: ???:("Mister"? Give me a break.)
Dialogue: ("Mister"? Give me a break.)

Original: Squall:I'm Squall. My client told me about you.
Dialogue: I'm Squall. My client told me about you.

Original: Squall:Mentioned you're on a journey to seal the Torsions.
Dialogue: Mentioned you're on a journey to seal the Torsions.

Original: Warrior of Light:What is your purpose here?
Dialogue: What is your purpose here?

Original: Squall:I'm a mercenary.
Dialogue: I'm a mercenary.

Original: Squall:I've been tasked to investigate this cavern and eliminate any threat.
Dialogue: I've been tasked to investigate this cavern and eliminate any threat.

Original: Hope:All by yourself? I get that you're a soldier, but...
Dialogue: All by yourself? I get that you're a soldier, but...

Original: Squall:I can take care of myself.
Dialogue: I can take care of myself.

Original: Vivi:I guess he's not interested in joining us.
Dialogue: I guess he's not interested in joining us.

Original: Y'shtola:He is merely choosing not to get close to others.
Dialogue: He is merely choosing not to get close to others.

Original: Y'shtola:In any event, he bears the light, does he not?
Dialogue: In any event, he bears the light, does he not?

Original: Warrior of Light:More importantly, who is this client he spoke of?
Dialogue: More importantly, who is this client he spoke of?

Original: Mog:We'll just have to ask him ourselves, kupo!
Dialogue: We'll just have to ask him ourselves, kupo!

Original: Mog:Found you, kupo!
Dialogue: Found you, kupo!

Original: Squall:(They're still here?)
Dialogue: (They're still here?)

Original: Vivi:Squall, are you fighting all by yourself? Isn't that a little dangerous?
Dialogue: Squall, are you fighting all by yourself? Isn't that a little dangerous?

Original: Squall:You're the ones who need to be careful.
Dialogue: You're the ones who need to be careful.

Original: Squall:This isn't a place for amateurs.
Dialogue: This isn't a place for amateurs.

Original: Squall:You should get out of here before you get hurt.
Dialogue: You should get out of here before you get hurt.

Original: Sazh:Would it kill you to lighten up a bit?
Dialogue: Would it kill you to lighten up a bit?

Original: Rem:Squall, I'm a soldier just like you.
Dialogue: Squall, I'm a soldier just like you.

Original: Rem:Everyone here has their own reason for fighting. We know what we're doing.
Dialogue: Everyone here has their own reason for fighting. We know what we're doing.

Original: Cloud:Show off as much as you want, but we have some questions that need answers first.
Dialogue: Show off as much as you want, but we have some questions that need answers first.

Original: Squall:(Who's showing off?)
Dialogue: (Who's showing off?)

Original: Cloud:Who's your client? And how do they know about us?
Dialogue: Who's your client? And how do they know about us?

Original: Squall:That's confidential.
Dialogue: That's confidential.

Original: Sazh:I don't get you at all. What's with the attitude?
Dialogue: I don't get you at all. What's with the attitude?

Original: Squall:You're the ones not making any sense.
Dialogue: You're the ones not making any sense.

Original: Squall:You're risking your lives solely based on what that moogle told you.
Dialogue: You're risking your lives solely based on what that moogle told you.

Original: Squall:While in reality, you have no idea what's actually happening in this world right now.
Dialogue: While in reality, you have no idea what's actually happening in this world right now.

Original: Mog:I'm a messenger of the goddess Materia. It's my duty to protect the planet, kupo!
Dialogue: I'm a messenger of the goddess Materia. It's my duty to protect the planet, kupo!

Original: Cloud:We all have something we want to protect. Isn't that reason enough?
Dialogue: We all have something we want to protect. Isn't that reason enough?

Original: Squall:Something you want to protect...
Dialogue: Something you want to protect...

Original: Cloud:Anyway, sorry for stopping you. Later.
Dialogue: Anyway, sorry for stopping you. Later.

Original: Squall:Stop. You're no match for what's lurking around here.
Dialogue: Stop. You're no match for what's lurking around here.

Original: Vivi:But it's way too dangerous for you to go alone too.
Dialogue: But it's way too dangerous for you to go alone too.

Original: Squall:If you're scared, you can stay close to me. Just don't get in my way.
Dialogue: If you're scared, you can stay close to me. Just don't get in my way.

Original: Rem:So you'll join us then?
Dialogue: So you'll join us then?

Original: Squall:I didn't say that. But I'll help you out while you're here.
Dialogue: I didn't say that. But I'll help you out while you're here.

Original: Squall:Come on, let's go. Things should be easier now that I'm with you.
Dialogue: Come on, let's go. Things should be easier now that I'm with you.

Original: Tifa:Looks like we made it.
Dialogue: Looks like we made it.

Original: Vivi:It feels good to be outside again.
Dialogue: It feels good to be outside again.

Original: Squall:Don't relax just yet. We still have to make it through the forest before we reach our destination.
Dialogue: Don't relax just yet. We still have to make it through the forest before we reach our destination.

Original: Hope:You really know your way around here, don't you?
Dialogue: You really know your way around here, don't you?

Original: Squall:I'm just going by the information I received from my client. Anyway, be careful. There are monsters up ahead.
Dialogue: I'm just going by the information I received from my client. Anyway, be careful. There are monsters up ahead.

Original: Rem:Sounds like he's really familiar with the area. It's nice having someone you can count on.
Dialogue: Sounds like he's really familiar with the area. It's nice having someone you can count on.

Original: Squall:I never said I trusted him. I'm simply relaying what I was told.
Dialogue: I never said I trusted him. I'm simply relaying what I was told.

Original: Rem:You're risking your life for a client you don't even trust?
Dialogue: You're risking your life for a client you don't even trust?

Original: Squall:...I needed a purpose. I was lost.
Dialogue: ...I needed a purpose. I was lost.

Original: Squall:That's when he came along. Told me he needed my help.
Dialogue: That's when he came along. Told me he needed my help.

Original: Squall:Didn't even ask who I was or where I came from.
Dialogue: Didn't even ask who I was or where I came from.

Original: Hope:So you only trust him because you're contractually obligated...
Dialogue: So you only trust him because you're contractually obligated...

Original: Squall:But I don't think my client would lie since he's counting on my success.
Dialogue: But I don't think my client would lie since he's counting on my success.

Original: Squall:In that sense, I trust him. That's all.
Dialogue: In that sense, I trust him. That's all.

Original: Tifa:Sounds like you've got a lot on your mind. Reminds me of someone else I know.
Dialogue: Sounds like you've got a lot on your mind. Reminds me of someone else I know.

Original: Squall:(Hmph... You don't know me.)
Dialogue: (Hmph... You don't know me.)

Original: Tifa:He can also be a bit awkward.
Dialogue: He can also be a bit awkward.

Original: Hope:Is that being awkward?
Dialogue: Is that being awkward?

Original: Rem:Everyone has a different way of looking at things. That's what makes us unique.
Dialogue: Everyone has a different way of looking at things. That's what makes us unique.

Original: Vivi:Yeah, exactly.
Dialogue: Yeah, exactly.

Original: Squall:...Come on.
Dialogue: ...Come on.

Original: Squall:Let's get out of here before any more monsters show up.
Dialogue: Let's get out of here before any more monsters show up.

Original: Tifa:Yeah, good idea.
Dialogue: Yeah, good idea.

Original: Cloud:He's going to get himself killed if he keeps this up.
Dialogue: He's going to get himself killed if he keeps this up.

Original: Y'shtola:You refer to Squall.
Dialogue: You refer to Squall.

Original: Rem:You're really worried about him, aren't you?
Dialogue: You're really worried about him, aren't you?

Original: Cloud:No, I'm worried about us.
Dialogue: No, I'm worried about us.

Original: Cloud:Who knows where this so-called client is taking us.
Dialogue: Who knows where this so-called client is taking us.

Original: Cloud:And the farther we go, the more monsters there are.
Dialogue: And the farther we go, the more monsters there are.

Original: Hope:What do you think we should do then? I mean, he seems to be avoiding talking to us.
Dialogue: What do you think we should do then? I mean, he seems to be avoiding talking to us.

Original: Tifa:Yeah, but it's not like we can pretend everything's okay.
Dialogue: Yeah, but it's not like we can pretend everything's okay.

Original: Rem:Do you think we can get him to change his mind?
Dialogue: Do you think we can get him to change his mind?

Original: Y'shtola:That may prove to be difficult. To him, the mission is everything.
Dialogue: That may prove to be difficult. To him, the mission is everything.

Original: Y'shtola:He is not going to turn back until the investigation is complete.
Dialogue: He is not going to turn back until the investigation is complete.

Original: Rem:Squall is one of us. We can't just abandon him.
Dialogue: Squall is one of us. We can't just abandon him.

Original: Tifa:Then I guess we need to see this through until the end, huh?
Dialogue: Then I guess we need to see this through until the end, huh?

Original: Hope:I was about to say the same thing. ...But what about you, Cloud?
Dialogue: I was about to say the same thing. ...But what about you, Cloud?

Original: Cloud:I never said we should turn back. I was just saying we need to be more cautious.
Dialogue: I never said we should turn back. I was just saying we need to be more cautious.

Original: Tifa:...He said cautiously.
Dialogue: ...He said cautiously.

Original: Cloud:What's that supposed to mean?
Dialogue: What's that supposed to mean?

Original: Tifa:Nothing. Cautious is good.
Dialogue: Nothing. Cautious is good.

Original: Rem:I'm sure there's a reason Squall's in such a hurry.
Dialogue: I'm sure there's a reason Squall's in such a hurry.

Original: Y'shtola:Any clue why?
Dialogue: Any clue why?

Original: Rem:He said he needed a purpose.
Dialogue: He said he needed a purpose.

Original: Rem:So maybe he's trying to make something of himselftrying to find his identity.
Dialogue: So maybe he's trying to make something of himself—trying to find his identity.

Original: Y'shtola:So even Squall has worries.
Dialogue: So even Squall has worries.

Original: Hope:I hope there's something we can do to help.
Dialogue: I hope there's something we can do to help.

Original: Tifa:Yeah, come on, we have to be there for him.
Dialogue: Yeah, come on, we have to be there for him.

Original: Cloud:...Not interested.
Dialogue: ...Not interested.

Original: Tifa:Yeah, yeah. You keep telling yourself that.
Dialogue: Yeah, yeah. You keep telling yourself that.

Original: Rem:Hey, Squall? You're here on a mission, right?
Dialogue: Hey, Squall? You're here on a mission, right?

Original: Rem:You don't need to report back to your client or anything?
Dialogue: You don't need to report back to your client or anything?

Original: Squall:My client is only interested in the Torsions.
Dialogue: My client is only interested in the Torsions.

Original: Squall:How I handle the mission is up to me. That's why I chose to accompany you.
Dialogue: How I handle the mission is up to me. That's why I chose to accompany you.

Original: Y'shtola:And yet you continue to conceal your client's identity.
Dialogue: And yet you continue to conceal your client's identity.

Original: Squall:Like I said
Dialogue: Like I said—

Original: Y'shtola:"That's confidential."
Dialogue: "That's confidential."

Original: Y'shtola:You fear growing close to others.
Dialogue: You fear growing close to others.

Original: Y'shtola:But I sense the good in youa desire to protect and a great inner zeal.
Dialogue: But I sense the good in you—a desire to protect and a great inner zeal.

Original: Hope:Is everything okay? Everyone's already heading to the next area.
Dialogue: Is everything okay? Everyone's already heading to the next area.

Original: Rem:Sorry, we'll be right there.
Dialogue: Sorry, we'll be right there.

Original: Y'shtola:I expect great things from you, Squall.
Dialogue: I expect great things from you, Squall.

Original: Hope:Um, do you have a second?
Dialogue: Um, do you have a second?

Original: Hope:I was thinking about what you said earlier.
Dialogue: I was thinking about what you said earlier.

Original: Hope:Mog told us that sealing the Torsions would protect this world.
Dialogue: Mog told us that sealing the Torsions would protect this world.

Original: Hope:And as a result, save our worlds as well.
Dialogue: And as a result, save our worlds as well.

Original: Squall:That's the idea.
Dialogue: That's the idea.

Original: Squall:But there's no way to find out for sure until we return home.
Dialogue: But there's no way to find out for sure until we return home.

Original: Hope:I want to know the truth. I want to know what's really happening.
Dialogue: I want to know the truth. I want to know what's really happening.

Original: Squall:Sorry, but I don't have all the answers either.
Dialogue: Sorry, but I don't have all the answers either.

Original: Hope:Then why are you fighting? I'm sure you're not just following orders.
Dialogue: Then why are you fighting? I'm sure you're not just following orders.

Original: Squall:I don't fight for some great cause like saving the world or anything.
Dialogue: I don't fight for some great cause like saving the world or anything.

Original: Squall:I'm just trying to survive to see my friends again. That's all.
Dialogue: I'm just trying to survive to see my friends again. That's all.

Original: Hope:They must mean a lot to you.
Dialogue: They must mean a lot to you.

Original: Squall:Yeah. Now come on, let's go. You need my help, right?
Dialogue: Yeah. Now come on, let's go. You need my help, right?

Original: Hope:To be reunited with your friends, huh?
Dialogue: To be reunited with your friends, huh?

Original: Hope:Maybe I just need to keep my eyes front. There's no going back after all.
Dialogue: Maybe I just need to keep my eyes front. There's no going back after all.

Original: Mog:Kupo?
Dialogue: Kupo?

Original: Y'shtola:Aye, how peculiar.
Dialogue: Aye, how peculiar.

Original: Sazh:Something the matter? I thought we were almost out of here.
Dialogue: Something the matter? I thought we were almost out of here.

Original: Y'shtola:We would be if this were a normal forest.
Dialogue: We would be if this were a normal forest.

Original: Tifa:Wait, are you saying it's not?
Dialogue: Wait, are you saying it's not?

Original: Mog:It's almost like we're trapped inside, kupo.
Dialogue: It's almost like we're trapped inside, kupo.

Original: Hope:We're trapped? You mean we can't leave!?
Dialogue: We're trapped? You mean we can't leave!?

Original: Y'shtola:Rather, we are not allowed to leave.
Dialogue: Rather, we are not allowed to leave.

Original: Sazh:I'm not followin' you.
Dialogue: I'm not followin' you.

Original: Tifa:You mean someone intentionally trapped us in here?
Dialogue: You mean someone intentionally trapped us in here?

Original: Y'shtola:Or perhaps "something." Escaping may prove to be quite arduous.
Dialogue: Or perhaps "something." Escaping may prove to be quite arduous.

Original: Mog:Someone's in trouble, kupo!
Dialogue: Someone's in trouble, kupo!

Original: Hope:That voice! Is that!?
Dialogue: That voice! Is that—!?

Original: Sazh:Hope! *Sigh* Can't take your eyes off him for a second.
Dialogue: Hope! *Sigh* Can't take your eyes off him for a second.

Original: Tifa:C'mon, we have to go after him!
Dialogue: C'mon, we have to go after him!

Original: Warrior of Light:It appears that was the last of them.
Dialogue: It appears that was the last of them.

Original: ???:I mean, you're not one of the bad guys...right?
Dialogue: I mean, you're not one of the bad guys...right?

Original: Warrior of Light:We bear no animosity toward those who wish us no harm.
Dialogue: We bear no animosity toward those who wish us no harm.

Original: Warrior of Light:Are you hurt?
Dialogue: Are you hurt?

Original: ???:I'm fine. That was a close one! By the way...who are you guys?
Dialogue: I'm fine. That was a close one! By the way...who are you guys?

Original: Hope:It looks like there aren't any more monsters here. Vanille, are you okay?
Dialogue: It looks like there aren't any more monsters here. Vanille, are you okay?

Original: Sazh:Man, kids these days think they'e invincible. Glad you're okay though.
Dialogue: Man, kids these days think they'e invincible. Glad you're okay though.

Original: Vanille:Hope! Sazh!
Dialogue: Hope! Sazh!

Original: Mog:You're friends? Introduce us, kupo!
Dialogue: You're friends? Introduce us, kupo!

Original: Hope:She's a friend from back home.
Dialogue: She's a friend from back home.

Original: Vanille:I'm Vanille. Nice to meet you.
Dialogue: I'm Vanille. Nice to meet you.

Original: Vanille:So...where are we?
Dialogue: So...where are we?

Original: Mog:Come on, I'll explain on the way, kupo!
Dialogue: Come on, I'll explain on the way, kupo!

Original: Vanille:Wait... Do you mean I can come with you?
Dialogue: Wait... Do you mean I can come with you?

Original: Warrior of Light:It is far too dangerous for you to travel alone. You may accompany us until we reach a safe
Dialogue: It is far too dangerous for you to travel alone. You may accompany us until we reach a safe—

Original: Mog:You also bear the light, kupo! You should come with us!
Dialogue: You also bear the light, kupo! You should come with us!

Original: Vanille:The light? Hold on. Is that a moogle?
Dialogue: The light? Hold on. Is that a moogle?

Original: Sazh:What can I say? You've missed out on a lot. But for now, we could really use your help.
Dialogue: What can I say? You've missed out on a lot. But for now, we could really use your help.

Original: Vanille:Really? Count me in.
Dialogue: Really? Count me in.

Original: Mog:You can trust me, kupo!
Dialogue: You can trust me, kupo!

Original: Vanille:A friend of Sazh and Hope's is a friend of mine.
Dialogue: A friend of Sazh and Hope's is a friend of mine.

Original: Y'shtola:What a peculiar girl.
Dialogue: What a peculiar girl.

Original: Sazh:For real? What's so weird about trusting others?
Dialogue: For real? What's so weird about trusting others?

Original: Y'shtola:I do not think it a bad thing.
Dialogue: I do not think it a bad thing.

Original: Y'shtola:In any event, the force preventing us from leaving the forest has weakened.
Dialogue: In any event, the force preventing us from leaving the forest has weakened.

Original: Vanille:We're leaving already? But there are still areas I haven't checked out yet.
Dialogue: We're leaving already? But there are still areas I haven't checked out yet.

Original: Vanille:This forest is huge! Who knows what wonderful treasures await us? Besides, I feel like something's calling me!
Dialogue: This forest is huge! Who knows what wonderful treasures await us? Besides, I feel like something's calling me!

Original: Sazh:And if we get lost? Then what? Listen, we need to regroup and Aw, forget it. You've already made up your mind.
Dialogue: And if we get lost? Then what? Listen, we need to regroup and— Aw, forget it. You've already made up your mind.

Original: Vanille:I knew you'd understand, Sazh. All right then, let the treasure hunt begin!
Dialogue: I knew you'd understand, Sazh. All right then, let the treasure hunt begin!

Original: Vanille:Hey, so... Is someone going to tell me where we are yet?
Dialogue: Hey, so... Is someone going to tell me where we are yet?

Original: Cecil:We still owe you an explanation, don't we?
Dialogue: We still owe you an explanation, don't we?

Original: Mog:Oh yeah, kupo! Allow me to explain.
Dialogue: Oh yeah, kupo! Allow me to explain.

Original: Mog:This is an illusionary world created by the gods, but it's being corrupted by the Torsions.
Dialogue: This is an illusionary world created by the gods, but it's being corrupted by the Torsions.

Original: Mog:That's why I'm on a journey to make friends with those who are blessed with the light to save it.
Dialogue: That's why I'm on a journey to make friends with those who are blessed with the light to save it.

Original: Cecil:Those Torsions threaten to erode each of our worlds as well.
Dialogue: Those Torsions threaten to erode each of our worlds as well.

Original: Mog:Exactly! Which is why this is such an important journey for us all, kupo!
Dialogue: Exactly! Which is why this is such an important journey for us all, kupo!

Original: Vanille:I get that something has to be done...
Dialogue: I get that something has to be done...

Original: Vanille:But why would such powerful gods need our help to fix things?
Dialogue: But why would such powerful gods need our help to fix things?

Original: Yuna:Now that you mention it... If our worlds really are in trouble, why would we need to come here to save them?
Dialogue: Now that you mention it... If our worlds really are in trouble, why would we need to come here to save them?

Original: Mog:Because the gods aren't all-powerful and in control of everything, kupo.
Dialogue: Because the gods aren't all-powerful and in control of everything, kupo.

Original: Mog:Besides, it's not like they created this world to be destroyed. They made it for a reason.
Dialogue: Besides, it's not like they created this world to be destroyed. They made it for a reason.

Original: Mog:That's why we desperately need your help to save it, kupo.
Dialogue: That's why we desperately need your help to save it, kupo.

Original: Vanille:Hm... Alright then.
Dialogue: Hm... Alright then.

Original: Mog:Does it make sense now, kupo?
Dialogue: Does it make sense now, kupo?

Original: Vanille:Nope! But at least I'm certain it doesn't make sense now.
Dialogue: Nope! But at least I'm certain it doesn't make sense now.

Original: Yuna:For now, I guess all we can do is focus on what's in front of us. We have to seal the Torsions.
Dialogue: For now, I guess all we can do is focus on what's in front of us. We have to seal the Torsions.

Original: Vivi:Yeah, we don't have any other choice if we want to protect our homes.
Dialogue: Yeah, we don't have any other choice if we want to protect our homes.

Original: Vanille:Huh... So that's what this is all about.
Dialogue: Huh... So that's what this is all about.

Original: Mog:Yep! So there's no time to waste, kupo!
Dialogue: Yep! So there's no time to waste, kupo!

Original: Vanille:...Okay, ready to go then?
Dialogue: ...Okay, ready to go then?

Original: Vivi:Let's be careful we don't get lost.
Dialogue: Let's be careful we don't get lost.

Original: Cecil:Mog, lead the way, if you could.
Dialogue: Mog, lead the way, if you could.

Original: Yuna:We're counting on you.
Dialogue: We're counting on you.

Original: Mog:Kupo!? R-right this way.
Dialogue: Kupo!? R-right this way.

Original: Vanille:Things don't always go as planned...even for gods, huh?
Dialogue: Things don't always go as planned...even for gods, huh?

Original: Vanille:I know the feeling.
Dialogue: I know the feeling.

Original: Vanille:...I really hope there's some way I can help save this world.
Dialogue: ...I really hope there's some way I can help save this world.

Original: Yda:Hrm. This forest truly is confounding.
Dialogue: Hrm. This forest truly is confounding.

Original: Vanille:But you sound like you might know where we are!
Dialogue: But you sound like you might know where we are!

Original: Yda:Well, I could bring us back to whence we started. I've trekked through a wood or two in my day.
Dialogue: Well, I could bring us back to whence we started. I've trekked through a wood or two in my day.

Original: Yuffie:What a relief. I'd hate to get stuck here forever.
Dialogue: What a relief. I'd hate to get stuck here forever.

Original: Rem:Are you okay? You can wait outside the forest if you're worried about getting lost.
Dialogue: Are you okay? You can wait outside the forest if you're worried about getting lost.

Original: Yuffie:And let you hog all the treasure? Not a chance.
Dialogue: And let you hog all the treasure? Not a chance.

Original: Yuffie:The treasure you told us about! You said it was callin' you.
Dialogue: The treasure you told us about! You said it was callin' you.

Original: Vanille:Oh yeah... I guess I did say something like that.
Dialogue: Oh yeah... I guess I did say something like that.

Original: Yuffie:Must be something amazing for you to feel it calling you from so far away.
Dialogue: Must be something amazing for you to feel it calling you from so far away.

Original: Rem:I just hope it's nothing dangerous.
Dialogue: I just hope it's nothing dangerous.

Original: Vanille:Well, uh... Let's hope for the best!
Dialogue: Well, uh... Let's hope for the best!

Original: Yuffie:C'mon, have some faith! You're the one who brought it up, after all.
Dialogue: C'mon, have some faith! You're the one who brought it up, after all.

Original: Vanille:Well, it's true I feel like something's calling me.
Dialogue: Well, it's true I feel like something's calling me.

Original: Yda:Perhaps that something is why we couldn't leave the forest earlier.
Dialogue: Perhaps that something is why we couldn't leave the forest earlier.

Original: Vanille:I guess we'll soon find out.
Dialogue: I guess we'll soon find out.

Original: Yda:That we will! Whatever it is, I just hope it's not alive!
Dialogue: That we will! Whatever it is, I just hope it's not alive!

Original: Rem:You two are starting to scare me.
Dialogue: You two are starting to scare me.

Original: Yuffie:Yeah, maybe I will go back and wait.
Dialogue: Yeah, maybe I will go back and wait.

Original: Vanille:Come on, we've come this far. Let's see this through together.
Dialogue: Come on, we've come this far. Let's see this through together.

Original: Yuffie:Y-you're just trying to trick me into taking point, aren't you!
Dialogue: Y-you're just trying to trick me into taking point, aren't you!

Original: Y'shtola:Everyone has become rather comfortable around each other, haven't they?
Dialogue: Everyone has become rather comfortable around each other, haven't they?

Original: Edge:You won't hear me complain.
Dialogue: You won't hear me complain.

Original: Y'shtola:Why don't you join them?
Dialogue: Why don't you join them?

Original: Edge:Sometimes it's nice to just sit back and enjoy the view.
Dialogue: Sometimes it's nice to just sit back and enjoy the view.

Original: Edge:Gotta let the ladies have their fun, you know?
Dialogue: Gotta let the ladies have their fun, you know?

Original: Y'shtola:...Aren't we the noble one?
Dialogue: ...Aren't we the noble one?

Original: Rem:This pendant's drawing in mana. Maybe this was what trapped us in the forest?
Dialogue: This pendant's drawing in mana. Maybe this was what trapped us in the forest?

Original: Vivi:It's kind of creepy. I don't like it.
Dialogue: It's kind of creepy. I don't like it.

Original: Rem:Yeah, we should probably leave it alone.
Dialogue: Yeah, we should probably leave it alone.

Original: Vanille:What are you two whispering about? Hey, check it out!
Dialogue: What are you two whispering about? Hey, check it out!

Original: Vanille:So? How does it look?
Dialogue: So? How does it look?

Original: Vivi:What are you doing!?
Dialogue: What are you doing!?

Original: Vanille:What do you mean?
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Original: Rem:Huh? What happened to the dark aura?
Dialogue: Huh? What happened to the dark aura?

Original: Vivi:It's gone... But why?
Dialogue: It's gone... But why?

Original: Vanille:"Dark aura"? What are you talking about? It's just a cute pendant. See?
Dialogue: "Dark aura"? What are you talking about? It's just a cute pendant. See?

Original: Mog:They say some items in this world choose their owner. It looks like that one has taken a liking to you, kupo.
Dialogue: They say some items in this world choose their owner. It looks like that one has taken a liking to you, kupo.

Original: Sazh:Or maybe you scared off the "dark aura" with your rainbows-and-sunshine attitude.
Dialogue: Or maybe you scared off the "dark aura" with your rainbows-and-sunshine attitude.

Original: Vanille:Sazh, maybe it's your turn to wear this pendant. Let's see how the dark aura likes you!
Dialogue: Sazh, maybe it's your turn to wear this pendant. Let's see how the dark aura likes you!

Original: Sazh:Okay, okay! You win. You know magic and I don't get along.
Dialogue: Okay, okay! You win. You know magic and I don't get along.

Original: Y'shtola:Not a terribly adventurous spirit, I see.
Dialogue: Not a terribly adventurous spirit, I see.

Original: Sazh:You can't afford to take any chances at my age.
Dialogue: You can't afford to take any chances at my age.

Original: Vanille:You take chances all the time though. Especially when it involves your family.
Dialogue: You take chances all the time though. Especially when it involves your family.

Original: Sazh:Guess we're not that different then, huh?
Dialogue: Guess we're not that different then, huh?

Original: Vanille:Yeah... I wonder how everyone's doing back home.
Dialogue: Yeah... I wonder how everyone's doing back home.

Original: Rem:Well, you were reunited with Sazh and Hope in this world.
Dialogue: Well, you were reunited with Sazh and Hope in this world.

Original: Rem:Who knows? Maybe it won't be long before you see your family again, too.
Dialogue: Who knows? Maybe it won't be long before you see your family again, too.

Original: Y'shtola:Aye, now is not the time for sorrow.
Dialogue: Aye, now is not the time for sorrow.

Original: Vanille:Was it that obvious? You're right. I shouldn't worry.
Dialogue: Was it that obvious? You're right. I shouldn't worry.

Original: Vivi:Besides, you have us now. We're here for you.
Dialogue: Besides, you have us now. We're here for you.

Original: Vanille:Thank you so much! I'm looking forward to getting to know you all.
Dialogue: Thank you so much! I'm looking forward to getting to know you all.

Original: ???:Grasslands as far as the eye can see and not a casino or pub in sight. Wish there was at least a beautiful lady to keep me company.
Dialogue: Grasslands as far as the eye can see and not a casino or pub in sight. Wish there was at least a beautiful lady to keep me company.

Original: ???:If only I had my airship.
Dialogue: If only I had my airship.

Original: Mog:Kupo! I can sense the light coming from that man!
Dialogue: Kupo! I can sense the light coming from that man!

Original: Setzer:Heh, wasn't expecting to run into you guys here.
Dialogue: Heh, wasn't expecting to run into you guys here.

Original: Shadow:Setzer, you too? How long have you been in this world?
Dialogue: Setzer, you too? How long have you been in this world?

Original: Setzer:What do you mean "this world"?
Dialogue: What do you mean "this world"?

Original: Shadow:This moogle knows more about it than I do. He can fill you in.
Dialogue: This moogle knows more about it than I do. He can fill you in.

Original: Mog:Leave it to me, kupo!
Dialogue: Leave it to me, kupo!

Original: Setzer:Whew... Sounds like I've gotten myself in a real mess this time.
Dialogue: Whew... Sounds like I've gotten myself in a real mess this time.

Original: Setzer:And you say you want me to help you save the world?
Dialogue: And you say you want me to help you save the world?

Original: Hope:That's right.
Dialogue: That's right.

Original: Terra:The world will be destroyed if we don't do something. Setzer, please come with us.
Dialogue: The world will be destroyed if we don't do something. Setzer, please come with us.

Original: Setzer:Thanks, but no thanks.
Dialogue: Thanks, but no thanks.

Original: Mog:Kupo!? Why?
Dialogue: Kupo!? Why?

Original: Setzer:No casinos, no pubs... There's nothing to live for here, so why risk my life?
Dialogue: No casinos, no pubs... There's nothing to live for here, so why risk my life?

Original: Mog:Awww, kupo...
Dialogue: Awww, kupo...

Original: Setzer:I'm a wandering gambler. I do what I want, going wherever the wind takes me.
Dialogue: I'm a wandering gambler. I do what I want, going wherever the wind takes me.

Original: Shadow:Hmph. You never change, even if the world does.
Dialogue: Hmph. You never change, even if the world does.

Original: Setzer:Life is a series of gambles. You've gotta go with your gut.
Dialogue: Life is a series of gambles. You've gotta go with your gut.

Original: Setzer:I just want to be the one who rolls the dice.
Dialogue: I just want to be the one who rolls the dice.

Original: Mog:Why do you have to be so difficult, kupo?
Dialogue: Why do you have to be so difficult, kupo?

Original: Setzer:Well, good luck with that saving the world thing. Who knows? Maybe we'll meet again one day.
Dialogue: Well, good luck with that saving the world thing. Who knows? Maybe we'll meet again one day.

Original: Hope:What a mysterious person. Are you sure we can trust him?
Dialogue: What a mysterious person. Are you sure we can trust him?

Original: Shadow:He would no doubt be an excellent addition to our cause.
Dialogue: He would no doubt be an excellent addition to our cause.

Original: Shadow:Perhaps an airship really could tilt things in our favor.
Dialogue: Perhaps an airship really could tilt things in our favor.

Original: ???:Well, I'm impressed.
Dialogue: Well, I'm impressed.

Original: Setzer:I watched you take care of those monsters.
Dialogue: I watched you take care of those monsters.

Original: Mog:You're back, kupo! It's nice to see you again!
Dialogue: You're back, kupo! It's nice to see you again!

Original: Warrior of Light:Setzer, was it? Have you decided to accept our proposal?
Dialogue: Setzer, was it? Have you decided to accept our proposal?

Original: Setzer:Not quite. I'm just trying to figure something out.
Dialogue: Not quite. I'm just trying to figure something out.

Original: Hope:What do you mean?
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Original: Setzer:Why do you fight? What are you risking your lives for?
Dialogue: Why do you fight? What are you risking your lives for?

Original: Setzer:There's not a single town or person in this world. Nothing here's worth fighting for.
Dialogue: There's not a single town or person in this world. Nothing here's worth fighting for.

Original: Warrior of Light:We are no different from youwarriors from another world.
Dialogue: We are no different from you—warriors from another world.

Original: Warrior of Light:Naturally, we all have homes we must return to and dreams yet to be fulfilled. Surely that is worth fighting for.
Dialogue: Naturally, we all have homes we must return to and dreams yet to be fulfilled. Surely that is worth fighting for.

Original: Setzer:Chasing after your dreams, huh?
Dialogue: Chasing after your dreams, huh?

Original: Yuffie:Exactly! Take me for example. My dream's to one day steal enough treasure to restore glory to my village!
Dialogue: Exactly! Take me for example. My dream's to one day steal enough treasure to restore glory to my village!

Original: Vivi:When I get home, I wanna go to the theater and watch plays every day.
Dialogue: When I get home, I wanna go to the theater and watch plays every day.

Original: Hope:No matter what happens, I can't let myself give upfor the sake of my friends and for myself as well. I'm using this opportunity to get stronger.
Dialogue: No matter what happens, I can't let myself give up—for the sake of my friends and for myself as well. I'm using this opportunity to get stronger.

Original: Warrior of Light:We continue our journey because each of us has something we're looking to accomplish. Is that not enough?
Dialogue: We continue our journey because each of us has something we're looking to accomplish. Is that not enough?

Original: Setzer:All right, you've got me.
Dialogue: All right, you've got me.

Original: Setzer:I mean, why not? Consider my life a chip in your pile.
Dialogue: I mean, why not? Consider my life a chip in your pile.

Original: Terra:Do you mean...!?
Dialogue: Do you mean...!?

Original: Setzer:What you said reminded me that I still have a dream like no other. I was a fool.
Dialogue: What you said reminded me that I still have a dream like no other. I was a fool.

Original: Setzer:Sitting around isn't gonna solve anything. You know, sometimes you've just gotta roll the dice and hope for the best.
Dialogue: Sitting around isn't gonna solve anything. You know, sometimes you've just gotta roll the dice and hope for the best.

Original: Yuffie:I didn't even get half of that, but you sounded cool to me!
Dialogue: I didn't even get half of that, but you sounded cool to me!

Original: Setzer:I'm a gambler. Deception is but one of my many talents. I'll show you just how rewarding my skills can be in battle.
Dialogue: I'm a gambler. Deception is but one of my many talents. I'll show you just how rewarding my skills can be in battle.

Original: Warrior of Light:We are counting on you.
Dialogue: We are counting on you.

Original: Hope:Yeah, we really appreciate the help.
Dialogue: Yeah, we really appreciate the help.

Original: Mog:Thanks, everybody, for getting him onboard, kupo!
Dialogue: Thanks, everybody, for getting him onboard, kupo!

Original: Setzer:I can't wait. What could be more exciting than gambling with your own life?
Dialogue: I can't wait. What could be more exciting than gambling with your own life?

Original: Vivi:What's wrong?
Dialogue: What's wrong?

Original: Setzer:Ever since I came here, all I've done is fight.
Dialogue: Ever since I came here, all I've done is fight.

Original: Setzer:Nothing wrong with that, but I have to wonder if there isn't anything else in this world to do for fun.
Dialogue: Nothing wrong with that, but I have to wonder if there isn't anything else in this world to do for fun.

Original: Mog:For fun? Our company isn't fun enough, kupo?
Dialogue: For fun? Our company isn't fun enough, kupo?

Original: Setzer:That's not what I meant. I'm talking about entertainmentgambling, games, you know?
Dialogue: That's not what I meant. I'm talking about entertainment—gambling, games, you know?

Original: Steiner:...Shooting what?
Dialogue: ...Shooting what?

Original: Tifa:Shooting Coaster. You ride in a cart that zooms down a track full of twists and turns.
Dialogue: Shooting Coaster. You ride in a cart that zooms down a track full of twists and turns.

Original: Setzer:Zooms, eh? That does sound like fun.
Dialogue: Zooms, eh? That does sound like fun.

Original: Cloud:...It's not for everyone.
Dialogue: ...It's not for everyone.

Original: Tifa:Oh, uh... Yeah... Not if you're prone to nausea.
Dialogue: Oh, uh... Yeah... Not if you're prone to nausea.

Original: Vivi:Theater plays are probably the most fun in our world, right?
Dialogue: Theater plays are probably the most fun in our world, right?

Original: Setzer:Theater and card games, huh? Your world sounds a lot like mine.
Dialogue: Theater and card games, huh? Your world sounds a lot like mine.

Original: Cloud:So what's your idea of fun?
Dialogue: So what's your idea of fun?

Original: Setzer:Gamblingyou could say it's what I live for.
Dialogue: Gambling—you could say it's what I live for.

Original: Setzer:I used to play all night at my casino against the top gamblers from around the world.
Dialogue: I used to play all night at my casino against the top gamblers from around the world.

Original: Tifa:"At my..."? You run a casino!?
Dialogue: "At my..."? You run a casino!?

Original: Setzer:I would love for you to come see it when this is all over.
Dialogue: I would love for you to come see it when this is all over.

Original: Mog:It's too bad we still haven't found a casino in this world, kupo...
Dialogue: It's too bad we still haven't found a casino in this world, kupo...

Original: Setzer:The sky is as vast as in any world...
Dialogue: The sky is as vast as in any world...

Original: Setzer:I'd be tearing it up if I only had my wings... Heh.
Dialogue: I'd be tearing it up if I only had my wings... Heh.

Original: Yda:Ah, there he is! Hey! Setzer!
Dialogue: Ah, there he is! Hey! Setzer!

Original: Edge:What's with the moping? Come on, let's go.
Dialogue: What's with the moping? Come on, let's go.

Original: Setzer:See that bird looking down on us?
Dialogue: See that bird looking down on us?

Original: Edge:Yeah? So what?
Dialogue: Yeah? So what?

Original: Setzer:Surrendering itself to the wind, hovering in the skywe're on the same planet, yet we live in different worlds.
Dialogue: Surrendering itself to the wind, hovering in the sky—we're on the same planet, yet we live in different worlds.

Original: Yda:Is it just me or is he acting unusually sentimental?
Dialogue: Is it just me or is he acting unusually sentimental?

Original: Edge:You think he ate something funny?
Dialogue: You think he ate something funny?

Original: Yang:Is everything okay?
Dialogue: Is everything okay?

Original: Laguna:What's the holdup, folks?
Dialogue: What's the holdup, folks?

Original: Yda:Setzer has got the blues, if you can believe that!
Dialogue: Setzer has got the blues, if you can believe that!

Original: Setzer:I'm just tired of treading this earth.
Dialogue: I'm just tired of treading this earth.

Original: Laguna:Wh-whoa! Don't tell me you're gonna jump off that cliff!
Dialogue: Wh-whoa! Don't tell me you're gonna jump off that cliff!

Original: Yang:Setzer, you're not thinking straight! If you need to talk, I'm here for you!
Dialogue: Setzer, you're not thinking straight! If you need to talk, I'm here for you!

Original: Setzer:...That's not what I meant.
Dialogue: ...That's not what I meant.

Original: Laguna:Oh, really? Man, don't startle me like that.
Dialogue: Oh, really? Man, don't startle me like that.

Original: Yang:Let's go back to camp. Mog is waiting for us.
Dialogue: Let's go back to camp. Mog is waiting for us.

Original: Setzer:I'll find a way back and make our wish come true.
Dialogue: I'll find a way back and make our wish come true.

Original: Hope:It looks like we've sealed all the Torsions in this area.
Dialogue: It looks like we've sealed all the Torsions in this area.

Original: Sazh:Then let's fly outta here!
Dialogue: Then let's fly outta here!

Original: Vaan:Hey Sazh, let me take a turn at the wheel for once!
Dialogue: Hey Sazh, let me take a turn at the wheel for once!

Original: Sazh:Not in a million years, kid.
Dialogue: Not in a million years, kid.

Original: Setzer:Hold up, old man.
Dialogue: Hold up, old man.

Original: Sazh:Old man? You talkin' about me?
Dialogue: Old man? You talkin' about me?

Original: Hope:Who else would he be talking about?
Dialogue: Who else would he be talking about?

Original: Setzer:Did you just say "airship"? You have one?
Dialogue: Did you just say "airship"? You have one?

Original: Sazh:Of course, I do! You're lookin' at the best pilot this world's ever seen.
Dialogue: Of course, I do! You're lookin' at the best pilot this world's ever seen.

Original: Setzer:I thought you were just some guy in a strange getup from another world, but it looks like we're one and the same after all.
Dialogue: I thought you were just some guy in a strange getup from another world, but it looks like we're one and the same after all.

Original: Sazh:What do you mean "one and the same"?
Dialogue: What do you mean "one and the same"?

Original: Vaan:Wait... Setzer, you're a pilot, too?
Dialogue: Wait... Setzer, you're a pilot, too?

Original: Sazh:What, you too!?
Dialogue: What, you too!?

Original: Hope:I thought you were a gambler, not a pilot.
Dialogue: I thought you were a gambler, not a pilot.

Original: Setzer:Don't get me wrong. I do love gamblingto the point that I even built a casino on my airship.
Dialogue: Don't get me wrong. I do love gambling—to the point that I even built a casino on my airship.

Original: Setzer:But that's not my calling. What I want most is to be the fastest thing soaring across the wide blue yonder.
Dialogue: But that's not my calling. What I want most is to be the fastest thing soaring across the wide blue yonder.

Original: Vaan:I know what you mean. One day, I want to be the greatest sky pirate there ever was!
Dialogue: I know what you mean. One day, I want to be the greatest sky pirate there ever was!

Original: Sazh:There's nothing like flying, right!? Man, I'd love to hear some of your stories!
Dialogue: There's nothing like flying, right!? Man, I'd love to hear some of your stories!

Original: Shadow:Looks like they really hit it off.
Dialogue: Looks like they really hit it off.

Original: Mog:I'm glad we're all friends now, kupo!
Dialogue: I'm glad we're all friends now, kupo!

Original: Setzer:I'm sure I'll discover new revelations looking down from the clouds on what I once thought was a barren world.
Dialogue: I'm sure I'll discover new revelations looking down from the clouds on what I once thought was a barren world.

Original: Setzer:All right, I've made up my mind. I'm going to become the fastest pilot in this world!
Dialogue: All right, I've made up my mind. I'm going to become the fastest pilot in this world!

Original: Setzer:It doesn't matter where you are. If you're going to dream, dream big. Right, old man?
Dialogue: It doesn't matter where you are. If you're going to dream, dream big. Right, old man?

Original: Sazh:Now that's what I'm talkin' about!
Dialogue: Now that's what I'm talkin' about!

Original: Vaan:Don't count me out yet! Come on, I challenge you to a race!
Dialogue: Don't count me out yet! Come on, I challenge you to a race!

Original: Hope:I wish I had something that I could get excited about.
Dialogue: I wish I had something that I could get excited about.

Original: Sazh:Hope, you're still young. You've got the rest of your life ahead of you to find something you enjoy.
Dialogue: Hope, you're still young. You've got the rest of your life ahead of you to find something you enjoy.

Original: Hope:You're right. I'll remember that.
Dialogue: You're right. I'll remember that.

Original: Mog:I sense another Torsion in the area, kupo.
Dialogue: I sense another Torsion in the area, kupo.

Original: ???:Oh? I wasn't expecting an audience.
Dialogue: Oh? I wasn't expecting an audience.

Original: Warrior of Light:Who goes there?
Dialogue: Who goes there?

Original: Vaan:What're you doing here?
Dialogue: What're you doing here?

Original: Balthier:I should be asking you that. I see you've made some interesting friends.
Dialogue: I should be asking you that. I see you've made some interesting friends.

Original: Vaan:Er...yeah. We're working together to seal the Torsions spreading destruction throughout this world...or something like that.
Dialogue: Er...yeah. We're working together to seal the Torsions spreading destruction throughout this world...or something like that.

Original: Mog:And we're always looking for new friends that can help us, kupo!
Dialogue: And we're always looking for new friends that can help us, kupo!

Original: Cloud:So what does the "leading man" want with the Torsion?
Dialogue: So what does the "leading man" want with the Torsion?

Original: Vivi:Sky pirate? So you're a thief who flies on an airship? That's so cool!
Dialogue: Sky pirate? So you're a thief who flies on an airship? That's so cool!

Original: Balthier:Along with mypartner, I'm afraid. We're not inIvaliceanymore, are we?
Dialogue: Along with my partner, I'm afraid. We're not in Ivalice anymore, are we?

Original: Mog:Everyone here was summoned from a different world, kupo.
Dialogue: Everyone here was summoned from a different world, kupo.

Original: Balthier:If only I had my airship.
Dialogue: If only I had my airship.

Original: Mog:We have one, kupo! We can take you wherever you want!
Dialogue: We have one, kupo! We can take you wherever you want!

Original: Balthier:Is that so? It appears the moogles here also know their stuff when it comes to machinery.
Dialogue: Is that so? It appears the moogles here also know their stuff when it comes to machinery.

Original: Mog:I can feel the light radiating from you, kupo! Come with us!
Dialogue: I can feel the light radiating from you, kupo! Come with us!

Original: Balthier:You're asking me to trust you, a complete stranger? I'd rather not be murdered today, thank you.
Dialogue: You're asking me to trust you, a complete stranger? I'd rather not be murdered today, thank you.

Original: Vaan:What? You don't trust me?
Dialogue: What? You don't trust me?

Original: Balthier:You know how it is. Besides, it's against my policy to work for free.
Dialogue: You know how it is. Besides, it's against my policy to work for free.

Original: Balthier:Well, take care. Maybe we'll meet again.
Dialogue: Well, take care. Maybe we'll meet again.

Original: Vivi:Is he really going to be okay on his own?
Dialogue: Is he really going to be okay on his own?

Original: Rem:So the Torsion's up ahead, right?
Dialogue: So the Torsion's up ahead, right?

Original: Balthier:Hmph. I got my hopes up when I saw you were with a lady. A shame she's but a child.
Dialogue: Hmph. I got my hopes up when I saw you were with a lady. A shame she's but a child.

Original: Cloud:You again? Did you follow us?
Dialogue: You again? Did you follow us?

Original: Balthier:We're going to the same place. It's only logical that we'd run into each other again.
Dialogue: We're going to the same place. It's only logical that we'd run into each other again.

Original: Balthier:Are you fighting alongside them too, my dear?
Dialogue: Are you fighting alongside them too, my dear?

Original: Rem:Yes, I'm asoldier, after all. Well, I amback home, at least.
Dialogue: Yes, I'm a soldier, after all. Well, I am back home, at least.

Original: Balthier:At your age? What a barbaric world.
Dialogue: At your age? What a barbaric world.

Original: Balthier:Then again, I guess no world is free of those who exploit the innocent.
Dialogue: Then again, I guess no world is free of those who exploit the innocent.

Original: Sazh:Happens where you're from too, huh? Makes you sick, doesn't it?
Dialogue: Happens where you're from too, huh? Makes you sick, doesn't it?

Original: Balthier:Hey, you there. You said you were searching for new allies, correct?
Dialogue: Hey, you there. You said you were searching for new allies, correct?

Original: Balthier:I really hope you have a good reason for recruiting children.
Dialogue: I really hope you have a good reason for recruiting children.

Original: Mog:Only a select few can close the dimensional distortions eating away at this world, kupo.
Dialogue: Only a select few can close the dimensional distortions eating away at this world, kupo.

Original: Mog:And those are the ones who bear the light.
Dialogue: And those are the ones who bear the light.

Original: Mog:Just like you, kupo!
Dialogue: Just like you, kupo!

Original: Sazh:So what's it gonna be? We could really use the help.
Dialogue: So what's it gonna be? We could really use the help.

Original: Balthier:You'd be better off without me. The fewer, the better, as they say.
Dialogue: You'd be better off without me. The fewer, the better, as they say.

Original: Vaan:Who says that? I've never felt that way.
Dialogue: Who says that? I've never felt that way.

Original: Cloud:You have any skills?
Dialogue: You have any skills?

Original: Balthier:I can steal certain enemy abilities.
Dialogue: I can steal certain enemy abilities.

Original: Balthier:When an enemy enhances its defenses, for example, I can swipe it and take it for myself.
Dialogue: When an enemy enhances its defenses, for example, I can swipe it and take it for myself.

Original: Mog:You're exactly the kind of person we need right now, kupo!
Dialogue: You're exactly the kind of person we need right now, kupo!

Original: Mog:My senses are telling me that the enemy up ahead is tough!
Dialogue: My senses are telling me that the enemy up ahead is tough!

Original: Rem:I know it's asking a lot, but could you help us?
Dialogue: I know it's asking a lot, but could you help us?

Original: Balthier:You just don't give up, do you? All right, lead the way.
Dialogue: You just don't give up, do you? All right, lead the way.

Original: Yang:Balthier, you said you are a sky pirate.
Dialogue: Balthier, you said you are a sky pirate.

Original: Balthier:You find that odd?
Dialogue: You find that odd?

Original: Yang:You don't see anyone with their own airship where we're from.
Dialogue: You don't see anyone with their own airship where we're from.

Original: Vaan:I thought Cecil had an airship.
Dialogue: I thought Cecil had an airship.

Original: Cecil:I commanded a fleet. The airships themselves belonged to the kingdom.
Dialogue: I commanded a fleet. The airships themselves belonged to the kingdom.

Original: Cecil:Anyone can possess an airship in your world?
Dialogue: Anyone can possess an airship in your world?

Original: Vaan:Poor people can't afford them, but I guess more people do than in your world.
Dialogue: Poor people can't afford them, but I guess more people do than in your world.

Original: Balthier:Not to mention the nations waging war on each other with their own fleets.
Dialogue: Not to mention the nations waging war on each other with their own fleets.

Original: Cecil:Instruments...of war... So no matter the world, the concerns are the same.
Dialogue: Instruments...of war... So no matter the world, the concerns are the same.

Original: Balthier:There's a glum face. I'd imagine you had a plum career as a royal knight.
Dialogue: There's a glum face. I'd imagine you had a plum career as a royal knight.

Original: Cecil:Baron is a military state. It used its airships to invade other nations.
Dialogue: Baron is a military state. It used its airships to invade other nations.

Original: Cecil:The innocents I...even under orders...
Dialogue: The innocents I...even under orders...

Original: Vaan:You don't like airships?
Dialogue: You don't like airships?

Original: Cecil:I have nothing against the technology itself...but when used to plunder...
Dialogue: I have nothing against the technology itself...but when used to plunder...

Original: Balthier:Treasure is my only target.
Dialogue: Treasure is my only target.

Original: Balthier:Though I suppose there's no excusing that in the eyes of a straightlaced knight.
Dialogue: Though I suppose there's no excusing that in the eyes of a straightlaced knight.

Original: Vaan:Sky pirates are different from soldiers and petty thieves. They're free and debonair and everyone looks up to them.
Dialogue: Sky pirates are different from soldiers and petty thieves. They're free and debonair and everyone looks up to them.

Original: Vaan:Every kid from the slums dreams of becoming a sky pirate. Me included.
Dialogue: Every kid from the slums dreams of becoming a sky pirate. Me included.

Original: Cecil:A love for the sky was the same in my world.
Dialogue: A love for the sky was the same in my world.

Original: Cecil:But why...why did it turn out that way...?
Dialogue: But why...why did it turn out that way...?

Original: Balthier:Knights have it tough wherever you go.
Dialogue: Knights have it tough wherever you go.

Original: Balthier:Ply the skies all you like, as long as you have something hanging over you, you can hardly call it freedom.
Dialogue: Ply the skies all you like, as long as you have something hanging over you, you can hardly call it freedom.

Original: Balthier:...Said the pot to the kettle.
Dialogue: ...Said the pot to the kettle.

Original: Balthier:Why do you ask? Are you going to go look for her?
Dialogue: Why do you ask? Are you going to go look for her?

Original: Yuffie:I was thinking I should get one, too. A gal's got her limits, you know? I wanna know how to pick a good one.
Dialogue: I was thinking I should get one, too. A gal's got her limits, you know? I wanna know how to pick a good one.

Original: Bartz:Balthier's already a force to be reckoned with. I bet they're unstoppable together.
Dialogue: Balthier's already a force to be reckoned with. I bet they're unstoppable together.

Original: Balthier:For heaven's sake... You'll forgive me if I keep the particulars to myself.
Dialogue: For heaven's sake... You'll forgive me if I keep the particulars to myself.

Original: Hope:Vaan, do you know anything about her?
Dialogue: Vaan, do you know anything about her?

Original: Vaan:She's a friend. We traveled together.
Dialogue: She's a friend. We traveled together.

Original: Yuffie:Tell me more, tell me more. Balthier's being a sourpuss.
Dialogue: Tell me more, tell me more. Balthier's being a sourpuss.

Original: Vaan:She's real tall and good at magicks... She's got long ears...real grown-up.
Dialogue: She's real tall and good at magicks... She's got long ears...real grown-up.

Original: Bartz:Like Y'shtola?
Dialogue: Like Y'shtola?

Original: Y'shtola:You all look to be having fun, but what's this about me?
Dialogue: You all look to be having fun, but what's this about me?

Original: Yuffie:Vaan's telling us about Balthier's partner.
Dialogue: Vaan's telling us about Balthier's partner.

Original: Balthier:...A right nuisance for her if you think he's doing a good job of it.
Dialogue: ...A right nuisance for her if you think he's doing a good job of it.

Original: Vaan:Then why don't you tell them?
Dialogue: Then why don't you tell them?

Original: Balthier:They'll know when they meet her. Describing viera to someone from another world will confuse them more than not.
Dialogue: They'll know when they meet her. Describing viera to someone from another world will confuse them more than not.

Original: Y'shtola:So there are avariety of racesin your world, too?
Dialogue: So there are a variety of races in your world, too?

Original: Balthier:None likeyourselfto my knowledge, but wehumesaren't the only ones who walk upright, to say the least.
Dialogue: None like yourself to my knowledge, but we humes aren't the only ones who walk upright, to say the least.

Original: Yuffie:Long ears and grown-up like Y'shtola, huh...?
Dialogue: Long ears and grown-up like Y'shtola, huh...?

Original: Vaan:They aren't all that alike...though I guess there are some similarities.
Dialogue: They aren't all that alike...though I guess there are some similarities.

Original: Hope:Even from different worlds, they do have something in common?
Dialogue: Even from different worlds, they do have something in common?

Original: Vaan:I still have no idea how old she is. Y'shtola, how?
Dialogue: I still have no idea how old she is. Y'shtola, how—?

Original: Balthier:...Grow up.
Dialogue: ...Grow up.

Original: Hope:...You're being rude.
Dialogue: ...You're being rude.

Original: Yuffie:Haha, Vaan got in trouble. You're such a kid.
Dialogue: Haha, Vaan got in trouble. You're such a kid.

Original: Bartz:...Good point. I wonder how old Y'shtola is. ...Oh well.
Dialogue: ...Good point. I wonder how old Y'shtola is. ...Oh well.

Original: Balthier:Well...I guess this belt should suffice as payment.
Dialogue: Well...I guess this belt should suffice as payment.

Original: Balthier:It was a pleasure doing business with you.
Dialogue: It was a pleasure doing business with you.

Original: Hope:Um, sir... Would you be interested in fighting with us from now on...permanently?
Dialogue: Um, sir... Would you be interested in fighting with us from now on...permanently?

Original: Hope:I would feel a lot more comfortable with you on our side.
Dialogue: I would feel a lot more comfortable with you on our side.

Original: Balthier:I commend you for your manners, but you still have a lot to learn, I'm afraid.
Dialogue: I commend you for your manners, but you still have a lot to learn, I'm afraid.

Original: Balthier:Man cannot live by goodwill alone. Especially sky pirates. What's in it for me?
Dialogue: Man cannot live by goodwill alone. Especially sky pirates. What's in it for me?

Original: Warrior of Light:So you do not share our desire to save the world?
Dialogue: So you do not share our desire to save the world?

Original: Balthier:If something were to happen to it, I'll just take to the skies, free as can be.
Dialogue: If something were to happen to it, I'll just take to the skies, free as can be.

Original: Vaan:But you don't have your ship.
Dialogue: But you don't have your ship.

Original: Mog:Never fear, kupo! You want an airship? We've got one!
Dialogue: Never fear, kupo! You want an airship? We've got one!

Original: Y'shtola:Is a reward truly the only thing you seek? ...Nay, I sense you are worried about someone.
Dialogue: Is a reward truly the only thing you seek? ...Nay, I sense you are worried about someone.

Original: Y'shtola:And If I may venture a guess, I would say that person is your dear partner, is it not?
Dialogue: And If I may venture a guess, I would say that person is your dear partner, is it not?

Original: Balthier:You have quite the intuition. I like that.
Dialogue: You have quite the intuition. I like that.

Original: Mog:All the more reason you should come with us, kupo!
Dialogue: All the more reason you should come with us, kupo!

Original: Mog:I have the power to find those who bear the light!
Dialogue: I have the power to find those who bear the light!

Original: Warrior of Light:It would be in your best interest to join us.
Dialogue: It would be in your best interest to join us.

Original: Warrior of Light:After all, finding your partner would be a reward in itself, would it not?
Dialogue: After all, finding your partner would be a reward in itself, would it not?

Original: Hope:Everyone helped me reunite with my friends from back home. I'm sure we can help you too.
Dialogue: Everyone helped me reunite with my friends from back home. I'm sure we can help you too.

Original: Balthier:I guess any self-respecting leading man needs to do something heroic every once in a while.
Dialogue: I guess any self-respecting leading man needs to do something heroic every once in a while.

Original: Balthier:But I'm doing this for me. Don't forget that.
Dialogue: But I'm doing this for me. Don't forget that.

Original: Mog:Of course, kupo!
Dialogue: Of course, kupo!

Original: Y'shtola:Perhaps a man can live by goodwill after all.
Dialogue: Perhaps a man can live by goodwill after all.

Original: Y'shtola:Or maybe it's that the "leading man" simply couldn't turn his back on those in need?
Dialogue: Or maybe it's that the "leading man" simply couldn't turn his back on those in need?

Original: Balthier:Hmph. You can read men like a book.
Dialogue: Hmph. You can read men like a book.

Original: ???:Zidane! Where are you, Zidane!?
Dialogue: Zidane! Where are you, Zidane!?

Original: ???:*Sniffle* This isn't how you treat a lady.
Dialogue: *Sniffle* This isn't how you treat a lady.

Original: ???:How could you leave *sniffle* a helpless little girl like me behind? I can't believe you guys.
Dialogue: How could you leave *sniffle* a helpless little girl like me behind? I can't believe you guys.

Original: ???:More importantly...where am I? I've never seen this place before.
Dialogue: More importantly...where am I? I've never seen this place before.

Original: ???:I've got a bad feeling about this. ...Like a monster could come out at any moment.
Dialogue: I've got a bad feeling about this. ...Like a monster could come out at any moment.

Original: Eiko:No, I'm not gonna cry! I'm a grown-up!
Dialogue: No, I'm not gonna cry! I'm a grown-up!

Original: Eiko:Besides, I'm gonna find them! I just know it!
Dialogue: Besides, I'm gonna find them! I just know it!

Original: Eiko:Then, I"ll make them pay for leaving me behind! Oh, the nerve!
Dialogue: Then, I"ll make them pay for leaving me behind! Oh, the nerve!

Original: Eiko:Zidane!? Zidane, is that you?
Dialogue: Zidane!? Zidane, is that you?

Original: Eiko:I'll even take Vivi or Steiner! I just want to see somebody I know...
Dialogue: I'll even take Vivi or Steiner! I just want to see somebody I know...

Original: Eiko:Oh, uh...
Dialogue: Oh, uh...

Original: Eiko:S-sorry for bothering you. So, uh... Catch ya later?
Dialogue: S-sorry for bothering you. So, uh... Catch ya later?

Original: Eiko:Ahhh! Help! P-please don't eat me!
Dialogue: Ahhh! Help! P-please don't eat me!

Original: Eiko:Zidane!
Dialogue: Zidane!

Original: Zidane:Eiko!? Is that really you?
Dialogue: Eiko!? Is that really you?

Original: Eiko:Finally! I've been looking all over for you, Zidane!
Dialogue: Finally! I've been looking all over for you, Zidane!

Original: Vivi:We had no idea you were even here! I'm so glad you're okay.
Dialogue: We had no idea you were even here! I'm so glad you're okay.

Original: Eiko:Do I look okay?
Dialogue: Do I look okay?

Original: Eiko:I was so lonely...and hungry... *sniffle*...and a monster even tried to eat me.
Dialogue: I was so lonely...and hungry... *sniffle*...and a monster even tried to eat me.

Original: Vivi:I...I'm sorry you had to go through that.
Dialogue: I...I'm sorry you had to go through that.

Original: Eiko:By the way, what do you mean by "here"? Where are we? could someone tell me what's going on?
Dialogue: By the way, what do you mean by "here"? Where are we? could someone tell me what's going on?

Original: Mog:I can do that, kupo!
Dialogue: I can do that, kupo!

Original: Eiko:Hey, a moogle! I feel better already.
Dialogue: Hey, a moogle! I feel better already.

Original: Cecil:What a cheerful young girl you are. Are you one of Vivi's friends?
Dialogue: What a cheerful young girl you are. Are you one of Vivi's friends?

Original: Eiko:Hmph! Me, interested in a little kid like Vivi? Don't make me laugh!
Dialogue: Hmph! Me, interested in a little kid like Vivi? Don't make me laugh!

Original: Eiko:There's only one man for me. He's older, brave, and has a tail...
Dialogue: There's only one man for me. He's older, brave, and has a tail...

Original: Tifa:Zidane! She's just a little girl!
Dialogue: Zidane! She's just a little girl!

Original: Zidane:Whoa! Hold up! It's not what you think!
Dialogue: Whoa! Hold up! It's not what you think!

Original: Eiko:Then what is it!?
Dialogue: Then what is it!?

Original: Mog:Kupo! Can I please explain
Dialogue: Kupo! Can I please explain—

Original: Eiko:Two people once separated only to be reunited in a faraway world...
Dialogue: Two people once separated only to be reunited in a faraway world...

Original: Eiko:Isn't it romantic!? I've always dreamed about this moment!
Dialogue: Isn't it romantic!? I've always dreamed about this moment!

Original: Mog:Great! So you'll join us, kupo?
Dialogue: Great! So you'll join us, kupo?

Original: Eiko:Of course! Wherever Zidane goes, I go!
Dialogue: Of course! Wherever Zidane goes, I go!

Original: Bartz:Looks like someone's got a crush on you, Zidane.
Dialogue: Looks like someone's got a crush on you, Zidane.

Original: Zidane:Haha, yeah... It's tough being so popular sometimes.
Dialogue: Haha, yeah... It's tough being so popular sometimes.

Original: Eiko:I'll be friends with the rest of you, too! After all, Zidane's friends are my friends!
Dialogue: I'll be friends with the rest of you, too! After all, Zidane's friends are my friends!

Original: Yuna:I'm looking forward to getting to know you, Eiko.
Dialogue: I'm looking forward to getting to know you, Eiko.

Original: Yuna:I-is something the matter? Did I say something strange?
Dialogue: I-is something the matter? Did I say something strange?

Original: Eiko:Looks like I've got myself a rivala beautiful one at that. Just great.
Dialogue: Looks like I've got myself a rival—a beautiful one at that. Just great.

Original: Eiko:Zidane, a word, please!
Dialogue: Zidane, a word, please!

Original: Zidane:Ugh... Why me?
Dialogue: Ugh... Why me?

Original: Yuffie:Eiko, this has been nagging at me, but...
Dialogue: Eiko, this has been nagging at me, but...

Original: Yuffie:What's with the horn? Is that a hair accessory?
Dialogue: What's with the horn? Is that a hair accessory?

Original: Eiko:Nope, it's stuck to my head.
Dialogue: Nope, it's stuck to my head.

Original: Eiko:Why are you so surprised? Everybody knows that.
Dialogue: Why are you so surprised? Everybody knows that.

Original: Cecil:Is that so...?
Dialogue: Is that so...?

Original: Eiko:Wow, really? You can talk to eidolons even without a horn?
Dialogue: Wow, really? You can talk to eidolons even without a horn?

Original: Eiko:Hmmm, sounds rough.
Dialogue: Hmmm, sounds rough.

Original: Eiko:Hm? "We"? You mean there are lots of summoners other than you?
Dialogue: Hm? "We"? You mean there are lots of summoners other than you?

Original: Eiko:Lots of summoners... A world where you won't be lonely...
Dialogue: Lots of summoners... A world where you won't be lonely...

Original: Eiko:Are other worlds like that? What about yours, Yuffie?
Dialogue: Are other worlds like that? What about yours, Yuffie?

Original: Yuffie:We don't have summoners to begin with.
Dialogue: We don't have summoners to begin with.

Original: Eiko:Anyone can use it!?
Dialogue: Anyone can use it!?

Original: Eiko:Talk about culture shock. There are all sorts of worlds out there.
Dialogue: Talk about culture shock. There are all sorts of worlds out there.

Original: Sazh:Heh heh! Bet you didn't know I'm a summoner, too.
Dialogue: Heh heh! Bet you didn't know I'm a summoner, too.

Original: Eiko:Wow! So cute! Does it have a name?
Dialogue: Wow! So cute! Does it have a name?

Original: Yuffie:Oh, nice going, Pops! You know your way to grab the kidlets' hearts.
Dialogue: Oh, nice going, Pops! You know your way to grab the kidlets' hearts.

Original: Yuna:The chick and Eiko are cute, aren't they?
Dialogue: The chick and Eiko are cute, aren't they?

Original: Cecil:Quite. She's always trying so hard, it's nice to see a childlike smile for a change.
Dialogue: Quite. She's always trying so hard, it's nice to see a childlike smile for a change.

Original: Bartz:Ughhh... I'm hungry. Wish I had something to eat...
Dialogue: Ughhh... I'm hungry. Wish I had something to eat...

Original: Vaan:The beasts here don't make for good cooking, so there's no use in hunting them.
Dialogue: The beasts here don't make for good cooking, so there's no use in hunting them.

Original: Eiko:Sorry to keep you waiting!
Dialogue: Sorry to keep you waiting!

Original: Eiko:The rock-fisted potato stew is ready! Come and get it before it gets cold!
Dialogue: The rock-fisted potato stew is ready! Come and get it before it gets cold!

Original: Bartz:Did you say stew?
Dialogue: Did you say stew?

Original: Eiko:It's my specialty! I gathered all the ingredients and put my heart into it!
Dialogue: It's my specialty! I gathered all the ingredients and put my heart into it!

Original: Vivi:I gathered most of
Dialogue: I gathered most of—

Original: Vivi:Uh...never mind...
Dialogue: Uh...never mind...

Original: Bartz:Hooray! Stew! I'm gonna eat till I pop!
Dialogue: Hooray! Stew! I'm gonna eat till I pop!

Original: Vaan:Hey, wait! No fair getting a head start!
Dialogue: Hey, wait! No fair getting a head start!

Original: Terra:Hehe. Isn't everyone cheerful?
Dialogue: Hehe. Isn't everyone cheerful?

Original: Bartz:Woof, am I stuffed! I can't remember the last time I ate like this!
Dialogue: Woof, am I stuffed! I can't remember the last time I ate like this!

Original: Terra:Thank you, Eiko. It was delicious.
Dialogue: Thank you, Eiko. It was delicious.

Original: Eiko:Gosh! Really?
Dialogue: Gosh! Really?

Original: Zidane:Yeah, it didn't have any "interesting" seasonings today.
Dialogue: Yeah, it didn't have any "interesting" seasonings today.

Original: Eiko:Well, what else would you expect from a proper lady?
Dialogue: Well, what else would you expect from a proper lady?

Original: Vaan:Traveling with you means we get to eat like this?
Dialogue: Traveling with you means we get to eat like this?

Original: Bartz:Man, Zidane and Vivi, you guys have it made!
Dialogue: Man, Zidane and Vivi, you guys have it made!

Original: Eiko:Hehehe, right? I'll cook for you anytime you ask, so don't hesitate!
Dialogue: Hehehe, right? I'll cook for you anytime you ask, so don't hesitate!

Original: Vivi:(I guess that means I've got to gather ingredients again.)
Dialogue: (I guess that means I've got to gather ingredients again.)

Original: Zidane:(I'll pitch in next time.)
Dialogue: (I'll pitch in next time.)

Original: Terra:Everyone looks so happy. I suppose I should give cooking a try...
Dialogue: Everyone looks so happy. I suppose I should give cooking a try...

Original: Mog:We did it! Everything is going according to plan, kupo! The Torsions will all be sealed in no time.
Dialogue: We did it! Everything is going according to plan, kupo! The Torsions will all be sealed in no time.

Original: Eiko:Wow, you're amazing!
Dialogue: Wow, you're amazing!

Original: Eiko:Hey, you have friends and family too, right? Can I meet them?
Dialogue: Hey, you have friends and family too, right? Can I meet them?

Original: Mog:F-friends, kupo? Family, kupo?
Dialogue: F-friends, kupo? Family, kupo?

Original: Mog:I don't have either of those things... I'm just a messenger for the goddess Materia.
Dialogue: I don't have either of those things... I'm just a messenger for the goddess Materia.

Original: Eiko:Really? That's strange.
Dialogue: Really? That's strange.

Original: Terra:A village full of moogles?
Dialogue: A village full of moogles?

Original: Vivi:Yeah, they're her family.
Dialogue: Yeah, they're her family.

Original: Terra:I'm so jealous.
Dialogue: I'm so jealous.

Original: Zidane:Postal workers,merchants,travelers, you name it.
Dialogue: Postal workers, merchants, travelers, you name it.

Original: Bartz:Huh, I had no idea moogles were so different in each world.
Dialogue: Huh, I had no idea moogles were so different in each world.

Original: Eiko:It doesn't matter where they're from! They're all the same to me, and I'll always be their friend!
Dialogue: It doesn't matter where they're from! They're all the same to me, and I'll always be their friend!

Original: Eiko:Oh yeah! I have something I wanna give you!
Dialogue: Oh yeah! I have something I wanna give you!

Original: Mog:A kupo nut...kupo?
Dialogue: A kupo nut...kupo?

Original: Mog:Kupo! This is delicious! I love it, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo! This is delicious! I love it, kupo!

Original: Eiko:Amazing, right? I'll give you another one after we seal the next Torsion!
Dialogue: Amazing, right? I'll give you another one after we seal the next Torsion!

Original: Mog:I feel like a new moogle! Come on, follow me, kupo!
Dialogue: I feel like a new moogle! Come on, follow me, kupo!

Original: Zidane:That's Eiko for ya. She's really good with moogles.
Dialogue: That's Eiko for ya. She's really good with moogles.

Original: Terra:...I wish I could have a kupo nut.
Dialogue: ...I wish I could have a kupo nut.

Original: ???:Seriously though, where am I?
Dialogue: Seriously though, where am I?

Original: ???:And what was with that puppet back there?
Dialogue: And what was with that puppet back there?

Original: ???:I mean, it was like talking to a brick wall. There was something familiar about it though.
Dialogue: I mean, it was like talking to a brick wall. There was something familiar about it though.

Original: ???:Anyway, I have to find Yuna. If only there were some way to
Dialogue: Anyway, I have to find Yuna. If only there were some way to—

Original: ???:Wait, I got it!
Dialogue: Wait, I got it!

Original: ???:Well, that didn't work.
Dialogue: Well, that didn't work.

Original: ???:Don't tell me I'm on my own.
Dialogue: Don't tell me I'm on my own.

Original: ???:Argh! Where is everybody!?
Dialogue: Argh! Where is everybody!?

Original: Zidane:Yuna? What are you doing all by yourself?
Dialogue: Yuna? What are you doing all by yourself?

Original: Yuna:I'm trying to find him. He might have been summoned to this world, too.
Dialogue: I'm trying to find him. He might have been summoned to this world, too.

Original: Zidane:Oh... Well, good luck with that.
Dialogue: Oh... Well, good luck with that.

Original: Edge:G-get away from me! I said I don't want to fight you!
Dialogue: G-get away from me! I said I don't want to fight you!

Original: ???:Nice try, puppet! You can't fool me!
Dialogue: Nice try, puppet! You can't fool me!

Original: Yuna:That voice! Is that!?
Dialogue: That voice! Is that—!?

Original: Zidane:C'mon, let's go!
Dialogue: C'mon, let's go!

Original: Zidane:Edge, are you all right!?
Dialogue: Edge, are you all right!?

Original: Tidus:Yuna!?
Dialogue: Yuna!?

Original: Edge:You know this guy? Then can you tell him to back off? He came out of nowhere and started attacking me!
Dialogue: You know this guy? Then can you tell him to back off? He came out of nowhere and started attacking me!

Original: Yuna:I just knew we would find each other.
Dialogue: I just knew we would find each other.

Original: Tidus:Is that really you, Yuna?
Dialogue: Is that really you, Yuna?

Original: Yuna:Of course, it's me! I'm so happy to see you, Tidus.
Dialogue: Of course, it's me! I'm so happy to see you, Tidus.

Original: Mog:Hooray for reunions! I think I'm going to cry, kupo!
Dialogue: Hooray for reunions! I think I'm going to cry, kupo!

Original: Zidane:Oh, so this is who you were looking for. Glad you found each other.
Dialogue: Oh, so this is who you were looking for. Glad you found each other.

Original: Tidus:So those humanoid monsters are called manikins, huh?
Dialogue: So those humanoid monsters are called manikins, huh?

Original: Edge:Yeah, and you better not confuse me for one again!
Dialogue: Yeah, and you better not confuse me for one again!

Original: Tidus:I'm really sorry about that.
Dialogue: I'm really sorry about that.

Original: Tidus:So, Yuna...
Dialogue: So, Yuna...

Original: Tidus:Is that Seymour behind you real or not?
Dialogue: Is that Seymour behind you real or not?

Original: Mog:Th-that's a manikin, kupo!
Dialogue: Th-that's a manikin, kupo!

Original: Zidane:Well, still beats the real thing.
Dialogue: Well, still beats the real thing.

Original: Tidus:You guys met Seymour? Guess you know what kind of a man he is too, then!
Dialogue: You guys met Seymour? Guess you know what kind of a man he is too, then!

Original: Tidus:Real or fake, we've gotta stop him.
Dialogue: Real or fake, we've gotta stop him.

Original: Tidus:So make room for me! I'll show you just how quick I really am!
Dialogue: So make room for me! I'll show you just how quick I really am!

Original: King:Wakka, I've been wondering... What's your ball for? It doesn't look like it was made for battle...
Dialogue: Wakka, I've been wondering... What's your ball for? It doesn't look like it was made for battle...

Original: Tidus:Me and Wakka are both blitzball athletes!
Dialogue: Me and Wakka are both blitzball athletes!

Original: Firion:Athletes...? I took you for warriors...
Dialogue: Athletes...? I took you for warriors...
