Dialogue: But who knows when he'll betray us. It's hard to fight when you always have to watch your back.

Original: Cecil:Yes, it bothers me, too. His beliefs are far beyond odious.
Dialogue: Yes, it bothers me, too. His beliefs are far beyond odious.

Original: Cecil:What was Mog thinking? Just what could he be preparing us to fight?
Dialogue: What was Mog thinking? Just what could he be preparing us to fight?

Original: Firion:Our organization also had doubts about Mog's motives.
Dialogue: Our organization also had doubts about Mog's motives.

Original: Wakka:The Returners, ya?
Dialogue: The Returners, ya?

Original: Firion:Shadow's already informed them about Seymour.
Dialogue: Shadow's already informed them about Seymour.

Original: Shadow:Our client's a cautious man. I'm sure he'll be able to uncover the truth.
Dialogue: Our client's a cautious man. I'm sure he'll be able to uncover the truth.

Original: Yuna:We really don't know anything yet, do we?
Dialogue: We really don't know anything yet, do we?

Original: Cecil:Right now, we basically share the same goal as Mog, so we're working together.
Dialogue: Right now, we basically share the same goal as Mog, so we're working together.

Original: Cecil:But what happens if there's a conflict of interest?
Dialogue: But what happens if there's a conflict of interest?

Original: Wakka:Yeah, what would we do in this deranged world without a guide? We'd be helpless.
Dialogue: Yeah, what would we do in this deranged world without a guide? We'd be helpless.

Original: Firion:If that ever happened, you could come join us. Right, Shadow?
Dialogue: If that ever happened, you could come join us. Right, Shadow?

Original: Shadow:Not a bad idea.
Dialogue: Not a bad idea.

Original: Yuna:What we believe and who we protect is something we have to decide for ourselves.
Dialogue: What we believe and who we protect is something we have to decide for ourselves.

Original: Mog:Ready to go, kupo?
Dialogue: Ready to go, kupo?

Original: Cecil:Yes, let's go, everyone.
Dialogue: Yes, let's go, everyone.

Original: Firion:I want to believe that Mog's a good guy who's simply trying to protect the world, but...
Dialogue: I want to believe that Mog's a good guy who's simply trying to protect the world, but...

Original: Shadow:Let him continue thinking he has us right where he wants us. We'll find out soon enough.
Dialogue: Let him continue thinking he has us right where he wants us. We'll find out soon enough.

Original: Firion:You're right. He can't force us to do anything against our will.
Dialogue: You're right. He can't force us to do anything against our will.

Original: Firion:We just need to keep an eye on Seymour...and Mog as well.
Dialogue: We just need to keep an eye on Seymour...and Mog as well.

Original: Shadow:That's what I plan to do.
Dialogue: That's what I plan to do.

Original: Eiko:...What should I do? I'm lost.
Dialogue: ...What should I do? I'm lost.

Original: Eiko:Oooh! The nerve! How could they leave me behind like this!
Dialogue: Oooh! The nerve! How could they leave me behind like this!

Original: Eiko:...What...was that noise?
Dialogue: ...What...was that noise?

Original: Eiko:Aiee! A giant monster! S-somebody help meee!
Dialogue: Aiee! A giant monster! S-somebody help meee!

Original: ???:Get down.
Dialogue: Get down.

Original: Eiko:Y-you're...
Dialogue: Y-you're...

Original: Seymour:All alone in a place like this... What happened to your friends?
Dialogue: All alone in a place like this... What happened to your friends?

Original: Raijin:There she is! Missing child found, ya know!
Dialogue: There she is! Missing child found, ya know!

Original: Zidane:Seymour! What do you think you're doing!
Dialogue: Seymour! What do you think you're doing!

Original: Zidane:You won't be walking away from here if I don't like your answer!
Dialogue: You won't be walking away from here if I don't like your answer!

Original: Eiko:Zidane! You've got it all wrong!
Dialogue: Zidane! You've got it all wrong!

Original: Eiko:A monster was after me, and he saved me!
Dialogue: A monster was after me, and he saved me!

Original: Zidane:What? This guy!?
Dialogue: What? This guy!?

Original: Raijin:I get it! He had a change of heart, ya know?
Dialogue: I get it! He had a change of heart, ya know?

Original: Seymour:A change of heart? Hah. ...You are grossly mistaken.
Dialogue: A change of heart? Hah. ...You are grossly mistaken.

Original: Seymour:Were the girl to die, I do believe your morale would be shaken. That would be problematic.
Dialogue: Were the girl to die, I do believe your morale would be shaken. That would be problematic.

Original: Zidane:...Exploitative as ever.
Dialogue: ...Exploitative as ever.

Original: Seymour:...Now, if you'll excuse me...
Dialogue: ...Now, if you'll excuse me...

Original: Eiko:Um... Th-thanks for saving me...
Dialogue: Um... Th-thanks for saving me...

Original: Seymour:...Keep your thanks. You shall meet your end by my hand in time...
Dialogue: ...Keep your thanks. You shall meet your end by my hand in time...

Original: Zidane:I can never tell what that snake is thinking...
Dialogue: I can never tell what that snake is thinking...

Original: Fujin:RESOLVED. FORGET.
Dialogue: RESOLVED. FORGET.

Original: Raijin:I know how ya feel, but all's well that ends well, ya know?
Dialogue: I know how ya feel, but all's well that ends well, ya know?

Original: Zidane:Yeah...but still...
Dialogue: Yeah...but still...

Original: Tidus:Hrmmm... I still don't like it.
Dialogue: Hrmmm... I still don't like it.

Original: Yuna:You mean about Maester Seymour?
Dialogue: You mean about Maester Seymour?

Original: Tidus:I can't trust him. I get chills fighting alongside him.
Dialogue: I can't trust him. I get chills fighting alongside him.

Original: Wakka:Mog made it clear he's only around to help in battle, but...
Dialogue: Mog made it clear he's only around to help in battle, but...

Original: Wakka:It's a hard pill to swallow.
Dialogue: It's a hard pill to swallow.

Original: Edgar:Frankly, it surprised me, too, to hear Seymour would join this side.
Dialogue: Frankly, it surprised me, too, to hear Seymour would join this side.

Original: Edgar:His ideology is madness itself.
Dialogue: His ideology is madness itself.

Original: Shantotto:In death, relief... Why does he so adhere to that belief?
Dialogue: In death, relief... Why does he so adhere to that belief?

Original: Wakka:It was hoped he might be a bridge between the races.
Dialogue: It was hoped he might be a bridge between the races.

Original: Edgar:A bridge... I can appreciate that hope. ...I expect there were those prejudiced against it, too.
Dialogue: A bridge... I can appreciate that hope. ...I expect there were those prejudiced against it, too.

Original: Yuna:Yes. In his youth, he was persecuted by the Guado for his impure ancestry.
Dialogue: Yes. In his youth, he was persecuted by the Guado for his impure ancestry.

Original: Edgar:And from that trauma, he lost hope in life itself...?
Dialogue: And from that trauma, he lost hope in life itself...?

Original: Wakka:It almost sounds reasonable, talking to you like this. But to heck if we can understand it.
Dialogue: It almost sounds reasonable, talking to you like this. But to heck if we can understand it.

Original: Shantotto:Ruin's aesthetic? How pathetic.
Dialogue: Ruin's aesthetic? How pathetic.

Original: Irvine:Do you need to understand it?
Dialogue: Do you need to understand it?

Original: Irvine:I mean, everybody has it rough at some time or another.
Dialogue: I mean, everybody has it rough at some time or another.

Original: Irvine:The way I see it, life is about somehow getting over it and moving on.
Dialogue: The way I see it, life is about somehow getting over it and moving on.

Original: Edgar:Agreed. Death accomplishes nothing, least of all relief...
Dialogue: Agreed. Death accomplishes nothing, least of all relief...

Original: Edgar:He's simply looking for a way to escape the realities before him.
Dialogue: He's simply looking for a way to escape the realities before him.

Original: Shantotto:And at others' expense. What utter nonsense.
Dialogue: And at others' expense. What utter nonsense.

Original: Irvine:Though I doubt he'd accept our point of view all that easily.
Dialogue: Though I doubt he'd accept our point of view all that easily.

Original: Tidus:I just can't relax, waiting for him to stab us in the back in the middle of a fight...
Dialogue: I just can't relax, waiting for him to stab us in the back in the middle of a fight...

Original: Edgar:I wouldn't worry about that as long as Mog's intentions remain unclear.
Dialogue: I wouldn't worry about that as long as Mog's intentions remain unclear.

Original: Edgar:He wants to know of what use Mog and we can be to him.
Dialogue: He wants to know of what use Mog and we can be to him.

Original: Tidus:And what about when Mog's intentions do become clear? What then?
Dialogue: And what about when Mog's intentions do become clear? What then?

Original: Shantotto:That ball's on Mog's ground.
Dialogue: That ball's on Mog's ground.

Original: Shantotto:And how long he plans to jerk us around.
Dialogue: And how long he plans to jerk us around.

Original: Yuna:Anyway, for now, all we can do is wait and watch...
Dialogue: Anyway, for now, all we can do is wait and watch...

Original: Steiner:Hrm, a decidedly spooky forest. It feels some ghoul could pop out at any moment.
Dialogue: Hrm, a decidedly spooky forest. It feels some ghoul could pop out at any moment.

Original: Mog:They say that a mischievous ghost haunts these woods, kupo.
Dialogue: They say that a mischievous ghost haunts these woods, kupo.

Original: Steiner:What!? A gh-ghost, you say?
Dialogue: What!? A gh-ghost, you say?

Original: Steiner:Bah! Ridiculous! Ghosts aren't real. B-besides, even if they were, they'd b-be no match for me!
Dialogue: Bah! Ridiculous! Ghosts aren't real. B-besides, even if they were, they'd b-be no match for me!

Original: Mog:Er, right, kupo.
Dialogue: Er, right, kupo.

Original: Mog:Now, come on! We'll never make it to the next Torsion if we're scared of a little ghost, kupo!
Dialogue: Now, come on! We'll never make it to the next Torsion if we're scared of a little ghost, kupo!

Original: Steiner:Such a courageous moogle. I would do well to follow his example.
Dialogue: Such a courageous moogle. I would do well to follow his example.

Original: Steiner:Hm? Is something the matter?
Dialogue: Hm? Is something the matter?

Original: Shadow:An unsettling presence approaches.
Dialogue: An unsettling presence approaches.

Original: Steiner:What!? D-do you think it's the...!?
Dialogue: What!? D-do you think it's the...!?

Original: Mog:Help, kupo! A bear!
Dialogue: Help, kupo! A bear!

Original: Shadow:A bear?
Dialogue: A bear?

Original: ???:Stop right there! I'm not gonna let you get away!
Dialogue: Stop right there! I'm not gonna let you get away!

Original: Mog:You know this bear, kupo?
Dialogue: You know this bear, kupo?

Original: Shadow:He's an ally from back home.
Dialogue: He's an ally from back home.

Original: Steiner:Is that so? Thank goodness!
Dialogue: Is that so? Thank goodness!

Original: Sabin:Your "ally"? Don't make me laugh! Put your fists up!
Dialogue: Your "ally"? Don't make me laugh! Put your fists up!

Original: Steiner:He's quite the aggressive one. Is he always like this?
Dialogue: He's quite the aggressive one. Is he always like this?

Original: Shadow:No, something's wrong.
Dialogue: No, something's wrong.

Original: Sabin:If it's three-on-three you want, you've got it!
Dialogue: If it's three-on-three you want, you've got it!

Original: Steiner:Are those manikins!? And that one looks just like him!
Dialogue: Are those manikins!? And that one looks just like him!

Original: Shadow:What is Sabin doing with them?
Dialogue: What is Sabin doing with them?

Original: Sabin:Ow, my head... Wh-where am I?
Dialogue: Ow, my head... Wh-where am I?

Original: Terra:Sabin, are you okay?
Dialogue: Sabin, are you okay?

Original: Sabin:Hm? Terra?
Dialogue: Hm? Terra?

Original: Sabin:Whoa, it really is you! How long have you been here?
Dialogue: Whoa, it really is you! How long have you been here?

Original: Terra:I've been here the entire time. You don't remember anything?
Dialogue: I've been here the entire time. You don't remember anything?

Original: Firion:What's the last thing you remember?
Dialogue: What's the last thing you remember?

Original: Sabin:I remember coming to this forest to train.
Dialogue: I remember coming to this forest to train.

Original: Sabin:Then, some weird creature attacked me...and that's where everything starts to get a little fuzzy.
Dialogue: Then, some weird creature attacked me...and that's where everything starts to get a little fuzzy.

Original: Wakka:Think it was that fabled ghost?
Dialogue: Think it was that fabled ghost?

Original: Mog:That must have been what it was, kupo! He was possessed!
Dialogue: That must have been what it was, kupo! He was possessed!

Original: Edge:Possessed!? That ghost sounds like a real jerk.
Dialogue: Possessed!? That ghost sounds like a real jerk.

Original: Sabin:Looks like you've got yourself a lot of new friends. Introduce me!
Dialogue: Looks like you've got yourself a lot of new friends. Introduce me!

Original: Firion:...And that's why we have to seal the Torsions.
Dialogue: ...And that's why we have to seal the Torsions.

Original: Sabin:Huh... Not entirely sure I get it, but count me in.
Dialogue: Huh... Not entirely sure I get it, but count me in.

Original: Wakka:Whoa, man! You sure you know what you're getting yourself into?
Dialogue: Whoa, man! You sure you know what you're getting yourself into?

Original: Terra:Sabin's not much of a thinker.
Dialogue: Sabin's not much of a thinker.

Original: Edge:A real meathead, huh?
Dialogue: A real meathead, huh?

Original: Mog:But it looks like even bears can bear the light, kupo!
Dialogue: But it looks like even bears can bear the light, kupo!

Original: Sabin:You're asking for it.
Dialogue: You're asking for it.

Original: Mog:S-sorry, kupo.
Dialogue: S-sorry, kupo.

Original: Firion:There's a Torsion deep within the forest. Do you want to come with us?
Dialogue: There's a Torsion deep within the forest. Do you want to come with us?

Original: Sabin:Yeah, of course. I'm never one to turn down a good ol' ghost hunt!
Dialogue: Yeah, of course. I'm never one to turn down a good ol' ghost hunt!

Original: Wakka:Yeah, and look where that got you.
Dialogue: Yeah, and look where that got you.

Original: Sabin:Yahoo! Let's do this!
Dialogue: Yahoo! Let's do this!

Original: Terra:...And that's how we close the Torsions.
Dialogue: ...And that's how we close the Torsions.

Original: Sabin:Great! So? How'd I do?
Dialogue: Great! So? How'd I do?

Original: Yang:You're a seasoned warrior. It is an honor to fight by your side.
Dialogue: You're a seasoned warrior. It is an honor to fight by your side.

Original: Sabin:Right!? Hard training doesn't lie. Let's show these guys what monks are made of!
Dialogue: Right!? Hard training doesn't lie. Let's show these guys what monks are made of!

Original: Yda:Your appearance sure doesn't betray your passionate nature.
Dialogue: Your appearance sure doesn't betray your passionate nature.

Original: Yda:Slightly careless, but passionate nevertheless.
Dialogue: Slightly careless, but passionate nevertheless.

Original: Sabin:Eh, I got a little possessedbig deal! Hahaha!
Dialogue: Eh, I got a little possessed—big deal! Hahaha!

Original: Penelo:He startled me when he attacked us, but he seems to be a good person.
Dialogue: He startled me when he attacked us, but he seems to be a good person.

Original: Sabin:Hey, Shadow. My brother's somewhere in this world too, right?
Dialogue: Hey, Shadow. My brother's somewhere in this world too, right?

Original: Shadow:Correct. Firion and I are in his employ.
Dialogue: Correct. Firion and I are in his employ.

Original: Sabin:And we're helping him by closing these portals, yeah?
Dialogue: And we're helping him by closing these portals, yeah?

Original: Sabin:My brother comes up with the plan, and I make it happen.
Dialogue: My brother comes up with the plan, and I make it happen.

Original: Yang:That's very admirable. Let's put our muscles to good use and help those in need!
Dialogue: That's very admirable. Let's put our muscles to good use and help those in need!

Original: Sabin:Yeah! That's what I'm talkin' about!
Dialogue: Yeah! That's what I'm talkin' about!

Original: Terra:It looks like these monks have a lot in common.
Dialogue: It looks like these monks have a lot in common.

Original: Penelo:Hey, now that I think about it...wasn't Yang also brainwashed when we first met him?
Dialogue: Hey, now that I think about it...wasn't Yang also brainwashed when we first met him?

Original: Terra:Do you think that means that martial artists are easy to manipulate?
Dialogue: Do you think that means that martial artists are easy to manipulate?

Original: Penelo:Then that would make their next target...
Dialogue: Then that would make their next target...

Original: Yda:...Why are you looking at me!?
Dialogue: ...Why are you looking at me!?

Original: Yda:No! No way! That would never happen to me!
Dialogue: No! No way! That would never happen to me!

Original: Shadow:...Let us move on.
Dialogue: ...Let us move on.

Original: Edgar:Well, I've succeeded in connecting with the moogle's party. What's next...?
Dialogue: Well, I've succeeded in connecting with the moogle's party. What's next...?

Original: Sabin:Edgar? What are you up to?
Dialogue: Edgar? What are you up to?

Original: Edgar:Ah, Sabin. You look as good as ever.
Dialogue: Ah, Sabin. You look as good as ever.

Original: Sabin:You, too! It's a different world, but I'm glad we're adventuring together again!
Dialogue: You, too! It's a different world, but I'm glad we're adventuring together again!

Original: Edgar:Hearing you were here is one of the reasons I decided to join this party.
Dialogue: Hearing you were here is one of the reasons I decided to join this party.

Original: Edgar:I was worried they might confuse you for a bear.
Dialogue: I was worried they might confuse you for a bear.

Original: Sabin:Aw, c'mon! I don't need that from you!
Dialogue: Aw, c'mon! I don't need that from you!

Original: Edgar:...Sabin, what's your take on this.
Dialogue: ...Sabin, what's your take on this.

Original: Sabin:Huh? Take on what?
Dialogue: Huh? Take on what?

Original: Edgar:Why these gods made this world and summoned us here.
Dialogue: Why these gods made this world and summoned us here.

Original: Edgar:And what that moogle's motives are... I've had a number of allies look into it, but the mystery only deepens.
Dialogue: And what that moogle's motives are... I've had a number of allies look into it, but the mystery only deepens.

Original: Edgar:Have I been going about this the right way?
Dialogue: Have I been going about this the right way?

Original: Sabin:...It isn't like you to start whining like this.
Dialogue: ...It isn't like you to start whining like this.

Original: Edgar:Haha, I suppose not.
Dialogue: Haha, I suppose not.

Original: Sabin:I can't say I get the complicated stuff, but you've never steered me wrong before.
Dialogue: I can't say I get the complicated stuff, but you've never steered me wrong before.

Original: Sabin:Everything'll be fine! I believe in you! Whichever way you're heading, I'll make sure the path is clear for you!
Dialogue: Everything'll be fine! I believe in you! Whichever way you're heading, I'll make sure the path is clear for you!

Original: Edgar:...Of course. I know I can count on you.
Dialogue: ...Of course. I know I can count on you.

Original: Setzer:And we're a bunch of old maids?
Dialogue: And we're a bunch of old maids?

Original: Cyan:I, too, as a Returnernay, as a samuraishall do my utmost!
Dialogue: I, too, as a Returner—nay, as a samurai—shall do my utmost!

Original: Terra:We're all in this together again.
Dialogue: We're all in this together again.

Original: Edgar:Cyan, Terra...
Dialogue: Cyan, Terra...

Original: Sabin:Right! We've got friends coming out our ears! Quit your moping!
Dialogue: Right! We've got friends coming out our ears! Quit your moping!

Original: Sabin:Alright! Let's go shake things up in this world, too!
Dialogue: Alright! Let's go shake things up in this world, too!

Original: Shadow:...Heh. Never a boring bunch...
Dialogue: ...Heh. Never a boring bunch...

Original: Y'shtola:Our band has become rather merry, wouldn't you say?
Dialogue: Our band has become rather merry, wouldn't you say?

Original: Papalymo:Indubitably. Why, you could
Dialogue: Indubitably. Why, you could—

Original: Yda:Hnh! Hya! Take this!
Dialogue: Hnh! Hya! Take this!

Original: Yang:And one! And two!
Dialogue: And one! And two!

Original: Sabin:You're not there yet! I can't see your aura! Keep it up!
Dialogue: You're not there yet! I can't see your aura! Keep it up!

Original: Papalymo:...Say it's almost too merry.
Dialogue: ...Say it's almost too merry.

Original: Y'shtola:Haha. They're all so fired up since he joined us.
Dialogue: Haha. They're all so fired up since he joined us.

Original: Edgar:In truth. Even I'm surprised to see how burly he's turned out.
Dialogue: In truth. Even I'm surprised to see how burly he's turned out.

Original: Papalymo:Is that so?
Dialogue: Is that so?

Original: Edgar:Sabin was sickly and rather meek as a child.
Dialogue: Sabin was sickly and rather meek as a child.

Original: Edgar:Far scrawnier than me. ...Goes to show what training can do for you, I suppose.
Dialogue: Far scrawnier than me. ...Goes to show what training can do for you, I suppose.

Original: Y'shtola:A sickly and meek Sabin...
Dialogue: A sickly and meek Sabin...

Original: Papalymo:It taxes the imagination.
Dialogue: It taxes the imagination.

Original: Sabin:Edgar! What're you chatting about?
Dialogue: Edgar! What're you chatting about?

Original: Yda:Y'shtola and Papalymo will train with us, too!?
Dialogue: Y'shtola and Papalymo will train with us, too!?

Original: Papalymo:Who ever said that?
Dialogue: Who ever said that?

Original: Yang:Hm? Now that I think about it...
Dialogue: Hm? Now that I think about it...

Original: Yang:Seeing the two of you standing together, the resemblance is striking.
Dialogue: Seeing the two of you standing together, the resemblance is striking.

Original: Edgar:We are twins, so I would hope so.
Dialogue: We are twins, so I would hope so.

Original: Yda:What!? You're twins!?
Dialogue: What!? You're twins!?

Original: Prishe:I figured you were further apart in age since Edgar's king!
Dialogue: I figured you were further apart in age since Edgar's king!

Original: Papalymo:Ran you into no difficulties regarding succession?
Dialogue: Ran you into no difficulties regarding succession?

Original: Edgar:Nothing this little fellow couldn't settle.
Dialogue: Nothing this little fellow couldn't settle.

Original: Yang:Settling who would take the throne with a coin toss...? Extraordinary.
Dialogue: Settling who would take the throne with a coin toss...? Extraordinary.

Original: Papalymo:I see... So things were complicated.
Dialogue: I see... So things were complicated.

Original: Edgar:A trifling affair. ...Let's be on our way.
Dialogue: A trifling affair. ...Let's be on our way.

Original: Y'shtola:A remarkable brother you have, Sabin.
Dialogue: A remarkable brother you have, Sabin.

Original: Sabin:You know it! I couldn't be prouder! Gah-
Dialogue: You know it! I couldn't be prouder! Gah-

Original: Mog:Hey, look! I found a Torsion, kupo!
Dialogue: Hey, look! I found a Torsion, kupo!

Original: King:So if we close that, the monsters will stop coming, huh?
Dialogue: So if we close that, the monsters will stop coming, huh?

Original: Penelo:G-guys, we're not alone!
Dialogue: G-guys, we're not alone!

Original: Laguna:Whoa, is that a manikin?
Dialogue: Whoa, is that a manikin?

Original: Galuf:Hold on! Is that...?
Dialogue: Hold on! Is that...?

Original: Galuf:It is! That's Krile! That's my granddaughter Krile!
Dialogue: It is! That's Krile! That's my granddaughter Krile!

Original: Penelo:That's a manikin of your granddaughter!? Then that means
Dialogue: That's a manikin of your granddaughter!? Then that means—

Original: Mog:His granddaughter is probably somewhere in this world, too, kupo.
Dialogue: His granddaughter is probably somewhere in this world, too, kupo.

Original: Laguna:You see that? It ran headfirst right into the Torsion!
Dialogue: You see that? It ran headfirst right into the Torsion!

Original: Galuf:Stop right there! I'm not letting you get away!
Dialogue: Stop right there! I'm not letting you get away!

Original: King:So much for caution. What's our next move?
Dialogue: So much for caution. What's our next move?

Original: Penelo:Wh-what do you mean, "What's our next move"? We can't just leave him.
Dialogue: Wh-what do you mean, "What's our next move"? We can't just leave him.

Original: Laguna:Dunno about you guys, but I'm goin' in! Always wanted to see what the inside of a Torsion looks like, anyway.
Dialogue: Dunno about you guys, but I'm goin' in! Always wanted to see what the inside of a Torsion looks like, anyway.

Original: Laguna:All right, gramps! Ready or not, here I come!
Dialogue: All right, gramps! Ready or not, here I come!

Original: King:I suppose you got to have guts to be a journalist.
Dialogue: I suppose you got to have guts to be a journalist.

Original: Mog:Come on, we're going after them, kupo! Ready?
Dialogue: Come on, we're going after them, kupo! Ready?

Original: Penelo:R-ready when you are.
Dialogue: R-ready when you are.

Original: Mog:Then away we go!
Dialogue: Then away we go!

Original: Steiner:Rejoice! Victory is ours. Sir Galuf, are you feeling okay?
Dialogue: Rejoice! Victory is ours. Sir Galuf, are you feeling okay?

Original: Galuf:I know it wasn't really her...but this isn't something a grandparent should ever have to go through.
Dialogue: I know it wasn't really her...but this isn't something a grandparent should ever have to go through.

Original: Galuf:Th-this voice! Is that...!?
Dialogue: Th-this voice! Is that...!?

Original: ???:I knew it was you! I've been looking all over for you!
Dialogue: I knew it was you! I've been looking all over for you!

Original: Galuf:Oh, Krile! My dear Krile, I'm so glad to see the real you!
Dialogue: Oh, Krile! My dear Krile, I'm so glad to see the real you!

Original: Galuf:Are you okay? You're not hurt at all? What are you doing here, anyway?
Dialogue: Are you okay? You're not hurt at all? What are you doing here, anyway?

Original: Krile:I'm here because II felt you were in trouble.
Dialogue: I'm here because I—I felt you were in trouble.

Original: Krile:I thought I heard your voice coming from this whirlpool-like tunnel, so I jumped inside!
Dialogue: I thought I heard your voice coming from this whirlpool-like tunnel, so I jumped inside!

Original: Cecil:She must have found a Torsion.
Dialogue: She must have found a Torsion.

Original: Yuna:And you leapt inside to save Galuf without even giving it a second thought.
Dialogue: And you leapt inside to save Galuf without even giving it a second thought.

Original: Steiner:Such a devoted granddaughter.
Dialogue: Such a devoted granddaughter.

Original: Krile:Grandpa, who are they?
Dialogue: Grandpa, who are they?

Original: Galuf:They're new friends I met in this world. Where are your manners? Go on, say hello.
Dialogue: They're new friends I met in this world. Where are your manners? Go on, say hello.

Original: Krile:Hi, everybody! I'm Krile. Nice to meet you.
Dialogue: Hi, everybody! I'm Krile. Nice to meet you.

Original: Yuna:I can't believe you came here all by yourself. You must have gotten that heroism from your grandfather.
Dialogue: I can't believe you came here all by yourself. You must have gotten that heroism from your grandfather.

Original: Cecil:You don't seem to be taken aback by the fact that you're in a different world.
Dialogue: You don't seem to be taken aback by the fact that you're in a different world.

Original: Krile:Why would I be? This isn't my first time in a new world.
Dialogue: Why would I be? This isn't my first time in a new world.

Original: Galuf:I told you before, didn't I? We're used to things like this.
Dialogue: I told you before, didn't I? We're used to things like this.

Original: Cecil:Our worlds must be even more different than I thought.
Dialogue: Our worlds must be even more different than I thought.

Original: Mog:She has the light as well, kupo!
Dialogue: She has the light as well, kupo!

Original: Krile:Wow! You can talk?
Dialogue: Wow! You can talk?

Original: Krile:I can tell what moogles want to say, but you can talk just like us!
Dialogue: I can tell what moogles want to say, but you can talk just like us!

Original: Mog:Wait, you know what I'm thinking, kupo?
Dialogue: Wait, you know what I'm thinking, kupo?

Original: Krile:Huh? Well, probably...?
Dialogue: Huh? Well, probably...?

Original: Mog:Kupo! No time to dawdle! Come on, everybody, we have to find the exit, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo! No time to dawdle! Come on, everybody, we have to find the exit, kupo!

Original: Krile:Hey, wait! I thought we were still talking!
Dialogue: Hey, wait! I thought we were still talking!

Original: Yuna:He seemed to be in a rush.
Dialogue: He seemed to be in a rush.

Original: Cecil:It's almost as if there's something he doesn't want us to know.
Dialogue: It's almost as if there's something he doesn't want us to know.

Original: Bartz:Krile, you seriously just jumped into a random Torsion you found? You never change.
Dialogue: Krile, you seriously just jumped into a random Torsion you found? You never change.

Original: Krile:I'd do anything to save Grandpa!
Dialogue: I'd do anything to save Grandpa!

Original: Galuf:That's my granddaughter for ya!
Dialogue: That's my granddaughter for ya!

Original: Vincent:Love transcends time and space, huh?
Dialogue: Love transcends time and space, huh?

Original: Firion:I don't like it here one bit. It feels like it's draining the strength out of me.
Dialogue: I don't like it here one bit. It feels like it's draining the strength out of me.

Original: Firion:Weren't you scared?
Dialogue: Weren't you scared?

Original: Krile:When things look scary, the trick is to not let yourself get caught up with it.
Dialogue: When things look scary, the trick is to not let yourself get caught up with it.

Original: Krile:Just close your eyes and think of your favorite animal, and that way, you won't be scared anymore.
Dialogue: Just close your eyes and think of your favorite animal, and that way, you won't be scared anymore.

Original: Firion:D-does that really work?
Dialogue: D-does that really work?

Original: Galuf:Oh, don't be so wimpy. Learn a thing or two from Krileshe's far your junior, but has twice your pluck!
Dialogue: Oh, don't be so wimpy. Learn a thing or two from Krile—she's far your junior, but has twice your pluck!

Original: Vincent:Pluck alone won't see us through this... Not without the strength of will to go with it.
Dialogue: Pluck alone won't see us through this... Not without the strength of will to go with it.

Original: Mog:Sorry to keep you waiting, kupo! I found the exit!
Dialogue: Sorry to keep you waiting, kupo! I found the exit!

Original: Firion:Thank goodness. We can finally get out of here.
Dialogue: Thank goodness. We can finally get out of here.

Original: Mog:Follow me, kupo!
Dialogue: Follow me, kupo!

Original: Yuffie:Finally! I was getting sick of this place!
Dialogue: Finally! I was getting sick of this place!

Original: Bartz:Let's go and get some fresh air!
Dialogue: Let's go and get some fresh air!

Original: Galuf:Come on, Krile, let's get moving.
Dialogue: Come on, Krile, let's get moving.

Original: Galuf:Hm? Is something the matter?
Dialogue: Hm? Is something the matter?

Original: Krile:I missed you so much.
Dialogue: I missed you so much.

Original: Krile:Don't leave me behind anymore, okay? I don't know what I'd do without you.
Dialogue: Don't leave me behind anymore, okay? I don't know what I'd do without you.

Original: Galuf:Hoho, what's gotten into you?
Dialogue: Hoho, what's gotten into you?

Original: Krile:It's just... I just...!
Dialogue: It's just... I just...!

Original: Galuf:'Krile, I'll always be there for you. We're family.
Dialogue: Krile, I'll always be there for you. We're family.

Original: Krile:Grandpa... Thank you.
Dialogue: Grandpa... Thank you.

Original: Bartz:Hold up, Gramps.
Dialogue: Hold up, Gramps.

Original: Bartz:'Don't forget about the rest of us.
Dialogue: Don't forget about the rest of us.

Original: Galuf:I'll be there for all of you until the very end.
Dialogue: I'll be there for all of you until the very end.

Original: Galuf:Now, come, everyone's waiting.
Dialogue: Now, come, everyone's waiting.

Original: Krile:Ahh, feel that wind! It's good to know it blows here, too.
Dialogue: Ahh, feel that wind! It's good to know it blows here, too.

Original: Penelo:Oh? Look over there.
Dialogue: Oh? Look over there.

Original: Krile:A chocobo! They're here, too!
Dialogue: A chocobo! They're here, too!

Original: Ace:...Something seems wrong, though.
Dialogue: ...Something seems wrong, though.

Original: Chocobo:Kweh... Kwehhh...
Dialogue: Kweh... Kwehhh...

Original: Bartz:What's that? You've got something on your mind? Are you thinking about lunch?
Dialogue: What's that? You've got something on your mind? Are you thinking about lunch?

Original: Krile:I don't think that's it. He's thinking about...love!
Dialogue: I don't think that's it. He's thinking about...love!

Original: Ace:Is that something a chocobo would worry about?
Dialogue: Is that something a chocobo would worry about?

Original: Krile:There's another chocobo he likes, and he can't decide to profess his love or not.
Dialogue: There's another chocobo he likes, and he can't decide to profess his love or not.

Original: Bartz:Would ya look at this smooth operator?
Dialogue: Would ya look at this smooth operator?

Original: Penelo:I think you should admit your feelings. You never know what the world has in store for you.
Dialogue: I think you should admit your feelings. You never know what the world has in store for you.

Original: Ace:Right. Being proactive is more constructive than doing nothing.
Dialogue: Right. Being proactive is more constructive than doing nothing.

Original: Krile:You're worried about doing it alone? You can be braver than that!
Dialogue: You're worried about doing it alone? You can be braver than that!

Original: Chocobo:Kweh... Kwehhh!
Dialogue: Kweh... Kwehhh!

Original: Bartz:That settles it. Don't worry, we'll be right behind you.
Dialogue: That settles it. Don't worry, we'll be right behind you.

Original: Penelo:We'll be watching to see how it goes!
Dialogue: We'll be watching to see how it goes!

Original: Chocobo:Kweh? Kweh?
Dialogue: Kweh? Kweh?

Original: Ace:Is he...nervous? It doesn't look like the conversation is getting very far.
Dialogue: Is he...nervous? It doesn't look like the conversation is getting very far.

Original: Bartz:C'mon, what happened to those guts from a minute ago?
Dialogue: C'mon, what happened to those guts from a minute ago?

Original: Penelo:Ah, he's coming this way!
Dialogue: Ah, he's coming this way!

Original: Chocobo:Kwehhh... Kweh-kweh...
Dialogue: Kwehhh... Kweh-kweh...

Original: Bartz:What? You need advice?
Dialogue: What? You need advice?

Original: Krile:Boy, you're high maintenance! Okay, in this kind of situation, you should...
Dialogue: Boy, you're high maintenance! Okay, in this kind of situation, you should...

Original: Chocobo:Kweh!? Kweh kweh!?
Dialogue: Kweh!? Kweh kweh!?

Original: Krile:Right! So go for it!
Dialogue: Right! So go for it!

Original: Chocobo:Kweh-kweh! Kwehhh!
Dialogue: Kweh-kweh! Kwehhh!

Original: Chocobo:...Kweh, kweeeh...
Dialogue: ...Kweh, kweeeh...

Original: Penelo:Is it safe to say it went well? All thanks to Krile, huh?
Dialogue: Is it safe to say it went well? All thanks to Krile, huh?

Original: Ace:What advice did you give him?
Dialogue: What advice did you give him?

Original: Krile:"Don't keep a lady waiting! She wants to hear what you have to say!"
Dialogue: "Don't keep a lady waiting! She wants to hear what you have to say!"

Original: Krile:...I could tell what she was thinking, too.
Dialogue: ...I could tell what she was thinking, too.

Original: Ace:Can't hide anything from you.
Dialogue: Can't hide anything from you.

Original: Penelo:I hope they live happily ever after.
Dialogue: I hope they live happily ever after.

Original: Bartz:This reminds me of Boko... I hope he's getting along well with his missus.
Dialogue: This reminds me of Boko... I hope he's getting along well with his missus.

Original: Krile:I'm sure they're doing fine. Let's go see them when we get back home.
Dialogue: I'm sure they're doing fine. Let's go see them when we get back home.

Original: Krile:Well, Grandpa? Am I doing it right?
Dialogue: Well, Grandpa? Am I doing it right?

Original: Galuf:Marvelously, my girl.
Dialogue: Marvelously, my girl.

Original: Krile:Because you taught me how, you know.
Dialogue: Because you taught me how, you know.

Original: Setzer:Good grief... Galuf makes a picture perfect doting grandparent.
Dialogue: Good grief... Galuf makes a picture perfect doting grandparent.

Original: Firion:How can he help it with a cute grandchild like Krile? It's good to cherish your family.
Dialogue: How can he help it with a cute grandchild like Krile? It's good to cherish your family.

Original: Krile:Alright, let's head to our next destination.
Dialogue: Alright, let's head to our next destination.

Original: Terra:Krile, didn't you say this isn't your first time in another world?
Dialogue: Krile, didn't you say this isn't your first time in another world?

Original: Firion:A m-meteorite!? That's something you can ride?
Dialogue: A m-meteorite!? That's something you can ride?

Original: Terra:Not like the magic ones, I guess. ...What's it like?
Dialogue: Not like the magic ones, I guess. ...What's it like?

Original: Krile:Where we're from, you can use them to travel to another world.
Dialogue: Where we're from, you can use them to travel to another world.

Original: Setzer:Sightseeing from a rock hurtling through the sky doesn't sound so bad.
Dialogue: Sightseeing from a rock hurtling through the sky doesn't sound so bad.

Original: Cloud:...I'll pass. You won't see me on a meteor anytime soon...
Dialogue: ...I'll pass. You won't see me on a meteor anytime soon...

Original: Galuf:From the beginning, our world is divided intotwoseparateworlds.
Dialogue: From the beginning, our world is divided into two separate worlds.

Original: Krile:Bartz and the others live in a different world from me and Grandpa.
Dialogue: Bartz and the others live in a different world from me and Grandpa.

Original: Cloud:That means you and Bartz are aliens from each other's perspective?
Dialogue: That means you and Bartz are aliens from each other's perspective?

Original: Galuf:In the strictest sense of the word, yes.
Dialogue: In the strictest sense of the word, yes.

Original: Krile:One day, Grandpa took a meteorite to the other world...
Dialogue: One day, Grandpa took a meteorite to the other world...

Original: Krile:So I took another one to go help him! That's where I met Bartz and Faris.
Dialogue: So I took another one to go help him! That's where I met Bartz and Faris.

Original: Terra:Wow... You're so brave.
Dialogue: Wow... You're so brave.

Original: Firion:Isn't that a little reckless? Riding on meteorites and jumping into Torsions...
Dialogue: Isn't that a little reckless? Riding on meteorites and jumping into Torsions...

Original: Krile:It's the least I can do for Grandpa!
Dialogue: It's the least I can do for Grandpa!

Original: Setzer:...Courage is one thing, but what about worrying Galuf?
Dialogue: ...Courage is one thing, but what about worrying Galuf?

Original: Galuf:I'd be lying if I said she doesn't worry me...
Dialogue: I'd be lying if I said she doesn't worry me...

Original: Galuf:But I couldn't be happier to have raised a child who acts on her own for the sake of her family.
Dialogue: But I couldn't be happier to have raised a child who acts on her own for the sake of her family.

Original: Krile:Thanks for the encouragement, Grandpa!
Dialogue: Thanks for the encouragement, Grandpa!

Original: Setzer:I see... I guess they are a perfect match...
Dialogue: I see... I guess they are a perfect match...

Original: Cloud:Like grandfather, like granddaughter.
Dialogue: Like grandfather, like granddaughter.

Original: Edge:We're being followed. I don't sense any hostility though.
Dialogue: We're being followed. I don't sense any hostility though.

Original: Zidane:Yeah, you can come out now.
Dialogue: Yeah, you can come out now.

Original: ???:Besides, it would be foolish of me to pick a fight with a band of skilled warriors such as yourselves. Surely, you wouldn't hurt a man of peace, either?
Dialogue: Besides, it would be foolish of me to pick a fight with a band of skilled warriors such as yourselves. Surely, you wouldn't hurt a man of peace, either?

Original: Warrior of Light:You seem lightly equipped for someone traveling these lands alone.
Dialogue: You seem lightly equipped for someone traveling these lands alone.

Original: ???:A wandering minstrel such as myself has no need for any more than what's necessary to survive.
Dialogue: A wandering minstrel such as myself has no need for any more than what's necessary to survive.

Original: Onion Knight:Right... And do bards usually spy on people, too?
Dialogue: Right... And do bards usually spy on people, too?

Original: ???:I had to make sure you weren't a bevy of ladies after my heart.
Dialogue: I had to make sure you weren't a bevy of ladies after my heart.

Original: ???:Besides, I am unfamiliar with these lands, so I'd prefer to remain careful.
Dialogue: Besides, I am unfamiliar with these lands, so I'd prefer to remain careful.

Original: Onion Knight:Yeah...I guess I'd do the same thing if I were in your shoes.
Dialogue: Yeah...I guess I'd do the same thing if I were in your shoes.

Original: Onion Knight:Our journey has just made us a little distrusting of others. That's all.
Dialogue: Our journey has just made us a little distrusting of others. That's all.

Original: Onion Knight:Anyway, you're a bard, right? Sing us something.
Dialogue: Anyway, you're a bard, right? Sing us something.

Original: Mog:Good idea, kupo! I wanna hear a song!
Dialogue: Good idea, kupo! I wanna hear a song!

Original: Thancred:They call me Thancred.
Dialogue: They call me Thancred.

Original: Thancred:And while I wish I could humbly honor your request, I only sing sweet whispers of love to the ladies. I fear I haven't a song in my repertoire for your lot.
Dialogue: And while I wish I could humbly honor your request, I only sing sweet whispers of love to the ladies. I fear I haven't a song in my repertoire for your lot.

Original: Thancred:Well, I apologize for bothering you. Now if you would be so kind as to excuse me.
Dialogue: Well, I apologize for bothering you. Now if you would be so kind as to excuse me.

Original: Zidane:Can you believe that guy?
Dialogue: Can you believe that guy?

Original: Edge:Yeah, what a disgrace to the profession.
Dialogue: Yeah, what a disgrace to the profession.

Original: Mog:But I sensed the light in him, kupo.
Dialogue: But I sensed the light in him, kupo.

Original: Warrior of Light:Then I suppose we will cross paths again one day.
Dialogue: Then I suppose we will cross paths again one day.

Original: Thancred:Oh, if it isn't that moogle and his friends.
Dialogue: Oh, if it isn't that moogle and his friends.

Original: Thancred:So we meet again. Glad to see you are doing well.
Dialogue: So we meet again. Glad to see you are doing well.

Original: Mog:Kupo!? It's the bard from earlier!
Dialogue: Kupo!? It's the bard from earlier!

Original: Thancred:Excellent, you remember me.
Dialogue: Excellent, you remember me.

Original: Rem:Who's that?
Dialogue: Who's that?

Original: Terra:I have no idea.
Dialogue: I have no idea.

Original: Thancred:Ah, it seems there are a few new faces. Why didn't you tell me you were traveling with such beautiful ladies?
Dialogue: Ah, it seems there are a few new faces. Why didn't you tell me you were traveling with such beautiful ladies?

Original: Thancred:I would have prepared a song.
Dialogue: I would have prepared a song.

Original: Y'shtola:Go on. We do not mind waiting. Besides, it would make a good story for when we return home.
Dialogue: Go on. We do not mind waiting. Besides, it would make a good story for when we return home.

Original: Yda:Yeah, if everyone isn't already fed up with Thancred, that is!
Dialogue: Yeah, if everyone isn't already fed up with Thancred, that is!

Original: Thancred:Y'shtola!? Yda!?
Dialogue: Y'shtola!? Yda!?

Original: Thancred:I searched all over for you two.
Dialogue: I searched all over for you two.

Original: Y'shtola:Oh, really? It certainly didn't sound like it.
Dialogue: Oh, really? It certainly didn't sound like it.

Original: Thancred:I wandered the continent as a bard in search of someone I recognized. I sought information on this world.
Dialogue: I wandered the continent as a bard in search of someone I recognized. I sought information on this world.

Original: Thancred:And I am of the mind that music is merely a tool to get people to open up.
Dialogue: And I am of the mind that music is merely a tool to get people to open up.

Original: Thancred:After all, love makes us closer. Wouldn't you agree, milady? How about I play a song to show you what I mean?
Dialogue: After all, love makes us closer. Wouldn't you agree, milady? How about I play a song to show you what I mean?

Original: Terra:I'm sorry. I, uh... I don't really know what to say.
Dialogue: I'm sorry. I, uh... I don't really know what to say.

Original: Thancred:Well, even a good marksman may miss sometimes.
Dialogue: Well, even a good marksman may miss sometimes.

Original: Yda:Thancred, stop. You're making Terra uncomfortable.
Dialogue: Thancred, stop. You're making Terra uncomfortable.

Original: Thancred:My apologies. That wasn't my intention, love.
Dialogue: My apologies. That wasn't my intention, love.

Original: Y'shtola:What will you do now?
Dialogue: What will you do now?

Original: Thancred:Well... It is a relief to see you two. Would you mind if I accompanied you?
Dialogue: Well... It is a relief to see you two. Would you mind if I accompanied you?

Original: Warrior of Light:But you are a bard, are you not? I would assume combat to be outside your realm of expertise.
Dialogue: But you are a bard, are you not? I would assume combat to be outside your realm of expertise.

Original: Thancred:Not exactly.
Dialogue: Not exactly.

Original: Thancred:The world has become a dangerous place. Even a traveling minstrel needs to be able to take care of himself.
Dialogue: The world has become a dangerous place. Even a traveling minstrel needs to be able to take care of himself.

Original: Warrior of Light:Impressive. You are evidently no stranger to the battlefield.
Dialogue: Impressive. You are evidently no stranger to the battlefield.

Original: Thancred:What can I say? I am a man with many skills.
Dialogue: What can I say? I am a man with many skills.

Original: Mog:I'm all for having another, friend, kupo! Especially one that's been blessed by the light!
Dialogue: I'm all for having another, friend, kupo! Especially one that's been blessed by the light!

Original: Thancred:Blessed by the light?
Dialogue: Blessed by the light?

Original: Rem:You could say it means you're one of us.
Dialogue: You could say it means you're one of us.

Original: Thancred:I see. There is unquestionably much more I need to learn about this world. Anyway, it is an honor to make your acquaintance.
Dialogue: I see. There is unquestionably much more I need to learn about this world. Anyway, it is an honor to make your acquaintance.

Original: Thancred:Hells, finally I catch up.
Dialogue: Hells, finally I catch up.

Original: Vaan:Where'd you run off to? I thought someone was missing.
Dialogue: Where'd you run off to? I thought someone was missing.

Original: Thancred:Just a mite about.
Dialogue: Just a mite about.

Original: Hope:Don't wander too far or you'll get lost.
Dialogue: Don't wander too far or you'll get lost.

Original: Thancred:My bad. I'll take more care.
Dialogue: My bad. I'll take more care.

Original: Vaan:We were about to get going, but you wanna catch your breath first?
Dialogue: We were about to get going, but you wanna catch your breath first?

Original: Thancred:Don't mind me. I mayn't look much, but my endurance has never failed me yet.
Dialogue: Don't mind me. I mayn't look much, but my endurance has never failed me yet.

Original: Tifa:Huh? Thancred, are you hurt?
Dialogue: Huh? Thancred, are you hurt?

Original: Penelo:Oh, no! Quick, let's tend
Dialogue: Oh, no! Quick, let's tend—

Original: Thancred:My, wherever did I pick this up?
Dialogue: My, wherever did I pick this up?

Original: Thancred:I wouldn't even notice a scrape like this.
Dialogue: I wouldn't even notice a scrape like this.

Original: Vaan:If you're fine, that's fine, but speak up if it starts to get to you, hear?
Dialogue: If you're fine, that's fine, but speak up if it starts to get to you, hear?

Original: Vaan:Alright, let's get a move on!
Dialogue: Alright, let's get a move on!

Original: Thancred:Not quite yet. I suggest you give up on that path.
Dialogue: Not quite yet. I suggest you give up on that path.

Original: Thancred:It's thick with fiends. Far too many to avoid.
Dialogue: It's thick with fiends. Far too many to avoid.

Original: Thancred:We'd be better off taking the long way. The battles avoided will be a shortcut in the end.
Dialogue: We'd be better off taking the long way. The battles avoided will be a shortcut in the end.

Original: Hope:...How do you know that?
Dialogue: ...How do you know that?

Original: Hope:Don't tell me that's how you...?
Dialogue: Don't tell me that's how you...?

Original: Thancred:I had hoped to pull things off more gracefully, but I suppose it goes to show where I need to grow.
Dialogue: I had hoped to pull things off more gracefully, but I suppose it goes to show where I need to grow.

Original: Hope:You're sure a capable hand.
Dialogue: You're sure a capable hand.

Original: Thancred:...Gathering information is a specialty of mine, is all.
Dialogue: ...Gathering information is a specialty of mine, is all.

Original: Thancred:As embarrassing as it might be to be injured while carrying out my so-called specialty, haha.
Dialogue: As embarrassing as it might be to be injured while carrying out my so-called specialty, haha.

Original: Penelo:That's nothing to laugh about! It's dangerous to work alone!
Dialogue: That's nothing to laugh about! It's dangerous to work alone!

Original: Tifa:Yeah, quit trying to act cool while you're making us worry about you.
Dialogue: Yeah, quit trying to act cool while you're making us worry about you.

Original: Thancred:S-sorry, it won't happen again.
Dialogue: S-sorry, it won't happen again.

Original: Thancred:But you can't argue that it's best we know the safest way ahead. ...Am I right?
Dialogue: But you can't argue that it's best we know the safest way ahead. ...Am I right?

Original: Penelo:We can agree on it's best being safe.
Dialogue: We can agree on it's best being safe.

Original: Penelo:But that includes your safety, too.
Dialogue: But that includes your safety, too.

Original: Thancred:...You are a gentle soul. I appreciate your kindness, and will not betray it.
Dialogue: ...You are a gentle soul. I appreciate your kindness, and will not betray it.

Original: Thancred:Henceforth, I will do my best to carry out my investigations with a minimum of enemy engagement.
Dialogue: Henceforth, I will do my best to carry out my investigations with a minimum of enemy engagement.

Original: Tifa:That'd be a load off our shoulders. Shall we leave it to the expert?
Dialogue: That'd be a load off our shoulders. Shall we leave it to the expert?

Original: Penelo:That...seems fair.
Dialogue: That...seems fair.

Original: Thancred:If a fight is inevitable, I will seek your help. You have my word.
Dialogue: If a fight is inevitable, I will seek your help. You have my word.

Original: Cecil:Halt!
Dialogue: Halt!

Original: Thancred:Ahh, you got me!
Dialogue: Ahh, you got me!

Original: Thancred:I thought I stood a chance, but...now not so much.
Dialogue: I thought I stood a chance, but...now not so much.

Original: Bartz:I wasn't sure if you were holding back.
Dialogue: I wasn't sure if you were holding back.

Original: Thancred:Same to you. You tailored your style for me, did you not?
Dialogue: Same to you. You tailored your style for me, did you not?

Original: Thancred:The advantage was mine at the start, but from some point, you had made all my moves your own.
Dialogue: The advantage was mine at the start, but from some point, you had made all my moves your own.

Original: Thancred:An aptitude worth envying, you have there.
Dialogue: An aptitude worth envying, you have there.

Original: Bartz:I didn't want to lose, and got to learn a thing or two.
Dialogue: I didn't want to lose, and got to learn a thing or two.

Original: Onion Knight:Guess it's my turn.
Dialogue: Guess it's my turn.

Original: Thancred:Spare me a moment to regain myself. Bartz here just about drained me.
Dialogue: Spare me a moment to regain myself. Bartz here just about drained me.

Original: Cecil:In that case, perhaps you might spar with me instead.
Dialogue: In that case, perhaps you might spar with me instead.

Original: Thancred:...An unforgiving lot.
Dialogue: ...An unforgiving lot.

Original: Yang:Would you blame them?
Dialogue: Would you blame them?

Original: Yang:They all wish to know how much they can rely on one calling himself a bard.
Dialogue: They all wish to know how much they can rely on one calling himself a bard.

Original: Thancred:I wonder about that... But the spark in their eyes was at least apparent.
Dialogue: I wonder about that... But the spark in their eyes was at least apparent.

Original: Thancred:...Aw, come on. Are they making fun of me?
Dialogue: ...Aw, come on. Are they making fun of me?

Original: Thancred:Onion Knight is fighting like he's dual wielding.
Dialogue: Onion Knight is fighting like he's dual wielding.

Original: Thancred:And Cecil's going along with it.
Dialogue: And Cecil's going along with it.

Original: Yang:I doubt it is by accident.
Dialogue: I doubt it is by accident.

Original: Yang:It shows how you hold their interest.
Dialogue: It shows how you hold their interest.

Original: Thancred:Each and every one of them is trying to drain the confidence from me.
Dialogue: Each and every one of them is trying to drain the confidence from me.

Original: Yang:The more they learn of your abilities, the stronger grows their sense of camaraderie.
Dialogue: The more they learn of your abilities, the stronger grows their sense of camaraderie.

Original: Thancred:I suppose it's easier than composing a ballad for a lot of lads.
Dialogue: I suppose it's easier than composing a ballad for a lot of lads.

Original: Yang:Come now, are you rested enough? I have been waiting for my chance to spar as well.
Dialogue: Come now, are you rested enough? I have been waiting for my chance to spar as well.

Original: Thancred:...Oof. Would you consider accepting a ballad instead?
Dialogue: ...Oof. Would you consider accepting a ballad instead?

Original: Thancred:Torsions...was it? There are quite a number of them, aren't there?
Dialogue: Torsions...was it? There are quite a number of them, aren't there?

Original: Rem:And this is only the beginning. They're appearing all over the world even as we speak.
Dialogue: And this is only the beginning. They're appearing all over the world even as we speak.

Original: Terra:You don't have to force yourself to help if you don't want to.
Dialogue: You don't have to force yourself to help if you don't want to.

Original: Thancred:I couldn't run away and leave you with all the work, my dear. Besides, it is not like I have anywhere else to be.
Dialogue: I couldn't run away and leave you with all the work, my dear. Besides, it is not like I have anywhere else to be.

Original: Edge:Thancred, be honest with me. Are you really just a bard?
Dialogue: Thancred, be honest with me. Are you really just a bard?

Original: Thancred:What, still don't trust me?
Dialogue: What, still don't trust me?

Original: Edge:No, it's not that. I'm just amazed by how well you carry yourself in battle.
Dialogue: No, it's not that. I'm just amazed by how well you carry yourself in battle.

Original: Thancred:Heh, I appreciate the flattery.
Dialogue: Heh, I appreciate the flattery.

Original: Edge:That's why it's hard to believe you're nothing more than a bard.
Dialogue: That's why it's hard to believe you're nothing more than a bard.

Original: Edge:Or was that singing sweet whispers stuff all a lie?
Dialogue: Or was that singing sweet whispers stuff all a lie?

Original: Y'shtola:Oh, it is anything but falsehood. As I recall
Dialogue: Oh, it is anything but falsehood. As I recall—

Original: Thancred:Y-Y'shtola, I'm afraid to ask what you are about to say.
Dialogue: Y-Y'shtola, I'm afraid to ask what you are about to say.

Original: Y'shtola:You fear I will tell anecdotes of the array of women you've seduced? Or perhaps tales of a time before you took up the blade?
Dialogue: You fear I will tell anecdotes of the array of women you've seduced? Or perhaps tales of a time before you took up the blade?

Original: Edge:That many women, huh? Nice.
Dialogue: That many women, huh? Nice.

Original: Thancred:Y-you jest, surely?
Dialogue: Y-you jest, surely?

Original: Thancred:I was not misleading you when I said I was a bard who sings of love.
Dialogue: I was not misleading you when I said I was a bard who sings of love.

Original: Thancred:I daresay you still may not trust me, but I assure you I will not act to your detriment.
Dialogue: I daresay you still may not trust me, but I assure you I will not act to your detriment.

Original: Edge:Come on, I never said I didn't trust you. Anyway, we're counting on you.
Dialogue: Come on, I never said I didn't trust you. Anyway, we're counting on you.

Original: Thancred:And I, on you all. It is truly an honor to fight alongside such seasoned warriors.
Dialogue: And I, on you all. It is truly an honor to fight alongside such seasoned warriors.

Original: Yda:Hey, Thancred, I don't mean to interrupt, but...
Dialogue: Hey, Thancred, I don't mean to interrupt, but...

Original: Thancred:What is it?
Dialogue: What is it?

Original: Rem:...Seducing an array of women? Do you think Y'shtola was being serious?
Dialogue: ...Seducing an array of women? Do you think Y'shtola was being serious?

Original: Terra:I don't know, but...
Dialogue: I don't know, but...

Original: Thancred:Why are you backing away!?
Dialogue: Why are you backing away!?

Original: Y'shtola:Oh dear. Instinct is a marvelous gift.
Dialogue: Oh dear. Instinct is a marvelous gift.

Original: Thancred:Come on, you know I am no scoundrel. Tell them.
Dialogue: Come on, you know I am no scoundrel. Tell them.

Original: Edge:Heh, can't wait to hear about all these babes you got with! Fill me in on the details later, okay?
Dialogue: Heh, can't wait to hear about all these babes you got with! Fill me in on the details later, okay?

Original: Thancred:Aye, very well...
Dialogue: Aye, very well...

Original: Mog:Kupo?
Dialogue: Kupo?

Original: Mog:Someone's heading toward the Torsion up ahead.
Dialogue: Someone's heading toward the Torsion up ahead.

Original: Warrior of Light:A foe, perchance?
Dialogue: A foe, perchance?

Original: Mog:Quite the opposite, kupo! They're one of us!
Dialogue: Quite the opposite, kupo! They're one of us!

Original: Tifa:You think they're trying to close the Torsion then?
Dialogue: You think they're trying to close the Torsion then?

Original: Rem:They probably have no idea what they're getting themselves into.
Dialogue: They probably have no idea what they're getting themselves into.

Original: Vaan:Which is why we oughta save them. The monsters here are too tough to fight alone.
Dialogue: Which is why we oughta save them. The monsters here are too tough to fight alone.

Original: Mog:We have to hurry then, kupo!
Dialogue: We have to hurry then, kupo!

Original: Sazh:Seriously though, you gotta be pretty reckless to be out here wrestling monsters all alone.
Dialogue: Seriously though, you gotta be pretty reckless to be out here wrestling monsters all alone.

Original: Sazh:...Especially while trudging through all this snow.
Dialogue: ...Especially while trudging through all this snow.

Original: Warrior of Light:That is simply a testament to his courage. I am certain he shall prove to be a great help to our cause.
Dialogue: That is simply a testament to his courage. I am certain he shall prove to be a great help to our cause.

Original: Mog:There's only one way to find out. Come on, kupo!
Dialogue: There's only one way to find out. Come on, kupo!

Original: Warrior of Light:Well, we were able to close the Torsion.
Dialogue: Well, we were able to close the Torsion.

Original: Warrior of Light:But where is the lone warrior who came this way?
Dialogue: But where is the lone warrior who came this way?

Original: Hope:He's probably still around here somewhere.
Dialogue: He's probably still around here somewhere.

Original: Hope:There are still some monsters left
Dialogue: There are still some monsters left—

Original: ???:Take this!
Dialogue: Take this!

Original: Hope:Snow!?
Dialogue: Snow!?

Original: Snow:Is that really you!?
Dialogue: Is that really you!?

Original: Zidane:You two know each other?
Dialogue: You two know each other?

Original: Sazh:He's a friend of ours from back home. Never expected to run into him here though.
Dialogue: He's a friend of ours from back home. Never expected to run into him here though.

Original: Snow:Sazh, it's good to see you. By the way, who are your new friends?
Dialogue: Sazh, it's good to see you. By the way, who are your new friends?

Original: Mog:They're warriors gathered here from different worlds, kupo!
Dialogue: They're warriors gathered here from different worlds, kupo!

Original: Zidane:And any friend of Hope and Sazh is a friend of ours.
Dialogue: And any friend of Hope and Sazh is a friend of ours.

Original: Zidane:I mean, you risked your life to save someone who you thought was a stranger.
Dialogue: I mean, you risked your life to save someone who you thought was a stranger.

Original: Zidane:Now that's a real hero!
Dialogue: Now that's a real hero!

Original: Snow:A talking moogle and a guy with a tailand I thought I'd seen it all.
Dialogue: A talking moogle and a guy with a tail—and I thought I'd seen it all.

Original: Snow:Consider my mind blown.
Dialogue: Consider my mind blown.

Original: Hope:Doesn't take much to do that.
Dialogue: Doesn't take much to do that.

Original: Zidane:Whoa, harsh. What's gotten into him?
Dialogue: Whoa, harsh. What's gotten into him?

Original: Sazh:Let's just say things weren't always sunshine and rainbows between them.
Dialogue: Let's just say things weren't always sunshine and rainbows between them.

Original: Warrior of Light:For what purpose did you approach the Torsion?
Dialogue: For what purpose did you approach the Torsion?

Original: Snow:You talking about that portal-thing? I don't know where it came from.
Dialogue: You talking about that portal-thing? I don't know where it came from.

Original: Snow:But I can't just ignore something that's spitting out monsters.
Dialogue: But I can't just ignore something that's spitting out monsters.

Original: Snow:So I figured I should do something about it before anyone got hurt.
Dialogue: So I figured I should do something about it before anyone got hurt.

Original: Mog:Then you should come with us to save the world, kupo!
Dialogue: Then you should come with us to save the world, kupo!

Original: Snow:Save the world, huh? I like the sound of that.
Dialogue: Save the world, huh? I like the sound of that.

Original: Snow:All right! You need a hero, you got one!
Dialogue: All right! You need a hero, you got one!

Original: Mog:Great! We're counting on you, kupo!
Dialogue: Great! We're counting on you, kupo!

Original: Snow:I know how to take a hit, so if you need me to lure the enemies, just let me know.
Dialogue: I know how to take a hit, so if you need me to lure the enemies, just let me know.

Original: Hope:You never change, do you?
Dialogue: You never change, do you?

Original: Snow:But man am I glad to see you safe and sound, Serah.
Dialogue: But man am I glad to see you safe and sound, Serah.

Original: Serah:Not just thatI can hold my own in a fight now, too! I might even be more useful than you.
Dialogue: Not just that—I can hold my own in a fight now, too! I might even be more useful than you.

Original: Snow:That's great. Having you along for the ride's a real pick-me-up.
Dialogue: That's great. Having you along for the ride's a real pick-me-up.

Original: Vincent:...Go figure.
Dialogue: ...Go figure.

Original: Vincent:I would have expected him to want to keep Serah away from battle, like someone else here...
Dialogue: I would have expected him to want to keep Serah away from battle, like someone else here...

Original: Lightning:Are you fine with putting Serah in danger? Aren't you worried about her?
Dialogue: Are you fine with putting Serah in danger? Aren't you worried about her?

Original: Serah:Not this again...
Dialogue: Not this again...

Original: Snow:Course I'm worried. But it's her choice to fight, and I'm gonna respect that.
Dialogue: Course I'm worried. But it's her choice to fight, and I'm gonna respect that.

Original: Snow:Plus, she's got us if anything ever happens.
Dialogue: Plus, she's got us if anything ever happens.

Original: Snow:If I can't save her, you will. Right, Sis?
Dialogue: If I can't save her, you will. Right, Sis?

Original: Lightning:Of course! When did I ever say I wouldn't?
Dialogue: Of course! When did I ever say I wouldn't?

Original: Snow:Right? She'll never have better backup than you.
Dialogue: Right? She'll never have better backup than you.

Original: Sabin:Hey, don't forget about us. We're watching out for all three of you, too...
Dialogue: Hey, don't forget about us. We're watching out for all three of you, too...

Original: Sabin:We're all in this together, so nobody needs to ask for help. It's a given.
Dialogue: We're all in this together, so nobody needs to ask for help. It's a given.

Original: Snow:Thanks, Sabin. I just want to make sure Serah's able to do what she wants.
Dialogue: Thanks, Sabin. I just want to make sure Serah's able to do what she wants.

Original: Snow:So listen, Sis...
Dialogue: So listen, Sis...

Original: Shadow:Keeping a distance is also a method of defense...
Dialogue: Keeping a distance is also a method of defense...

Original: Vincent:I can appreciate the dread of not recovering what you've let go, though...
Dialogue: I can appreciate the dread of not recovering what you've let go, though...

Original: Vincent:Regrets don't vanish so easily...
Dialogue: Regrets don't vanish so easily...

Original: Lightning:I... I can't bear it...
Dialogue: I... I can't bear it...

Original: Shadow:...For as brave as you are as a warrior, you're just as cautious when it comes to Serah.
Dialogue: ...For as brave as you are as a warrior, you're just as cautious when it comes to Serah.

Original: Lightning:Of course I am. She's my family.
Dialogue: Of course I am. She's my family.

Original: Serah:I feel the same way, you know. I'm worried you don't look out for yourself.
Dialogue: I feel the same way, you know. I'm worried you don't look out for yourself.

Original: Snow:Ditto. She's not the only one.
Dialogue: Ditto. She's not the only one.

Original: Lightning:Argh...you two...
Dialogue: Argh...you two...

Original: Lightning:Fine. Listen. Now that this bruiser's here, too...
Dialogue: Fine. Listen. Now that this bruiser's here, too...

Original: Lightning:If we're fighting together, I expect you to drive us like dogs, got it?
Dialogue: If we're fighting together, I expect you to drive us like dogs, got it?

Original: Serah:Lightning...! Got it!
Dialogue: Lightning...! Got it!

Original: Snow:Alright! Just tell me what you need! I'll keep all y'all safe and sound!
Dialogue: Alright! Just tell me what you need! I'll keep all y'all safe and sound!

Original: Firion:We need to stay on our toes here. No telling what enemies lie ahead.
Dialogue: We need to stay on our toes here. No telling what enemies lie ahead.

Original: Snow:If things start to get hot, just holler. I'll keep everyone out of harm's way!
Dialogue: If things start to get hot, just holler. I'll keep everyone out of harm's way!

Original: Wakka:Not that I don't 'preciate it, but "everyone" is a bit much, ya?
Dialogue: Not that I don't 'preciate it, but "everyone" is a bit much, ya?

Original: Snow:"A bit much" is my middle name.
Dialogue: "A bit much" is my middle name.

Original: Snow:Back home, too, I fought like crazy so I wouldn't lose Serah or anyone else.
Dialogue: Back home, too, I fought like crazy so I wouldn't lose Serah or anyone else.

Original: Ace:You derive your strength to protect from a desire not to lose anyone.
Dialogue: You derive your strength to protect from a desire not to lose anyone.

Original: Snow:Everything that was my normal suddenly came crashing down one day.
Dialogue: Everything that was my normal suddenly came crashing down one day.

Original: Snow:Everything I thought was real, people I thought were my allies, it was all turned upside down.
Dialogue: Everything I thought was real, people I thought were my allies, it was all turned upside down.

Original: Ramza:...All I once surveyed was but a fraction of the real world, and the more I learned the truth, the less sure I became.
Dialogue: ...All I once surveyed was but a fraction of the real world, and the more I learned the truth, the less sure I became.

Original: Steiner:You cannot see the whole picture unless it also extends beyond the frame...
Dialogue: You cannot see the whole picture unless it also extends beyond the frame...

Original: Wakka:You didn't lose it when everything you believed in came tumbling down? I know I did...
Dialogue: You didn't lose it when everything you believed in came tumbling down? I know I did...

Original: Snow:I'm too dumb for that.
Dialogue: I'm too dumb for that.

Original: Snow:I could be cut off from the entire world, but as long as I stick to my principles, I figure it's all alright.
Dialogue: I could be cut off from the entire world, but as long as I stick to my principles, I figure it's all alright.

Original: Ramza:You're also a man driven by faith.
Dialogue: You're also a man driven by faith.

Original: Snow:Finding out what's true only brings what needs protecting into clearer focus.
Dialogue: Finding out what's true only brings what needs protecting into clearer focus.

Original: Snow:I'll fight, survive, and make Serah my wife.
Dialogue: I'll fight, survive, and make Serah my wife.

Original: Wakka:Heh, she might whip you good, ya know?
Dialogue: Heh, she might whip you good, ya know?

Original: Snow:I'm just happy to have her by my side.
Dialogue: I'm just happy to have her by my side.

Original: Steiner:A joyous sentiment if there ever was one!
Dialogue: A joyous sentiment if there ever was one!

Original: Firion:...We're all warriors, but we're all fighting to bring an end to fighting.
Dialogue: ...We're all warriors, but we're all fighting to bring an end to fighting.

Original: Snow:You got that right. That's why I'm gonna make sure you all get home in one piece.
Dialogue: You got that right. That's why I'm gonna make sure you all get home in one piece.

Original: Firion:Okay, just don't overdo it.
Dialogue: Okay, just don't overdo it.

Original: Snow:Let's get a move on!
Dialogue: Let's get a move on!

Original: Snow:So all of you are fighting for something, huh?
Dialogue: So all of you are fighting for something, huh?

Original: Zidane:You too, right? You must've got some sort of plan.
Dialogue: You too, right? You must've got some sort of plan.

Original: Zidane:I mean, you wouldn't be risking your life to protect others if you didn't.
Dialogue: I mean, you wouldn't be risking your life to protect others if you didn't.

Original: Snow:I'll do anything to protect those I care about. Doesn't matter where I am.
Dialogue: I'll do anything to protect those I care about. Doesn't matter where I am.

Original: Hope:It's someplace back in our world. Snow, come on, nobody knows what you're talking about.
Dialogue: It's someplace back in our world. Snow, come on, nobody knows what you're talking about.

Original: Snow:Yeah, my bad. Anyway, I can't allow my home to be destroyed.
Dialogue: Yeah, my bad. Anyway, I can't allow my home to be destroyed.

Original: Cloud:Pretty sure of yourself, huh?
Dialogue: Pretty sure of yourself, huh?

Original: Cecil:Do you really think you can do it all on your own?
Dialogue: Do you really think you can do it all on your own?

Original: Snow:It's not gonna be easy, but I'm sure it'll all work out. It always does.
Dialogue: It's not gonna be easy, but I'm sure it'll all work out. It always does.

Original: Snow:Besides, I'm not alone. I've got you guys, right?
Dialogue: Besides, I'm not alone. I've got you guys, right?

Original: Zidane:That's the spirit! I think we're gonna get along just fine.
Dialogue: That's the spirit! I think we're gonna get along just fine.

Original: Zidane:...So is this someone you're trying to protect really that cute?
Dialogue: ...So is this someone you're trying to protect really that cute?

Original: Snow:You bet she is. I could go on about her all day. ...So I better not see you try to make a move on her.
Dialogue: You bet she is. I could go on about her all day. ...So I better not see you try to make a move on her.

Original: Zidane:Y-you don't say. Sounds like Snow has it rough back home.
Dialogue: Y-you don't say. Sounds like Snow has it rough back home.

Original: Warrior of Light:Someone to protect...
Dialogue: Someone to protect...

Original: Snow:Come on, I know there's someone you're fighting for, too.
Dialogue: Come on, I know there's someone you're fighting for, too.

Original: Warrior of Light:I have walked the path of light.
Dialogue: I have walked the path of light.

Original: Warrior of Light:But I question if I have ever risked my life to protect someone as you do.
Dialogue: But I question if I have ever risked my life to protect someone as you do.

Original: Mog:Don't beat yourself up over not being able to remember, kupo.
Dialogue: Don't beat yourself up over not being able to remember, kupo.

Original: Cloud:I'm sure you'll find yourself if you just keep moving forward.
Dialogue: I'm sure you'll find yourself if you just keep moving forward.

Original: Cloud:Talking about it can only get you so far.
Dialogue: Talking about it can only get you so far.

Original: Warrior of Light:You're right.
Dialogue: You're right.

Original: Warrior of Light:Perhaps one day, I will become more like you, able to
Dialogue: Perhaps one day, I will become more like you, able to—

Original: Snow:You're thinking too much again! Just go with the flow and it'll all work out. I promise.
Dialogue: You're thinking too much again! Just go with the flow and it'll all work out. I promise.

Original: Hope:*Sigh* While I'm glad he's okay, I'm starting to miss when things were a little...quieter.
Dialogue: *Sigh* While I'm glad he's okay, I'm starting to miss when things were a little...quieter.

Original: Zidane:Come on, what's the fun in that? Besides, I kind of like the guy.
Dialogue: Come on, what's the fun in that? Besides, I kind of like the guy.

Original: ???:Take this you little...!
Dialogue: Take this you little...!

Original: Mog:Kupo!? Did you hear that!?
Dialogue: Kupo!? Did you hear that!?

Original: Rem:Hey, doesn't that sound like...?
Dialogue: Hey, doesn't that sound like...?

Original: King:Yeah, let's go check it out.
Dialogue: Yeah, let's go check it out.

Original: Rem:Cater! Is that you?
Dialogue: Cater! Is that you?

Original: Cater:Rem!? And is that King!?
Dialogue: Rem!? And is that King!?

Original: Steiner:Did you vanquish the monsters here all by yourself!?
Dialogue: Did you vanquish the monsters here all by yourself!?

Original: Yang:Your courage is commendable.
Dialogue: Your courage is commendable.

Original: Cater:Huh? Oh, thanks. ...So, uh, what's up with the get-up? You guys circus performers or something?
Dialogue: Huh? Oh, thanks. ...So, uh, what's up with the get-up? You guys circus performers or something?

Original: Steiner:...! Hmph. Well, the others seem to know her, so I'll let it pass.
Dialogue: ...! Hmph. Well, the others seem to know her, so I'll let it pass.

Original: Steiner:I am Adelbert Steiner.
Dialogue: I am Adelbert Steiner.

Original: Yang:And I am Yang, monk and leader of Fabul.
Dialogue: And I am Yang, monk and leader of Fabul.

Original: Cater:Hold up. A man wearing armor and a warrior monk? What in the world is going on here?
Dialogue: Hold up. A man wearing armor and a warrior monk? What in the world is going on here?

Original: King:We need to talk.
Dialogue: We need to talk.

Original: Rem:So, Cater, this world we're in...
Dialogue: So, Cater, this world we're in...

Original: Cater:Ohhh! No wonder they're dressed so funny.
Dialogue: Ohhh! No wonder they're dressed so funny.

Original: Yang:Well, we are from different worlds, after all.
Dialogue: Well, we are from different worlds, after all.

Original: Steiner:Exactly. Our attire is simply a characteristic of our home.
Dialogue: Exactly. Our attire is simply a characteristic of our home.

Original: Rem:She's just never seen anybody dressed like you two before. That's all.
Dialogue: She's just never seen anybody dressed like you two before. That's all.

Original: Cater:But seriously, I have the worst luck. I was just taking a nap on the terrace, and the next thing you know, I'm in a different world.
Dialogue: But seriously, I have the worst luck. I was just taking a nap on the terrace, and the next thing you know, I'm in a different world.

Original: Cater:Anyway, we need to close those Torsions or whatever if we ever wanna go home, right?
Dialogue: Anyway, we need to close those Torsions or whatever if we ever wanna go home, right?

Original: Mog:Right, kupo! So you should come
Dialogue: Right, kupo! So you should come—

Original: Cater:All right, I'm gonna go see what's up ahead! You guys check that way! We'll meet up later!
Dialogue: All right, I'm gonna go see what's up ahead! You guys check that way! We'll meet up later!

Original: Mog:Waaait! I wasn't finished talking yet, kupo!
Dialogue: Waaait! I wasn't finished talking yet, kupo!

Original: Yang:Are you sure she'll be okay?
Dialogue: Are you sure she'll be okay?

Original: King:No, this place is crawling with monsters.
Dialogue: No, this place is crawling with monsters.

Original: Rem:Leave it to Cater to go running off without thinking first.
Dialogue: Leave it to Cater to go running off without thinking first.

Original: Steiner:Come, let us hurry after your comrade!
Dialogue: Come, let us hurry after your comrade!

Original: Mog:Finally! I didn't think we'd ever catch up, kupo!
