Original: Garnet:I heard it often when I was little.
Dialogue: I heard it often when I was little.

Original: Garnet:When I sing this song, it warms my heart...
Dialogue: When I sing this song, it warms my heart...

Original: Garnet:It reminds me that I'm not alone, and gives me the strength to go on.
Dialogue: It reminds me that I'm not alone, and gives me the strength to go on.

Original: King:A favorite song from your childhood...? Sounds a lot like Ace.
Dialogue: A favorite song from your childhood...? Sounds a lot like Ace.

Original: Vivi:That's right, you sing a lot, too, don't you?
Dialogue: That's right, you sing a lot, too, don't you?

Original: Ace:But I also feel a mysterious comfort when I sing it.
Dialogue: But I also feel a mysterious comfort when I sing it.

Original: Tidus:Hmmm, I get it. Songs from memory that calm you down...
Dialogue: Hmmm, I get it. Songs from memory that calm you down...

Original: Jecht:...Songs, huh. S'pose you'd find something like that in every world.
Dialogue: ...Songs, huh. S'pose you'd find something like that in every world.

Original: Garnet:People everywhere have such memories.
Dialogue: People everywhere have such memories.

Original: Garnet:Sir Jecht, I do so wish to hear your song. Might you sing it for me?
Dialogue: Sir Jecht, I do so wish to hear your song. Might you sing it for me?

Original: Jecht:Yeah, well, I'd love to.
Dialogue: Yeah, well, I'd love to.

Original: Jecht:...If it were that easy.
Dialogue: ...If it were that easy.

Original: King:...Sounds like it has a complicated backstory.
Dialogue: ...Sounds like it has a complicated backstory.

Original: Vivi:You look a little lonely, Mister Jecht.
Dialogue: You look a little lonely, Mister Jecht.

Original: Jecht:Naw, nothing like that. It's a song everyone loved in our world. Anyone hearin' it'd feel at ease.
Dialogue: Naw, nothing like that. It's a song everyone loved in our world. Anyone hearin' it'd feel at ease.

Original: Ace:As we did, led here by Garnet's voice.
Dialogue: As we did, led here by Garnet's voice.

Original: Ace:There's some invisible power songs may have. Even in different worlds, that power doesn't change.
Dialogue: There's some invisible power songs may have. Even in different worlds, that power doesn't change.

Original: Jecht:...Maybe. Even if your world changes... Even if you change, ya can still hear it...
Dialogue: ...Maybe. Even if your world changes... Even if you change, ya can still hear it...

Original: Vivi:I wanna hear your song again! Would you sing it one more time?
Dialogue: I wanna hear your song again! Would you sing it one more time?

Original: Garnet:It would be my pleasure.
Dialogue: It would be my pleasure.

Original: Garnet:Ahem... Haha, I'm a little nervous.
Dialogue: Ahem... Haha, I'm a little nervous.

Original: Garnet:...So you also asked to be kidnapped to escape your kingdom?
Dialogue: ...So you also asked to be kidnapped to escape your kingdom?

Original: Garnet:I understand how you feel... Painfully so.
Dialogue: I understand how you feel... Painfully so.

Original: Cecil:Why, if it isn't Ashe and Garnet?
Dialogue: Why, if it isn't Ashe and Garnet?

Original: Edgar:Two flowers blooming in the desert... Hm, a lovely view indeed.
Dialogue: Two flowers blooming in the desert... Hm, a lovely view indeed.

Original: Garnet:Blooming...? There's not a flower in sight, is there?
Dialogue: Blooming...? There's not a flower in sight, is there?

Original: Edgar:That innocence suits you all too well, Your Highness.
Dialogue: That innocence suits you all too well, Your Highness.

Original: Ashe:Edgar, you are royalty as well, yes?
Dialogue: Edgar, you are royalty as well, yes?

Original: Edgar:That is correct. I'm honored you remembered.
Dialogue: That is correct. I'm honored you remembered.

Original: Garnet:Do you worry for your subjects back home?
Dialogue: Do you worry for your subjects back home?

Original: Edgar:I'd be lying if I said I didn't.
Dialogue: I'd be lying if I said I didn't.

Original: Edgar:But the people ofFigaroare made of sturdy stuff. They supported their country marvelously whilst I was away battlingKefka.
Dialogue: But the people of Figaro are made of sturdy stuff. They supported their country marvelously whilst I was away battling Kefka.

Original: Cecil:There was never unrest or threat of invasion during your absence?
Dialogue: There was never unrest or threat of invasion during your absence?

Original: Edgar:Not once. We ran into a bit of engine trouble with the castle, but civil issues...
Dialogue: Not once. We ran into a bit of engine trouble with the castle, but civil issues...

Original: Edgar:Well, I suppose it'd also be a lie to say there were never any of those...
Dialogue: Well, I suppose it'd also be a lie to say there were never any of those...

Original: Sabin:Haha, you got that right. Things were...complicated.
Dialogue: Haha, you got that right. Things were...complicated.

Original: Sabin:...Thanks, Edgar.
Dialogue: ...Thanks, Edgar.

Original: Edgar:Come, now. Bygones are bygones. And we could get through that because of all the good help we had.
Dialogue: Come, now. Bygones are bygones. And we could get through that because of all the good help we had.

Original: Edgar:A king can only be king with the support of the people around him. I'm sure you feel the same.
Dialogue: A king can only be king with the support of the people around him. I'm sure you feel the same.

Original: Ashe:...Yes, I am deeply indebted to my retainers and associates.
Dialogue: ...Yes, I am deeply indebted to my retainers and associates.

Original: Garnet:I, too, feel it's thanks to Zidane, Steiner, and the others that I can continue on.
Dialogue: I, too, feel it's thanks to Zidane, Steiner, and the others that I can continue on.

Original: Cecil:...Thinking ever of your people and blessed with reliable allies... The citizens of your kingdoms must be happy ones.
Dialogue: ...Thinking ever of your people and blessed with reliable allies... The citizens of your kingdoms must be happy ones.

Original: Garnet:Yes... Power will change even the finest person...
Dialogue: Yes... Power will change even the finest person...

Original: Palom:Heeey! Cecil!
Dialogue: Heeey! Cecil!

Original: Palom:What're you doing? Get your butt over here!
Dialogue: What're you doing? Get your butt over here!

Original: Yang:We are soon to depart! Please make your preparations!
Dialogue: We are soon to depart! Please make your preparations!

Original: Edgar:...Heh. You have your own reliable allies, I'd say.
Dialogue: ...Heh. You have your own reliable allies, I'd say.

Original: Garnet:And a gentle heart. It seems being king might suit you, Cecil.
Dialogue: And a gentle heart. It seems being king might suit you, Cecil.

Original: Cecil:Haha...me, king? Please, do not even jest. I have no intention of instigating a coup d'tat.
Dialogue: Haha...me, king? Please, do not even jest. I have no intention of instigating a coup d'état.

Original: Garnet:Ah, no, I only meant you have the makings of a fine king. Forgive me.
Dialogue: Ah, no, I only meant you have the makings of a fine king. Forgive me.

Original: Cecil:What a fantasy...to be king. A dark knight, not true royalty like you, has no place above others.
Dialogue: What a fantasy...to be king. A dark knight, not true royalty like you, has no place above others.

Original: Cecil:But...why does something about it ring familiar...?
Dialogue: But...why does something about it ring familiar...?

Original: Cecil:A groggy feeling...of some fragment of a memory...
Dialogue: A groggy feeling...of some fragment of a memory...

Original: Yuna:Whew... The monsters in this tower are rather fearsome.
Dialogue: Whew... The monsters in this tower are rather fearsome.

Original: Wakka:Just the thing for your summoner's training. We're right behind ya, so don't sweat it.
Dialogue: Just the thing for your summoner's training. We're right behind ya, so don't sweat it.

Original: Tidus:Exactly! You got a hundred and ten percent of our support!
Dialogue: Exactly! You got a hundred and ten percent of our support!

Original: Vivi:Hang in there, Miss Yuna! I'll try my hardest, too!
Dialogue: Hang in there, Miss Yuna! I'll try my hardest, too!

Original: Yuna:Thank you, everyone.
Dialogue: Thank you, everyone.

Original: Yuna:I...wonder if I'm getting stronger.
Dialogue: I...wonder if I'm getting stronger.

Original: Eiko:You can do it! I'm cheering for you!
Dialogue: You can do it! I'm cheering for you!

Original: Vivi:Yeah! I can breathe easy just having you here!
Dialogue: Yeah! I can breathe easy just having you here!

Original: Vivi:Don't you think so, too, Mister?
Dialogue: Don't you think so, too, Mister?

Original: ???:...I wonder about that.
Dialogue: ...I wonder about that.

Original: Wakka:Haha... Harsh as ever, Auron...
Dialogue: Haha... Harsh as ever, Auron...

Original: Tidus:You can say that again. That's why Auron always
Dialogue: You can say that again. That's why Auron always—

Original: Wakka:...!? H-h-how long have you been standing there!?
Dialogue: ...!? H-h-how long have you been standing there!?

Original: Vivi:Yipes, I was talking to a stranger...
Dialogue: Yipes, I was talking to a stranger...

Original: Eiko:Wh-who the heck are you! It's rude to surprise a lady like that! You scared the stuffing outta me!
Dialogue: Wh-who the heck are you! It's rude to surprise a lady like that! You scared the stuffing outta me!

Original: Tidus:Vivi, Eiko, relax. He's no stranger. You could almost say he's as familiar as they come...
Dialogue: Vivi, Eiko, relax. He's no stranger. You could almost say he's as familiar as they come...

Original: Yuna:It's been a while, Sir Auron. I'm happy to see you again.
Dialogue: It's been a while, Sir Auron. I'm happy to see you again.

Original: Auron:...This isn't the time for joyous reunions. Look over there.
Dialogue: ...This isn't the time for joyous reunions. Look over there.

Original: Vivi:Wah! A monster!
Dialogue: Wah! A monster!

Original: Eiko:Argh! Why does everyone have to pop out of nowhere like that!? If you're gonna show up suddenly, say so first!
Dialogue: Argh! Why does everyone have to pop out of nowhere like that!? If you're gonna show up suddenly, say so first!

Original: Auron:Perfect timing. Yuna, Tidus. Let's see how you've grown.
Dialogue: Perfect timing. Yuna, Tidus. Let's see how you've grown.

Original: Wakka:Yuna, it's all good. With Auron on our side, we got nothin' to worry 'bout!
Dialogue: Yuna, it's all good. With Auron on our side, we got nothin' to worry 'bout!

Original: Auron:Who said I was joining you?
Dialogue: Who said I was joining you?

Original: Eiko:...Whaaat? I thought you're her friend! Give us a hand here!
Dialogue: ...Whaaat? I thought you're her friend! Give us a hand here!

Original: Auron:I'll be watching closely. You won't get any help from me.
Dialogue: I'll be watching closely. You won't get any help from me.

Original: Vivi:Y-you can't mean that! What if we lose? Then what?
Dialogue: Y-you can't mean that! What if we lose? Then what?

Original: Auron:We'll cross that bridge when we come to it.
Dialogue: We'll cross that bridge when we come to it.

Original: Wakka:Harsh, man... Alright, bring it on!
Dialogue: Harsh, man... Alright, bring it on!

Original: Tidus:Let's show Auron what we're made of!
Dialogue: Let's show Auron what we're made of!

Original: Tidus:Yahoo! The winners!
Dialogue: Yahoo! The winners!

Original: Firion:He really did just watch. Is he some big shot where you're from?
Dialogue: He really did just watch. Is he some big shot where you're from?

Original: Wakka:Right, and the summoner saves the world. Been there, done that for Sir Auron.
Dialogue: Right, and the summoner saves the world. Been there, done that for Sir Auron.

Original: Yuna:Sir Auron journeyed with myfatherand defeatedSin.
Dialogue: Sir Auron journeyed with my father and defeated Sin.

Original: Firion:So if I follow you...defeating Sin's what made him legendary?
Dialogue: So if I follow you...defeating Sin's what made him legendary?

Original: Tidus:...More or less.
Dialogue: ...More or less.

Original: Auron:Not bad. You've improved.
Dialogue: Not bad. You've improved.

Original: Yuna:No, I'm afraid I...still have a long way to go.
Dialogue: No, I'm afraid I...still have a long way to go.

Original: Yuna:I've only made it this far with everyone else's support.
Dialogue: I've only made it this far with everyone else's support.

Original: Auron:Hah. You should be happy with that.
Dialogue: Hah. You should be happy with that.

Original: Auron:The number of guardians you have is the number of people you can rely on.
Dialogue: The number of guardians you have is the number of people you can rely on.

Original: Auron:The strength of your guardians is a sign of your own strength. Hold your head higher.
Dialogue: The strength of your guardians is a sign of your own strength. Hold your head higher.

Original: Yuna:Y-yes! Thank you, sir!
Dialogue: Y-yes! Thank you, sir!

Original: Firion:He just complimented us.
Dialogue: He just complimented us.

Original: Tidus:Aren't you happy about it.
Dialogue: Aren't you happy about it.

Original: Firion:Why shouldn't I be? Someone a big enough deal to be called a legend complimented all my friends.
Dialogue: Why shouldn't I be? Someone a big enough deal to be called a legend complimented all my friends.

Original: Wakka:...Ya can sure be honest when ya least expect it. Or maybe "pure" is the word.
Dialogue: ...Ya can sure be honest when ya least expect it. Or maybe "pure" is the word.

Original: Yuna:Ah, Sir Auron. If it's no problem, might you consider traveling with us...?
Dialogue: Ah, Sir Auron. If it's no problem, might you consider traveling with us...?

Original: Auron:Of course. I intend to.
Dialogue: Of course. I intend to.

Original: Auron:Your enemies' strength will also grow from here on out. I will once more escort you as a guardian.
Dialogue: Your enemies' strength will also grow from here on out. I will once more escort you as a guardian.

Original: Vincent:A legendary guardian, eh...? How much ability must one have to be called a legend?
Dialogue: A legendary guardian, eh...? How much ability must one have to be called a legend?

Original: Auron:...Legends don't mean a thing when all the rules have changed. Don't let your guard down just because I'm here.
Dialogue: ...Legends don't mean a thing when all the rules have changed. Don't let your guard down just because I'm here.

Original: Vincent:Change the world and titles are irrelevant? Sound reasoning.
Dialogue: Change the world and titles are irrelevant? Sound reasoning.

Original: Auron:Precisely. And strength doesn't come from an individual's title or power.
Dialogue: Precisely. And strength doesn't come from an individual's title or power.

Original: Tidus:Why are you two so serious? The gist is, it's everyone's power together that's important. Am I right?
Dialogue: Why are you two so serious? The gist is, it's everyone's power together that's important. Am I right?

Original: Vincent:...Hmph. Such innocence.
Dialogue: ...Hmph. Such innocence.

Original: Auron:Through and through. How much trouble has he caused you?
Dialogue: Through and through. How much trouble has he caused you?

Original: Tidus:Why's it a given I'm causing trouble!
Dialogue: Why's it a given I'm causing trouble!

Original: Auron:As his chaperone, too, I beg your cooperation.
Dialogue: As his chaperone, too, I beg your cooperation.

Original: Vincent:Heh. ...Likewise. I can tell he's been a handful for you.
Dialogue: Heh. ...Likewise. I can tell he's been a handful for you.

Original: Cyan:An enormous tower, this is. Prodigious in monsters and no top in sight.
Dialogue: An enormous tower, this is. Prodigious in monsters and no top in sight.

Original: Auron:The monsters around here are trivial. ...Let's keep moving.
Dialogue: The monsters around here are trivial. ...Let's keep moving.

Original: Zell:You call those trivial!? Man, legend is right!
Dialogue: You call those trivial!? Man, legend is right!

Original: Cyan:Sir Auron has a superior sword arm and the nerve to match it.
Dialogue: Sir Auron has a superior sword arm and the nerve to match it.

Original: Yang:Indeed. Fighting alongside him is a right fine workout.
Dialogue: Indeed. Fighting alongside him is a right fine workout.

Original: Tidus:Can you lay it on a little thicker?
Dialogue: Can you lay it on a little thicker?

Original: Yuna:Haha, it's truly a great help having you with us, Sir Auron.
Dialogue: Haha, it's truly a great help having you with us, Sir Auron.

Original: Yuna:Running into you in a place like this... Miracles really do happen!
Dialogue: Running into you in a place like this... Miracles really do happen!

Original: Auron:Not that easily, they don't. I'm here because you are.
Dialogue: Not that easily, they don't. I'm here because you are.

Original: Yuna:...What do you mean?
Dialogue: ...What do you mean?

Original: Zell:It almost sounds like you've been tailing us the whole time.
Dialogue: It almost sounds like you've been tailing us the whole time.

Original: Auron:Oh ho, you're sharper than you look.
Dialogue: Oh ho, you're sharper than you look.

Original: Auron:Just so, I came to this tower and have been observing you for a while.
Dialogue: Just so, I came to this tower and have been observing you for a while.

Original: Yang:What!? I hadn't the slightest!
Dialogue: What!? I hadn't the slightest!

Original: Cyan:Nor I. My training is clearly far from adequate.
Dialogue: Nor I. My training is clearly far from adequate.

Original: Tidus:Why didn't you show your face sooner!? You're fine watching Yuna struggle!?
Dialogue: Why didn't you show your face sooner!? You're fine watching Yuna struggle!?

Original: Tidus:Well, yeah, but...
Dialogue: Well, yeah, but...

Original: Auron:If I couldn't confirm your journey wasn't in error, I wouldn't have offered to help.
Dialogue: If I couldn't confirm your journey wasn't in error, I wouldn't have offered to help.

Original: Auron:Moreover...I was enjoying myself. Watching all you and your companions put into growing stronger...
Dialogue: Moreover...I was enjoying myself. Watching all you and your companions put into growing stronger...

Original: Yang:Paternal devotion...you might say.
Dialogue: Paternal devotion...you might say.

Original: Cyan:I understand thy feeling all too well, Sir Auron.
Dialogue: I understand thy feeling all too well, Sir Auron.

Original: Yuna:I want to save the world with everyone else... This isn't Spira, but my mind is made up.
Dialogue: I want to save the world with everyone else... This isn't Spira, but my mind is made up.

Original: Yuna:So please, lend us your strength in this world, too!
Dialogue: So please, lend us your strength in this world, too!

Original: Auron:The start of a new story...eh?
Dialogue: The start of a new story...eh?

Original: Jecht:Y'know, Auron, you've sure mellowed out.
Dialogue: Y'know, Auron, you've sure mellowed out.

Original: Auron:...How long do you think it's been since then?
Dialogue: ...How long do you think it's been since then?

Original: Jecht:Heh, yeah. My brat's put on an inch or two, too.
Dialogue: Heh, yeah. My brat's put on an inch or two, too.

Original: Jecht:I owe it to ya... Thanks.
Dialogue: I owe it to ya... Thanks.

Original: Laguna:Oh? Here's a dainty-looking get-together!
Dialogue: Oh? Here's a dainty-looking get-together!

Original: Cyan:From Lady Yuna I heard tell these two art old friends.
Dialogue: From Lady Yuna I heard tell these two art old friends.

Original: Jecht:Yup, me and Auron were her old man's guardians.
Dialogue: Yup, me and Auron were her old man's guardians.

Original: Sazh:Oh, yeah, did he also have to do that summoner's journey thing?
Dialogue: Oh, yeah, did he also have to do that summoner's journey thing?

Original: Steiner:A journey to save the world! They both accomplished such an amazing feat. Truly inspiring!
Dialogue: A journey to save the world! They both accomplished such an amazing feat. Truly inspiring!

Original: Jecht:An amazing feat, huh? ...Yeah, well...a lot went down, and I ended up unable to go home...
Dialogue: An amazing feat, huh? ...Yeah, well...a lot went down, and I ended up unable to go home...

Original: Jecht:So I had to ask this guy to wipe my kid's nose in my place.
Dialogue: So I had to ask this guy to wipe my kid's nose in my place.

Original: Laguna:Ah, I get it! So you're like Tidus's second pops.
Dialogue: Ah, I get it! So you're like Tidus's second pops.

Original: Cyan:To take charge of another man's son...thy trust must be in no small measure.
Dialogue: To take charge of another man's son...thy trust must be in no small measure.

Original: Auron:...That's how long we've known each other.
Dialogue: ...That's how long we've known each other.

Original: Laguna:I'll be. You two don't look very friendly on the outside...
Dialogue: I'll be. You two don't look very friendly on the outside...

Original: Laguna:But obviously that's not the case!
Dialogue: But obviously that's not the case!

Original: Auron:The first impression Jecht left was...horrendous.
Dialogue: The first impression Jecht left was...horrendous.

Original: Auron:Imprudent, self-satisfied, and reckless. And a bad drunk on top of all that.
Dialogue: Imprudent, self-satisfied, and reckless. And a bad drunk on top of all that.

Original: Jecht:This guy was as stubborn as they come.
Dialogue: This guy was as stubborn as they come.

Original: Jecht:And he was so hot-headed, we were like oil and water! I don't know how many times we went at it.
Dialogue: And he was so hot-headed, we were like oil and water! I don't know how many times we went at it.

Original: Sazh:Auron, hot-headed! I can't begin to imagine...
Dialogue: Auron, hot-headed! I can't begin to imagine...

Original: Auron:...It was a long time ago.
Dialogue: ...It was a long time ago.

Original: Steiner:And in spite of your difficult beginnings, there is no questioning the friendship between you now!
Dialogue: And in spite of your difficult beginnings, there is no questioning the friendship between you now!

Original: Steiner:In my case, though I could not accept Zidane...my impression of him changed during our struggles together.
Dialogue: In my case, though I could not accept Zidane...my impression of him changed during our struggles together.

Original: Laguna:I'm best buds with my brothers-in-arms! I wonder if they're here, too. I'd sure like to introduce you to them.
Dialogue: I'm best buds with my brothers-in-arms! I wonder if they're here, too. I'd sure like to introduce you to them.

Original: Cyan:Ahh...the bonds forged on the battlefield can overcome all.
Dialogue: Ahh...the bonds forged on the battlefield can overcome all.

Original: Sazh:Huh, everybody's got plenty of stories to tell. Say, what're y'all up to later?
Dialogue: Huh, everybody's got plenty of stories to tell. Say, what're y'all up to later?

Original: Auron:...I'm game.
Dialogue: ...I'm game.

Original: Jecht:Alright! I like the sound of that! Been a while since we cut loose!
Dialogue: Alright! I like the sound of that! Been a while since we cut loose!

Original: Hope:The World of Darkness... Are we really going to be okay?
Dialogue: The World of Darkness... Are we really going to be okay?

Original: Raijin:Wh-wh-what're ya worried about, ya know? We'll be f-f-fine, ya know!
Dialogue: Wh-wh-what're ya worried about, ya know? We'll be f-f-fine, ya know!

Original: Zell:Hahaha! Raijin, you're quaking in your boots!
Dialogue: Hahaha! Raijin, you're quaking in your boots!

Original: Hope:Aren't you, too?
Dialogue: Aren't you, too?

Original: Zell:Ulp! You could tell?
Dialogue: Ulp! You could tell?

Original: Galuf:How pitiful. Can't you show a little more spine?
Dialogue: How pitiful. Can't you show a little more spine?

Original: Zell:Easier said than done...
Dialogue: Easier said than done...

Original: Auron:To lose your nerve before a great trial can happen to anyone... Even me.
Dialogue: To lose your nerve before a great trial can happen to anyone... Even me.

Original: Raijin:Wha...? You mean to tell us you've been through this too, ya know?
Dialogue: Wha...? You mean to tell us you've been through this too, ya know?

Original: Auron:...Of course.
Dialogue: ...Of course.

Original: Auron:In my younger days, hoping to change things, I journeyed to hone my skills.
Dialogue: In my younger days, hoping to change things, I journeyed to hone my skills.

Original: Auron:But in the end...nothing changed. I was insufficiently prepared.
Dialogue: But in the end...nothing changed. I was insufficiently prepared.

Original: Galuf:Everyone experiences something like that at some point.
Dialogue: Everyone experiences something like that at some point.

Original: Hope:Even you?
Dialogue: Even you?

Original: Galuf:Quite some time ago...
Dialogue: Quite some time ago...

Original: Galuf:If I had been a bit more dependable, I wouldn't have caused everyone so much trouble.
Dialogue: If I had been a bit more dependable, I wouldn't have caused everyone so much trouble.

Original: Auron:Bartz and the others don't seem troubled, though, so it shouldn't trouble you.
Dialogue: Bartz and the others don't seem troubled, though, so it shouldn't trouble you.

Original: Auron:But for the rest of you, we only want you to not choose a path forever regretting the same old rut.
Dialogue: But for the rest of you, we only want you to not choose a path forever regretting the same old rut.

Original: Galuf:In every world, the aged entrust their hopes to posterity.
Dialogue: In every world, the aged entrust their hopes to posterity.

Original: Hope:...Yeah, if we want to accomplish anything, we need to conquer ourselves first...
Dialogue: ...Yeah, if we want to accomplish anything, we need to conquer ourselves first...

Original: Raijin:Hear! Nothing to it but to do it, ya know! Time to screw our courage after coming this far, ya know!
Dialogue: Hear! Nothing to it but to do it, ya know! Time to screw our courage after coming this far, ya know!

Original: Zell:I'm ready! If there's anything I don't want, it's regrets!
Dialogue: I'm ready! If there's anything I don't want, it's regrets!

Original: Auron:You'll define your generation. It is enough to shape your stories without dwelling on them.
Dialogue: You'll define your generation. It is enough to shape your stories without dwelling on them.

Original: Galuf:...Looks like you spurred them on.
Dialogue: ...Looks like you spurred them on.

Original: Auron:...If so, good.
Dialogue: ...If so, good.

Original: Galuf:...You know, you don't need to act so decrepit yet though.
Dialogue: ...You know, you don't need to act so decrepit yet though.

Original: Auron:...What's that supposed to mean?
Dialogue: ...What's that supposed to mean?

Original: Galuf:Sure, the aged are supposed to inspire the young, but from where I stand, you're still plenty young.
Dialogue: Sure, the aged are supposed to inspire the young, but from where I stand, you're still plenty young.

Original: Galuf:Your tale isn't finished either. Let's keep spinning this yarn together.
Dialogue: Your tale isn't finished either. Let's keep spinning this yarn together.

Original: Galuf:I jest!
Dialogue: I jest!

Original: Auron:...I intend to. I have my own story...
Dialogue: ...I intend to. I have my own story...

Original: ???:Huff... Is this the last of them?
Dialogue: Huff... Is this the last of them?

Original: ???:Argh! There's no end!
Dialogue: Argh! There's no end!

Original: ???:What on earth...is going on? Why is this happening to me?
Dialogue: What on earth...is going on? Why is this happening to me?
Oh... Ohhh...

Original: ???:Setzer! Cyan!
Dialogue: Setzer! Cyan!

Original: ???:Thank goodness I found you! Where have you
Dialogue: Thank goodness I found you! Where have you—

Original: ???:Something's not right...
Dialogue: Something's not right...

Original: Manikin:Ohhhgh... Ough...
Dialogue: Ohhhgh... Ough...

Original: ???:You're just imitations...
Dialogue: You're just imitations...

Original: ???:It seems I have no choice...but to fight...!
Dialogue: It seems I have no choice...but to fight...!

Original: Setzer:Hm? Is someone there?
Dialogue: Hm? Is someone there?

Original: Setzer:Celes! Well, this is a surprise! So you were dragged
Dialogue: Celes! Well, this is a surprise! So you were dragged—

Original: Celes:Not a step! Don't you come near me!
Dialogue: Not a step! Don't you come near me!

Original: Setzer:...Now what's this about? It's rare to hear you joke around.
Dialogue: ...Now what's this about? It's rare to hear you joke around.

Original: Celes:I'm not joking! If you fakes think you can fool me again
Dialogue: I'm not joking! If you fakes think you can fool me again—

Original: Celes:...It can talk? And it isn't sparkling like the others...
Dialogue: ...It can talk? And it isn't sparkling like the others...

Original: Setzer:Of course. You fell in with some manikins. It happens a lot around here.
Dialogue: Of course. You fell in with some manikins. It happens a lot around here.

Original: Setzer:How about this? Celes Chere, the brilliantMagitek Knightraised in theGestahlian Empire.
Dialogue: How about this? Celes Chere, the brilliant Magitek Knight raised in the Gestahlian Empire.

Original: Setzer:Numerous feats on the battlefield have earned you a reputation as the undefeated general...
Dialogue: Numerous feats on the battlefield have earned you a reputation as the undefeated general...

Original: Setzer:Not to mention your stunning good looks and equally stunning vocal chords. You could be in the opera.
Dialogue: Not to mention your stunning good looks and equally stunning vocal chords. You could be in the opera.

Original: Setzer:Aren't I well informed? You still doubt I'm the genuine article?
Dialogue: Aren't I well informed? You still doubt I'm the genuine article?

Original: Celes:Setzer...! It's the real you!
Dialogue: Setzer...! It's the real you!

Original: Setzer:Welcome to a world abounding in thrills and mysteries. It's good to have you, Celes.
Dialogue: Welcome to a world abounding in thrills and mysteries. It's good to have you, Celes.

Original: Zell:Aha, there he is. Setzer! You lookin' at the sky again?
Dialogue: Aha, there he is. Setzer! You lookin' at the sky again?

Original: Layle:That never gets old with you, does it? ...And who have we here?
Dialogue: That never gets old with you, does it? ...And who have we here?

Original: Cyan:Wh-what's this! If it isn't Lady Celes!
Dialogue: Wh-what's this! If it isn't Lady Celes!

Original: Zell:A friend of Setzer and Cyan? That means a new friend of ours!
Dialogue: A friend of Setzer and Cyan? That means a new friend of ours!

Original: Layle:Hmm... Presumably a friend of Edgar's then, too.
Dialogue: Hmm... Presumably a friend of Edgar's then, too.

Original: Celes:Ah, who might you be?
Dialogue: Ah, who might you be?

Original: Celes:A different world... Warriors of light... Another, newly formed Returners...
Dialogue: A different world... Warriors of light... Another, newly formed Returners...

Original: Cyan:It is expected that thou wouldst be confused. I had no easy time grasping it myself.
Dialogue: It is expected that thou wouldst be confused. I had no easy time grasping it myself.

Original: Layle:Is it that complicated? It all made sense to me.
Dialogue: Is it that complicated? It all made sense to me.

Original: Zell:You get used to things too easily...
Dialogue: You get used to things too easily...

Original: Setzer:We're not alone. Terra and Shadow are here, too. Don't you worry.
Dialogue: We're not alone. Terra and Shadow are here, too. Don't you worry.

Original: Celes:And Kefka... That menace is also here...
Dialogue: And Kefka... That menace is also here...

Original: Cyan:That villain would lead this world to ruin as well. We mustn't let him roam free!
Dialogue: That villain would lead this world to ruin as well. We mustn't let him roam free!

Original: Layle:So is it safe to assume you'll be coming with us? You have a beef with Kefka, too, I'd wager.
Dialogue: So is it safe to assume you'll be coming with us? You have a beef with Kefka, too, I'd wager.

Original: Zell:He's not the only punk up to no good either. You gotta help us out!
Dialogue: He's not the only punk up to no good either. You gotta help us out!

Original: Celes:I have no reason to decline. Allow me to join your ranks.
Dialogue: I have no reason to decline. Allow me to join your ranks.

Original: Celes:We'll cut short their wicked ambitions!
Dialogue: We'll cut short their wicked ambitions!

Original: Edgar:The dignified rose mayn't choose where it blooms. Your beauty is unchanging.
Dialogue: The dignified rose mayn't choose where it blooms. Your beauty is unchanging.

Original: Celes:As is your philandering, Edgar.
Dialogue: As is your philandering, Edgar.

Original: Sabin:Gah-ha-ha-ha! He's always raring to go!
Dialogue: Gah-ha-ha-ha! He's always raring to go!

Original: Shantotto:And you're always deafening, you know.
Dialogue: And you're always deafening, you know.

Original: Cecil:There is nothing better than friends with whom you can laugh out loud, Shantotto.
Dialogue: There is nothing better than friends with whom you can laugh out loud, Shantotto.

Original: Shantotto:I understand you belonged to the imperial army or somesuch in your land.
Dialogue: I understand you belonged to the imperial army or somesuch in your land.

Original: Shantotto:Which should make you enemies with these two. What caused you to give them a hand?
Dialogue: Which should make you enemies with these two. What caused you to give them a hand?

Original: Celes:I was a general of the Gestahlian Empire...but no longer...
Dialogue: I was a general of the Gestahlian Empire...but no longer...

Original: Edgar:Emperor Gestahlused his military might to invade nations the world over. WithKefkaat his side.
Dialogue: Emperor Gestahl used his military might to invade nations the world over. With Kefka at his side.

Original: Sabin:And Celes had had enough of it! That's why she teamed up with us!
Dialogue: And Celes had had enough of it! That's why she teamed up with us!

Original: Cecil:You also turned against your homeland...and that courage changed the world...
Dialogue: You also turned against your homeland...and that courage changed the world...

Original: Celes:I don't know that I'd call it courage...but I am indeed a traitor.
Dialogue: I don't know that I'd call it courage...but I am indeed a traitor.

Original: Terra:No, you're nothing of the sort.
Dialogue: No, you're nothing of the sort.

Original: Terra:You've risked your life fighting to rescue the innocent.
Dialogue: You've risked your life fighting to rescue the innocent.

Original: Edgar:Hear, hear. A true servicewoman is the one who sincerely puts the happiness of civilians first.
Dialogue: Hear, hear. A true servicewoman is the one who sincerely puts the happiness of civilians first.

Original: Edgar:More properly, it is the emperor who is the traitor. Such a selfish individual is wholly unfit as a head of state.
Dialogue: More properly, it is the emperor who is the traitor. Such a selfish individual is wholly unfit as a head of state.

Original: Shantotto:More importantly...if you hail from the same country, you must know of that clown's pedigree.
Dialogue: More importantly...if you hail from the same country, you must know of that clown's pedigree.

Original: Celes:Kefka...and I are the same. We were both artificially infused with magic to become magitek knights.
Dialogue: Kefka...and I are the same. We were both artificially infused with magic to become magitek knights.

Original: Cecil:The same!?
Dialogue: The same!?

Original: Celes:You could say Kefka paid for his power with his sanity.
Dialogue: You could say Kefka paid for his power with his sanity.

Original: Celes:One wrong step, and that could have been me...
Dialogue: One wrong step, and that could have been me...

Original: Sabin:You as mad as Kefka? I can't even begin to imagine it.
Dialogue: You as mad as Kefka? I can't even begin to imagine it.

Original: Shantotto:Driven mad with magic power? Don't make me sniff. It just shows how fragile his mind was to begin with.
Dialogue: Driven mad with magic power? Don't make me sniff. It just shows how fragile his mind was to begin with.

Original: Cecil:Your strength of heart let you resist the temptation of power. At least that is what I believe.
Dialogue: Your strength of heart let you resist the temptation of power. At least that is what I believe.

Original: Celes:...Thank you, Cecil.
Dialogue: ...Thank you, Cecil.

Original: Shantotto:Be that as it may...
Dialogue: Be that as it may...

Original: Shantotto:One man-made magitek knight...
Dialogue: One man-made magitek knight...

Original: Shantotto:And one natural-born mage...
Dialogue: And one natural-born mage...

Original: Shantotto:I couldn't have produced better test subjects had I myself set the stage!
Dialogue: I couldn't have produced better test subjects had I myself set the stage!

Original: Sabin:Not!
Dialogue: Not!

Original: Shantotto:Oh ho ho ho! Haven't you ever heard a joke, you lot?
Dialogue: Oh ho ho ho! Haven't you ever heard a joke, you lot?

Original: Terra:It didn't sound like she was joking...
Dialogue: It didn't sound like she was joking...

Original: Eiko:I fear I love thee more than I should!
Dialogue: I fear I love thee more than I should!

Original: Zidane:Princess... Wilt thou be happy, married to a lowly peasant such as I?
Dialogue: Princess... Wilt thou be happy, married to a lowly peasant such as I?

Original: Eiko:Prithee, call me "princess" no more!
Dialogue: Prithee, call me "princess" no more!

Original: Eiko:Wilt thou truly cherish me, the king's only daughter?
Dialogue: Wilt thou truly cherish me, the king's only daughter?

Original: Eiko:Or is such a desire too dear to wish for!? After our nuptials, shall I...shall I...
Dialogue: Or is such a desire too dear to wish for!? After our nuptials, shall I...shall I...

Original: Zidane:"...Become no more than a puppet?"
Dialogue: "...Become no more than a puppet?"

Original: Eiko:Arrrgh! I completely forgot it! Darn it, darn it, darn it!
Dialogue: Arrrgh! I completely forgot it! Darn it, darn it, darn it!

Original: Garnet:Haha, shall we take it once more from the top then?
Dialogue: Haha, shall we take it once more from the top then?

Original: Setzer:What are you all doing here?
Dialogue: What are you all doing here?

Original: Eiko:We're practicing a play. Garnet knows all the lines, so we're going over it from scratch.
Dialogue: We're practicing a play. Garnet knows all the lines, so we're going over it from scratch.

Original: Celes:A play?
Dialogue: A play?

Original: Setzer:Aha, I see... This sounds like Celes's cue.
Dialogue: Aha, I see... This sounds like Celes's cue.

Original: Celes:H-hey! Don't even start!
Dialogue: H-hey! Don't even start!

Original: Zidane:You have theater experience?
Dialogue: You have theater experience?

Original: Celes:I had no choice! You know
Dialogue: I had no choice! You know—

Original: Eiko:Wow, Celes! That's so cool!
Dialogue: Wow, Celes! That's so cool!

Original: Vivi:I'd love to see you in the play!
Dialogue: I'd love to see you in the play!

Original: Garnet:As would I!
Dialogue: As would I!

Original: Celes:Ulp... W-well, if you insist... Give me a moment to warm up...
Dialogue: Ulp... W-well, if you insist... Give me a moment to warm up...

Original: Celes:Ahhh, mi mi mi mi~ Ahem, Ma~ri~a~
Dialogue: Ahhh, mi mi mi mi~ Ahem, Ma~ri~a~

Original: Setzer:Heh. Not bad.
Dialogue: Heh. Not bad.

Original: Celes:I'm the darkness, you're the starlight / Shining brightly from afar. / Through hours of despair, / I offer this prayer / To you, my evening star.
Dialogue: I'm the darkness, you're the starlight / Shining brightly from afar. / Through hours of despair, / I offer this prayer / To you, my evening star.

Original: Celes:...How'd I sound?
Dialogue: ...How'd I sound?

Original: Garnet:...I'm so moved! Your voice is so strong and clear! There's no denying you're a star!
Dialogue: ...I'm so moved! Your voice is so strong and clear! There's no denying you're a star!

Original: Eiko:I was hypnotized! I could listen to you forever!
Dialogue: I was hypnotized! I could listen to you forever!

Original: Zidane:Yeah, you blew away all my expectations!
Dialogue: Yeah, you blew away all my expectations!

Original: Vivi:It was wonderful!
Dialogue: It was wonderful!

Original: Celes:R-really? Well, I guess I can sing a little more...
Dialogue: R-really? Well, I guess I can sing a little more...

Original: Celes:Must my final vows exchanged / Be with him and not with you? / Were you only here to quiet my fear... / O speak! Guide me anew.
Dialogue: Must my final vows exchanged / Be with him and not with you? / Were you only here to quiet my fear... / O speak! Guide me anew.

Original: Setzer:...Let's not get carried away now...
Dialogue: ...Let's not get carried away now...

Original: Terra:Before you met us, you were attacked by manikins of Setzer and Cyan, right?
Dialogue: Before you met us, you were attacked by manikins of Setzer and Cyan, right?

Original: Celes:Yes... They looked so much alike, I'm sorry to admit I let my guard down.
Dialogue: Yes... They looked so much alike, I'm sorry to admit I let my guard down.

Original: Tidus:Those things sure are a piece of work. When I first saw Seymour's manikin, I couldn't tell either.
Dialogue: Those things sure are a piece of work. When I first saw Seymour's manikin, I couldn't tell either.

Original: Bartz:They couldn't fool me! I'd never seen the real Galuf sparkle like that!
Dialogue: They couldn't fool me! I'd never seen the real Galuf sparkle like that!

Original: Galuf:Good grief. You choose the oddest things to be astute about...
Dialogue: Good grief. You choose the oddest things to be astute about...

Original: Galuf:Be that as it may, isn't it true you learnt I was here after finding a manikin of me?
Dialogue: Be that as it may, isn't it true you learnt I was here after finding a manikin of me?

Original: Celes:In other words...
Dialogue: In other words...

Original: Celes:If we see a manikin of someone, it means that person's somewhere out there in this world?
Dialogue: If we see a manikin of someone, it means that person's somewhere out there in this world?

Original: Shadow:That would be a natural conclusion.
Dialogue: That would be a natural conclusion.

Original: Terra:Mog says the manikins are created by Spiritus...
Dialogue: Mog says the manikins are created by Spiritus...

Original: Shadow:If you believe what he says.
Dialogue: If you believe what he says.

Original: Terra:He didn't seem to be lying, though!
Dialogue: He didn't seem to be lying, though!

Original: Tidus:Now, now, arguing won't get us anywhere.
Dialogue: Now, now, arguing won't get us anywhere.

Original: Celes:Assuming it's true, why would Spiritus make those copies?
Dialogue: Assuming it's true, why would Spiritus make those copies?

Original: Bartz:Ummm, aren't he and the goddess who summoned us on real bad terms?
Dialogue: Ummm, aren't he and the goddess who summoned us on real bad terms?

Original: Celes:Enjoying watching allies fight each other? I did point my blade at Setzer...
Dialogue: Enjoying watching allies fight each other? I did point my blade at Setzer...

Original: Tidus:You mean he's trying to get us all mixed up?
Dialogue: You mean he's trying to get us all mixed up?

Original: Shadow:That does not explain the manikins of our adversaries from our home worlds.
Dialogue: That does not explain the manikins of our adversaries from our home worlds.

Original: Tidus:Ah, good point...
Dialogue: Ah, good point...

Original: Galuf:Manikins usually appear in or around Torsions, a road anyone who's come here has taken...
Dialogue: Manikins usually appear in or around Torsions, a road anyone who's come here has taken...

Original: Galuf:We're bound to learn the source of the manikins in time, wouldn't you say?
Dialogue: We're bound to learn the source of the manikins in time, wouldn't you say?

Original: Bartz:There's lots of enemies with manikins as lackeys, too.
Dialogue: There's lots of enemies with manikins as lackeys, too.

Original: Celes:So Spiritus makes manikins of anyone who comes through a Torsion...
Dialogue: So Spiritus makes manikins of anyone who comes through a Torsion...

Original: Celes:And then places them under the command of the warriors he's summoned...?
Dialogue: And then places them under the command of the warriors he's summoned...?

Original: Tidus:Has she got it right?
Dialogue: Has she got it right?

Original: Shadow:I can't jump to any conclusions, nor have I a reason to.
Dialogue: I can't jump to any conclusions, nor have I a reason to.

Original: Terra:I'll go ask Mog again. Maybe he has something new to tell us.
Dialogue: I'll go ask Mog again. Maybe he has something new to tell us.

Original: Celes:I'll go with you. There's plenty more I'd like to know, too.
Dialogue: I'll go with you. There's plenty more I'd like to know, too.

Original: Shadow:...Too bad it's a waste of your time.
Dialogue: ...Too bad it's a waste of your time.

Original: Cecil:Is that...Kain!? You're here!
Dialogue: Is that...Kain!? You're here!

Original: Edge:Somebody you know, Cecil?
Dialogue: Somebody you know, Cecil?

Original: Kain:Edge... Yang... I see. You two have lost it as well.
Dialogue: Edge... Yang... I see. You two have lost it as well.

Original: Kain:Cecil... To think you'd lose the hallowed light...
Dialogue: Cecil... To think you'd lose the hallowed light...

Original: Cecil:What do you mean? What are you doing here?
Dialogue: What do you mean? What are you doing here?

Original: Kain:...Don't be so suspicious of me. How long have we known each other? My voice should be enough to understand.
Dialogue: ...Don't be so suspicious of me. How long have we known each other? My voice should be enough to understand.

Original: Kain:Be at ease... I have no interest in conflict here. What we hope to protect is the same.
Dialogue: Be at ease... I have no interest in conflict here. What we hope to protect is the same.

Original: Mog:Kupo! He entered the Torsion, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo! He entered the Torsion, kupo!

Original: Warrior of Light:Does he intend to close it by himself?
Dialogue: Does he intend to close it by himself?

Original: Edge:He'll be in a bind if he is! Let's go give him a hand!
Dialogue: He'll be in a bind if he is! Let's go give him a hand!

Original: Cecil:I know we ought to. But Kain...
Dialogue: I know we ought to. But Kain...

Original: Yang:He broke off relations with Lord Cecil to serve under avillain. Myhomeland, too, was...by his forces...
Dialogue: He broke off relations with Lord Cecil to serve under a villain. My homeland, too, was...by his forces...

Original: Warrior of Light:He appeared to be concerned for your wellbeing, though.
Dialogue: He appeared to be concerned for your wellbeing, though.

Original: Warrior of Light:That you had lost something...
Dialogue: That you had lost something...

Original: Cecil:You lost some of your memories when you came here. It is to that he must have been referring.
Dialogue: You lost some of your memories when you came here. It is to that he must have been referring.

Original: Edge:Come to think of it, he knew my name.
Dialogue: Come to think of it, he knew my name.

Original: Edge:I don't know any dragoons... Huh? Or...do I...?
Dialogue: I don't know any dragoons... Huh? Or...do I...?

Original: Yang:Is there something we may have forgotten about Lord Kain and ourselves...?
Dialogue: Is there something we may have forgotten about Lord Kain and ourselves...?

Original: Cecil:Let us enter this Torsion as well. If Kain knows anything...it would be in our interest to know as well.
Dialogue: Let us enter this Torsion as well. If Kain knows anything...it would be in our interest to know as well.

Original: Edge:Amen! This is gonna bug me if we don't clear things up!
Dialogue: Amen! This is gonna bug me if we don't clear things up!

Original: Cecil:Mog...there is something I would ask you.
Dialogue: Mog...there is something I would ask you.

Original: Cecil:The light... Did you sense it in him?
Dialogue: The light... Did you sense it in him?

Original: Mog:If he's planning to use his powers properly, then it's the light, kupo!
Dialogue: If he's planning to use his powers properly, then it's the light, kupo!

Original: Cecil:...I see.
Dialogue: ...I see.

Original: Cecil:Kain!? Why!?
Dialogue: Kain!? Why!?

Original: Kain:...That should be obvious. Draw your blade, Cecil!
Dialogue: ...That should be obvious. Draw your blade, Cecil!

Original: Bartz:The Torsion closed! Wait, that means...!
Dialogue: The Torsion closed! Wait, that means...!

Original: Kain:I created it. And by defeating me, you closed it.
Dialogue: I created it. And by defeating me, you closed it.

Original: Cecil:Why, Kain! Why would you threaten the world this way!
Dialogue: Why, Kain! Why would you threaten the world this way!

Original: Cecil:Unless... Is someone manipulating you!?
Dialogue: Unless... Is someone manipulating you!?

Original: Squall:...This isn't like you.
Dialogue: ...This isn't like you.

Original: Squall:Would you mind speaking so we can follow along, too?
Dialogue: Would you mind speaking so we can follow along, too?

Original: Onion Knight:Tell us what's going on. Wasn't there something you wanted to know?
Dialogue: Tell us what's going on. Wasn't there something you wanted to know?

Original: Kain:...That moogle is not here.
Dialogue: ...That moogle is not here.

Original: Kain:Have you noticed while battling in this world a feeling that your strength is being drawn out of you?
Dialogue: Have you noticed while battling in this world a feeling that your strength is being drawn out of you?

Original: King:Yeah, we have wondered about that.
Dialogue: Yeah, we have wondered about that.

Original: King:It seems most obvious when fighting inside a Torsion.
Dialogue: It seems most obvious when fighting inside a Torsion.

Original: Kain:How about when fighting against me, a warrior from another world like yourselves?
Dialogue: How about when fighting against me, a warrior from another world like yourselves?

Original: Squall:It was more pronounced than going up against manikins or monsters...maybe.
Dialogue: It was more pronounced than going up against manikins or monsters...maybe.

Original: Bartz:Ah! Come to think of it, it might've felt that way whenever we fight those other guys, too!
Dialogue: Ah! Come to think of it, it might've felt that way whenever we fight those other guys, too!

Original: Onion Knight:So you picked a fight with us to figure that out.
Dialogue: So you picked a fight with us to figure that out.

Original: Kain:I don't have all the answers.
Dialogue: I don't have all the answers.

Original: Kain:Only...I've been told what's draining your strength is that moogle.
Dialogue: Only...I've been told what's draining your strength is that moogle.

Original: Cecil:Who told you that?
Dialogue: Who told you that?

Original: Kain:You aren't ready to know.
Dialogue: You aren't ready to know.

Original: Cecil:Because I've...forgotten something important?
Dialogue: Because I've...forgotten something important?

Original: Cecil:Kain... Please tell me. I... What have I lost?
Dialogue: Kain... Please tell me. I... What have I lost?

Original: Kain:Something meaningless if you can't remember on your own.
Dialogue: Something meaningless if you can't remember on your own.

Original: Squall:So what now? Going back to whoever is feeding you info?
Dialogue: So what now? Going back to whoever is feeding you info?

Original: Kain:That was my plan...
Dialogue: That was my plan...

Original: Bartz:And you're just gonna leave your friend worried and confused?
Dialogue: And you're just gonna leave your friend worried and confused?

Original: Kain:He's the one who does not trust me... But you are right, warrior from another world.
Dialogue: He's the one who does not trust me... But you are right, warrior from another world.

Original: Kain:I cannot leave Cecil in this state. I will join you on your journey.
Dialogue: I cannot leave Cecil in this state. I will join you on your journey.

Original: Onion Knight:That would be a big help. Let's share what we know.
Dialogue: That would be a big help. Let's share what we know.

Original: Cecil:Kain... Can I trust you...?
Dialogue: Kain... Can I trust you...?

Original: Kain:Call me a traitor if you like. ...I will bring the light back to my friend.
Dialogue: Call me a traitor if you like. ...I will bring the light back to my friend.

Original: Zell:Yo, Kain! How do you train to jump like that?
Dialogue: Yo, Kain! How do you train to jump like that?

Original: Zell:You can jump really high, right? I wanna jump like you, too!
Dialogue: You can jump really high, right? I wanna jump like you, too!

Original: Kain:Many years of dragoon training. It's not something you'll learn in a day.
Dialogue: Many years of dragoon training. It's not something you'll learn in a day.

Original: Bartz:Huh, you don't say.
Dialogue: Huh, you don't say.

Original: Bartz:Inour world, the crystals can give us all sorts ofjobser...powers.
Dialogue: In our world, the crystals can give us all sorts of jobs—er...powers.

Original: Vaan:Hmmm... I know we had all sorts in our world, but did we have dragoons?
Dialogue: Hmmm... I know we had all sorts in our world, but did we have dragoons?

Original: Rem:Even if we use the same word for it, a dragoon can be completely different from world to world, it seems.
Dialogue: Even if we use the same word for it, a dragoon can be completely different from world to world, it seems.

Original: Rem:InOrience, there was akingdomwhose soldiers fought while mounted on dragons.
Dialogue: In Orience, there was a kingdom whose soldiers fought while mounted on dragons.

Original: Zell:Get out! Oh, man, that's so rad!
Dialogue: Get out! Oh, man, that's so rad!

Original: Rem:Our countries were at war, though, so they were our enemy...
Dialogue: Our countries were at war, though, so they were our enemy...

Original: Vaan:That sucks.
Dialogue: That sucks.

Original: Kain:A lively party... ...Cecil?
Dialogue: A lively party... ...Cecil?

Original: Cecil:...Our friends from other worlds have been able to accept Kain without prejudice.
Dialogue: ...Our friends from other worlds have been able to accept Kain without prejudice.

Original: Cecil:And yet I...cannot even trust my dear friend...
Dialogue: And yet I...cannot even trust my dear friend...

Original: Kain:...That's not your fault.
Dialogue: ...That's not your fault.

Original: Cecil:Kain...I... I am sorry...
Dialogue: Kain...I... I am sorry...

Original: Kain:It's fine. In the memories you have now, I am still a traitor.
Dialogue: It's fine. In the memories you have now, I am still a traitor.

Original: Cecil:Is there no way you will tell me what I've forgotten?
Dialogue: Is there no way you will tell me what I've forgotten?

Original: Kain:No. If you cannot reclaim it yourself, your hallowed light will have no brilliance to it.
Dialogue: No. If you cannot reclaim it yourself, your hallowed light will have no brilliance to it.

Original: Kain:And it does nothing to change the fact that I did betray you.
Dialogue: And it does nothing to change the fact that I did betray you.

Original: Vaan:Are you talking about something serious?
Dialogue: Are you talking about something serious?

Original: Zell:Hey, we know we can count on him! Don't sweat the small stuff!
Dialogue: Hey, we know we can count on him! Don't sweat the small stuff!

Original: Bartz:You alright, Cecil?
Dialogue: You alright, Cecil?

Original: Cecil:Yes... Sorry to worry you. Let us be on our way.
Dialogue: Yes... Sorry to worry you. Let us be on our way.

Original: Kain:...What do you mean?
Dialogue: ...What do you mean?

Original: Kain:TheDragoons of Baronstood shoulder to shoulder with theRed Wings, our air force.
Dialogue: The Dragoons of Baron stood shoulder to shoulder with the Red Wings, our air force.

Original: Kain:Though in recent years perhaps, the king's favor fell more so upon the Red Wings.
Dialogue: Though in recent years perhaps, the king's favor fell more so upon the Red Wings.

Original: Firion:What made you decide to become a dragoon?
Dialogue: What made you decide to become a dragoon?

Original: Kain:Heh... You are a curious lot. What is the point in asking such a thing?
Dialogue: Heh... You are a curious lot. What is the point in asking such a thing?

Original: Vanille:Is it so weird to want to hear about a friend?
Dialogue: Is it so weird to want to hear about a friend?

Original: Cloud:...It's just small talk.
Dialogue: ...It's just small talk.

Original: Firion:Forgive us if it's something you'd rather not share. I just wanted to know more about your world.
Dialogue: Forgive us if it's something you'd rather not share. I just wanted to know more about your world.

Original: Yuna:Everyone is interested since there's so much we don't know about each other.
Dialogue: Everyone is interested since there's so much we don't know about each other.

Original: Kain:...Is that so?
Dialogue: ...Is that so?

Original: Kain:I...chose the life of a dragoon out of pride.
Dialogue: I...chose the life of a dragoon out of pride.

Original: Vivi:Were you always with Mr. Cecil? You're best friends, right?
Dialogue: Were you always with Mr. Cecil? You're best friends, right?

Original: Kain:Yes... We grew up together.
Dialogue: Yes... We grew up together.

Original: Vanille:...Where could she be now? She just popped into my mind.
Dialogue: ...Where could she be now? She just popped into my mind.

Original: Vivi:I'm sure you'll see her again.
Dialogue: I'm sure you'll see her again.

Original: Firion:Though best friends, you and Cecil are having a hard time of it...
Dialogue: Though best friends, you and Cecil are having a hard time of it...

Original: Cloud:It's the Torsions... They've taken something from all of us.
Dialogue: It's the Torsions... They've taken something from all of us.

Original: Yuna:...It's a little scary. I wonder what it is I don't remember.
Dialogue: ...It's a little scary. I wonder what it is I don't remember.

Original: Kain:You'll remember eventually as we journey on.
Dialogue: You'll remember eventually as we journey on.

Original: Kain:The question is, what will you do when what was lost is reclaimed?
Dialogue: The question is, what will you do when what was lost is reclaimed?

Original: Cloud:Everyone from your world seems to have lost something pretty important.
Dialogue: Everyone from your world seems to have lost something pretty important.

Original: Kain:Indeed, but...
Dialogue: Indeed, but...

Original: Kain:With comrades such as all of you, I'm certain they'll regain it.
Dialogue: With comrades such as all of you, I'm certain they'll regain it.

Original: Firion:That's right... We're all in this together.
Dialogue: That's right... We're all in this together.

Original: Warrior of Light:You've grown more pensive since Kain joined us.
Dialogue: You've grown more pensive since Kain joined us.

Original: Zidane:Is it whatever you can't remember from back home that's eating you?
Dialogue: Is it whatever you can't remember from back home that's eating you?

Original: Cecil:...Indeed. I've lost something important that for the life of me...I just can't figure out.
Dialogue: ...Indeed. I've lost something important that for the life of me...I just can't figure out.

Original: Cecil:But more painful than that is this cold-hearted distrust of my friend.
Dialogue: But more painful than that is this cold-hearted distrust of my friend.

Original: Cecil:Have I...let my heart become as black as this armor...?
Dialogue: Have I...let my heart become as black as this armor...?

Original: Zidane:For such a softie, you're way too hard on yourself.
Dialogue: For such a softie, you're way too hard on yourself.

Original: Warrior of Light:As am I. Everyone has missing memories to some extent or another... I know this thanks to him.
Dialogue: As am I. Everyone has missing memories to some extent or another... I know this thanks to him.

Original: Zidane:I trust Kain. After all, he's sticking his neck out there for everyone, right?
Dialogue: I trust Kain. After all, he's sticking his neck out there for everyone, right?

Original: Warrior of Light:Agreed. His spear shows us the way.
Dialogue: Agreed. His spear shows us the way.

Original: Warrior of Light:The mystery to be solved is the Torsions...
Dialogue: The mystery to be solved is the Torsions...

Original: Cecil:If we can know them, we can know what it is we have lost, is it?
Dialogue: If we can know them, we can know what it is we have lost, is it?

Original: Cecil:You two are right. There is nothing to gain in fretting...
Dialogue: You two are right. There is nothing to gain in fretting...

Original: Zidane:The way I see it, Kain's defending you along with the rest of us.
Dialogue: The way I see it, Kain's defending you along with the rest of us.

Original: Zidane:Any doubts you have'll clear up eventually, hear?
Dialogue: Any doubts you have'll clear up eventually, hear?

Original: Cecil:Thank you, Zidane. As I am, I will do what I can to believe that.
Dialogue: Thank you, Zidane. As I am, I will do what I can to believe that.

Original: Kain:Cecil and his companions were summoned by this Materia...
Dialogue: Cecil and his companions were summoned by this Materia...

Original: Kain:Could the difference in our memories have to do with who summoned us?
Dialogue: Could the difference in our memories have to do with who summoned us?

Original: Spiritus:Warrior burdened with the mark of treachery... Go, and protect my world!
Dialogue: Warrior burdened with the mark of treachery... Go, and protect my world!

Original: Kain:As though I would fight for your sake.
Dialogue: As though I would fight for your sake.

Original: Kain:I fight...to protect my friend.
Dialogue: I fight...to protect my friend.

Original: ???:Now, to Cecil's side with you...
Dialogue: Now, to Cecil's side with you...

Original: Kain:Heh... My thoughts exactly.
Dialogue: Heh... My thoughts exactly.

Original: ???:Ah! A hiding spot!
Dialogue: Ah! A hiding spot!

Original: ???:...Whew. Finally they're gone.
Dialogue: ...Whew. Finally they're gone.

Original: ???:How did I get myself into this...? I can't even tell where I am.
Dialogue: How did I get myself into this...? I can't even tell where I am.

Original: ???:Nor can I take another step. I'm exhausted...
Dialogue: Nor can I take another step. I'm exhausted...

Original: ???:...I wish the others were here. Firion... Sniff...
Dialogue: ...I wish the others were here. Firion... Sniff...

Original: ???:Oh? What's this?
Dialogue: Oh? What's this?

Original: ???:Wild rose... Therebel army'spassword. A flower of hope that connects us.
Dialogue: Wild rose... The rebel army's password. A flower of hope that connects us.

Original: ???:Blooming even here, deep in these woods, unwithered and full of vigor.
Dialogue: Blooming even here, deep in these woods, unwithered and full of vigor.

Original: ???:...No, I mustn't give up now.
Dialogue: ...No, I mustn't give up now.

Original: ???:If I continue running, I should find the others! This is no time to stop!
Dialogue: If I continue running, I should find the others! This is no time to stop!

Original: ???:...You have my thanks.
Dialogue: ...You have my thanks.

Original: Firion:This forest is crawling with monsters. Let's watch our step...
Dialogue: This forest is crawling with monsters. Let's watch our step...

Original: Yang:Hrm! Speak of the devil...!
Dialogue: Hrm! Speak of the devil...!

Original: Firion:Maria!? Is that you!?
Dialogue: Maria!? Is that you!?

Original: Maria:Ah! Firion, I finally found you!
Dialogue: Ah! Firion, I finally found you!

Original: Firion:I'm glad to see you safe and sound. Did you come through this forest on your own?
Dialogue: I'm glad to see you safe and sound. Did you come through this forest on your own?

Original: Maria:I thought I was a goner with all the fiends at my heels...
Dialogue: I thought I was a goner with all the fiends at my heels...

Original: Maria:But...at the moment I had nearly given up hope, I came across a patch of wild rose that reminded me of you and the others...
Dialogue: But...at the moment I had nearly given up hope, I came across a patch of wild rose that reminded me of you and the others...

Original: Maria:That gave me just what I needed to carry on.
Dialogue: That gave me just what I needed to carry on.

Original: Firion:I see. We owe it to the wild rose...our password in the rebellion.
Dialogue: I see. We owe it to the wild rose...our password in the rebellion.

Original: Galuf:Rebellion? Is she also one of your Returners?
Dialogue: Rebellion? Is she also one of your Returners?

Original: Shadow:...Her face is unknown to me. A new recruit?
Dialogue: ...Her face is unknown to me. A new recruit?

Original: Firion:There's a resistance back in our world, too. Maria and I both fought together for the rebel army.
Dialogue: There's a resistance back in our world, too. Maria and I both fought together for the rebel army.

Original: Maria:Returners? Back in our world?
Dialogue: Returners? Back in our world?

Original: Layle:How about you fill her in, Firion?
Dialogue: How about you fill her in, Firion?

Original: Firion:Maria, try not to panic, but the world we're in now...
Dialogue: Maria, try not to panic, but the world we're in now...

Original: Maria:...So it's the fault of these Torsions that we've all been torn from our homes.
Dialogue: ...So it's the fault of these Torsions that we've all been torn from our homes.

Original: Layle:We're all in the same boat here. Summoned by a "god" of some sort to fight for the "sake of the world."
Dialogue: We're all in the same boat here. Summoned by a "god" of some sort to fight for the "sake of the world."

Original: Yang:If we do not defend this world, our home worlds are also at risk of being consumed... In other words, we also fight to protect our own worlds...
Dialogue: If we do not defend this world, our home worlds are also at risk of being consumed... In other words, we also fight to protect our own worlds...

Original: Yang:Or that is what Lord Mog has professed...
Dialogue: Or that is what Lord Mog has professed...

Original: Shadow:With no evidence to back up the claim.
Dialogue: With no evidence to back up the claim.

Original: Galuf:Moreover, it's not only the villains who can create Torsions... We're up to our necks in mysteries.
Dialogue: Moreover, it's not only the villains who can create Torsions... We're up to our necks in mysteries.

Original: Firion:Did you happen to feel as though your strength was being drawn out of you when you passed through the Torsion or while battling monsters?
Dialogue: Did you happen to feel as though your strength was being drawn out of you when you passed through the Torsion or while battling monsters?

Original: Maria:Come to think of it, my legs were trembling...but I had assumed it was from fear and exhaustion...
Dialogue: Come to think of it, my legs were trembling...but I had assumed it was from fear and exhaustion...

Original: Shadow:If only it were just that.
Dialogue: If only it were just that.

Original: Layle:My employer, the Returners, is the group trying to get to the bottom of why we're here and what these gods are up to.
Dialogue: My employer, the Returners, is the group trying to get to the bottom of why we're here and what these gods are up to.

Original: Maria:Leave it to Firion to join the rebellion in a completely different world.
Dialogue: Leave it to Firion to join the rebellion in a completely different world.

Original: Firion:Our other friends from the rebel army must be here, too.
Dialogue: Our other friends from the rebel army must be here, too.

Original: Firion:Let's find them together. And uncover the mysteries of this world! You will join us, won't you?
Dialogue: Let's find them together. And uncover the mysteries of this world! You will join us, won't you?

Original: Maria:But of course! I wouldn't want to disappoint any of you!
Dialogue: But of course! I wouldn't want to disappoint any of you!

Original: Galuf:Ho ho ho! Admirable confidence.
Dialogue: Ho ho ho! Admirable confidence.

Original: Yang:We will put our faith in you, Lady Maria!
Dialogue: We will put our faith in you, Lady Maria!

Original: Wakka:Alrighty then. That's enough of a break. Let's hit the road again, yeah?
Dialogue: Alrighty then. That's enough of a break. Let's hit the road again, yeah?

Original: Penelo:...Huh? I don't see Yuna.
Dialogue: ...Huh? I don't see Yuna.

Original: Yuna:Sorry to keep you!
Dialogue: Sorry to keep you!

Original: Yuna:Forgive me, I must have started to doze off...
Dialogue: Forgive me, I must have started to doze off...

Original: Vaan:Ha ha, no kidding! Nice bed head!
Dialogue: Ha ha, no kidding! Nice bed head!

Original: Yuna:Eh!? B-bed head!?
Dialogue: Eh!? B-bed head!?

Original: Yuna:Ohhh, not again...
Dialogue: Ohhh, not again...

Original: Vaan:You know, for as much as you look like you've got it together, you can be pretty scatterbrained sometimes.
Dialogue: You know, for as much as you look like you've got it together, you can be pretty scatterbrained sometimes.

Original: Wakka:Right? She's been like that since way back when.
Dialogue: Right? She's been like that since way back when.

Original: Maria:Since way back? Are you two childhood friends?
Dialogue: Since way back? Are you two childhood friends?

Original: Maria:Like siblings... Just like me and Firion.
Dialogue: Like siblings... Just like me and Firion.

Original: Wakka:Oh yeah? You two also have a long history together?
Dialogue: Oh yeah? You two also have a long history together?

Original: Firion:I was without mother or father, so Maria's took me in.
Dialogue: I was without mother or father, so Maria's took me in.

Original: Vaan:Oh, so you're family.
Dialogue: Oh, so you're family.

Original: Yuna:...How dreadful. I'm so sorry...
Dialogue: ...How dreadful. I'm so sorry...

Original: Penelo:Imperial invasions happen in any world...huh...
Dialogue: Imperial invasions happen in any world...huh...

Original: Penelo:War takes everyone... Family... Homeland...
Dialogue: War takes everyone... Family... Homeland...

Original: Wakka:Shoot! Can't start dwelling on the past!
Dialogue: Shoot! Can't start dwelling on the past!

Original: Vaan:Separated from yourbrother...'cause of theempire...
Dialogue: Separated from your brother...'cause of the empire...

Original: Vaan:Me and Penelo are both orphans, too. It's a pretty common story. But that doesn't mean we're alone.
Dialogue: Me and Penelo are both orphans, too. It's a pretty common story. But that doesn't mean we're alone.

Original: Firion:That's right. We're not alone. Even if the world changes, that's still the same.
Dialogue: That's right. We're not alone. Even if the world changes, that's still the same.

Original: Firion:So let's keep our eyes on the future. Surely Leon, too, will...
Dialogue: So let's keep our eyes on the future. Surely Leon, too, will...

Original: Maria:Yes, you're right. Let's go!
Dialogue: Yes, you're right. Let's go!

Original: Wakka:Fore that, though, let's give Lady Yuna a chance to fix her hair.
Dialogue: Fore that, though, let's give Lady Yuna a chance to fix her hair.

Original: Yuna:Oooh, Wakka!
Dialogue: Oooh, Wakka!

Original: Celes:Ah...a dead end. There's not much we can do about a rampart such as this.
Dialogue: Ah...a dead end. There's not much we can do about a rampart such as this.

Original: Auron:We'll have to turn back and look for another way around.
Dialogue: We'll have to turn back and look for another way around.

Original: Cater:Whaaat!? We already came this far! What a waste!
Dialogue: Whaaat!? We already came this far! What a waste!

Original: Vanille:Yeah, isn't there something we can do? Maybe try climbing it?
Dialogue: Yeah, isn't there something we can do? Maybe try climbing it?

Original: Celes:Please... What if someone falls?
Dialogue: Please... What if someone falls?

Original: Auron:I doubt anyone plans on falling...
Dialogue: I doubt anyone plans on falling...

Original: Mog:Let's give up here, kupo. I'll start looking for another route.
Dialogue: Let's give up here, kupo. I'll start looking for another route.

Original: Vanille:Hey, can't you float us over the wall?
Dialogue: Hey, can't you float us over the wall?

Original: Mog:Not likely, kupo... It's not even an emergency, and if I dropped someone midway...kupo...
Dialogue: Not likely, kupo... It's not even an emergency, and if I dropped someone midway...kupo...

Original: Cater:Well, there is NO way I'm going back the way we came.
Dialogue: Well, there is NO way I'm going back the way we came.

Original: Celes:This isn't going anywhere... Maria, what do you think?
Dialogue: This isn't going anywhere... Maria, what do you think?

Original: Maria:I understand how Cater feels, but we shouldn't consider scaling it.
Dialogue: I understand how Cater feels, but we shouldn't consider scaling it.

Original: Maria:We have children like Vivi and Eiko with us, too, after all. Do try to bear it.
Dialogue: We have children like Vivi and Eiko with us, too, after all. Do try to bear it.

Original: Cater:Yeah... I guess that would be hard on them.
Dialogue: Yeah... I guess that would be hard on them.

Original: Vanille:If we can't climb it...what if we knocked it down?
Dialogue: If we can't climb it...what if we knocked it down?

Original: Auron:What are you thinking...?
Dialogue: What are you thinking...?

Original: Vanille:Haha, I was only joking.
Dialogue: Haha, I was only joking.

Original: Maria:...Why didn't I think of that...?
Dialogue: ...Why didn't I think of that...?

Original: Maria:Mog, are there any cannons on the airship?
Dialogue: Mog, are there any cannons on the airship?

Original: Mog:Kupo? C-cannons, kupo?
Dialogue: Kupo? C-cannons, kupo?

Original: Maria:Or maybe Cater's guns have enough magic power...
Dialogue: Or maybe Cater's guns have enough magic power...

Original: Auron:Maria? Don't tell me...
Dialogue: Maria? Don't tell me...

Original: Maria:It's settled! Let's blow this thing up!
Dialogue: It's settled! Let's blow this thing up!

Original: Celes:You can't be serious! The whole wall!?
Dialogue: You can't be serious! The whole wall!?

Original: Vanille:Yeah, I don't know about that...
Dialogue: Yeah, I don't know about that...

Original: Cater:I'm in! The best answer is the simplest one!
Dialogue: I'm in! The best answer is the simplest one!

Original: Celes:H-hold on! If you blow it up, what about all the debris!?
Dialogue: H-hold on! If you blow it up, what about all the debris!?

Original: Auron:Crushed under a collapsing wall is just as much a dead end.
Dialogue: Crushed under a collapsing wall is just as much a dead end.

Original: Cater:Uh, didn't think about that. We could hide behind something...but I don't see anyplace...
Dialogue: Uh, didn't think about that. We could hide behind something...but I don't see anyplace...

Original: Mog:Another route is the only answer, kupo. Give it up, you two.
Dialogue: Another route is the only answer, kupo. Give it up, you two.

Original: Maria:I thought it was a good idea...
Dialogue: I thought it was a good idea...

Original: Auron:"Let's blow this thing up!" She's more of a firecracker than I would have expected.
Dialogue: "Let's blow this thing up!" She's more of a firecracker than I would have expected.

Original: Celes:Indeed... Doubtless she's seen her fair share of mayhem in the rebel army.
Dialogue: Indeed... Doubtless she's seen her fair share of mayhem in the rebel army.

Original: Maria:It is not only back home, but in this world, too, the battles are unceasing...
Dialogue: It is not only back home, but in this world, too, the battles are unceasing...

Original: Maria:The peaceful days spent with my family have become a distant memory...
Dialogue: The peaceful days spent with my family have become a distant memory...

Original: Cait Sith:Oh, Maria?
Dialogue: Oh, Maria?

Original: Cait Sith:What's got you so down?
Dialogue: What's got you so down?

Original: Maria:...I'm sorry. I was thinking of home...
Dialogue: ...I'm sorry. I was thinking of home...

Original: Seven:Yours and Firion's...?
Dialogue: Yours and Firion's...?

Original: Ramza:You had mentioned your hometown was caught up in war, and you were separated from your family...
Dialogue: You had mentioned your hometown was caught up in war, and you were separated from your family...

Original: Ramza:There is no end to conflict in my world as well. ...I share your pain.
Dialogue: There is no end to conflict in my world as well. ...I share your pain.

Original: Chelinka:It's sad and scary to lose family... For your family to lose you, too...
Dialogue: It's sad and scary to lose family... For your family to lose you, too...

Original: Chelinka:But...you can't lose hope... Once you do, you can never change your fate...
Dialogue: But...you can't lose hope... Once you do, you can never change your fate...

Original: Chelinka:I know there's still hope for your world, so please...don't give up...
Dialogue: I know there's still hope for your world, so please...don't give up...

Original: Kain:...Agreed. Everyoneeven those in similar circumstancesthat's what we're fighting to protect.
Dialogue: ...Agreed. Everyone—even those in similar circumstances—that's what we're fighting to protect.

Original: Maria:You're all too kind...
Dialogue: You're all too kind...

Original: Seven:Oh, yeah. Cait Sith, how about a fortune telling?
Dialogue: Oh, yeah. Cait Sith, how about a fortune telling?

Original: Cait Sith:Fortune telling? Of what?
Dialogue: Fortune telling? Of what?

Original: Seven:Maria's fortune, of course. Isn't that your deal?
Dialogue: Maria's fortune, of course. Isn't that your deal?

Original: Cait Sith:Oh, you better believe it! Let's give it a whirl!
Dialogue: Oh, you better believe it! Let's give it a whirl!

Original: Cait Sith:Beyond ordeals lies an unexpected reunion. Your lucky color is a daaark one...
Dialogue: Beyond ordeals lies an unexpected reunion. Your lucky color is a daaark one...

Original: Seven:Look at that. A reunion awaits you.
Dialogue: Look at that. A reunion awaits you.

Original: Kain:Ordeals, eh... Will those be obstacles before you...or within?
Dialogue: Ordeals, eh... Will those be obstacles before you...or within?

Original: Ramza:But whatever could, "Your lucky color is a dark one," mean?
Dialogue: But whatever could, "Your lucky color is a dark one," mean?

Original: Cait Sith:Hmm... It's just a regular fortune, so maybe a connection to something black?
Dialogue: Hmm... It's just a regular fortune, so maybe a connection to something black?

Original: Chelinka:But doesn't that give you something to look forward to now?
Dialogue: But doesn't that give you something to look forward to now?

Original: Maria:...Haha, thank you.
Dialogue: ...Haha, thank you.

Original: Maria:Yes, I do think that fortune gave me a little bit of hope.
Dialogue: Yes, I do think that fortune gave me a little bit of hope.

Original: Cait Sith:Oho! I couldn't be happier to hear it! Fortune must be smiling on this fortune-telling machine!
Dialogue: Oho! I couldn't be happier to hear it! Fortune must be smiling on this fortune-telling machine!

Original: Maria:If I can live with my family again...
Dialogue: If I can live with my family again...

Original: Maria:I will overcome any ordeal I must!
