Dialogue: The boat she wanted was captained by none other than yours truly.

Original: Balthier:I can't imagine such a meeting was a mere coincidence. Sounds like fate to me.
Dialogue: I can't imagine such a meeting was a mere coincidence. Sounds like fate to me.

Original: Steiner:Princess Lenna, I know you left your home for a noble reason, but you shouldn't have.
Dialogue: Princess Lenna, I know you left your home for a noble reason, but you shouldn't have.

Original: Steiner:You are royalty! You must consider your own safety!
Dialogue: You are royalty! You must consider your own safety!

Original: Steiner:I cannot condone running away and collaborating with brigands under any circumstances!
Dialogue: I cannot condone running away and collaborating with brigands under any circumstances!

Original: Garnet:...Are you trying to lecture me, Steiner?
Dialogue: ...Are you trying to lecture me, Steiner?

Original: Ashe:There comes a time where everyone needs some help, no matter the source.
Dialogue: There comes a time where everyone needs some help, no matter the source.

Original: Balthier:I much prefer a princess who takes action than one who stays locked up in her tower, crying her eyes out.
Dialogue: I much prefer a princess who takes action than one who stays locked up in her tower, crying her eyes out.

Original: Steiner:But what about her people?
Dialogue: But what about her people?

Original: Steiner:The people want their monarchs to be safe and in good health! Please don't forget that!
Dialogue: The people want their monarchs to be safe and in good health! Please don't forget that!

Original: Garnet:...He's right. I don't know what to say back...
Dialogue: ...He's right. I don't know what to say back...

Original: Ashe:I am chagrined...
Dialogue: I am chagrined...

Original: Steiner:P-please, don't lose such heart!
Dialogue: P-please, don't lose such heart!

Original: Faris:Steiner has a point.
Dialogue: Steiner has a point.

Original: Faris:There are a lot of people waiting for you to return. That's why we need to go back alive, Lenna.
Dialogue: There are a lot of people waiting for you to return. That's why we need to go back alive, Lenna.

Original: Lenna:Of course. I have no intention otherwise.
Dialogue: Of course. I have no intention otherwise.

Original: Lenna:I will keep fighting for this world, and the people of Tycoon!
Dialogue: I will keep fighting for this world, and the people of Tycoon!

Original: Balthier:Someone waiting for your return... How nice that must be.
Dialogue: Someone waiting for your return... How nice that must be.

Original: Galuf:That's the last of the Torsions in the vicinity.
Dialogue: That's the last of the Torsions in the vicinity.

Original: Mog:It's all thanks to your hard work, kupo!
Dialogue: It's all thanks to your hard work, kupo!

Original: Bartz:Kay, let's move on to our next destination.
Dialogue: Kay, let's move on to our next destination.

Original: Yuna:...Hm? Just a moment. I don't see Lenna around.
Dialogue: ...Hm? Just a moment. I don't see Lenna around.

Original: Galuf:Now that you mention it...
Dialogue: Now that you mention it...

Original: Bartz:Vivi and Eiko are gone, too. Where'd everyone go?
Dialogue: Vivi and Eiko are gone, too. Where'd everyone go?

Original: Eiko:Guys! Sorry to keep you waiting!
Dialogue: Guys! Sorry to keep you waiting!

Original: Galuf:You're all muddied up? What on earth happened?
Dialogue: You're all muddied up? What on earth happened?

Original: Vivi:The three of us dug a grave for the dragon.
Dialogue: The three of us dug a grave for the dragon.

Original: Bartz:A grave for the dragon?
Dialogue: A grave for the dragon?

Original: Lenna:Yes... I want her to rest in peace.
Dialogue: Yes... I want her to rest in peace.

Original: Yuna:Is that so...?
Dialogue: Is that so...?

Original: Yuna:I am certain she's so terribly happy that you were there to send her on.
Dialogue: I am certain she's so terribly happy that you were there to send her on.

Original: Eiko:We left lots and lots of flower seeds over the grave for her!
Dialogue: We left lots and lots of flower seeds over the grave for her!

Original: Galuf:Ho ho ho, wonderful! Lovely flowers are sure to bloom.
Dialogue: Ho ho ho, wonderful! Lovely flowers are sure to bloom.

Original: Bartz:Yeah. Let's come back after some time so we can all pay our respects.
Dialogue: Yeah. Let's come back after some time so we can all pay our respects.

Original: Lenna:Thank you, everyone...
Dialogue: Thank you, everyone...

Original: Mog:As long as the Torsions persist, incidents like this are bound to happen, kupo...
Dialogue: As long as the Torsions persist, incidents like this are bound to happen, kupo...

Original: Yuna:Monsters from different worlds will come into conflict after passing through the Torsions...
Dialogue: Monsters from different worlds will come into conflict after passing through the Torsions...

Original: Galuf:Neither side was ever meant to encounter the other.
Dialogue: Neither side was ever meant to encounter the other.

Original: Galuf:An unnatural struggle... It's no wonder that poor dragon met such a fate.
Dialogue: An unnatural struggle... It's no wonder that poor dragon met such a fate.

Original: Lenna:I...want to see all the Torsions closed. I can't bear to see this tragedy repeat itself...
Dialogue: I...want to see all the Torsions closed. I can't bear to see this tragedy repeat itself...

Original: Mog:Kupo! Those are the words I hoped to hear, kupo! I can feel the kindness flowing form the light of your will, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo! Those are the words I hoped to hear, kupo! I can feel the kindness flowing form the light of your will, kupo!

Original: Vivi:Let's give it our all, Miss Lenna.
Dialogue: Let's give it our all, Miss Lenna.

Original: Eiko:We'll all help!
Dialogue: We'll all help!

Original: Bartz:Gosh... Don't take on more than you can handle, hear?
Dialogue: Gosh... Don't take on more than you can handle, hear?

Original: Galuf:Not to worry, Bartz. When they take on too much, we'll be there to lend them a hand.
Dialogue: Not to worry, Bartz. When they take on too much, we'll be there to lend them a hand.

Original: Cloud:...You're cornered.
Dialogue: ...You're cornered.

Original: Cloud:So what? Draw your weapon!
Dialogue: So what? Draw your weapon!

Original: Hope:I can't find Cloud anywhere.
Dialogue: I can't find Cloud anywhere.

Original: Warrior of Light:Have we no hint as to his whereabouts?
Dialogue: Have we no hint as to his whereabouts?

Original: Mog:I sense something powerful over that way, kupo! Two somethings, kupo!
Dialogue: I sense something powerful over that way, kupo! Two somethings, kupo!

Original: Sephiroth:...World order?
Dialogue: ...World order?

Original: Sephiroth:Of course... You're the one...
Dialogue: Of course... You're the one...

Original: Mog:K-kupo!? He's gonna attack us, kupo!
Dialogue: K-kupo!? He's gonna attack us, kupo!

Original: Tifa:He's not an opponent to take lightly! Help me out, guys!
Dialogue: He's not an opponent to take lightly! Help me out, guys!

Original: Sephiroth:Heh heh... ...That's right. Let me see this.
Dialogue: Heh heh... ...That's right. Let me see this.

Original: Sephiroth:...Now I see.
Dialogue: ...Now I see.

Original: Mog:Kupo! S-stop looking at me, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo! S-stop looking at me, kupo!

Original: Cloud:I'm over here!
Dialogue: I'm over here!

Original: Shadow:Wait! We're not alone... Manikins!
Dialogue: Wait! We're not alone... Manikins!

Original: Zidane:Aww, c'mon. The real ones are bad enough.
Dialogue: Aww, c'mon. The real ones are bad enough.

Original: Sephiroth:Heh... A copy that was never even a lab rat...
Dialogue: Heh... A copy that was never even a lab rat...

Original: Sephiroth:...Don't make me laugh.
Dialogue: ...Don't make me laugh.

Original: Zidane:He's gonna fight the manikins!?
Dialogue: He's gonna fight the manikins!?

Original: Shadow:"The enemy of my enemy is my friend," eh? Cloud, what say you?
Dialogue: "The enemy of my enemy is my friend," eh? Cloud, what say you?

Original: Cloud:There's got to be a catch... There's no way we can trust him.
Dialogue: There's got to be a catch... There's no way we can trust him.

Original: Mog:Y-yeah, but...!
Dialogue: Y-yeah, but...!

Original: Mog:There's no way we can fight Sephiroth and his manikin at the same time, kupo...
Dialogue: There's no way we can fight Sephiroth and his manikin at the same time, kupo...

Original: Shadow:Hm. Either one alone would leave us in sorry shape.
Dialogue: Hm. Either one alone would leave us in sorry shape.

Original: Mog:Desperate times call for desperate measures. We need to take the advantage we can, kupo.
Dialogue: Desperate times call for desperate measures. We need to take the advantage we can, kupo.

Original: Sephiroth:Heh heh heh... So that's how you lead them.
Dialogue: Heh heh heh... So that's how you lead them.

Original: Mog:Kupo... What amazing energy, kupo. With that
Dialogue: Kupo... What amazing energy, kupo. With that—

Original: Sephiroth:Ha ha ha...
Dialogue: Ha ha ha...

Original: Cloud:Sephiroth! We aren't finished!
Dialogue: Sephiroth! We aren't finished!

Original: Sephiroth:So cold, Cloud.
Dialogue: So cold, Cloud.

Original: Sephiroth:This isn't the planet to return to. You lost your reason to fight me long ago.
Dialogue: This isn't the planet to return to. You lost your reason to fight me long ago.

Original: Vivi:Cloud... What's he talking about?
Dialogue: Cloud... What's he talking about?

Original: Sephiroth:It's entirely possible you wouldn't understand... How much do you remember?
Dialogue: It's entirely possible you wouldn't understand... How much do you remember?

Original: Sephiroth:Have you never questioned those memories? Your abilities?
Dialogue: Have you never questioned those memories? Your abilities?

Original: Sephiroth:Things you've lost... And things you're given... Do you plan to repeat this pattern over and over?
Dialogue: Things you've lost... And things you're given... Do you plan to repeat this pattern over and over?

Original: Sephiroth:And you're the one using that to gather power.
Dialogue: And you're the one using that to gather power.

Original: Mog:I haven't the foggiest, kupo.
Dialogue: I haven't the foggiest, kupo.

Original: Sephiroth:All you've gathered... Let me see that power for myself...!
Dialogue: All you've gathered... Let me see that power for myself...!

Original: Sephiroth:Ha ha ha... You're joking, right? Don't tell me you haven't been suspicious from the start.
Dialogue: Ha ha ha... You're joking, right? Don't tell me you haven't been suspicious from the start.

Original: Warrior of Light:Hn... That is...
Dialogue: Hn... That is...

Original: Vivi:I-I trust Mog! I know everyone else is unsure, but I decided to trust him!
Dialogue: I-I trust Mog! I know everyone else is unsure, but I decided to trust him!

Original: Warrior of Light:Vivi... Indeed, you have the right of it... Although my faith in Mog may have wavered
Dialogue: Vivi... Indeed, you have the right of it... Although my faith in Mog may have wavered—

Original: Sephiroth:Save your theatrics.
Dialogue: Save your theatrics.

Original: Sephiroth:Cloud... How about you? What crosses your mind when you look at this unfinished world and its unfinished puppets?
Dialogue: Cloud... How about you? What crosses your mind when you look at this unfinished world and its unfinished puppets?

Original: Cloud:I...trust Mog...
Dialogue: I...trust Mog...

Original: Sephiroth:That's your answer?
Dialogue: That's your answer?

Original: Sephiroth:Heh heh. Very well... I shall usher you forward, so you can see your own reactions when confronted with the truth.
Dialogue: Heh heh. Very well... I shall usher you forward, so you can see your own reactions when confronted with the truth.

Original: Warrior of Light:Usher...? Explain yourself!
Dialogue: Usher...? Explain yourself!

Original: Sephiroth:Take it.
Dialogue: Take it.

Original: Sephiroth:That power inside of you... Don't disappoint me.
Dialogue: That power inside of you... Don't disappoint me.

Original: Cloud:You took his dimensional coordinates!?
Dialogue: You took his dimensional coordinates!?

Original: Mog:That's the will I was given, kupo...
Dialogue: That's the will I was given, kupo...

Original: Mog:I don't understand his intentions either, but I'm sure his strength will be of use to you, kupo.
Dialogue: I don't understand his intentions either, but I'm sure his strength will be of use to you, kupo.

Original: Mog:I can't fight, kupo... So I have to help you find your way in this world...and trust...in you...
Dialogue: I can't fight, kupo... So I have to help you find your way in this world...and trust...in you...

Original: Mog:All I can do...is support you, kupo...
Dialogue: All I can do...is support you, kupo...

Original: Mog:I-I... I want to he...lp you, kupo... I... I...
Dialogue: I-I... I want to he...lp you, kupo... I... I...

Original: Vivi:M-M-Mog, are you alright!?
Dialogue: M-M-Mog, are you alright!?

Original: Mog:What do you mean, kupo?
Dialogue: What do you mean, kupo?

Original: Mog:We've got a new ally! Let's keep fighting and go close those Torsions, kupo!
Dialogue: We've got a new ally! Let's keep fighting and go close those Torsions, kupo!

Original: Mog:Cheer up, everyone! Let's go, kupo!
Dialogue: Cheer up, everyone! Let's go, kupo!

Original: Cait Sith:I know what they say about cats and curiosity, but I can't help wondering what Sephiroth is thinking.
Dialogue: I know what they say about cats and curiosity, but I can't help wondering what Sephiroth is thinking.

Original: Cait Sith:I just can't put my paw on what his goal is. He seems different from Spiritus's other warriors.
Dialogue: I just can't put my paw on what his goal is. He seems different from Spiritus's other warriors.

Original: Zidane:Kuja wants to change his destiny
Dialogue: Kuja wants to change his destiny—

Original: Tidus:Seymour said he wanted to liberate us with death.
Dialogue: Seymour said he wanted to liberate us with death.

Original: Celes:And Kefka just seems to be enjoying the carnage as always.
Dialogue: And Kefka just seems to be enjoying the carnage as always.

Original: Cait Sith:But Sephiroth's goal here doesn't match up with the kind of things he did back home.
Dialogue: But Sephiroth's goal here doesn't match up with the kind of things he did back home.

Original: Layle:Maybe we could help if we knew more about him.
Dialogue: Maybe we could help if we knew more about him.

Original: Layle:Could you tell us what kind of person he was back in your world?
Dialogue: Could you tell us what kind of person he was back in your world?

Original: Cloud:But...after learning the truth about his birth, he went mad and started spiraling out of control.
Dialogue: But...after learning the truth about his birth, he went mad and started spiraling out of control.

Original: Layle:What exactly did he find out?
Dialogue: What exactly did he find out?

Original: Celes:Artificially enhanced? Just like me and Kefka...
Dialogue: Artificially enhanced? Just like me and Kefka...

Original: Zidane:I see. So maybe Sephiroth's not so different from us after all...
Dialogue: I see. So maybe Sephiroth's not so different from us after all...

Original: Cait Sith:No... He's completely different.
Dialogue: No... He's completely different.

Original: Cloud:I'll never forget the heat of the flames from that day...
Dialogue: I'll never forget the heat of the flames from that day...

Original: Tidus:So Cloud went after Sephiroth for revenge?
Dialogue: So Cloud went after Sephiroth for revenge?

Original: Cait Sith:Cloud's hometown was just the beginning.
Dialogue: Cloud's hometown was just the beginning.

Original: Cait Sith:After that, he tried to destroy the entire planet.
Dialogue: After that, he tried to destroy the entire planet.

Original: Celes:Then he's just like Kefka, isn't he?
Dialogue: Then he's just like Kefka, isn't he?

Original: Cloud:The planet tried to fix itself. And he gathered that energy...
Dialogue: The planet tried to fix itself. And he gathered that energy...

Original: Cloud:Wait. Could he be trying to gather this world's energy like that planesgorger that possessed Mog?
Dialogue: Wait. Could he be trying to gather this world's energy like that planesgorger that possessed Mog?

Original: Layle:Maybe he wants the energy to rewrite world order, like some kind of god.
Dialogue: Maybe he wants the energy to rewrite world order, like some kind of god.

Original: Cait Sith:I don't get it. Even if he changed the world order here, what good would it do?
Dialogue: I don't get it. Even if he changed the world order here, what good would it do?

Original: Cait Sith:All I know is we're all in trouble if he's found a new purpose in this world...
Dialogue: All I know is we're all in trouble if he's found a new purpose in this world...

Original: Tidus:This guy sounds like a real pain.
Dialogue: This guy sounds like a real pain.

Original: Zidane:Well, whatever his goal may be, it sounds like he's still as dangerous an enemy as he was in your world.
Dialogue: Well, whatever his goal may be, it sounds like he's still as dangerous an enemy as he was in your world.

Original: Cloud:Yeah. We should be on our guard.
Dialogue: Yeah. We should be on our guard.

Original: Kefka:Heh heh heh. Welcome back! Did you have fun playing with our new pals?
Dialogue: Heh heh heh. Welcome back! Did you have fun playing with our new pals?

Original: Kuja:Were you waiting here just to ask me that?
Dialogue: Were you waiting here just to ask me that?

Original: Kefka:Why so cold? We're on the same team, aren't we?
Dialogue: Why so cold? We're on the same team, aren't we?

Original: Kuja:Please don't rope me in with your buffoonery.
Dialogue: Please don't rope me in with your buffoonery.

Original: Kefka:Oh! Back so soon?
Dialogue: Oh! Back so soon?

Original: Kefka:It seems like you just can't stay away from that porcupine head!
Dialogue: It seems like you just can't stay away from that porcupine head!

Original: Sephiroth:Stay out of my business.
Dialogue: Stay out of my business.

Original: Kefka:Aww... Nobody wants to play with me! What's the matter? Am I really that annoying?
Dialogue: Aww... Nobody wants to play with me! What's the matter? Am I really that annoying?

Original: Seymour:That is correct.
Dialogue: That is correct.

Original: Kefka:Well, if it isn't Mister Maester! Did you have some business to attend to with our friends, too?
Dialogue: Well, if it isn't Mister Maester! Did you have some business to attend to with our friends, too?

Original: Seymour:...I've had enough of your idle chatter. You couldn't possibly understand what I'm doing.
Dialogue: ...I've had enough of your idle chatter. You couldn't possibly understand what I'm doing.

Original: Kefka:You know, you're absolutely right!
Dialogue: You know, you're absolutely right!

Original: Kefka:So why don't you enlighten me? If not for kicks, then why are you helping them?
Dialogue: So why don't you enlighten me? If not for kicks, then why are you helping them?

Original: Kefka:Ack! Wait, wait! Come on. It's been so long since we've seen each other, so why don't you stay and chat?
Dialogue: Ack! Wait, wait! Come on. It's been so long since we've seen each other, so why don't you stay and chat?

Original: Kefka:...We could talk about that moogle, for example.
Dialogue: ...We could talk about that moogle, for example.

Original: Kuja:...Mog? He betrayed those fools.
Dialogue: ...Mog? He betrayed those fools.

Original: Kefka:Yeah! But while blabbing on about the big bad Blackened Will, he was oh so sneakily gathering energy!
Dialogue: Yeah! But while blabbing on about the big bad Blackened Will, he was oh so sneakily gathering energy!

Original: Kefka:And even after all that, those goody two-shoes still kept the scheming sack of fluff around! They're even chummier now!
Dialogue: And even after all that, those goody two-shoes still kept the scheming sack of fluff around! They're even chummier now!

Original: Kefka:I can't believe it! How does crazy stuff like this even happen!?
Dialogue: I can't believe it! How does crazy stuff like this even happen!?

Original: Sephiroth:Sympathy. Forgiveness. But those are all lies... Lies that pitiful humans cling to for survival.
Dialogue: Sympathy. Forgiveness. But those are all lies... Lies that pitiful humans cling to for survival.

Original: Kefka:I see! It's all because they're weak, little worms.
Dialogue: I see! It's all because they're weak, little worms.

Original: Seymour:That's right... Real truth doesn't exist in any world.
Dialogue: That's right... Real truth doesn't exist in any world.

Original: Sephiroth:They'll soon feel the sting of betrayal and the coldness of despair...
Dialogue: They'll soon feel the sting of betrayal and the coldness of despair...

Original: Kefka:Oooh, I get it now! It seems we're on the same page after all!
Dialogue: Oooh, I get it now! It seems we're on the same page after all!

Original: Kuja:Silence, clown.
Dialogue: Silence, clown.

Original: Sephiroth:Learn to hold your tongue...else I'll cut you down where you stand.
Dialogue: Learn to hold your tongue...else I'll cut you down where you stand.

Original: Kefka:Hmph. Alright, alright already!
Dialogue: Hmph. Alright, alright already!

Original: Seymour:It seems like the moogle and his friends are calling.
Dialogue: It seems like the moogle and his friends are calling.

Original: Kefka:Ta-ta! Have fun out there!
Dialogue: Ta-ta! Have fun out there!

Original: Vaan:You alright, Cloud? You don't look so good.
Dialogue: You alright, Cloud? You don't look so good.

Original: Cloud:It's nothing... Don't worry about it.
Dialogue: It's nothing... Don't worry about it.

Original: Vincent:He's just airsick.
Dialogue: He's just airsick.

Original: Sazh:Aw, man! Even you get sick?
Dialogue: Aw, man! Even you get sick?

Original: Sazh:...But I was at the helm. Sorry about that.
Dialogue: ...But I was at the helm. Sorry about that.

Original: Cloud:It's not your fault.
Dialogue: It's not your fault.

Original: Vaan:Leave the flying to me next time! I'll give you a smoother ride than Sazh's!
Dialogue: Leave the flying to me next time! I'll give you a smoother ride than Sazh's!

Original: Cloud:Please. Don't make things worse.
Dialogue: Please. Don't make things worse.

Original: Vaan:Tsk, figures... Huh?
Dialogue: Tsk, figures... Huh?

Original: Vaan:Is someone rummaging around over there?
Dialogue: Is someone rummaging around over there?

Original: Vincent:That's a familiar backside.
Dialogue: That's a familiar backside.

Original: Cloud:Yeah, it is. ...C'mon.
Dialogue: Yeah, it is. ...C'mon.

Original: ???:$#&%! Nothing but a pile of junk!
Dialogue: $#&%! Nothing but a pile of junk!

Original: Cid:Cloud! Vincent! Where the hell'd you two run off to?
Dialogue: Cloud! Vincent! Where the hell'd you two run off to?

Original: Vincent:What were you doing there?
Dialogue: What were you doing there?

Original: Cid:Huh? Trying to cobble together something to get me airborne, of course.
Dialogue: Huh? Trying to cobble together something to get me airborne, of course.

Original: Sazh:From scratch!?
Dialogue: From scratch!?

Original: Cid:Natch! Need some way to track down and reconnect with my group.
Dialogue: Natch! Need some way to track down and reconnect with my group.

Original: Cloud:In that case, you're all set. Here we are.
Dialogue: In that case, you're all set. Here we are.

Original: Cid:Huh? I guess so, but...
Dialogue: Huh? I guess so, but...

Original: Vaan:Look out! Behind you!
Dialogue: Look out! Behind you!

Original: Vincent:It appears a Torsion was buried under that rubble.
Dialogue: It appears a Torsion was buried under that rubble.

Original: Cid:The hell's a "Torsion"?
Dialogue: The hell's a "Torsion"?

Original: Cloud:We'll explain after we take care of those things.
Dialogue: We'll explain after we take care of those things.

Original: Cid:...You don't say. A whole new world, huh?
Dialogue: ...You don't say. A whole new world, huh?

Original: Yuffie:Gee, you caught on faster than I'd expect you to.
Dialogue: Gee, you caught on faster than I'd expect you to.

Original: Tifa:I don't think he's giving it all that much thought...
Dialogue: I don't think he's giving it all that much thought...

Original: Cid:Alright! Let's build a big ol' airship and fly on back home!
Dialogue: Alright! Let's build a big ol' airship and fly on back home!

Original: Sazh:Cid, listen. If it's a big airship you want we've got ya covered.
Dialogue: Cid, listen. If it's a big airship you want we've got ya covered.

Original: Cid:That so? Even if you do, I'm warning you, I can be a bit stubborn when it comes to these things.
Dialogue: That so? Even if you do, I'm warning you, I can be a bit stubborn when it comes to these things.

Original: Cid:We've got the world's best pilot here, I'll have you know! Even got an airship with my name on it!
Dialogue: We've got the world's best pilot here, I'll have you know! Even got an airship with my name on it!

Original: Setzer:And a new competitor enters the race.
Dialogue: And a new competitor enters the race.

Original: Sazh:Now, now, let's keep our passengers' safety in mind 'fore we talk about racing...
Dialogue: Now, now, let's keep our passengers' safety in mind 'fore we talk about racing...

Original: Vaan:Hey, Cid! Teach me how to fly, too, will ya? These guys never let me take the wheel.
Dialogue: Hey, Cid! Teach me how to fly, too, will ya? These guys never let me take the wheel.

Original: Cid:Huh? That's 'cause they sized you up, kid.
Dialogue: Huh? That's 'cause they sized you up, kid.

Original: Cid:If they haven't let you steer, there's a reason. All the more so with passengers on board.
Dialogue: If they haven't let you steer, there's a reason. All the more so with passengers on board.

Original: Cid:I didn't get to where I am in a day either. Take it one step at a time and you'll reach your dreams.
Dialogue: I didn't get to where I am in a day either. Take it one step at a time and you'll reach your dreams.

Original: Cid:For now, just work on aping others' techniques. Think of it as training.
Dialogue: For now, just work on aping others' techniques. Think of it as training.

Original: Vaan:I guess you're right. You all were young once, too, huh?
Dialogue: I guess you're right. You all were young once, too, huh?

Original: Setzer:I hope that remark wasn't directed at me.
Dialogue: I hope that remark wasn't directed at me.

Original: Cid:Alright, let's see this airship. Could be a tune up is in order.
Dialogue: Alright, let's see this airship. Could be a tune up is in order.

Original: Vaan:Sure thing! It's over here!
Dialogue: Sure thing! It's over here!

Original: Sazh:Man, now I want to take a look, too!
Dialogue: Man, now I want to take a look, too!

Original: Tifa:We didn't even have to ask him to join us.
Dialogue: We didn't even have to ask him to join us.

Original: Yuffie:Good for Cid hitting it off with his new friends.
Dialogue: Good for Cid hitting it off with his new friends.

Original: Cid:Hey, Mog. You're the one who provided that airship?
Dialogue: Hey, Mog. You're the one who provided that airship?

Original: Mog:Kupo! Do you like it, kupo?
Dialogue: Kupo! Do you like it, kupo?

Original: Cid:Yeah, she ain't a bad boat! Got a comfortable clunk to her!
Dialogue: Yeah, she ain't a bad boat! Got a comfortable clunk to her!

Original: Cid:...So, uh, I don't suppose she's got any rockets on her, eh?
Dialogue: ...So, uh, I don't suppose she's got any rockets on her, eh?

Original: Mog:K-kupo? Rockets...kupo?
Dialogue: K-kupo? Rockets...kupo?

Original: Cloud:Not that again...
Dialogue: Not that again...

Original: Cid:Argh! $#&%, yes, that again!
Dialogue: Argh! $#&%, yes, that again!

Original: Irvine:"That" what?
Dialogue: "That" what?

Original: Yuffie:Cid wants to be an astronaut. The first man in space.
Dialogue: Cid wants to be an astronaut. The first man in space.

Original: Irvine:Ohhh, space...
Dialogue: Ohhh, space...

Original: Irvine:I guess we beat him to the punch, eh, Squall?
Dialogue: I guess we beat him to the punch, eh, Squall?

Original: Squall:(Don't remind me...)
Dialogue: (Don't remind me...)

Original: Cid:Beat me...? You kids've been to space?
Dialogue: Beat me...? You kids've been to space?

Original: Irvine:It just kinda happened that way.
Dialogue: It just kinda happened that way.

Original: Cid:Just kinda happened!? Holy $#&%, am I jealous!
Dialogue: Just kinda happened!? Holy $#&%, am I jealous!

Original: Cid:Hey, what'd the planet look like from space!? Was there anything out there!?
Dialogue: Hey, what'd the planet look like from space!? Was there anything out there!?

Original: Cid:Do you really float around weightlessly!? D-don't tell me you went out on a spacewalk!
Dialogue: Do you really float around weightlessly!? D-don't tell me you went out on a spacewalk!

Original: Squall:(What a pain...)
Dialogue: (What a pain...)

Original: Mog:You're as giddy as a kid, kupo!
Dialogue: You're as giddy as a kid, kupo!

Original: Yuffie:I sure don't get it. Just thinking about going to space makes me queasy. ...Urp.
Dialogue: I sure don't get it. Just thinking about going to space makes me queasy. ...Urp.

Original: Cloud:Likewise. I want nothing to do with it.
Dialogue: Likewise. I want nothing to do with it.

Original: Cid:A s-space station...?
Dialogue: A s-space station...?

Original: Irvine:If you felt like it, you could probably go live there.
Dialogue: If you felt like it, you could probably go live there.

Original: Cid:Cloud! Yuffie! I've made up my mind!
Dialogue: Cloud! Yuffie! I've made up my mind!

Original: Cid:When we're done here, I'm going back to these guys' world! Don't try to stop me!
Dialogue: When we're done here, I'm going back to these guys' world! Don't try to stop me!

Original: Cloud:No one's stopping you...
Dialogue: No one's stopping you...

Original: Cid:Alright, gotta get to closing those Torsions! For space!
Dialogue: Alright, gotta get to closing those Torsions! For space!

Original: Mog:Th-that's not supposed to be why we're closing them, kupo...
Dialogue: Th-that's not supposed to be why we're closing them, kupo...

Original: Cid:Irvine! You tell me more about it!
Dialogue: Irvine! You tell me more about it!

Original: Irvine:What? Me!? Squall!
Dialogue: What? Me!? Squall!

Original: Squall:You reap what you sowed.
Dialogue: You reap what you sowed.

Original: Yuffie:He's all yours.
Dialogue: He's all yours.

Original: Cid:What's this all of a sudden?
Dialogue: What's this all of a sudden?

Original: Cecil:My apologies. I just realized something.
Dialogue: My apologies. I just realized something.

Original: Cecil:Inmy world, there's also someone by the name ofCid. He was both a pilot and engineer, not unlike you.
Dialogue: In my world, there's also someone by the name of Cid. He was both a pilot and engineer, not unlike you.

Original: Cid:Well, ain't that a coincidence!
Dialogue: Well, ain't that a coincidence!

Original: Onion Knight:He was an old man who knew his way around an airship, too. He used aperpetual engineto makeour shipfly.
Dialogue: He was an old man who knew his way around an airship, too. He used a perpetual engine to make our ship fly.

Original: Bartz:TheCidfrommy worldwas an inventor and scholar.
Dialogue: The Cid from my world was an inventor and scholar.

Original: Bartz:He could read ancient texts and remodel our airship. He was a big help on our journey.
Dialogue: He could read ancient texts and remodel our airship. He was a big help on our journey.

Original: Cid:Gahaha! Happy to hear they're doing their namesake proud.
Dialogue: Gahaha! Happy to hear they're doing their namesake proud.

Original: Tifa:You don't seem surprised at all.
Dialogue: You don't seem surprised at all.

Original: Cid:The world is a big place. It's only natural there'd be others with the same name.
Dialogue: The world is a big place. It's only natural there'd be others with the same name.

Original: Tifa:I guess you've got a point...
Dialogue: I guess you've got a point...

Original: Cid:How 'bout you, Zidane? Any great Cids in your world?
Dialogue: How 'bout you, Zidane? Any great Cids in your world?

Original: Zidane:He'sthe ruler of a hugecountry. He likes inventing and even developed airships.
Dialogue: He's the ruler of a huge country. He likes inventing and even developed airships.

Original: Bartz:Interesting, isn't it? It seems all Cids have ties to airships.
Dialogue: Interesting, isn't it? It seems all Cids have ties to airships.

Original: Cecil:And they've all helped us in their own way.
Dialogue: And they've all helped us in their own way.

Original: Cid:We're pretty nifty, aren't we? I'd like to talk to all of 'em and see what I could learn about technology.
Dialogue: We're pretty nifty, aren't we? I'd like to talk to all of 'em and see what I could learn about technology.

Original: Cecil:If you're discussing airships, please allow me to join.
Dialogue: If you're discussing airships, please allow me to join.

Original: Cid:A gathering of men of the sky! I'm already lookin' forward to meetin' like-minded fellas!
Dialogue: A gathering of men of the sky! I'm already lookin' forward to meetin' like-minded fellas!

Original: Onion Knight:I wonder if they'll all get along...
Dialogue: I wonder if they'll all get along...

Original: Zidane:This Cid's sure a roughneck.
Dialogue: This Cid's sure a roughneck.

Original: Tifa:Yeah, but he's a reliable one.
Dialogue: Yeah, but he's a reliable one.

Original: Cid:Alright! You ready for this?
Dialogue: Alright! You ready for this?

Original: Galuf:Good grief... You may have skill, but that doesn't mean you have to rush into everything like that.
Dialogue: Good grief... You may have skill, but that doesn't mean you have to rush into everything like that.

Original: Cid:What're you saying, old man? Having this kind of energy is a good thing!
Dialogue: What're you saying, old man? Having this kind of energy is a good thing!

Original: Jecht:That's right! It keeps everyone's spirits up.
Dialogue: That's right! It keeps everyone's spirits up.

Original: Yang:It seems you two have found a kindred spirit in each other.
Dialogue: It seems you two have found a kindred spirit in each other.

Original: Sazh:Your kids must be a handful.
Dialogue: Your kids must be a handful.

Original: Cid:Sorry, don't have any! I'm living a true bachelor's life.
Dialogue: Sorry, don't have any! I'm living a true bachelor's life.

Original: Galuf:I feared as much...
Dialogue: I feared as much...

Original: Yang:Lord Cid, they say one becomes stronger once having a family.
Dialogue: Lord Cid, they say one becomes stronger once having a family.

Original: Jecht:Isn't there anyone you've got your eye on?
Dialogue: Isn't there anyone you've got your eye on?

Original: Cid:A-absolutely not! So leave me alone, will ya!?
Dialogue: A-absolutely not! So leave me alone, will ya!?

Original: Sazh:...You're a terrible liar.
Dialogue: ...You're a terrible liar.

Original: Galuf:Ohoho. Hate is but the other side of love.
Dialogue: Ohoho. Hate is but the other side of love.

Original: Cid:That's enough out of you, old man...!
Dialogue: That's enough out of you, old man...!

Original: Cid:Sure she takes care of everything at the lab...
Dialogue: Sure she takes care of everything at the lab...

Original: Cid:But she's dumb as a rock when it comes to work! She put herself in danger for my dream. She could have died!
Dialogue: But she's dumb as a rock when it comes to work! She put herself in danger for my dream. She could have died!

Original: Cid:That's why I had to give up on that dream. It was all her fault...
Dialogue: That's why I had to give up on that dream. It was all her fault...

Original: Yang:Hm? You mean you saved her?
Dialogue: Hm? You mean you saved her?

Original: Cid:I wasn't about to sacrifice her!
Dialogue: I wasn't about to sacrifice her!

Original: Jecht:Which means she was more important than your dream.
Dialogue: Which means she was more important than your dream.

Original: Galuf:You just don't get it, do you?
Dialogue: You just don't get it, do you?

Original: Sazh:Ahh, youthful romance. I'm almost jealous.
Dialogue: Ahh, youthful romance. I'm almost jealous.

Original: Jecht:Isn't it time you grew up?
Dialogue: Isn't it time you grew up?

Original: Cid:The hell're they talkin' about? Lettin' their imaginations run wild is what...
Dialogue: The hell're they talkin' about? Lettin' their imaginations run wild is what...

Original: Cid:Don't stick your noses into other people's business, dammit!
Dialogue: Don't stick your noses into other people's business, dammit!

Original: Yuffie:Geez, this rain just won't let up.
Dialogue: Geez, this rain just won't let up.

Original: Mog:It's always raining here, kupo. My pom-pom is waterlogged...
Dialogue: It's always raining here, kupo. My pom-pom is waterlogged...

Original: Firion:I would welcome the rain, but it's bound to wear us down if it stays like this.
Dialogue: I would welcome the rain, but it's bound to wear us down if it stays like this.

Original: Tifa:We're all gonna catch our death out here. Cloud, let's go look for someplace
Dialogue: We're all gonna catch our death out here. Cloud, let's go look for someplace—

Original: Cloud:Someone's here.
Dialogue: Someone's here.

Original: Yuffie:Whaaa!? Who!?
Dialogue: Whaaa!? Who!?

Original: Cloud:...Over there!
Dialogue: ...Over there!

Original: Tifa:Ah! Wait! Cloud!
Dialogue: Ah! Wait! Cloud!

Original: Mog:Everybody after him, kupo! We can look for shelter after!
Dialogue: Everybody after him, kupo! We can look for shelter after!

Original: Cloud:!? Y-you...!?
???:Hm? But...where's this?
Dialogue: Hm? But...where's this?

Original: Mog:Kupo! We caught up!
Dialogue: Kupo! We caught up!

Original: Tifa:Is that...Zack!?
Dialogue: Is that...Zack!?

Original: Hope:He's dressed the same as Cloud. Does that mean he's also from SOLDIER?
Dialogue: He's dressed the same as Cloud. Does that mean he's also from SOLDIER?

Original: Warrior of Light:That would seem to be the case.
Dialogue: That would seem to be the case.

Original: Zack:Oho? That crowd back there all your friends?
Dialogue: Oho? That crowd back there all your friends?

Original: Cloud:Y-yeah... That's right.
Dialogue: Y-yeah... That's right.

Original: Zack:Hey, if it ain't Tifa, too! Long time, no see! All healed up?
Dialogue: Hey, if it ain't Tifa, too! Long time, no see! All healed up?

Original: Tifa:Yes...thanks to you...
Dialogue: Yes...thanks to you...

Original: Hope:It looks like they all know each other...but does something feel off to you?
Dialogue: It looks like they all know each other...but does something feel off to you?

Original: Warrior of Light:The Torsions warp everything... Our memories, too. There must be some details that do not match up for the three of them.
Dialogue: The Torsions warp everything... Our memories, too. There must be some details that do not match up for the three of them.

Original: Mog:That young man's will is as bright as can be, kupo! I sure hope he'll join us!
Dialogue: That young man's will is as bright as can be, kupo! I sure hope he'll join us!

Original: Zack:Huh? What's that fluffy thing? And what's this about my will?
Dialogue: Huh? What's that fluffy thing? And what's this about my will?

Original: Mog:Kupo! How nice of you to ask, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo! How nice of you to ask, kupo!

Original: Mog:You see, this world is yada yada kupo kupo...
Dialogue: You see, this world is yada yada kupo kupo...

Original: Zack:...Seriously? Get out.
Dialogue: ...Seriously? Get out.

Original: Cloud:Tifa and I both ended up here that way.
Dialogue: Tifa and I both ended up here that way.

Original: Zack:Really... Good grief. Never a boring day in my life, huh?
Dialogue: Really... Good grief. Never a boring day in my life, huh?

Original: Zack:But hey, different world or not, I'm sure glad to see you again!
Dialogue: But hey, different world or not, I'm sure glad to see you again!

Original: Cloud:...Yeah, me too.
Dialogue: ...Yeah, me too.

Original: Zack:Uhhh, the fluffy guy... Mog, was it?
Dialogue: Uhhh, the fluffy guy... Mog, was it?

Original: Zack:Sign me up! A mission that takes me the world over sounds like a blast!
Dialogue: Sign me up! A mission that takes me the world over sounds like a blast!

Original: Mog:Kupo! Just the words I wanted to hear, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo! Just the words I wanted to hear, kupo!

Original: Cloud:I'm in your debt again. ...Sorry.
Dialogue: I'm in your debt again. ...Sorry.

Original: Zack:Hahaha! Don't be so standoffish! We're friends, right?
Dialogue: Hahaha! Don't be so standoffish! We're friends, right?

Original: Cloud:Thank you, Zack.
Dialogue: Thank you, Zack.

Original: Zack:Heh heh... No sweat!
Dialogue: Heh heh... No sweat!

Original: Zack:Okay, boys and girls, let's hit the road! Destination: Torsion! Woo, I'm all fired up!
Dialogue: Okay, boys and girls, let's hit the road! Destination Torsion! Woo, I'm all fired up!

Original: Mog:Kupo! Way to show those monsters who's boss, kupo!
Dialogue: Kupo! Way to show those monsters who's boss, kupo!

Original: Zack:Yeah! Let's keep it up!
Dialogue: Yeah! Let's keep it up!

Original: Rem:If only the weather would clear up, it would do a lot for our visibility...
Dialogue: If only the weather would clear up, it would do a lot for our visibility...

Original: Vaan:I've got nothing against the rain, but it's getting old real fast.
Dialogue: I've got nothing against the rain, but it's getting old real fast.

Original: Zack:Hey, what's with the whining, you two?
Dialogue: Hey, what's with the whining, you two?

Original: Zack:Oho? Well, would you look at that? A break in the clouds.
Dialogue: Oho? Well, would you look at that? A break in the clouds.

Original: Mog:Kupo! The sun's so bright, kupo! And warm!
Dialogue: Kupo! The sun's so bright, kupo! And warm!

Original: Tifa:Hard to believe it was pouring like that up till now...
Dialogue: Hard to believe it was pouring like that up till now...

Original: Zack:As long as you keep looking ahead, the rain's bound to clear sometime. It's only when you give up that you hit the end of the line.
Dialogue: As long as you keep looking ahead, the rain's bound to clear sometime. It's only when you give up that you hit the end of the line.

Original: Zack:Whatever happens, protect your honor! Turn to face your dreams, and keep heading right for them!
Dialogue: Whatever happens, protect your honor! Turn to face your dreams, and keep heading right for them!

Original: Rem:Right. We've been able to keep this up because we have dreams we want to see come true.
Dialogue: Right. We've been able to keep this up because we have dreams we want to see come true.

Original: Vaan:Zack's like your complete opposite, Cloud.
Dialogue: Zack's like your complete opposite, Cloud.

Original: Cloud:(...Don't even bring that up.)
Dialogue: (...Don't even bring that up.)

Original: Zack:You've got it all wrong, Vaan. He may look that way, but Cloud's got a real passion hidden deep down in there.
Dialogue: You've got it all wrong, Vaan. He may look that way, but Cloud's got a real passion hidden deep down in there.

Original: Zack:He might be kinda awkward, or anxious around people...but there's no mistaking he's a swell guy!
Dialogue: He might be kinda awkward, or anxious around people...but there's no mistaking he's a swell guy!

Original: Rem:Hehe... You two must be close.
Dialogue: Hehe... You two must be close.

Original: Cloud:...That's Zack for you.
Dialogue: ...That's Zack for you.

Original: Mog:I hope you'll motivate everyone with that positive attitude, kupo!
Dialogue: I hope you'll motivate everyone with that positive attitude, kupo!

Original: Zack:You don't need to tell me; I plan to!
Dialogue: You don't need to tell me; I plan to!

Original: Zack:We'll knock out anyone who stands in the way of our dreams, and protect this world! If we pull this off, we'll all be heroes!
Dialogue: We'll knock out anyone who stands in the way of our dreams, and protect this world! If we pull this off, we'll all be heroes!

Original: Vaan:Heroes, huh... It's got a nice ring to it when you say it.
Dialogue: Heroes, huh... It's got a nice ring to it when you say it.

Original: Cloud:Zack...you sure about this?
Dialogue: Zack...you sure about this?

Original: Zack:Of course! We put our heads together, we can do anything!
Dialogue: Of course! We put our heads together, we can do anything!

Original: Cloud:Yeah... I suppose you're right.
Dialogue: Yeah... I suppose you're right.

Original: Zack:Come on, Cloud. Don't give me a wimpy response like that.
Dialogue: Come on, Cloud. Don't give me a wimpy response like that.

Original: Zack:This is when you turn up the volume and shout, "Move out!" or something like that! Alright? Take two!
Dialogue: This is when you turn up the volume and shout, "Move out!" or something like that! Alright? Take two!

Original: Cloud:...If you say so.
Dialogue: ...If you say so.

Original: Cloud:Alright, everyone! Move out!
Dialogue: Alright, everyone! Move out!

Original: Zack:"Dear Mom and Dad, I don't know how, but I'm in a different world now. I'm doing fine, though." Hmm...
Dialogue: "Dear Mom and Dad, I don't know how, but I'm in a different world now. I'm doing fine, though." Hmm...

Original: Sazh:Hey, Zack. Whatcha up to all on your lonesome?
Dialogue: Hey, Zack. Whatcha up to all on your lonesome?

Original: Zack:I'm writing a letter to my folks back home.
Dialogue: I'm writing a letter to my folks back home.

Original: Yang:How splendid! That is quite admirable of you.
Dialogue: How splendid! That is quite admirable of you.

Original: Zack:I'm sure they're worried about me, so the least I can do is write them a letter to say what I've been up to lately.
Dialogue: I'm sure they're worried about me, so the least I can do is write them a letter to say what I've been up to lately.

Original: Zack:I lived there with my mom and dad. But I had a dream I wanted to make come true ever since I was a kid...
Dialogue: I lived there with my mom and dad. But I had a dream I wanted to make come true ever since I was a kid...

Original: Zack:So I left home when I was thirteen and haven't seen them since.
Dialogue: So I left home when I was thirteen and haven't seen them since.

Original: Sazh:I see... They must be worried sick. I know I would be if you were my son.
Dialogue: I see... They must be worried sick. I know I would be if you were my son.

Original: Yang:To know that their only son left home to make his dreams come true must be bittersweet for them.
Dialogue: To know that their only son left home to make his dreams come true must be bittersweet for them.

Original: Garnet:What was this dream of yours anyway?
Dialogue: What was this dream of yours anyway?

Original: Zack:Thanks for asking!
Dialogue: Thanks for asking!

Original: Zack:I wanted to make friends the world over and swim wherever I had to meet 'em!
Dialogue: I wanted to make friends the world over and swim wherever I had to meet 'em!

Original: Garnet:It is wonderful to have so many friends, isn't it?
Dialogue: It is wonderful to have so many friends, isn't it?

Original: Sazh:In a sense, you can say your dream came true. You've even got friends from different worlds now.
Dialogue: In a sense, you can say your dream came true. You've even got friends from different worlds now.

Original: Yang:I am certain your parents would be overjoyed to hear as much.
Dialogue: I am certain your parents would be overjoyed to hear as much.

Original: Zack:Then maybe you should write letters, too! Let them know how you're doing!
Dialogue: Then maybe you should write letters, too! Let them know how you're doing!

Original: Zack:Oh, there he is! Hey, Mog!
Dialogue: Oh, there he is! Hey, Mog!

Original: Mog:Yes, kupo?
Dialogue: Yes, kupo?

Original: Sazh:Could we ask you for a favor?
Dialogue: Could we ask you for a favor?

Original: Yang:Would you deliver these letters for us, Lord Mog?
Dialogue: Would you deliver these letters for us, Lord Mog?

Original: Mog:L-letters, kupo?
Dialogue: L-letters, kupo?

Original: Mog:Don't be ridiculous! I'm no delivery moogle, kupo!
Dialogue: Don't be ridiculous! I'm no delivery moogle, kupo!

Original: Zack:So you won't?
Dialogue: So you won't?

Original: Garnet:Oh, that's too bad... I suppose even moogles have their differences.
Dialogue: Oh, that's too bad... I suppose even moogles have their differences.

Original: Yang:Even though we wrote these letters, it seems there is no way to get them to their receivers...
Dialogue: Even though we wrote these letters, it seems there is no way to get them to their receivers...

Original: Zack:Hey now. What are you two so disappointed about?
Dialogue: Hey now. What are you two so disappointed about?

Original: Zack:This is all the more reason for us to get home on the double! If we make it back to our worlds, we can tell them ourselves.
Dialogue: This is all the more reason for us to get home on the double! If we make it back to our worlds, we can tell them ourselves.

Original: Yang:Indeed! You are most correct, Lord Zack!
Dialogue: Indeed! You are most correct, Lord Zack!

Original: Garnet:Hehe. I wrote something for Zidane, but I suppose I could just give it to him in person.
Dialogue: Hehe. I wrote something for Zidane, but I suppose I could just give it to him in person.

Original: Mog:That's a great idea, kupo! Now let's get moving so the rest of you can do the same!
Dialogue: That's a great idea, kupo! Now let's get moving so the rest of you can do the same!

Original: Cid:Argh! $#&%, it's cold! I'll freeze to death at this rate!
Dialogue: Argh! $#&%, it's cold! I'll freeze to death at this rate!

Original: Quistis:We all will if we don't find a way out soon.
Dialogue: We all will if we don't find a way out soon.

Original: Zack:Come on, guys! Let's keep moving! There's only forward to go when chasing a dream!
Dialogue: Come on, guys! Let's keep moving! There's only forward to go when chasing a dream!

Original: Seifer:Hmph. Even this weather can't cool him down...
Dialogue: Hmph. Even this weather can't cool him down...

Original: Tidus:How are you in such high spirits, Zack? Does the cold not affect you at all?
Dialogue: How are you in such high spirits, Zack? Does the cold not affect you at all?

Original: Zack:Hehe. Let me tell you my little secret.
Dialogue: Hehe. Let me tell you my little secret.

Original: Zack:This is how I'm keeping warm! One, two! One, two!
Dialogue: This is how I'm keeping warm! One, two! One, two!

Original: Zack:That's right! Why don't you all give it a try? You'll be warm in no time!
Dialogue: That's right! Why don't you all give it a try? You'll be warm in no time!

Original: Cid:Huff... I'm beat...
Dialogue: Huff... I'm beat...

Original: Quistis:I suppose I am warmer, but at what cost...
Dialogue: I suppose I am warmer, but at what cost...

Original: Zack:One, two! One, two! Don't tell me you two are done already!
Dialogue: One, two! One, two! Don't tell me you two are done already!

Original: Seifer:That all you got? I'm not going down that easy!
Dialogue: That all you got? I'm not going down that easy!

Original: Tidus:Ha! This is nothing! I'll show you how tough a pro athlete can be!
Dialogue: Ha! This is nothing! I'll show you how tough a pro athlete can be!

Original: Zack:That's it, Seifer! Tidus!
Dialogue: That's it, Seifer! Tidus!

Original: Zack:Alright! Now this is a real fight! The last one standing is the winner!
Dialogue: Alright! Now this is a real fight! The last one standing is the winner!

Original: Cid:Don't you knuckleheads come whining to me after you've got bigger muscles than brains.
Dialogue: Don't you knuckleheads come whining to me after you've got bigger muscles than brains.

Original: Quistis:There's not much we can do except wait it out. All three hate to lose...
Dialogue: There's not much we can do except wait it out. All three hate to lose...

Original: Lenna:Everyone, we've found a way out! Let's go!
Dialogue: Everyone, we've found a way out! Let's go!

Original: Zack:Just... Just give us a second...
Dialogue: Just... Just give us a second...

Original: Tidus:My legs are so sore... I can't walk...
Dialogue: My legs are so sore... I can't walk...

Original: Seifer:Don't...underestimate me... I'm just...getting started...
Dialogue: Don't...underestimate me... I'm just...getting started...

Original: Cid:See? I told you so.
Dialogue: See? I told you so.

Original: Quistis:There's no point in tiring yourself out before battle. You need to pace yourselves!
Dialogue: There's no point in tiring yourself out before battle. You need to pace yourselves!

Original: Tidus:...No comment.
Dialogue: ...No comment.

Original: Zack:Sorry for dragging you all into this.
Dialogue: Sorry for dragging you all into this.

Original: Zack:I take full responsibility, so let them take a break!
Dialogue: I take full responsibility, so let them take a break!

Original: Quistis:...I suppose as long as you've learned your lesson, all is forgiven.
Dialogue: ...I suppose as long as you've learned your lesson, all is forgiven.

Original: Raijin:Take this, ya know!
Dialogue: Take this, ya know!

Original: Vivi:You're amazing, Mr. Raijin!
Dialogue: You're amazing, Mr. Raijin!

Original: Raijin:Hehe, you're makin' me blush, ya know?
Dialogue: Hehe, you're makin' me blush, ya know?

Original: Raijin:I can't remember the last time anybody complimented me, ya know!
Dialogue: I can't remember the last time anybody complimented me, ya know!

Original: Vivi:It's really too bad if no one ever compliments you...
Dialogue: It's really too bad if no one ever compliments you...

Original: Raijin:Anytime you need me, just let me know, ya know!
Dialogue: Anytime you need me, just let me know, ya know!

Original: Raijin:I got a Mr. Raijin Special to help you clobber any problem, ya know!
Dialogue: I got a Mr. Raijin Special to help you clobber any problem, ya know!

Original: Fujin:DANGER!
Dialogue: DANGER!

Original: Raijin:That's a dirty trick, sneakin' up on a guy like that, ya know!
Dialogue: That's a dirty trick, sneakin' up on a guy like that, ya know!

Original: Fujin:STAND! FIGHT!
Dialogue: STAND! FIGHT!

Original: Vivi:We can do this, Mr. Raijin!
Dialogue: We can do this, Mr. Raijin!

Original: Raijin:Y-yeah, just gimme a sec, ya know?
Dialogue: Y-yeah, just gimme a sec, ya know?

Original: ???:You're safe now.
Dialogue: You're safe now.

Original: Raijin:Y-you! It can't be!
Dialogue: Y-you! It can't be!

Original: Raijin:...Do I know ya, ya know?
Dialogue: ...Do I know ya, ya know?

Original: Fujin:PRIORITY. BATTLE.
Dialogue: PRIORITY. BATTLE.

Original: ???:Yang! And Edge, too! I'm so relieved to see you again!
Dialogue: Yang! And Edge, too! I'm so relieved to see you again!

Original: Yang:I...um... Have we met...?
Dialogue: I...um... Have we met...?

Original: Edge:You know me, miss?
Dialogue: You know me, miss?

Original: Rydia:Hold on, what do you mean? It's me, Rydia.
Dialogue: Hold on, what do you mean? It's me, Rydia.

Original: Yang:C-could it be? The summoner Rydia!?
Dialogue: C-could it be? The summoner Rydia!?

Original: Rydia:Yes! Now you remember?
Dialogue: Yes! Now you remember?

Original: Yang:Goodness gracious... The Rydia I remember was but a child...
Dialogue: Goodness gracious... The Rydia I remember was but a child...

Original: Yang:The resemblance is more than passing, though... Hmmm...
Dialogue: The resemblance is more than passing, though... Hmmm...

Original: Edge:...Even if you say that... Argh, I can't believe I'd forget such a pretty face...
Dialogue: ...Even if you say that... Argh, I can't believe I'd forget such a pretty face...

Original: Onion Knight:It could be the Torsions at play. Let's get her caught up on what's going on first.
Dialogue: It could be the Torsions at play. Let's get her caught up on what's going on first.

Original: Serah:...In short, even friends from the same world could have memories well out of sync.
Dialogue: ...In short, even friends from the same world could have memories well out of sync.

Original: Rydia:I had no idea... So that's why you don't remember me...
Dialogue: I had no idea... So that's why you don't remember me...

Original: Edge:Don't make such a sad face! Aw, heck...how could I have forgotten...?
Dialogue: Don't make such a sad face! Aw, heck...how could I have forgotten...?

Original: Yang:Whilst we were traveling at sea, we met with an accident and you were lost to us.
Dialogue: Whilst we were traveling at sea, we met with an accident and you were lost to us.

Original: Yang:That is the last thing I can remember...
Dialogue: That is the last thing I can remember...

Original: Serah:But if you've grown up, does that mean you're from the future?
Dialogue: But if you've grown up, does that mean you're from the future?

Original: Rydia:No, I don't think the time I'm from is so different from everyone else.
Dialogue: No, I don't think the time I'm from is so different from everyone else.

Original: Rydia:Time passes more quickly in the Feymarch, so...
Dialogue: Time passes more quickly in the Feymarch, so...

Original: Onion Knight:You grew up in the blink of an eye?
Dialogue: You grew up in the blink of an eye?

Original: Rydia:Yup, that's about it!
Dialogue: Yup, that's about it!

Original: Rydia:If so many other worlds are in danger, could this be what she meant?
Dialogue: If so many other worlds are in danger, could this be what she meant?

Original: Serah:You'll help us out, won't you?
Dialogue: You'll help us out, won't you?

Original: Rydia:Of course! Let's face this fate together.
Dialogue: Of course! Let's face this fate together.

Original: Edge:Yeah! More than just a beauty, you got pep to boot! I like your style, Rydia!
Dialogue: Yeah! More than just a beauty, you got pep to boot! I like your style, Rydia!

Original: Rydia:Edge hasn't changed at all... What a relief.
Dialogue: Edge hasn't changed at all... What a relief.

Original: Galuf:It's still hard to believe you were a child until recently.
Dialogue: It's still hard to believe you were a child until recently.

Original: Galuf:You're clearly a grown woman now.
Dialogue: You're clearly a grown woman now.

Original: Bartz:I guess people drifted here from all different times...
Dialogue: I guess people drifted here from all different times...

Original: Galuf:What's the matter, Bartz?
Dialogue: What's the matter, Bartz?

Original: Bartz:It's nothing. I was just thinking about how interesting the flow of time is.
Dialogue: It's nothing. I was just thinking about how interesting the flow of time is.

Original: Eiko:This is so annoying!
Dialogue: This is so annoying!

Original: Eiko:Just how rude can they be!?
Dialogue: Just how rude can they be!?

Original: Rydia:What's the matter, Eiko? You seem upset.
Dialogue: What's the matter, Eiko? You seem upset.

Original: Eiko:Zidane still treats me like a child! Doesn't he know I'm a lady!?
Dialogue: Zidane still treats me like a child! Doesn't he know I'm a lady!?

Original: Eiko:And then Edgar said something about it being a crime.
Dialogue: And then Edgar said something about it being a crime.

Original: Eiko:And to top it all off, Seifer called me a little brat! Grr! I can't take it anymore!
Dialogue: And to top it all off, Seifer called me a little brat! Grr! I can't take it anymore!

Original: Cloud:...Are they wrong?
Dialogue: ...Are they wrong?

Original: Eiko:What'd you say!?
Dialogue: What'd you say!?

Original: Bartz:Right! If you do, you'll grow up in the blink of an eye!
Dialogue: Right! If you do, you'll grow up in the blink of an eye!

Original: Eiko:Hmm... It definitely sounds interesting...
Dialogue: Hmm... It definitely sounds interesting...

Original: Eiko:Hey, Rydia. What's the Feymarch like?
Dialogue: Hey, Rydia. What's the Feymarch like?

Original: Rydia:Everyone coexists in peace there. The eidolons manageshops, and there's a hugelibrarywith all sorts of books!
Dialogue: Everyone coexists in peace there. The eidolons manage shops, and there's a huge library with all sorts of books!

Original: Eiko:Wow! That's wonderful!
Dialogue: Wow! That's wonderful!

Original: Eiko:A place where everyone is friends and I can become a lady like Rydia sounds like a dream come true!
Dialogue: A place where everyone is friends and I can become a lady like Rydia sounds like a dream come true!

Original: Irvine:But, you know, if the passage of time is faster there...
Dialogue: But, you know, if the passage of time is faster there...

Original: Irvine:You could become an old lady before you know it if you're not careful.
Dialogue: You could become an old lady before you know it if you're not careful.

Original: Eiko:Wh-what!? I don't want that...
Dialogue: Wh-what!? I don't want that...

Original: Galuf:Ho ho! There's wisdom you can only gain from experience. But it takes time, and there's no helping that.
Dialogue: Ho ho! There's wisdom you can only gain from experience. But it takes time, and there's no helping that.

Original: Eiko:Nooo! I'm not ready to be old yet! My life's just begun...
Dialogue: Nooo! I'm not ready to be old yet! My life's just begun...

Original: Bartz:No matter what you look like, Eiko, you're still you. Just leave things to the flow of time.
Dialogue: No matter what you look like, Eiko, you're still you. Just leave things to the flow of time.

Original: Balthier:Those two seem to have hit it off. Summoners must have a lot in common.
Dialogue: Those two seem to have hit it off. Summoners must have a lot in common.

Original: Tidus:I get the feeling Yuna and Rydia aren't all that alike. Fun to have another smiling face, though.
Dialogue: I get the feeling Yuna and Rydia aren't all that alike. Fun to have another smiling face, though.

Original: Tidus:Seymour!!
Dialogue: Seymour!!

Original: Balthier:Another sudden entrance. ...Can we help you?
Dialogue: Another sudden entrance. ...Can we help you?

Original: Seymour:You needn't look so frightening...
Dialogue: You needn't look so frightening...

Original: Seymour:I simply came to speak with this young woman.
Dialogue: I simply came to speak with this young woman.

Original: Rydia:Huh? Me?
Dialogue: Huh? Me?

Original: Seymour:Yes. There is something I must know.
Dialogue: Yes. There is something I must know.

Original: Seymour:Why you travel with the one who killed your mother.
Dialogue: Why you travel with the one who killed your mother.

Original: Yuna:...Killed Rydia's mother!?
Dialogue: ...Killed Rydia's mother!?

Original: Tidus:Who do you think here is gonna buy your lies, Seymour!
Dialogue: Who do you think here is gonna buy your lies, Seymour!

Original: Balthier:Is that your idea of a joke?
Dialogue: Is that your idea of a joke?

Original: Cecil:...Alas, it is not.
Dialogue: ...Alas, it is not.

Original: Cecil:Although I was unaware at the time, I am the one responsible for Rydia's mother's...
Dialogue: Although I was unaware at the time, I am the one responsible for Rydia's mother's...

Original: Yuna:It can't be true...
Dialogue: It can't be true...

Original: Seymour:Hatred and grief are never ending. I know too well how you feel.
Dialogue: Hatred and grief are never ending. I know too well how you feel.

Original: Seymour:For that reason alone, I find your actions difficult to comprehend.
Dialogue: For that reason alone, I find your actions difficult to comprehend.

Original: Seymour:Will you not seek revenge while it is in your power to claim it?
Dialogue: Will you not seek revenge while it is in your power to claim it?

Original: Rydia:...I can't say I understand it well, but one thing I do know...
Dialogue: ...I can't say I understand it well, but one thing I do know...

Original: Rydia:Revenge can't change the past.
Dialogue: Revenge can't change the past.

Original: Rydia:I can't wallow in my pity forever! I decided for myself that I would fill the role I was meant to.
Dialogue: I can't wallow in my pity forever! I decided for myself that I would fill the role I was meant to.

Original: Seymour:How truly wretched... You would try to whitewash a bloodstained past with pretty words?
Dialogue: How truly wretched... You would try to whitewash a bloodstained past with pretty words?

Original: Tidus:Would you shut up, already! What's so wrong with choosing to move forward!
Dialogue: Would you shut up, already! What's so wrong with choosing to move forward!

Original: Balthier:It strikes me as far more constructive than going in circles as you're bound by the past.
Dialogue: It strikes me as far more constructive than going in circles as you're bound by the past.

Original: Seymour:It does not seem as though we will be able to understand each other. I wasted my time...
Dialogue: It does not seem as though we will be able to understand each other. I wasted my time...

Original: Tidus:Ahhh! I can't stand that creep! Rydia, forget everything he said!
Dialogue: Ahhh! I can't stand that creep! Rydia, forget everything he said!

Original: Rydia:Don't worry; I'm fine. Though...
Dialogue: Don't worry; I'm fine. Though...

Original: Cecil:Rydia... I am so terribly sorry for the pain I have caused you...
Dialogue: Rydia... I am so terribly sorry for the pain I have caused you...

Original: Rydia:You don't need to apologize to me anymore, Cecil. Come on, look at me.
Dialogue: You don't need to apologize to me anymore, Cecil. Come on, look at me.

Original: Rydia:Your feelings came through to me, loud and clear.
Dialogue: Your feelings came through to me, loud and clear.

Original: Balthier:As a fellow man of the sky, let me give you some advice.
Dialogue: As a fellow man of the sky, let me give you some advice.

Original: Balthier:...Don't dwell too much on the past...
Dialogue: ...Don't dwell too much on the past...

Original: Rydia:Don't worry. Cecil has it in him to carry on. I know him!
Dialogue: Don't worry. Cecil has it in him to carry on. I know him!

Original: Cecil:...My thanks.
Dialogue: ...My thanks.

Original: Edge:Wow! It was no match for you, Edge!
Dialogue: Wow! It was no match for you, Edge!

Original: Edge:Do you get it, Rydia? This is the way we fight in this world.
Dialogue: Do you get it, Rydia? This is the way we fight in this world.

Original: Rydia:I see...
Dialogue: I see...

Original: Layle:Edge has been in high spirits ever since Rydia arrived.
Dialogue: Edge has been in high spirits ever since Rydia arrived.

Original: Krile:I've never seen him so excited...
Dialogue: I've never seen him so excited...

Original: Laguna:Well, I understand how he feels. He wants to show her his good side...
Dialogue: Well, I understand how he feels. He wants to show her his good side...

Original: Edge:No monster is a match for my blade.
Dialogue: No monster is a match for my blade.

Original: Edge:So there's no need to worry!
Dialogue: So there's no need to worry!

Original: Edge:I'll go on ahead. Follow me, everyone!
Dialogue: I'll go on ahead. Follow me, everyone!

Original: Rydia:That's enough! There's no need to rush. Don't you know how to look before you leap?
Dialogue: That's enough! There's no need to rush. Don't you know how to look before you leap?

Original: Edge:Wh-what's that!? We'll be just fine!
Dialogue: Wh-what's that!? We'll be just fine!

Original: Edge:Now what, Layle?
Dialogue: Now what, Layle?

Original: Layle:It's nothing, really. Just that you're such an open book.
Dialogue: It's nothing, really. Just that you're such an open book.

Original: Layle:You want to protect those close to you.
Dialogue: You want to protect those close to you.

Original: Layle:But it's impressive how you've got such a selfish prince under your thumb, Rydia.
Dialogue: But it's impressive how you've got such a selfish prince under your thumb, Rydia.

Original: Edge:You're just like the old man!
Dialogue: You're just like the old man!

Original: Krile:Old man? You mean my grandfather?
Dialogue: Old man? You mean my grandfather?

Original: Cecil:No, he doesn't mean Galuf.
Dialogue: No, he doesn't mean Galuf.

Original: Krile:Were Edge and Cid like this back home, too?
Dialogue: Were Edge and Cid like this back home, too?

Original: Laguna:I'll bet! I can just imagine Edge getting excited like this, and Rydia getting mad at him.
Dialogue: I'll bet! I can just imagine Edge getting excited like this, and Rydia getting mad at him.

Original: Cecil:Haha. Indeed.
Dialogue: Haha. Indeed.

Original: Edge:Th-that's enough out of you!
Dialogue: Th-that's enough out of you!

Original: Rydia:You need to calm down, too, Edge.
Dialogue: You need to calm down, too, Edge.

Original: Edge:R-right. Sorry, Rydia...
Dialogue: R-right. Sorry, Rydia...

Original: Laguna:Did you see that, Layle?
Dialogue: Did you see that, Layle?

Original: Layle:Yeah, but I thought I was hallucinating for a second. I didn't think that selfish prince knew the word "sorry."
Dialogue: Yeah, but I thought I was hallucinating for a second. I didn't think that selfish prince knew the word "sorry."

Original: Edge:H-hey! Don't you know you should respect your elders?
Dialogue: H-hey! Don't you know you should respect your elders?

Original: Layle:You're right. I forgot you were older than me.
Dialogue: You're right. I forgot you were older than me.

Original: Laguna:Haha! That just means you've got a long way to go before you're mature as me, Edge!
Dialogue: Haha! That just means you've got a long way to go before you're mature as me, Edge!

Original: Krile:Hehe. Everyone gets along so well.
Dialogue: Hehe. Everyone gets along so well.

Original: Cecil:Edge hasn't changed one bit, has he?
Dialogue: Edge hasn't changed one bit, has he?

Original: Cecil:Though he's supposed to have regained some of his memories, he still continues to support me...
Dialogue: Though he's supposed to have regained some of his memories, he still continues to support me...

Original: Rydia:I know. I heard about it from Edge.
Dialogue: I know. I heard about it from Edge.

Original: Rydia:He said he wasn't going to let you shoulder all of this alone.
Dialogue: He said he wasn't going to let you shoulder all of this alone.

Original: Rydia:And I couldn't agree more.
Dialogue: And I couldn't agree more.

Original: Cecil:...I am blessed to have such wonderful allies. Thank you, Rydia.
Dialogue: ...I am blessed to have such wonderful allies. Thank you, Rydia.

Original: Rydia:Please don't forget to thank Edge. We're all here for you, Cecil.
Dialogue: Please don't forget to thank Edge. We're all here for you, Cecil.

Original: Yuffie:Hey, those monster sounds were coming from this way, right?
Dialogue: Hey, those monster sounds were coming from this way, right?

Original: Yuffie:Uh-oh! Hurry it up, guys!
Dialogue: Uh-oh! Hurry it up, guys!

Original: Wakka:Take it easy, Yuffie! Running in headlong on your own won't do no good, ya?
Dialogue: Take it easy, Yuffie! Running in headlong on your own won't do no good, ya?

Original: Rem:Oh no! That girl is surrounded!
Dialogue: Oh no! That girl is surrounded!

Original: Wakka:...Aw, geez! We gotta hurry!
Dialogue: ...Aw, geez! We gotta hurry!

Original: Yuffie:That's what I've been saying!
Dialogue: That's what I've been saying!

Original: Lamia:Grrr... Hisss!
Dialogue: Grrr... Hisss!

Original: Lamia:Grrr... Hisss!
Dialogue: Grrr... Hisss!

Original: Rem:Did you just...beat all those monsters by yourself!?
Dialogue: Did you just...beat all those monsters by yourself!?

Original: ???:It would appear that way, wouldn't it?
Dialogue: It would appear that way, wouldn't it?

Original: Wakka:All at once, too! That's some trick!
Dialogue: All at once, too! That's some trick!

Original: Yuffie:Even I can tell, you're something else!
Dialogue: Even I can tell, you're something else!

Original: ???:...Are you from around here?
Dialogue: ...Are you from around here?

Original: Rem:No, we're traveling together.
Dialogue: No, we're traveling together.

Original: ???:Hm. The same as me, then.
Dialogue: Hm. The same as me, then.

Original: Wakka:You're traveling alone!? Even with all these monsters!?
Dialogue: You're traveling alone!? Even with all these monsters!?

Original: Yuffie:If you're asking us, that means you ain't from around here either.
Dialogue: If you're asking us, that means you ain't from around here either.

Original: ???:I have tread my fair share of foreign lands.
Dialogue: I have tread my fair share of foreign lands.

Original: Wakka:That doesn't make it any safer. Why don't you come with us?
Dialogue: That doesn't make it any safer. Why don't you come with us?

Original: ???:Are you asking me out? Regardless, I will have to pass.
Dialogue: Are you asking me out? Regardless, I will have to pass.

Original: ???:I haven't the time to fraternize with strangers.
Dialogue: I haven't the time to fraternize with strangers.

Original: ???:...Furthermore, I have mine own companions.
Dialogue: ...Furthermore, I have mine own companions.

Original: ???:Should we meet again, though, let us work together at that time.
Dialogue: Should we meet again, though, let us work together at that time.

Original: Yuffie:Ah, well... There she goes. Bummer.
Dialogue: Ah, well... There she goes. Bummer.

Original: Lilisette:Huh? You defeated them all already?
Dialogue: Huh? You defeated them all already?

Original: Wakka:Nope. We didn't do a thing.
Dialogue: Nope. We didn't do a thing.

Original: Rem:There was a girl surrounded by monsters who effortlessly beat them all with both magic and her sword.
Dialogue: There was a girl surrounded by monsters who effortlessly beat them all with both magic and her sword.

Original: Yuffie:Man, I coulda taken it easy with her on our team...
Dialogue: Man, I coulda taken it easy with her on our team...

Original: Lilisette:Is that so...? With all the amazing companions I've met, I shouldn't be surprised to meet another.
Dialogue: Is that so...? With all the amazing companions I've met, I shouldn't be surprised to meet another.

Original: Lilisette:But I'm really curious if she's impressed all of you this much.
Dialogue: But I'm really curious if she's impressed all of you this much.

Original: ???:...Ungh! I let my guard down.
Dialogue: ...Ungh! I let my guard down.

Original: Thancred:That'll be enough of that now.
Dialogue: That'll be enough of that now.

Original: ???:...You have my thanks, Thancred. You've saved me again.
Dialogue: ...You have my thanks, Thancred. You've saved me again.

Original: Thancred:Is that... Lady Alisaie!?
Dialogue: Is that... Lady Alisaie!?

Original: Zidane:Here I was expecting a tough-as-nails warrior woman, but if it isn't a pretty little lady!
Dialogue: Here I was expecting a tough-as-nails warrior woman, but if it isn't a pretty little lady!

Original: Jecht:So this is the kid with the amazing sword and magic powers?
Dialogue: So this is the kid with the amazing sword and magic powers?

Original: Thancred:No, Yuffie and the others must have meant someone else. This is
Dialogue: No, Yuffie and the others must have meant someone else. This is—

Original: Alisaie:My name is Alisaie. I am a companion of Thancred.
Dialogue: My name is Alisaie. I am a companion of Thancred.

Original: Alisaie:And I suppose you are companions of those whom I met earlier.
Dialogue: And I suppose you are companions of those whom I met earlier.

Original: Jecht:Yup, if you're the one Yuffie was going on about.
Dialogue: Yup, if you're the one Yuffie was going on about.

Original: Zidane:...Nasty attack. Maybe I spoke too soon about the tough-as-nails part.
Dialogue: ...Nasty attack. Maybe I spoke too soon about the tough-as-nails part.

Original: Yda:I never imagined we'd run into you here, though. It's such a relief to know you're safe, Lady Alisaie.
Dialogue: I never imagined we'd run into you here, though. It's such a relief to know you're safe, Lady Alisaie.

Original: Yda:Hm? Yes? Y'shtola and Papalymo are here, too, you know!
Dialogue: Hm? Yes? Y'shtola and Papalymo are here, too, you know!

Original: Alisaie:I-I see...
Dialogue: I-I see...

Original: Alisaie:At any rate, I am also glad to see you all hale.
Dialogue: At any rate, I am also glad to see you all hale.

Original: Alisaie:But more importantly...please stop with the "Lady Alisaie."
Dialogue: But more importantly...please stop with the "Lady Alisaie."

Original: Yda:...If you insist. Then..."Miss" Alisaie?
Dialogue: ...If you insist. Then..."Miss" Alisaie?

Original: Alisaie:That is just as much a mouthful. "Alisaie" alone will be fine, thank you.
Dialogue: That is just as much a mouthful. "Alisaie" alone will be fine, thank you.

Original: Yda:Alrighty! Alisaie it is!
Dialogue: Alrighty! Alisaie it is!

Original: Alisaie:So, I understand you're on a journey. Would you mind explaining to me of what sort?
Dialogue: So, I understand you're on a journey. Would you mind explaining to me of what sort?

Original: Zidane:...And that's how it is. Was that too much all at once?
Dialogue: ...And that's how it is. Was that too much all at once?

Original: Alisaie:Thank you. I believe I have the gist of it.
Dialogue: Thank you. I believe I have the gist of it.

Original: Alisaie:Though equal parts may have escaped my grasp.
Dialogue: Though equal parts may have escaped my grasp.

Original: Alisaie:In short, if we do not act, our own world will be in grave danger as well, yes?
Dialogue: In short, if we do not act, our own world will be in grave danger as well, yes?

Original: Alisaie:Although I declined your offer once for mine own convenience, would you still let me join you?
Dialogue: Although I declined your offer once for mine own convenience, would you still let me join you?

Original: Jecht:I don't see why not.
Dialogue: I don't see why not.

Original: Alisaie:Haha, how easily I am accepted.
Dialogue: Haha, how easily I am accepted.

Original: Jecht:You're pals with Yda, right? Ain't that good enough?
Dialogue: You're pals with Yda, right? Ain't that good enough?

Original: Mog:Let's give a warm welcome to another warrior who shares our will, kupo!
Dialogue: Let's give a warm welcome to another warrior who shares our will, kupo!

Original: Alisaie:Another warrior... Thancred and Yda, you two also share this will?
Dialogue: Another warrior... Thancred and Yda, you two also share this will?

Original: Thancred:You could say that.
Dialogue: You could say that.

Original: Alisaie:It has a nice ring to it.
Dialogue: It has a nice ring to it.

Original: Thancred:I'd say so.
Dialogue: I'd say so.

Original: Alisaie:Very well. It is my pleasure to share it, too.
Dialogue: Very well. It is my pleasure to share it, too.

Original: Alisaie:......
Serah:Is something off?
Dialogue: Is something off?

Original: Alisaie:...It is. I cannot shake this peculiar feeling.
Dialogue: ...It is. I cannot shake this peculiar feeling.

Original: Alisaie:But if I were forced to put a point on it, I sense I am the one who is out of step.
Dialogue: But if I were forced to put a point on it, I sense I am the one who is out of step.

Original: Lilisette:It's a common occurrence in this world.
Dialogue: It's a common occurrence in this world.

Original: Alisaie:Then I can assume the two of you have this sense as well?
Dialogue: Then I can assume the two of you have this sense as well?

Original: Serah:Yup, though I've gotten used to it...
Dialogue: Yup, though I've gotten used to it...

Original: Serah:You think Alisaie comes from a different time from the others?
Dialogue: You think Alisaie comes from a different time from the others?

Original: Lilisette:You think? Probably the past, or the future...
Dialogue: You think? Probably the past, or the future...
