Original: Alisaie:...I see. So that's normal in this realm.
Dialogue: ...I see. So that's normal in this realm.

Original: Alisaie:Phew... It boggles the mind.
Dialogue: Phew... It boggles the mind.

Original: Lilisette:Hmmm, "normal" might not be quite it, but I guess it's good enough.
Dialogue: Hmmm, "normal" might not be quite it, but I guess it's good enough.

Original: Serah:Right. My sister here is from the past...
Dialogue: Right. My sister here is from the past...

Original: Serah:But she's still my sister.
Dialogue: But she's still my sister.

Original: Alisaie:I can go along with that.
Dialogue: I can go along with that.

Original: Alisaie:There may be discrepancies in our memories, but it doesn't change my trust in them.
Dialogue: There may be discrepancies in our memories, but it doesn't change my trust in them.

Original: Serah:They're a reliable bunch.
Dialogue: They're a reliable bunch.

Original: Alisaie:And in its own way, this might be the more fortunate realm...
Dialogue: And in its own way, this might be the more fortunate realm...

Original: Serah:...I've thought the same at times. It's a happier place than the future I'm from...
Dialogue: ...I've thought the same at times. It's a happier place than the future I'm from...

Original: Alisaie:I see... And yet... No, let us leave off these thoughts.
Dialogue: I see... And yet... No, let us leave off these thoughts.

Original: Lightning:Serah, here you are. This is how you'll end up separated from the rest of us.
Dialogue: Serah, here you are. This is how you'll end up separated from the rest of us.

Original: Serah:Oh, give it a rest, Sis.
Dialogue: Oh, give it a rest, Sis.

Original: Alisaie:Haha, how reliable.
Dialogue: Haha, how reliable.

Original: Serah:She's always been like this.
Dialogue: She's always been like this.

Original: Alisaie:Well, let's be on our way before we worry your sister any further.
Dialogue: Well, let's be on our way before we worry your sister any further.

Original: Prishe:You guys really will get lost if you just run around willy-nilly.
Dialogue: You guys really will get lost if you just run around willy-nilly.

Original: Shantotto:Hearing that from you somehow strikes me as rather silly.
Dialogue: Hearing that from you somehow strikes me as rather silly.

Original: Irvine:You're quite the fighter, Alisaie.
Dialogue: You're quite the fighter, Alisaie.

Original: Alisaie:You think so?
Dialogue: You think so?

Original: Irvine:Sure do! You can hold your own in battle no matter the distance.
Dialogue: Sure do! You can hold your own in battle no matter the distance.

Original: Edge:...Though I could learn a thing or two from you about a smooth transition.
Dialogue: ...Though I could learn a thing or two from you about a smooth transition.

Original: Alisaie:It's important to know how to fight in close and ranged combat with this power.
Dialogue: It's important to know how to fight in close and ranged combat with this power.

Original: Alisaie:Both my magic and aetherial sword grow stronger when combining different types of swordplay.
Dialogue: Both my magic and aetherial sword grow stronger when combining different types of swordplay.

Original: Irvine:You mean you can get even more powerful?
Dialogue: You mean you can get even more powerful?

Original: Alisaie:I wonder!
Dialogue: I wonder!

Original: Vivi:That's amazing. You're so cool, Miss Alisaie!
Dialogue: That's amazing. You're so cool, Miss Alisaie!

Original: Alisaie:Thank you.
Dialogue: Thank you.

Original: Vivi:Hehe, you mean it?
Dialogue: Hehe, you mean it?

Original: Yda:To be honest, I'm impressed you've made it this far, Alisaie!
Dialogue: To be honest, I'm impressed you've made it this far, Alisaie!

Original: Alisaie:Are you implying that I have not been able to fight until now?
Dialogue: Are you implying that I have not been able to fight until now?

Original: Yda:Wh-what!? No, of course not...!
Dialogue: Wh-what!? No, of course not...!

Original: Alisaie:I jest, Yda. I understand what you mean.
Dialogue: I jest, Yda. I understand what you mean.

Original: Alisaie:And you're right. I am far stronger in battle than I used to be.
Dialogue: And you're right. I am far stronger in battle than I used to be.

Original: Yda:Yes. Did you see how surprised Thancred was?
Dialogue: Yes. Did you see how surprised Thancred was?

Original: Edge:The rest of us can't even imagine an Alisaie who can't fight.
Dialogue: The rest of us can't even imagine an Alisaie who can't fight.

Original: Alisaie:I couldn't bear always relying on others.
Dialogue: I couldn't bear always relying on others.

Original: Alisaie:To know the truth, I needed only the power to face it.
Dialogue: To know the truth, I needed only the power to face it.

Original: Alisaie:I hope I've grown enough not to be a burden on others now.
Dialogue: I hope I've grown enough not to be a burden on others now.

Original: Irvine:That's the path you chose. Maybe it was the only path you could choose...
Dialogue: That's the path you chose. Maybe it was the only path you could choose...

Original: Irvine:I understand.
Dialogue: I understand.

Original: Vivi:I want to be as cool as you some day, Miss Alisaie!
Dialogue: I want to be as cool as you some day, Miss Alisaie!

Original: Edge:If that's the case, watch and learn! I'm not afraid to face my fate, whatever it may be!
Dialogue: If that's the case, watch and learn! I'm not afraid to face my fate, whatever it may be!

Original: Vivi:Okay! I want to learn how to be strong like you, too, Mister Edge!
Dialogue: Okay! I want to learn how to be strong like you, too, Mister Edge!

Original: Edge:Haha, I'm gonna blush! Now then, let's get going!
Dialogue: Haha, I'm gonna blush! Now then, let's get going!

Original: Yda:The power to face one's fate...
Dialogue: The power to face one's fate...

Original: Yuffie:...Something's fishy.
Dialogue: ...Something's fishy.

Original: Layle:What's that supposed to mean?
Dialogue: What's that supposed to mean?

Original: Yuffie:Did you notice that Alisaie is always carrying a book?
Dialogue: Did you notice that Alisaie is always carrying a book?

Original: Layle:Huh? ...Yeah, now that you mention it, she does.
Dialogue: Huh? ...Yeah, now that you mention it, she does.

Original: Cyan:Perhaps it is a tome dear to her heart. I myself am very partial to books.
Dialogue: Perhaps it is a tome dear to her heart. I myself am very partial to books.

Original: Yang:It is moving to see such studious youths.
Dialogue: It is moving to see such studious youths.

Original: Yuffie:So you all know the book! She seems so attached to it, I can't help but be curious!
Dialogue: So you all know the book! She seems so attached to it, I can't help but be curious!

Original: Cyan:Has it sparked thy interest in reading, Lady Yuffie? This is joyous news.
Dialogue: Has it sparked thy interest in reading, Lady Yuffie? This is joyous news.

Original: Yuffie:No! The only interest I have in that book is its price!
Dialogue: No! The only interest I have in that book is its price!

Original: Layle:And you want our help with this?
Dialogue: And you want our help with this?

Original: Yuffie:That's right. I want you to help me find out more about the book.
Dialogue: That's right. I want you to help me find out more about the book.

Original: Yuffie:That should be no problem for you, right, Layle?
Dialogue: That should be no problem for you, right, Layle?

Original: Layle:What an audacious request. I refuse.
Dialogue: What an audacious request. I refuse.

Original: Yuffie:Wh-what!? But why!? Aren't you interested?
Dialogue: Wh-what!? But why!? Aren't you interested?

Original: Layle:If you're so determined, why not just ask her yourself?
Dialogue: If you're so determined, why not just ask her yourself?

Original: Alisaie:Is there something you want to ask me?
Dialogue: Is there something you want to ask me?

Original: Yuffie:No no no no no! Nothing at all!
Dialogue: No no no no no! Nothing at all!

Original: Alisaie:I overheard everything. You're interested in my grimoire, are you not?
Dialogue: I overheard everything. You're interested in my grimoire, are you not?

Original: Yuffie:Umm... Well... Y-yeah, I guess I am...
Dialogue: Umm... Well... Y-yeah, I guess I am...

Original: Yuffie:But how could I not be? You're always carrying it around like some precious treasure!
Dialogue: But how could I not be? You're always carrying it around like some precious treasure!

Original: Alisaie:But I don't know if it's very valuable otherwise.
Dialogue: But I don't know if it's very valuable otherwise.

Original: Yuffie:I see... A specially made book...
Dialogue: I see... A specially made book...

Original: Yang:You understand now, do you not? This book is not something we can lay a hand on...
Dialogue: You understand now, do you not? This book is not something we can lay a hand on...

Original: Yuffie:I get it! It's a very special book that she got from her family!
Dialogue: I get it! It's a very special book that she got from her family!

Original: Yuffie:Even I understand the value of something like that...
Dialogue: Even I understand the value of something like that...

Original: Layle:Well, that's a relief.
Dialogue: Well, that's a relief.

Original: Yuffie:But still! You wouldn't want to lose it, right? I can hold onto it for you if you want!
Dialogue: But still! You wouldn't want to lose it, right? I can hold onto it for you if you want!

Original: Alisaie:You're worried about me? I sincerely appreciate it.
Dialogue: You're worried about me? I sincerely appreciate it.

Original: Cyan:But something that precious must be kept safe by its owner and no one else.
Dialogue: But something that precious must be kept safe by its owner and no one else.

Original: Yang:Now that that is settled, shall we be on our way?
Dialogue: Now that that is settled, shall we be on our way?

Original: Alisaie:How nice it is to have such friendly allies. This will certainly keep things interesting.
Dialogue: How nice it is to have such friendly allies. This will certainly keep things interesting.

Original: Eiko:We've never gone this way before! I can't wait!
Dialogue: We've never gone this way before! I can't wait!

Original: Yuri:Yeah, who knows what we'll find!
Dialogue: Yeah, who knows what we'll find!

Original: Chelinka:Oh, Yuri. You're such a child, getting all worked up the moment you hear, "explore."
Dialogue: Oh, Yuri. You're such a child, getting all worked up the moment you hear, "explore."

Original: Yuri:Aw, don't act like you're the grown-up. We're twins, aren't we?
Dialogue: Aw, don't act like you're the grown-up. We're twins, aren't we?

Original: Yuri:You're the one tagging along because you wanted to explore, too.
Dialogue: You're the one tagging along because you wanted to explore, too.

Original: Chelinka:I-I'm just worried about the rest of you...
Dialogue: I-I'm just worried about the rest of you...

Original: Vivi:Wa-wah! A monster!
Dialogue: Wa-wah! A monster!

Original: Yuri:This, uh...doesn't look good.
Dialogue: This, uh...doesn't look good.

Original: ???:You okay!?
Dialogue: You okay!?

Original: Chelinka:When did he?
Dialogue: When did he—?

Original: ???:I'll handle this! You run!
Dialogue: I'll handle this! You run!

Original: Vivi:Wait! We'll help!
Dialogue: Wait! We'll help!

Original: ???:This isn't a job for kids!
Dialogue: This isn't a job for kids!

Original: Eiko:But we're surrounded!
Dialogue: But we're surrounded!

Original: Yuri:We'll take care of these guys! Mister, back us up over there!
Dialogue: We'll take care of these guys! Mister, back us up over there!
...Got it!

Original: Vivi:Thanks a lot, Mister!
Dialogue: Thanks a lot, Mister!

Original: Eiko:You were strong, but what'd you think of my magic?
Dialogue: You were strong, but what'd you think of my magic?

Original: ???:So that was magic after all.
Dialogue: So that was magic after all.

Original: Eiko:Huh? Weren't you watching?
Dialogue: Huh? Weren't you watching?

Original: Vivi:Is something wrong?
Dialogue: Is something wrong?

Original: ???:Well, using magic isn't really normal, you know.
Dialogue: Well, using magic isn't really normal, you know.

Original: ???:Man... What have I gotten myself into?
Dialogue: Man... What have I gotten myself into?

Original: Noctis:I guess that means it wasn't a dream...
Dialogue: I guess that means it wasn't a dream...

Original: Hope:You're the one who helped our friends?
Dialogue: You're the one who helped our friends?

Original: Hope:Thank you very much.
Dialogue: Thank you very much.

Original: Noctis:I'm not sure they needed it. Those battle-hardened kids are something else.
Dialogue: I'm not sure they needed it. Those battle-hardened kids are something else.

Original: Zell:Kids have to fight sometimes in their worlds.
Dialogue: Kids have to fight sometimes in their worlds.

Original: Noctis:"Their worlds"?
Dialogue: "Their worlds"?

Original: Balthier:Indeed. You've stumbled into a junction of sorts, connecting multiple worlds to each other.
Dialogue: Indeed. You've stumbled into a junction of sorts, connecting multiple worlds to each other.

Original: Zell:We've got folks from all over.
Dialogue: We've got folks from all over.

Original: Noctis:I wonder if anyone I know is here, too.
Dialogue: I wonder if anyone I know is here, too.

Original: Zell:I don't think we've run into anyone else with your fashion sense...
Dialogue: I don't think we've run into anyone else with your fashion sense...

Original: Balthier:Thus spake Zell. You may be out of luck.
Dialogue: Thus spake Zell. You may be out of luck.

Original: Noctis:All on my own, huh...
Dialogue: All on my own, huh...

Original: Faris:...We all started out in the same boat as you, summoned here without warning.
Dialogue: ...We all started out in the same boat as you, summoned here without warning.

Original: Faris:But after learning of the disturbances affecting this world, we're fighting to end them before they affect ours.
Dialogue: But after learning of the disturbances affecting this world, we're fighting to end them before they affect ours.

Original: Faris:Would you be willing to fight alongside us?
Dialogue: Would you be willing to fight alongside us?

Original: Hope:We've never seen anyone with your fighting style. If you'd lend us a hand, we'd be able to cope with that much more.
Dialogue: We've never seen anyone with your fighting style. If you'd lend us a hand, we'd be able to cope with that much more.

Original: Zell:Our clothes are kinda similar, but I don't think our worlds are. Let us hear about where you're from!
Dialogue: Our clothes are kinda similar, but I don't think our worlds are. Let us hear about where you're from!

Original: Noctis:Sure, why not?
Dialogue: Sure, why not?

Original: Balthier:Appreciate the quick conclusion.
Dialogue: Appreciate the quick conclusion.

Original: Noctis:Well, you asked.
Dialogue: Well, you asked.

Original: Prishe:Alright! Another one bites the dust!
Dialogue: Alright! Another one bites the dust!

Original: Noctis:I wonder how many of us that'll feed.
Dialogue: I wonder how many of us that'll feed.

Original: Tifa:You eat monsters, too!?
Dialogue: You eat monsters, too!?

Original: Snow:Is that edible?
Dialogue: Is that edible?

Original: Noctis:Yeah, it's a behemoth, isn't it? You can pick it up at the store. I eat it now and then.
Dialogue: Yeah, it's a behemoth, isn't it? You can pick it up at the store. I eat it now and then.

Original: Prishe:Right!? It's delish!
Dialogue: Right!? It's delish!

Original: Penelo:It may come as a surprise, but it's a luxury foodstuff.
Dialogue: It may come as a surprise, but it's a luxury foodstuff.

Original: Steiner:Sir Noctis, are you well versed in preparing monster cuisine?
Dialogue: Sir Noctis, are you well versed in preparing monster cuisine?

Original: Noctis:I've never actually made it myself.
Dialogue: I've never actually made it myself.

Original: Snow:All this food talk is making me hungry.
Dialogue: All this food talk is making me hungry.

Original: Prishe:C'mon, let's go cook something up!
Dialogue: C'mon, let's go cook something up!

Original: Penelo:How about fish? There's a river nearby.
Dialogue: How about fish? There's a river nearby.

Original: Tifa:Yeah, I'd prefer that than monster.
Dialogue: Yeah, I'd prefer that than monster.

Original: Steiner:Agreed. It will be easier to prepare dishes we're familiar with.
Dialogue: Agreed. It will be easier to prepare dishes we're familiar with.

Original: Prishe:Oh ho, gonna catch us a big one?
Dialogue: Oh ho, gonna catch us a big one?

Original: Noctis:You bet! One lunker coming right up!
Dialogue: You bet! One lunker coming right up!

Original: Tifa:If you're that confident, then I won't mind asking you for one, too.
Dialogue: If you're that confident, then I won't mind asking you for one, too.

Original: Prishe:Noctis, teach me how you do it! I wanna hook my own!
Dialogue: Noctis, teach me how you do it! I wanna hook my own!

Original: Snow:I'll come, too. Sounds like you're gonna need help carrying back this haul.
Dialogue: I'll come, too. Sounds like you're gonna need help carrying back this haul.

Original: Noctis:You can call me Noct. Let's do it.
Dialogue: You can call me Noct. Let's do it.

Original: Wakka:Hey, Noct. You okay?
Dialogue: Hey, Noct. You okay?

Original: Noct:I'm fine. Sorry about getting in the way of your attack.
Dialogue: I'm fine. Sorry about getting in the way of your attack.

Original: Sabin:Did something happen?
Dialogue: Did something happen?

Original: Yang:They pursued an enemy that escaped me and nearly collided with each other. My apologies for being so careless.
Dialogue: They pursued an enemy that escaped me and nearly collided with each other. My apologies for being so careless.

Original: Sazh:These things happen in a fight, especially when fighting close-range.
Dialogue: These things happen in a fight, especially when fighting close-range.

Original: Sabin:Perhaps you were just tired. Why don't we head back?
Dialogue: Perhaps you were just tired. Why don't we head back?

Original: Yang:You make a good point. Let us end our search here for today.
Dialogue: You make a good point. Let us end our search here for today.

Original: Sabin:Did the enemy make any strange movements in battle?
Dialogue: Did the enemy make any strange movements in battle?

Original: Noct:No. Our timing was just off...
Dialogue: No. Our timing was just off...

Original: Noct:Back home, I didn't pay much attention to what my friends were doing in battle.
Dialogue: Back home, I didn't pay much attention to what my friends were doing in battle.

Original: Noct:They would just match my style... But here, I have to change the way I fight.
Dialogue: They would just match my style... But here, I have to change the way I fight.

Original: Sabin:It's nice to hear you taking this seriously.
Dialogue: It's nice to hear you taking this seriously.

Original: Noct:...Would you mind training with me?
Dialogue: ...Would you mind training with me?

Original: Sabin:I'd like nothing better! Should I call the others?
Dialogue: I'd like nothing better! Should I call the others?

Original: Noct:Nah. I'd like to go one-on-one with you for now.
Dialogue: Nah. I'd like to go one-on-one with you for now.

Original: Sabin:Are you sure? No doubt my brother would have a thing or two to teach you.
Dialogue: Are you sure? No doubt my brother would have a thing or two to teach you.

Original: Noct:I'd...prefer if you didn't tell the others about this.
Dialogue: I'd...prefer if you didn't tell the others about this.

Original: Sabin:Haha! If you insist. It will be our secret.
Dialogue: Haha! If you insist. It will be our secret.

Original: Noct:Seems like you guys are good friends.
Dialogue: Seems like you guys are good friends.

Original: Yuri:Galuf is Krile's grandfather.
Dialogue: Galuf is Krile's grandfather.

Original: Noct:That makes sense. Seeing you reminded me of afamily friendand hisgranddaughter.
Dialogue: That makes sense. Seeing you reminded me of a family friend and his granddaughter.

Original: Laguna:Must be nice having such a happy family! What's your secret?
Dialogue: Must be nice having such a happy family! What's your secret?

Original: Krile:Being left behind once and never wanting to be apart again.
Dialogue: Being left behind once and never wanting to be apart again.

Original: Yuri:Did that happen?
Dialogue: Did that happen?

Original: Yuri:...You must have been so lonely.
Dialogue: ...You must have been so lonely.

Original: Krile:I was...
Dialogue: I was...

Original: Krile:My grandfather decided on his own that he wanted to protect everyone, so he left all by himself.
Dialogue: My grandfather decided on his own that he wanted to protect everyone, so he left all by himself.

Original: Krile:I was so sad and alone...
Dialogue: I was so sad and alone...

Original: Krile:That's why I'm so happy we can be together now!
Dialogue: That's why I'm so happy we can be together now!

Original: Yuri:I know how you feel. It's nice to be with family, isn't it?
Dialogue: I know how you feel. It's nice to be with family, isn't it?

Original: Noct:...Yeah. It is.
Dialogue: ...Yeah. It is.

Original: Laguna:Well, you have to forgive Galuf.
Dialogue: Well, you have to forgive Galuf.

Original: Laguna:I'm sure he had his reasons for going off alone.
Dialogue: I'm sure he had his reasons for going off alone.

Original: Yuri:But maybe she could have helped.
Dialogue: But maybe she could have helped.

Original: Galuf:No. I couldn't let her get involved in such a dangerous affair.
Dialogue: No. I couldn't let her get involved in such a dangerous affair.

Original: Yuri:Why not?
Dialogue: Why not?

Original: Yuri:You could have at least talked to her about it...
Dialogue: You could have at least talked to her about it...

Original: Galuf:We had a mission to fulfill, and I did not want to expose my family to danger.
Dialogue: We had a mission to fulfill, and I did not want to expose my family to danger.

Original: Edge:But I understand how Yuri feels. It's painful to be left behind.
Dialogue: But I understand how Yuri feels. It's painful to be left behind.

Original: Laguna:Still, having someone waiting for you will keep hope alive
Dialogue: Still, having someone waiting for you will keep hope alive—

Original: Laguna:Hope that you can one day return safe and sound to that person.
Dialogue: Hope that you can one day return safe and sound to that person.

Original: Yuri:...You don't understand how it feels to be the one left behind.
Dialogue: ...You don't understand how it feels to be the one left behind.

Original: Yuri:It's so lonesome without your family around...
Dialogue: It's so lonesome without your family around...

Original: Laguna:But the one who leaves has every intention of coming back.
Dialogue: But the one who leaves has every intention of coming back.

Original: Laguna:And they leave those precious to them behind so they have something to look forward to when coming home.
Dialogue: And they leave those precious to them behind so they have something to look forward to when coming home.

Original: Laguna:If they bring their beloved child with them, they'll constantly worry about protecting them.
Dialogue: If they bring their beloved child with them, they'll constantly worry about protecting them.

Original: Laguna:That's why they leave them in a safe place.
Dialogue: That's why they leave them in a safe place.

Original: Yuri:I see...
Dialogue: I see...

Original: Yuri:I understand how it feels to fight to protect something...
Dialogue: I understand how it feels to fight to protect something...

Original: Krile:That's why you can't just leave without saying anything!
Dialogue: That's why you can't just leave without saying anything!

Original: Galuf:Ho ho! You want to scare me into it?
Dialogue: Ho ho! You want to scare me into it?

Original: Noct:I know how you feel, when circumstances don't let you say what you're thinking.
Dialogue: I know how you feel, when circumstances don't let you say what you're thinking.

Original: Yuri:Yeah... Protecting something's a reason...
Dialogue: Yeah... Protecting something's a reason...

Original: Noct:...But it's still better to say so.
Dialogue: ...But it's still better to say so.

Original: Yuri:Hehe. Thanks, Noct.
Dialogue: Hehe. Thanks, Noct.

Original: ???:There're no cities or buildings in sight! Not even train tracks! I really stepped in it this time.
Dialogue: There're no cities or buildings in sight! Not even train tracks! I really stepped in it this time.

Original: ???:...Huh? What's that sound?
Dialogue: ...Huh? What's that sound?

Original: ???:Ahhh! An airship! Alright!
Dialogue: Ahhh! An airship! Alright!

Original: ???:I'll hitch a ride with them! Yeah, that's the ticket!
Dialogue: I'll hitch a ride with them! Yeah, that's the ticket!

Original: ???:Wait up! I said waaait!
Dialogue: Wait up! I said waaait!

Original: Kain:...Did you hear someone just now?
Dialogue: ...Did you hear someone just now?

Original: Zack:Yeah... It sounded like a girl shouting, "Waaait!"
Dialogue: Yeah... It sounded like a girl shouting, "Waaait!"

Original: Squall:You're imagining things. We're all the way up here.
Dialogue: You're imagining things. We're all the way up here.

Original: Zack:Naw, I definitely heard it! She must have a really high voice. ...Get it?
Dialogue: Naw, I definitely heard it! She must have a really high voice. ...Get it?

Original: Squall:(Oh, brother.)
Dialogue: (Oh, brother.)

Original: Zell:Hmm... It did sound kind of familiar, though.
Dialogue: Hmm... It did sound kind of familiar, though.

Original: ???:Wait up, already! C'mon!
Dialogue: Wait up, already! C'mon!

Original: Zack:See! We're not just hearing things!
Dialogue: See! We're not just hearing things!

Original: Kain:Is that...a girl?
Dialogue: Is that...a girl?

Original: Vaan:Hey, guys!
Dialogue: Hey, guys!

Original: Vaan:Someone's been chasing after us yelling things. Anyone know who it is?
Dialogue: Someone's been chasing after us yelling things. Anyone know who it is?

Original: Zell:Who would chase after an airship? Let me have a look.
Dialogue: Who would chase after an airship? Let me have a look.

Original: ???:Heeey! Give me a lift!
Dialogue: Heeey! Give me a lift!

Original: Zell:Waugh! Her!? Hey, Squall!
Dialogue: Waugh! Her!? Hey, Squall!

Original: Squall:Yeah... Vaan, could you ask them to touch down for a moment?
Dialogue: Yeah... Vaan, could you ask them to touch down for a moment?

Original: Kain:Hm. Not an enemy then.
Dialogue: Hm. Not an enemy then.

Original: Squall:(Brace yourself... Things are about to get noisy.)
Dialogue: (Brace yourself... Things are about to get noisy.)

Original: ???:Whee-ooo! You guys saved my life! And who'da thunk Squall and ya'll would be aboard, too!?
Dialogue: Whee-ooo! You guys saved my life! And who'da thunk Squall and ya'll would be aboard, too!?

Original: Irvine:Who'da thunk you'd be chasing after us? Right, Squall?
Dialogue: Who'da thunk you'd be chasing after us? Right, Squall?

Original: Squall:I don't know how you thought anyone would hear you... Crazy as ever.
Dialogue: I don't know how you thought anyone would hear you... Crazy as ever.

Original: ???:That's it? You're not surprised to see me?
Dialogue: That's it? You're not surprised to see me?

Original: Irvine:Selphie, let me introduce you. This little lady is Eiko, and the fella in armor is Cecil.
Dialogue: Selphie, let me introduce you. This little lady is Eiko, and the fella in armor is Cecil.

Original: Selphie:Wow! Nice horn! It's so cute!
Dialogue: Wow! Nice horn! It's so cute!

Original: Eiko:Oh, you think so? Hehe...you have good taste!
Dialogue: Oh, you think so? Hehe...you have good taste!

Original: Selphie:And your armor's really cool, man! You think I could try it on?
Dialogue: And your armor's really cool, man! You think I could try it on?

Original: Selphie:Isn't it super heavy!? Ah! Don't tell meyou're on a diet! I bet the pounds just melt off in that!
Dialogue: Isn't it super heavy!? Ah! Don't tell me—you're on a diet! I bet the pounds just melt off in that!

Original: Cecil:No...this...is simply standard equipment in my world...
Dialogue: No...this...is simply standard equipment in my world...

Original: Squall:You don't have to humor her. This is just how she is.
Dialogue: You don't have to humor her. This is just how she is.

Original: Eiko:Cheerful and fun! I can tell you're a nice person! Say, let's go play over there!
Dialogue: Cheerful and fun! I can tell you're a nice person! Say, let's go play over there!

Original: Laguna:Heyo! There's a new recruit? Introduce me, too!
Dialogue: Heyo! There's a new recruit? Introduce me, too!

Original: Selphie:Get out! Sir Laguna's here, too!? And he's young! It's that Sir Laguna!
Dialogue: Get out! Sir Laguna's here, too!? And he's young! It's that Sir Laguna!

Original: Selphie:My hero! I've missed you!
Dialogue: My hero! I've missed you!

Original: Laguna:Whoa! What the!? Is this the dream thing again!? Or the movie thing this time!?
Dialogue: Whoa! What the—!? Is this the dream thing again!? Or the movie thing this time!?

Original: Squall:I could've guessed this would happen... I hope she doesn't say anything she shouldn't...
Dialogue: I could've guessed this would happen... I hope she doesn't say anything she shouldn't...

Original: Irvine:Leave it to me. I'll make sure she understands.
Dialogue: Leave it to me. I'll make sure she understands.

Original: Irvine:Selphie, let's chat, eh? I've got something real important to tell you.
Dialogue: Selphie, let's chat, eh? I've got something real important to tell you.

Original: Selphie:So you two are classmates! It's no wonder you dress alike.
Dialogue: So you two are classmates! It's no wonder you dress alike.

Original: Deuce:We both attendAkademeia, where we learn how to fight and use magic. Students there are calledAgito cadets.
Dialogue: We both attend Akademeia, where we learn how to fight and use magic. Students there are called Agito cadets.

Original: Ace:As the war worsened, cadets like us were sent to the front lines. But the academy's main purpose is education...or so they say.
Dialogue: As the war worsened, cadets like us were sent to the front lines. But the academy's main purpose is education...or so they say.

Original: Selphie:So you're fighters and students, then.
Dialogue: So you're fighters and students, then.

Original: Irvine:Well, you're in good company!
Dialogue: Well, you're in good company!

Original: Selphie:Mmhmm! So tell me, what's your school festival like?
Dialogue: Mmhmm! So tell me, what's your school festival like?

Original: Selphie:Y-you mean...you don't have one!?
Dialogue: Y-you mean...you don't have one!?

Original: Selphie:But school festivals are so much fun! The students scheme up all sorts of events and PAAAH-TAY!
Dialogue: But school festivals are so much fun! The students scheme up all sorts of events and PAAAH-TAY!

Original: Selphie:I was on the committee that planned the festival. Or at least...something like it, right?
Dialogue: I was on the committee that planned the festival. Or at least...something like it, right?

Original: Irvine:Yeah. It was more like a concert, but you still did a great job putting it all together!
Dialogue: Yeah. It was more like a concert, but you still did a great job putting it all together!

Original: Deuce:It sounds wonderful. Maybe we could do one, too!
Dialogue: It sounds wonderful. Maybe we could do one, too!

Original: Selphie:That's the spirit! You need to live it up while you're young!
Dialogue: That's the spirit! You need to live it up while you're young!

Original: Selphie:I know! Why don't we have a school festival here? It'll be super fun with schools from different worlds!
Dialogue: I know! Why don't we have a school festival here? It'll be super fun with schools from different worlds!

Original: Irvine:Great idea, Selphie. Count me in!
Dialogue: Great idea, Selphie. Count me in!

Original: Ace:...So what exactly should we do?
Dialogue: ...So what exactly should we do?

Original: Selphie:Hmm... Good question.
Dialogue: Hmm... Good question.

Original: Selphie:Deuce can put on a flute concert, and Ace can do a magic show with his cards!
Dialogue: Deuce can put on a flute concert, and Ace can do a magic show with his cards!

Original: Deuce:Alright! I won't let you down!
Dialogue: Alright! I won't let you down!

Original: Ace:A magic show? Is that different from using normal magic...? Do I use magic to...entertain people...?
Dialogue: A magic show? Is that different from using normal magic...? Do I use magic to...entertain people...?

Original: Irvine:I think we need a few more acts. Is there anyone else we can ask?
Dialogue: I think we need a few more acts. Is there anyone else we can ask?

Original: Lilisette:It looks like you guys are having fun over here! What's going on?
Dialogue: It looks like you guys are having fun over here! What's going on?

Original: Selphie:Lilisette! Celes! You're just in time!
Dialogue: Lilisette! Celes! You're just in time!

Original: Selphie:We were talking about finding more acts for our school festival.
Dialogue: We were talking about finding more acts for our school festival.

Original: Selphie:You'll dance in our show, won't you, Lilisette?
Dialogue: You'll dance in our show, won't you, Lilisette?

Original: Lilisette:But of course! It's what I'm best at! I'll show you the grace of Troupe Mayakov!
Dialogue: But of course! It's what I'm best at! I'll show you the grace of Troupe Mayakov!

Original: Irvine:And Celes will sing!
Dialogue: And Celes will sing!

Original: Selphie:You're an opera singer, aren't you? That's what Setzer said.
Dialogue: You're an opera singer, aren't you? That's what Setzer said.

Original: Celes:That no good...!
Dialogue: That no good...!

Original: Selphie:Then it's decided! Let's do our best to make this the greatest school festival ever! ...After we beat the baddies, of course!
Dialogue: Then it's decided! Let's do our best to make this the greatest school festival ever! ...After we beat the baddies, of course!

Original: Laguna:Haha. It's nice to see them having so much fun. Well, you're only young once!
Dialogue: Haha. It's nice to see them having so much fun. Well, you're only young once!

Original: Sazh:That so? I can't imagine two old men like us ever being young...
Dialogue: That so? I can't imagine two old men like us ever being young...

Original: Selphie:Wow. These ruins are really...ruined.
Dialogue: Wow. These ruins are really...ruined.

Original: Quistis:Indeed... It's hard to get around with all this rubble.
Dialogue: Indeed... It's hard to get around with all this rubble.

Original: Firion:I can't help but remember myhometown, burnt to the ground by theempire. If we don't save this world, the others may share its fate...
Dialogue: I can't help but remember my hometown, burnt to the ground by the empire. If we don't save this world, the others may share its fate...

Original: Cait Sith:Hey there! What's got you all looking so gloomy?
Dialogue: Hey there! What's got you all looking so gloomy?

Original: Cait Sith:This journey's supposed to be full of smiles! C'mon now, turn those frowns upside down!
Dialogue: This journey's supposed to be full of smiles! C'mon now, turn those frowns upside down!

Original: Selphie:...Hey, Cait Sith, there's something I've been meaning to tell you.
Dialogue: ...Hey, Cait Sith, there's something I've been meaning to tell you.

Original: Cait Sith:What's that? I'm all ears!
Dialogue: What's that? I'm all ears!

Original: Selphie:You really remind me of my friends back home!
Dialogue: You really remind me of my friends back home!

Original: Cait Sith:Oh? That so!?
Dialogue: Oh? That so!?

Original: Selphie:Yeah! I'm fromTrabia, a cold and snowy place in myhome world. Even still, everyone's so warm and friendly there.
Dialogue: Yeah! I'm from Trabia, a cold and snowy place in my home world. Even still, everyone's so warm and friendly there.

Original: Lion:So Cait Sith's upbeat personality reminds you of home?
Dialogue: So Cait Sith's upbeat personality reminds you of home?

Original: Selphie:Not just that. I think he's got the same way of speaking, too! It's like we're old friends!
Dialogue: Not just that. I think he's got the same way of speaking, too! It's like we're old friends!

Original: Cait Sith:Happy to hear you think so, Selphie! I do my best to keep a smile on everyone's face!
Dialogue: Happy to hear you think so, Selphie! I do my best to keep a smile on everyone's face!

Original: Quistis:That certainly is kind of you.
Dialogue: That certainly is kind of you.

Original: Cait Sith:Think nothin' of it! It puts a smile on my face just bein' here with you all.
Dialogue: Think nothin' of it! It puts a smile on my face just bein' here with you all.

Original: Cait Sith:I hope we can become your warm and friendly home away from home, Selphie.
Dialogue: I hope we can become your warm and friendly home away from home, Selphie.

Original: Selphie:Thanks! I feel better already!
Dialogue: Thanks! I feel better already!

Original: Cait Sith:No thanks necessary! We're like family now!
Dialogue: No thanks necessary! We're like family now!

Original: Firion:Can a way of speaking really bring people so close...?
Dialogue: Can a way of speaking really bring people so close...?

Original: Wakka:You bet. And these two are birds of a feather. They can befriend anyone in a heartbeat.
Dialogue: You bet. And these two are birds of a feather. They can befriend anyone in a heartbeat.

Original: Lion:It's fascinating to see such similarities between people from completely different worlds!
Dialogue: It's fascinating to see such similarities between people from completely different worlds!

Original: Selphie:You got that right! It's super-duper neato!
Dialogue: You got that right! It's super-duper neato!

Original: Selphie:I feel lucky to know such friendly people in my home world and here, too!
Dialogue: I feel lucky to know such friendly people in my home world and here, too!

Original: Cait Sith:But they had such a serious job to do, they didn't have time to think about smilin'. So I decided to help 'em with that!
Dialogue: But they had such a serious job to do, they didn't have time to think about smilin'. So I decided to help 'em with that!

Original: Selphie:That's wonderful, Cait Sith! I'm sure that, together, we can spread smiles around the whole world!
Dialogue: That's wonderful, Cait Sith! I'm sure that, together, we can spread smiles around the whole world!

Original: Lion:...You sure are ambitious.
Dialogue: ...You sure are ambitious.

Original: Quistis:It can't be helped... Think of it as a good thing.
Dialogue: It can't be helped... Think of it as a good thing.

Original: Wakka:Selphie's got the right idea. We need to keep our heads up. We can't keep looking back.
Dialogue: Selphie's got the right idea. We need to keep our heads up. We can't keep looking back.

Original: Firion:Agreed. I must learn to look on the bright side, or risk forever being lost in dark thoughts about my home...
Dialogue: Agreed. I must learn to look on the bright side, or risk forever being lost in dark thoughts about my home...

Original: Cait Sith:Alrighty then! How 'bout we start by loosening up the way you talk?
Dialogue: Alrighty then! How 'bout we start by loosening up the way you talk?

Original: Selphie:With me and Cait Sith as your teachers, you'll be talking friendly in no time. Booyaka!
Dialogue: With me and Cait Sith as your teachers, you'll be talking friendly in no time. Booyaka!

Original: Firion:Haha... Perhaps we can begin lessons next time...
Dialogue: Haha... Perhaps we can begin lessons next time...

Original: Serah:What's up, Sis? You said you wanted to talk.
Dialogue: What's up, Sis? You said you wanted to talk.

Original: Lightning:Yeah. It might be nothing, but...
Dialogue: Yeah. It might be nothing, but...

Original: Lightning:It seems there's a secret code going around lately. Do you know anything about it?
Dialogue: It seems there's a secret code going around lately. Do you know anything about it?

Original: Lightning:I overheard Palom and Vivi using it earlier...
Dialogue: I overheard Palom and Vivi using it earlier...

Original: Palom:Booyaka, Vivi! Let's go practice your magic!
Dialogue: Booyaka, Vivi! Let's go practice your magic!

Original: Vivi:Booyaka! Thanks, Palom!
Dialogue: Booyaka! Thanks, Palom!

Original: Serah:...So you noticed, too. Actually, just a little while ago...
Dialogue: ...So you noticed, too. Actually, just a little while ago...

Original: Zack:Booyaka! Aerith, Cloud, would you get this?
Dialogue: Booyaka! Aerith, Cloud, would you get this?

Original: Lightning:What on earth is..."booyaka"?
Dialogue: What on earth is..."booyaka"?

Original: Serah:Sorry, but I don't know either. Maybe it's some other world's vocabulary.
Dialogue: Sorry, but I don't know either. Maybe it's some other world's vocabulary.

Original: Selphie:Booyaka! What's shaking, you two?
Dialogue: Booyaka! What's shaking, you two?

Original: Serah:Selphie... Can you tell us what "booyaka" means?
Dialogue: Selphie... Can you tell us what "booyaka" means?

Original: Selphie:Oho! How good of you to ask! It's a greeting I made up!
Dialogue: Oho! How good of you to ask! It's a greeting I made up!

Original: Selphie:I couldn't quite get it to catch on in my world, but everyone here's got the spirit!
Dialogue: I couldn't quite get it to catch on in my world, but everyone here's got the spirit!

Original: Lightning:...What does it mean?
Dialogue: ...What does it mean?

Original: Selphie:Cute, right?
Dialogue: Cute, right?

Original: Lightning:We're not...communicating...!
Dialogue: We're not...communicating...!

Original: Selphie:Feel free to use it as much as you can! Later! Booyaka!
Dialogue: Feel free to use it as much as you can! Later! Booyaka!

Original: Lightning:I can't take any more of this...
Dialogue: I can't take any more of this...

Original: Lightning:Serah! Not you, too!
Dialogue: Serah! Not you, too!

Original: Serah:Sis...I kinda like it! It's catchy!
Dialogue: Sis...I kinda like it! It's catchy!

Original: Serah:Booyaka! Hahaha, I gotta share this with Snow.
Dialogue: Booyaka! Hahaha, I gotta share this with Snow.

Original: Lightning:W-wait! Serah!
Dialogue: W-wait! Serah!

Original: Lightning:Serah... Why does it look like you're enjoying this...?
Dialogue: Serah... Why does it look like you're enjoying this...?

Original: Lightning:Or are you just trying to enjoy your time in this world...? Maybe I ought to follow her example...
Dialogue: Or are you just trying to enjoy your time in this world...? Maybe I ought to follow her example...

Original: ???:And yet...what a revolting development this is.
Dialogue: And yet...what a revolting development this is.

Original: ???:Even I, who has traipsed across countless dimensions, find this place yucky...
Dialogue: Even I, who has traipsed across countless dimensions, find this place yucky...

Original: ???:...What might Bartz, that spry, old fellow, and their merry band be up to about now?
Dialogue: ...What might Bartz, that spry, old fellow, and their merry band be up to about now?

Original: ???:Oh, my! Have we an exit before us!?
Dialogue: Oh, my! Have we an exit before us!?

Original: ???:This time we shall arrive in some space more respectable-like!
Dialogue: This time we shall arrive in some space more respectable-like!

Original: Mog:Kupo! What's a Torsion doing here, kupo?
Dialogue: Kupo! What's a Torsion doing here, kupo?

Original: Faris:There aren't many monsters about... Just a wee Torsion, I suppose.
Dialogue: There aren't many monsters about... Just a wee Torsion, I suppose.

Original: Mog:A Torsion is still a Torsion, kupo! Let's get in there and close it, kupo!
Dialogue: A Torsion is still a Torsion, kupo! Let's get in there and close it, kupo!

Original: ???:Whaaat iiin the!?
Dialogue: Whaaat iiin the—!?

Original: Gilgamesh:What ho! If it isn't Bartz! Then this must be...
Dialogue: What ho! If it isn't Bartz! Then this must be...

Original: Gilgamesh:...... ......
Firion:You...we fought you in the World of Illusions. If you came out of there, then that means...
Dialogue: You...we fought you in the World of Illusions. If you came out of there, then that means...

Original: Mog:You're the Torsion's master, kupo!?
Dialogue: You're the Torsion's master, kupo!?

Original: Gilgamesh:Fwa!? I haven't the faintest of what's going on, but you wish to cross blades!?
Dialogue: Fwa!? I haven't the faintest of what's going on, but you wish to cross blades!?

Original: Gilgamesh:Hah hah hah! Very well!
Dialogue: Hah hah hah! Very well!

Original: Gilgamesh:The me before you now is in prime condition! Three on one! Bring it!
Dialogue: The me before you now is in prime condition! Three on one! Bring it!

Original: Bartz:...I don't know what's going on either, but okay!
Dialogue: ...I don't know what's going on either, but okay!

Original: Gilgamesh:Arrrgh! You beat me agaaain!
Dialogue: Arrrgh! You beat me agaaain!

Original: Vaan:Hey, the Torsion isn't closing.
Dialogue: Hey, the Torsion isn't closing.

Original: Mog:Kupo!? Then the Torsion isn't his, kupo!?
Dialogue: Kupo!? Then the Torsion isn't his, kupo!?

Original: Squall:...What a waste of time.
Dialogue: ...What a waste of time.

Original: Bartz:Sorry about that Gilgamesh. So why are you here?
Dialogue: Sorry about that Gilgamesh. So why are you here?

Original: Gilgamesh:Why wouldn't I be? There was an exit, and I took it!
Dialogue: Why wouldn't I be? There was an exit, and I took it!

Original: Vaan:You were lost?
Dialogue: You were lost?

Original: Gilgamesh:I was not lost! I was wandering! As suits Gilgamesh, the wandering swordsman!
Dialogue: I was not lost! I was wandering! As suits Gilgamesh, the wandering swordsman!

Original: Serah:Bartz, this guy's from your world...right?
Dialogue: Bartz, this guy's from your world...right?

Original: Gilgamesh:Let us not discuss myformer employer. I am now a vagabond, roaming the expanse of theRift.
Dialogue: Let us not discuss my former employer. I am now a vagabond, roaming the expanse of the Rift.

Original: Squall:Why do you ask?
Dialogue: Why do you ask?

Original: Bartz:Huh? You all know Gilgamesh?
Dialogue: Huh? You all know Gilgamesh?

Original: Gilgamesh:I don't know you!
Dialogue: I don't know you!

Original: Squall:Just a passing resemblance...?
Dialogue: Just a passing resemblance...?

Original: Gilgamesh:Mayhaps we have met, but so long has been my journey, many a detail have I forgotten!
Dialogue: Mayhaps we have met, but so long has been my journey, many a detail have I forgotten!

Original: Mog:You've been wandering between dimensions without the need of Torsions? How unusual, kupo...
Dialogue: You've been wandering between dimensions without the need of Torsions? How unusual, kupo...

Original: Bartz:Anyway, Gilgamesh hasn't done anything wrong. Should we get back to closing the Torsion?
Dialogue: Anyway, Gilgamesh hasn't done anything wrong. Should we get back to closing the Torsion?

Original: Serah:Right, we can't leave it open.
Dialogue: Right, we can't leave it open.

Original: Squall:Our memories of back home aren't spot on in this world either... No point dwelling on it.
Dialogue: Our memories of back home aren't spot on in this world either... No point dwelling on it.

Original: Gilgamesh:Hey! You're going already!? Then I shall lend you my aid!
Dialogue: Hey! You're going already!? Then I shall lend you my aid!

Original: Gilgamesh:You say we have met... What kind of a jerk would I be if I let acquaintances risk their lives!?
Dialogue: You say we have met... What kind of a jerk would I be if I let acquaintances risk their lives!?

Original: Vaan:Sure you just don't want to be lost and alone again?
Dialogue: Sure you just don't want to be lost and alone again?

Original: Gilgamesh:I'm not lost! Nor am I letting your last memory of me be my humiliating defeat!
Dialogue: I'm not lost! Nor am I letting your last memory of me be my humiliating defeat!

Original: Bartz:Is it alright if he comes along?
Dialogue: Is it alright if he comes along?

Original: Mog:He's strong and doesn't seem like a bad guy. I don't see why not, kupo.
Dialogue: He's strong and doesn't seem like a bad guy. I don't see why not, kupo.

Original: Gilgamesh:Then it is decided! You won't regret this!
Dialogue: Then it is decided! You won't regret this!

Original: Gilgamesh:Alright! Consider my honor regained!
Dialogue: Alright! Consider my honor regained!

Original: Bartz:You were a big help. Sorry about the mixup earlier.
Dialogue: You were a big help. Sorry about the mixup earlier.

Original: Gilgamesh:Think nothing of it! You and I are buds, are we not!?
Dialogue: Think nothing of it! You and I are buds, are we not!?

Original: Galuf:Your skills haven't dulled at all either.
Dialogue: Your skills haven't dulled at all either.

Original: Gilgamesh:Of course not! I have been continually sharpening them!
Dialogue: Of course not! I have been continually sharpening them!

Original: Gilgamesh:I am heartened to see you in good health, old man. As for me, I must return to my journey.
Dialogue: I am heartened to see you in good health, old man. As for me, I must return to my journey.

Original: Mog:Kupo!? You won't stay with us, kupo?
Dialogue: Kupo!? You won't stay with us, kupo?

Original: Gilgamesh:Saving the world simply doesn't suit a wandering swordsman.
Dialogue: Saving the world simply doesn't suit a wandering swordsman.

Original: Vivi:Are you really gonna go, Mister?
Dialogue: Are you really gonna go, Mister?

Original: Vanille:Would you look at that? Even the kids like you despite that scary face of yours.
Dialogue: Would you look at that? Even the kids like you despite that scary face of yours.

Original: Gilgamesh:Ulp... Do not look at me with those eyes! I might get emotional!
Dialogue: Ulp... Do not look at me with those eyes! I might get emotional!

Original: Vivi:I'm worried about you... I don't want you to get lost and feel lonely again.
Dialogue: I'm worried about you... I don't want you to get lost and feel lonely again.

Original: Bartz:We were also washed up here away from home and are wandering just the same.
Dialogue: We were also washed up here away from home and are wandering just the same.

Original: Gilgamesh:Ho ho... Well, if you insist!
Dialogue: Ho ho... Well, if you insist!

Original: Gilgamesh:Moogle! Take this!
Dialogue: Moogle! Take this!

Original: Mog:Kupo! These are...dimensional coordinates, kupo?
Dialogue: Kupo! These are...dimensional coordinates, kupo?

Original: Gilgamesh:My journey has no destination, and when we next meet, it may be as rivals...
Dialogue: My journey has no destination, and when we next meet, it may be as rivals...

Original: Gilgamesh:Buuut! Whenever you folks need me, just call my name! I'll be there!
Dialogue: Buuut! Whenever you folks need me, just call my name! I'll be there!

Original: Mog:Yay, kupo! Another friend added to our roster, kupo!
Dialogue: Yay, kupo! Another friend added to our roster, kupo!

Original: Gilgamesh:Now then, fare thee well! Hrah!
Dialogue: Now then, fare thee well! Hrah!

Original: Vanille:I feel like our conversation went off the rails somewhere...but oh well?
Dialogue: I feel like our conversation went off the rails somewhere...but oh well?

Original: Galuf:He can be a hasty fellow, but try to welcome him warmly.
Dialogue: He can be a hasty fellow, but try to welcome him warmly.

Original: Bartz:Who could've imagined a day we'd be fighting side by side...? What a feeling.
Dialogue: Who could've imagined a day we'd be fighting side by side...? What a feeling.

Original: Gilgamesh:Ho! Fancy meeting you here! How fare your travels?
Dialogue: Ho! Fancy meeting you here! How fare your travels?

Original: Faris:Why are you here? We haven't summoned you.
Dialogue: Why are you here? We haven't summoned you.

Original: Gilgamesh:There's no need to be so cold. You should try to be nicer to others!
Dialogue: There's no need to be so cold. You should try to be nicer to others!

Original: Krile:Did you come to check on us?
Dialogue: Did you come to check on us?

Original: Gilgamesh:Even if we fight at each other's sides, there's no way of telling how you're doing!
Dialogue: Even if we fight at each other's sides, there's no way of telling how you're doing!

Original: Bartz:You've got a point. A lot's happened, but we're doing fine.
Dialogue: You've got a point. A lot's happened, but we're doing fine.

Original: Gilgamesh:Where's that old man? Is he still as sprightly as ever?
Dialogue: Where's that old man? Is he still as sprightly as ever?

Original: Krile:Of course! He's over there with some of the others.
Dialogue: Of course! He's over there with some of the others.

Original: Gilgamesh:...I see. Please take good care of him!
Dialogue: ...I see. Please take good care of him!

Original: Faris:Hey, Gilgamesh. Are you...hiding something that happened in our world?
Dialogue: Hey, Gilgamesh. Are you...hiding something that happened in our world?

Original: Krile:...Because of the Torsions, some people have lost their memories.
Dialogue: ...Because of the Torsions, some people have lost their memories.

Original: Galuf:Oho, here's a fine guest! What are you folks talking about?
Dialogue: Oho, here's a fine guest! What are you folks talking about?

Original: Gilgamesh:I-it's...nothing! Absolutely nothing! We were just chatting about how strong you are!
Dialogue: I-it's...nothing! Absolutely nothing! We were just chatting about how strong you are!

Original: Galuf:Ho ho ho! Your clumsiness hasn't changed a bit, has it?
Dialogue: Ho ho ho! Your clumsiness hasn't changed a bit, has it?

Original: Galuf:Perhaps you can see our future after wandering the Rift for so long.
Dialogue: Perhaps you can see our future after wandering the Rift for so long.

Original: Galuf:But you needn't worry. In order to fix the distortions and return the world to how it ought to be, I'm willing to accept any fate.
Dialogue: But you needn't worry. In order to fix the distortions and return the world to how it ought to be, I'm willing to accept any fate.

Original: Gilgamesh:Old man...you certainly are an exemplary warrior.
Dialogue: Old man...you certainly are an exemplary warrior.

Original: Gilgamesh:Sniff... Bah, my nose is running... H-how dare this weather aggravate my allergies!
Dialogue: Sniff... Bah, my nose is running... H-how dare this weather aggravate my allergies!

Original: Gilgamesh:I must be off! Pwing!
Dialogue: I must be off! Pwing!

Original: Faris:...What a weirdo.
Dialogue: ...What a weirdo.

Original: Bartz:He's a bit flaky, but he's not a bad guy.
Dialogue: He's a bit flaky, but he's not a bad guy.

Original: Bartz:Serah... You said you might've met Gilgamesh before, right?
Dialogue: Serah... You said you might've met Gilgamesh before, right?

Original: Serah:Yes... He reminds me of someone I fought once. We eventually became allies.
Dialogue: Yes... He reminds me of someone I fought once. We eventually became allies.

Original: Serah:But they're not the same. The person I know uses guns, and the swords are slightly different, too.
Dialogue: But they're not the same. The person I know uses guns, and the swords are slightly different, too.

Original: Bartz:This Gilgamesh uses only swords, so they're definitely different. Only their name is the same.
Dialogue: This Gilgamesh uses only swords, so they're definitely different. Only their name is the same.

Original: Zidane:But he didn't use a sword. He didn't fight at all, actually.
Dialogue: But he didn't use a sword. He didn't fight at all, actually.

Original: Lion:Though his appearance and profession are totally different.
Dialogue: Though his appearance and profession are totally different.

Original: Ace:We also have aGilgameshinOrience. He's the head of theLorican Alliance.
Dialogue: We also have a Gilgamesh in Orience. He's the head of the Lorican Alliance.

Original: Ace:Other than the fact that they're both military men, they've got nothing in common.
Dialogue: Other than the fact that they're both military men, they've got nothing in common.

Original: Seifer:Why does that ugly mug give me such a bad feeling...?
Dialogue: Why does that ugly mug give me such a bad feeling...?

Original: Seifer:Can it. I don't remember ever meeting an idiot like that!
Dialogue: Can it. I don't remember ever meeting an idiot like that!

Original: Zidane:Maybe you just lost your memories of him?
Dialogue: Maybe you just lost your memories of him?

Original: Seifer:Hmph. Lost memories or not, there's no way I'd lose to such a wuss.
Dialogue: Hmph. Lost memories or not, there's no way I'd lose to such a wuss.

Original: Ace:You can never fault Seifer for not being confident enough...
Dialogue: You can never fault Seifer for not being confident enough...

Original: Lion:I'd love for them to meet my dad. But I know it's probably for the best that they don't.
Dialogue: I'd love for them to meet my dad. But I know it's probably for the best that they don't.

Original: Bartz:I'm sure he'd be surprised to say the least. Even if it won't happen, it's fun to imagine.
Dialogue: I'm sure he'd be surprised to say the least. Even if it won't happen, it's fun to imagine.

Original: Lilisette:That's Shadow's partner for you! What a trouper!
Dialogue: That's Shadow's partner for you! What a trouper!

Original: Lilisette:There, there, who's a good boy...whoa!
Dialogue: There, there, who's a good boy...whoa!

Original: Lilisette:Did I make him mad? ...Maybe he doesn't like me.
Dialogue: Did I make him mad? ...Maybe he doesn't like me.

Original: Shadow:...He eats strangers.
Dialogue: ...He eats strangers.

Original: Zell:I guess he's a little rough around the edges, just like his master. Or "rrruff," in his case.
Dialogue: I guess he's a little rough around the edges, just like his master. Or "rrruff," in his case.

Original: Zell:He almost ate me...
Dialogue: He almost ate me...

Original: Sabin:Heeey! We got trouble!
Dialogue: Heeey! We got trouble!

Original: Lilisette:What's the matter, you two? You look like you've seen a ghost.
Dialogue: What's the matter, you two? You look like you've seen a ghost.

Original: Sabin:We just saw some things that look like people! That look like us!
Dialogue: We just saw some things that look like people! That look like us!

Original: Zell:Manikins? Well, that's nothing special.
Dialogue: Manikins? Well, that's nothing special.

Original: Terra:No, they were different from manikins...
Dialogue: No, they were different from manikins...

Original: Zell:Look like you, but not manikins? What could they be?
Dialogue: Look like you, but not manikins? What could they be?

Original: Terra:I don't know...but...
Dialogue: I don't know...but...

Original: Terra:They remind me of something. Maybe...
Dialogue: They remind me of something. Maybe...

Original: Zell:Ah! Interceptor! Where ya going!?
Dialogue: Ah! Interceptor! Where ya going!?

Original: Lilisette:He took off at top speed... Did he find something?
Dialogue: He took off at top speed... Did he find something?

Original: Shadow:It can't be...
Dialogue: It can't be...

Original: Zell:Wha!? There goes his master!
Dialogue: Wha—!? There goes his master!

Original: Lilisette:Let's go, too!
Dialogue: Let's go, too!

Original: ???:Good boy, Interceptor. Where's your owner?
Dialogue: Good boy, Interceptor. Where's your owner?

Original: Sabin:H-hey! It's Relm!
Dialogue: H-hey! It's Relm!

Original: Shadow:...Just as I thought.
Dialogue: ...Just as I thought.

Original: Relm:Shadow! And the muscle-man!
Dialogue: Shadow! And the muscle-man!

Original: Cloud:Is she talking about ...Why do I even ask?
Dialogue: Is she talking about— ...Why do I even ask?

Original: Relm:Great! I finally found somebody I know!
Dialogue: Great! I finally found somebody I know!

Original: Sabin:If you're here, then those guys we saw earlier must be...
Dialogue: If you're here, then those guys we saw earlier must be...

Original: Sabin:Were you painting pictures of us!
Dialogue: Were you painting pictures of us!

Original: Relm:Heh heh, ya got me.
Dialogue: Heh heh, ya got me.

Original: Relm:I was all by myself, lost in a strange place. I got lonely.
Dialogue: I was all by myself, lost in a strange place. I got lonely.

Original: Relm:So I had a little fun painting!
Dialogue: So I had a little fun painting!

Original: Penelo:Um, sorry, but I don't think I follow...
Dialogue: Um, sorry, but I don't think I follow...

Original: Penelo:Does painting have something to do with those doppelgangers?
Dialogue: Does painting have something to do with those doppelgangers?

Original: Sabin:When Relm paints a picture, the real thing pops out.
Dialogue: When Relm paints a picture, the real thing pops out.

Original: Penelo:Her pictures come to life!?
Dialogue: Her pictures come to life!?

Original: Cloud:...You have to watch out for paintings in your world?
Dialogue: ...You have to watch out for paintings in your world?

Original: Relm:What does he mean, "your world"? Who're they?
Dialogue: What does he mean, "your world"? Who're they?

Original: Shadow:They'll fill you in.
Dialogue: They'll fill you in.

Original: Relm:Hmm? If you say so!
Dialogue: Hmm? If you say so!

Original: Relm:Anyway, Interceptor! Let's go play over there!
Dialogue: Anyway, Interceptor! Let's go play over there!

Original: Sabin:If you cross her, she'll threaten to paint your picture. Be careful!
Dialogue: If you cross her, she'll threaten to paint your picture. Be careful!

Original: Penelo:I-I'll keep that in mind...
Dialogue: I-I'll keep that in mind...

Original: Palom:Hey, everyone!
Dialogue: Hey, everyone!

Original: Sazh:What's up? Looks like you kids are having fun.
Dialogue: What's up? Looks like you kids are having fun.

Original: Vivi:Yeah! Relm taught us how to paint portraits!
Dialogue: Yeah! Relm taught us how to paint portraits!

Original: Relm:Everyone's so good at it! Look!
Dialogue: Everyone's so good at it! Look!

Original: Eiko:Zidane, I, umm...painted a picture of you...
Dialogue: Zidane, I, umm...painted a picture of you...

Original: Zidane:Oh really? Let me see!
Dialogue: Oh really? Let me see!

Original: Zidane:Whoa! This looks just like me! Great job, Eiko!
Dialogue: Whoa! This looks just like me! Great job, Eiko!

Original: Eiko:Really? Yay! Ehehe.
Dialogue: Really? Yay! Ehehe.

Original: Sazh:I guess it does look like you, but...isn't it a bit TOO handsome?
Dialogue: I guess it does look like you, but...isn't it a bit TOO handsome?

Original: Quistis:I had no idea his lashes were this long...
Dialogue: I had no idea his lashes were this long...

Original: Vivi:I drew you, Sazh! Here!
Dialogue: I drew you, Sazh! Here!

Original: Sazh:That's wonderful! Thanks, Vivi!
Dialogue: That's wonderful! Thanks, Vivi!

Original: Sazh:...What's this? Am I nothing but a hairball...?
Dialogue: ...What's this? Am I nothing but a hairball...?

Original: Relm:I taught Vivi a secret technique: focusing on unique features!
Dialogue: I taught Vivi a secret technique focusing on unique features!

Original: Sazh:I...I see...
Dialogue: I...I see...

Original: Palom:I drew you, Quistis! I'm sure you'll love it!
Dialogue: I drew you, Quistis! I'm sure you'll love it!

Original: Quistis:Oh? Thank you, Palom.
Dialogue: Oh? Thank you, Palom.

Original: Zidane:Well, this...certainly is...Quistis...
Dialogue: Well, this...certainly is...Quistis...

Original: Sazh:Are these...horns? And it looks like you have fangs, too...
Dialogue: Are these...horns? And it looks like you have fangs, too...

Original: Quistis:Palom... What is the meaning of this?
Dialogue: Palom... What is the meaning of this?

Original: Palom:Well, you get mad when we misbehave, right?
Dialogue: Well, you get mad when we misbehave, right?

Original: Palom:I wanted to show how scary you look when you're upset! Right, Relm?
Dialogue: I wanted to show how scary you look when you're upset! Right, Relm?

Original: Relm:Capturing things unseen to the eye is also a very important technique!
Dialogue: Capturing things unseen to the eye is also a very important technique!

Original: Quistis:Am I really so...terrifying...?
Dialogue: Am I really so...terrifying...?

Original: Zidane:Aww, don't get so down about it. They're just kids.
Dialogue: Aww, don't get so down about it. They're just kids.

Original: Eiko:Growing horns is no big deal, either!
Dialogue: Growing horns is no big deal, either!

Original: Relm:It'll be alright, Quistis.
Dialogue: It'll be alright, Quistis.

Original: Relm:I think you're right to be this scary to rascals like Palom!
Dialogue: I think you're right to be this scary to rascals like Palom!

Original: Sazh:You're a rascal yourself, Relm.
Dialogue: You're a rascal yourself, Relm.

Original: Relm:What did you say!? Take that back, or else I'll draw you next!
Dialogue: What did you say!? Take that back, or else I'll draw you next!

Original: Sazh:Okay, okay! Just don't draw me!
Dialogue: Okay, okay! Just don't draw me!

Original: Vivi:I like drawing pictures!
Dialogue: I like drawing pictures!

Original: Eiko:Yeah! Let's draw the others, too!
Dialogue: Yeah! Let's draw the others, too!

Original: Tidus:Hyah! Fast break!
Dialogue: Hyah! Fast break!

Original: Jecht:Haha! Too easy! Take this!
Dialogue: Haha! Too easy! Take this!

Original: Jecht:Come on. Throwing in the towel already?
Dialogue: Come on. Throwing in the towel already?

Original: Jecht:You won't ever be better than me with those weak moves.
Dialogue: You won't ever be better than me with those weak moves.

Original: Tidus:Damn you, old man! One more time!
Dialogue: Damn you, old man! One more time!

Original: Jecht:Alright. Give it your best shot!
Dialogue: Alright. Give it your best shot!

Original: Shadow:You're quite lively...
Dialogue: You're quite lively...

Original: Relm:You two are really close, aren't you?
Dialogue: You two are really close, aren't you?

Original: Tidus:Me and this old man? Don't be ridiculous...
Dialogue: Me and this old man? Don't be ridiculous...

Original: Laguna:Aww, you're blushing. There's no need to be shy, Tidus!
Dialogue: Aww, you're blushing. There's no need to be shy, Tidus!

Original: Laguna:Aww, I miss her now. I want to be as close to her as you and your father!
Dialogue: Aww, I miss her now. I want to be as close to her as you and your father!

Original: Laguna:What about you Relm? Are you close to your parents?
Dialogue: What about you Relm? Are you close to your parents?

Original: Relm:Well, I don't have a father. When I was young, he left home.
Dialogue: Well, I don't have a father. When I was young, he left home.

Original: Laguna:Oh... I'm sorry for asking.
Dialogue: Oh... I'm sorry for asking.

Original: Tidus:Even though he left, he could still be alive, right?
Dialogue: Even though he left, he could still be alive, right?

Original: Relm:Hmm... I guess so. But I don't really remember him at all.
Dialogue: Hmm... I guess so. But I don't really remember him at all.

Original: Jecht:You're a tough girl. Different from a certain crybaby I know.
Dialogue: You're a tough girl. Different from a certain crybaby I know.

Original: Tidus:I hope you're not talking about me! I wasn't lonely or anything!
Dialogue: I hope you're not talking about me! I wasn't lonely or anything!

Original: Squall:Don't you two ever get tired of this...?
Dialogue: Don't you two ever get tired of this...?

Original: Jecht:Who would be cruel enough to leave such a cute little girl behind?
Dialogue: Who would be cruel enough to leave such a cute little girl behind?

Original: Laguna:You were both athletes, weren't you?
Dialogue: You were both athletes, weren't you?

Original: Laguna:Maybe Relm and her father were both painters!
Dialogue: Maybe Relm and her father were both painters!

Original: Squall:The more important part is the magic. Perhaps he was a mage.
Dialogue: The more important part is the magic. Perhaps he was a mage.

Original: Relm:They're both possible! I hope I can meet him someday!
Dialogue: They're both possible! I hope I can meet him someday!

Original: Tidus:You never know. He may be just around the corner.
Dialogue: You never know. He may be just around the corner.

Original: Jecht:Hahaha! Yeah right!
Dialogue: Hahaha! Yeah right!

Original: Krile:Are you tired, Grandpa? I'll give you a shoulder rub!
Dialogue: Are you tired, Grandpa? I'll give you a shoulder rub!

Original: Galuf:Oh, Krile, you're too kind. Just the sentiment is enough for me.
Dialogue: Oh, Krile, you're too kind. Just the sentiment is enough for me.

Original: Relm:...Grandpa, huh?
Dialogue: ...Grandpa, huh?

Original: Relm:Wonder what my old codger is up to about now.
Dialogue: Wonder what my old codger is up to about now.

Original: Tifa:"Old codger"...?
Dialogue: "Old codger"...?

Original: Krile:Did you live with your grandfather, too, Relm?
Dialogue: Did you live with your grandfather, too, Relm?

Original: Setzer:He looks like any aged fellow, but he's a rather skilled mage.
Dialogue: He looks like any aged fellow, but he's a rather skilled mage.

Original: Cecil:His magic was also so great as to earn him the title "sage." A dependable companion.
Dialogue: His magic was also so great as to earn him the title "sage." A dependable companion.

Original: Relm:Oh, really...?
Dialogue: Oh, really...?

Original: Relm:Galuf, or Tellah, or whoever, everyone has such great grandpas.
Dialogue: Galuf, or Tellah, or whoever, everyone has such great grandpas.

Original: Relm:Mine on the other hand... He just gave up on his dreams and does nothing but get older...
Dialogue: Mine on the other hand... He just gave up on his dreams and does nothing but get older...

Original: Tifa:You're worried about him, aren't you?
Dialogue: You're worried about him, aren't you?

Original: Relm:Hmmm... He's pretty awful, but I can't just leave him alone.
Dialogue: Hmmm... He's pretty awful, but I can't just leave him alone.

Original: Galuf:That Strago must be a happy man.
Dialogue: That Strago must be a happy man.

Original: Krile:I hope you, and Cecil too, can meet them again soon.
Dialogue: I hope you, and Cecil too, can meet them again soon.

Original: Galuf:I'd like to meet them, too. They must have some stories to tell.
Dialogue: I'd like to meet them, too. They must have some stories to tell.

Original: Setzer:You and Strago would get along. You have a thing or two in common.
Dialogue: You and Strago would get along. You have a thing or two in common.

Original: Relm:Please take good care of him when the time comes!
Dialogue: Please take good care of him when the time comes!

Original: Relm:If he starts whining, just clock him one, 'kay?
Dialogue: If he starts whining, just clock him one, 'kay?

Original: Galuf:S-sure, but gently, perhaps...
Dialogue: S-sure, but gently, perhaps...

Original: Cecil:Love comes in all forms...I guess.
Dialogue: Love comes in all forms...I guess.

Original: Tifa:You can say that again.
Dialogue: You can say that again.

Original: Relm:Grandpa... I'm doing fine, so you hang in there, too...
Dialogue: Grandpa... I'm doing fine, so you hang in there, too...

Original: Firion:This finishes it! Hah!
Dialogue: This finishes it! Hah!

Original: Jecht:Oh, not bad, Firion! Got a good arm on ya!
Dialogue: Oh, not bad, Firion! Got a good arm on ya!

Original: Tidus:That was a big one. Didn't think we'd run into this sort around here.
Dialogue: That was a big one. Didn't think we'd run into this sort around here.

Original: ???:Good show.
Dialogue: Good show.

Original: Firion:That voice!
Dialogue: That voice!

Original: The Emperor:You have grown stronger. I did not expect you to defeat the fiend I sent your way.
Dialogue: You have grown stronger. I did not expect you to defeat the fiend I sent your way.

Original: Jecht:"Sent our way," huh? What's the big idea!?
Dialogue: "Sent our way," huh? What's the big idea!?

Original: The Emperor:Did I not make myself clear? To test your strength.
Dialogue: Did I not make myself clear? To test your strength.

Original: The Emperor:And I find that strength increasingly appealing. What do you say? Shall I dominate you now?
Dialogue: And I find that strength increasingly appealing. What do you say? Shall I dominate you now?

Original: Tidus:You never learn, do ya?
Dialogue: You never learn, do ya?

Original: Firion:Don't make us repeat ourselves! No one wishes to be ruled over!
Dialogue: Don't make us repeat ourselves! No one wishes to be ruled over!

Original: The Emperor:Ha... In that case, might the sight of this man sway your position?
Dialogue: Ha... In that case, might the sight of this man sway your position?

Original: Firion:Leon!
Dialogue: Leon!

Original: Leon:Unh... Is that you...Firion...?
Dialogue: Unh... Is that you...Firion...?

Original: Jecht:Who's this guy? Friend of yours?
Dialogue: Who's this guy? Friend of yours?

Original: Firion:My best friend... But why is he...?
Dialogue: My best friend... But why is he...?

Original: Tidus:Your best friend works for the Emperor!? The heck!?
Dialogue: Your best friend works for the Emperor!? The heck!?

Original: Leon:Ngah...! Fir...iooon! Power... Give me your power! If I kill you...then I...!
Dialogue: Ngah...! Fir...iooon! Power... Give me your power! If I kill you...then I...!

Original: Leon:I can...! Become the true...ruler...!
Dialogue: I can...! Become the true...ruler...!

Original: Jecht:Hey, he's spoutin' crazy talk now. You really used to hang out with this nut job?
Dialogue: Hey, he's spoutin' crazy talk now. You really used to hang out with this nut job?

Original: Firion:...Clearly something is amiss. The Leon I know would never...
Dialogue: ...Clearly something is amiss. The Leon I know would never...

Original: The Emperor:Well, now what? Here is a bit of fun where former friends battle to the death... Try to entertain me.
Dialogue: Well, now what? Here is a bit of fun where former friends battle to the death... Try to entertain me.

Original: The Emperor:Go, Leon!
Dialogue: Go, Leon!

Original: Leon:Fir...ion! You think...you can defeat me!?
Dialogue: Fir...ion! You think...you can defeat me!?

Original: Firion:Leon...snap out of it! Blast, have we no choice but to fight!?
Dialogue: Leon...snap out of it! Blast, have we no choice but to fight!?

Original: Leon:Ngh... Firion...
Dialogue: Ngh... Firion...

Original: Firion:Leon, please, come to your senses... This fight is...meaningless.
Dialogue: Leon, please, come to your senses... This fight is...meaningless.

Original: The Emperor:Hmph, some opponent you proved to be. Hopeless.
Dialogue: Hmph, some opponent you proved to be. Hopeless.

Original: The Emperor:I have no need for useless worms. Allow me to deliver the finishing blow.
Dialogue: I have no need for useless worms. Allow me to deliver the finishing blow.

Original: Firion:Stop, Emperor!
Dialogue: Stop, Emperor!

Original: The Emperor:Oh, you wish to protect the man who betrayed you? And why is that, may I ask?
Dialogue: Oh, you wish to protect the man who betrayed you? And why is that, may I ask?

Original: Firion:Leon is my friend...and my family!
Dialogue: Leon is my friend...and my family!

Original: The Emperor:Hahaha... A truly worthless reason.
Dialogue: Hahaha... A truly worthless reason.

Original: The Emperor:I think it best I finish you both here and now!
Dialogue: I think it best I finish you both here and now!

Original: Irvine:That'll be enough, Mr. E. Mind stepping away from my friends now?
Dialogue: That'll be enough, Mr. E. Mind stepping away from my friends now?

Original: Snow:His family is our family! You aren't laying a finger on him!
Dialogue: His family is our family! You aren't laying a finger on him!

Original: Thancred:Do afford us the dashing entrance from time to time, eh, Firion?
Dialogue: Do afford us the dashing entrance from time to time, eh, Firion?

Original: Firion:My friends...!
Dialogue: My friends...!

Original: The Emperor:...Hmph. Your theatrics have spoiled my entertainment.
Dialogue: ...Hmph. Your theatrics have spoiled my entertainment.

Original: The Emperor:Well enough. This one is now steeped in darkness. He is certain to betray you in his thirst for power...
Dialogue: Well enough. This one is now steeped in darkness. He is certain to betray you in his thirst for power...

Original: The Emperor:Ugly battles amongst yourselves is the most you have to look forward to.
Dialogue: Ugly battles amongst yourselves is the most you have to look forward to.

Original: Snow:He got away! Everyone in one piece?
Dialogue: He got away! Everyone in one piece?

Original: Firion:Leon! Are you alright!?
Dialogue: Leon! Are you alright!?

Original: Firion:Can you stand, Leon?
Dialogue: Can you stand, Leon?

Original: Leon:Y-yes... I am fine now...
Dialogue: Y-yes... I am fine now...

Original: Leon:But are you? You heard what he said...
Dialogue: But are you? You heard what he said...

Original: Firion:Why don't you tell us what happened first? Why were you with the Emperor?
Dialogue: Why don't you tell us what happened first? Why were you with the Emperor?

Original: Leon:I realized I was in this world...felt some dark will pursuing me, and lost consciousness...blast it all.
Dialogue: I realized I was in this world...felt some dark will pursuing me, and lost consciousness...blast it all.

Original: Leon:I was with that monster...
Dialogue: I was with that monster...

Original: Leon:I'm sorry. Please, leave me be.
Dialogue: I'm sorry. Please, leave me be.

Original: Snow:Hey, you gonna let him go? I thought he was family.
Dialogue: Hey, you gonna let him go? I thought he was family.

Original: Irvine:Yeah, you need to take better care of him than that. Heeey, Leeeooon!
Dialogue: Yeah, you need to take better care of him than that. Heeey, Leeeooon!

Original: Firion:Snow, Irvine... You're right...
Dialogue: Snow, Irvine... You're right...

Original: Firion:Leon! This world isn't ours...so please stay with us, at least as long as you're here...!
Dialogue: Leon! This world isn't ours...so please stay with us, at least as long as you're here...!

Original: Leon:...Firion... But...I'm sure I will eventually betray you...
Dialogue: ...Firion... But...I'm sure I will eventually betray you...

Original: Snow:Geez, don't you make this harder than it needs to be.
Dialogue: Geez, don't you make this harder than it needs to be.

Original: Snow:What'd we say? Firion's family is our family! We don't care what your baggage is!
Dialogue: What'd we say? Firion's family is our family! We don't care what your baggage is!

Original: Snow:Family sticks together! Hey, you guys with me here?
Dialogue: Family sticks together! Hey, you guys with me here?

Original: Thancred:Aye, I have no interest in digging up the past.
Dialogue: Aye, I have no interest in digging up the past.

Original: Irvine:Yeah, and it's safer if you're with us than getting yourself lost and manipulated by some other wacko.
Dialogue: Yeah, and it's safer if you're with us than getting yourself lost and manipulated by some other wacko.

Original: Firion:Thank you, everyone...!
Dialogue: Thank you, everyone...!

Original: Firion:No one among us will hold anything against you.
Dialogue: No one among us will hold anything against you.

Original: Firion:I finally found you...
Dialogue: I finally found you...

Original: Leon:...Very well.
Dialogue: ...Very well.

Original: Snow:Right-o! That settles it! Let's go let the others know we've got a new friend! I mean family member!
Dialogue: Right-o! That settles it! Let's go let the others know we've got a new friend! I mean family member!

Original: Leon:Am I...truly fit for this...?
