Original: Lilisette:Good idea! She's probably a friend of someone from another world.
Dialogue: Good idea! She's probably a friend of someone from another world.

Original: Celes:Could it be that you're also lost in this world?
Dialogue: Could it be that you're also lost in this world?

Original: Lenna:Yes. There are others like you, us included. Could you tell us what happened to you?
Dialogue: Yes. There are others like you, us included. Could you tell us what happened to you?

Original: Lulu:I was told by a goddess that this is a different world... I'm searching for my comrades now.
Dialogue: I was told by a goddess that this is a different world... I'm searching for my comrades now.

Original: Lilisette:Then we can definitely help! What kind of person are you looking for?
Dialogue: Then we can definitely help! What kind of person are you looking for?

Original: Lulu:A young woman. She's a summoner.
Dialogue: A young woman. She's a summoner.

Original: Celes:I know some likely candidates. You wait right here. I'll go and fetch who I can.
Dialogue: I know some likely candidates. You wait right here. I'll go and fetch who I can.

Original: Rydia:Um, well... Nice to meet you?
Dialogue: Um, well... Nice to meet you?

Original: Eiko:I don't know this lady, either! But we can still be friends.
Dialogue: I don't know this lady, either! But we can still be friends.

Original: Celes:I'm sorry. You said "summoner," so I thought...
Dialogue: I'm sorry. You said "summoner," so I thought...

Original: Lilisette:I guess we got it wrong.
Dialogue: I guess we got it wrong.

Original: Lulu:I see... You two are also summoners?
Dialogue: I see... You two are also summoners?

Original: Lulu:What fascinating dress... This truly is a different world.
Dialogue: What fascinating dress... This truly is a different world.

Original: Lulu:I hope she's all right, wherever she is...
Dialogue: I hope she's all right, wherever she is...

Original: Lulu:Thank you for your help. I'll continue my search.
Dialogue: Thank you for your help. I'll continue my search.

Original: Celes:Wait. I can't let you go off on your own.
Dialogue: Wait. I can't let you go off on your own.

Original: Rydia:You must be exhausted. Please don't push yourself.
Dialogue: You must be exhausted. Please don't push yourself.

Original: Eiko:Why don't you take a break first? Then we'll all help you find your friends!
Dialogue: Why don't you take a break first? Then we'll all help you find your friends!

Original: Lenna:Indeed. We have other summoners in our group. There's a chance the one you're looking for is among them.
Dialogue: Indeed. We have other summoners in our group. There's a chance the one you're looking for is among them.

Original: Lilisette:Yeah! You can meet all of our comrades if you come with us to the airship.
Dialogue: Yeah! You can meet all of our comrades if you come with us to the airship.

Original: Lulu:...I suppose you're right.
Dialogue: ...I suppose you're right.

Original: Lulu:Thank you for your kindness. Let us do just that, then.
Dialogue: Thank you for your kindness. Let us do just that, then.

Original: Penelo:How are you holding up, Lulu? We should be out of the forest soon.
Dialogue: How are you holding up, Lulu? We should be out of the forest soon.

Original: Lulu:I'm fine, thank you for asking.
Dialogue: I'm fine, thank you for asking.

Original: Penelo:Not at all! By the way, that's a cute doll you have there.
Dialogue: Not at all! By the way, that's a cute doll you have there.

Original: Lulu:Thank you. You must find it weird for me to be carrying this around.
Dialogue: Thank you. You must find it weird for me to be carrying this around.

Original: Penelo:What? Of course not! I think it's adorable!
Dialogue: What? Of course not! I think it's adorable!

Original: Lulu:Hehe. My apologies for teasing you.
Dialogue: Hehe. My apologies for teasing you.

Original: Lulu:This doll is capable of more than just looking cute.
Dialogue: This doll is capable of more than just looking cute.

Original: Seven:It moved!
Dialogue: It moved!

Original: Seven:You two are from different worlds, right? How is it possible you know that?
Dialogue: You two are from different worlds, right? How is it possible you know that?

Original: Shantotto:Though the theory behind it is not the same, I believe something akin to magic is to blame.
Dialogue: Though the theory behind it is not the same, I believe something akin to magic is to blame.

Original: Lulu:...So the idea of magic is the same then. Well, she's right. This moves by magic.
Dialogue: ...So the idea of magic is the same then. Well, she's right. This moves by magic.

Original: Penelo:Then you're a mage, Lulu? We've got lots of allies who can also use magic!
Dialogue: Then you're a mage, Lulu? We've got lots of allies who can also use magic!

Original: Penelo:I hope we can find your friend soon!
Dialogue: I hope we can find your friend soon!

Original: Seven:We're nearly there. Just a little more.
Dialogue: We're nearly there. Just a little more.

Original: Lulu:I can't thank you enough for helping me. I feel much better now.
Dialogue: I can't thank you enough for helping me. I feel much better now.

Original: Seven:Don't mention it. We all know what it's like to be lost in this world.
Dialogue: Don't mention it. We all know what it's like to be lost in this world.

Original: Wakka:Man, this thing just won't quit!
Dialogue: Man, this thing just won't quit!

Original: Seven:Wakka? What's the matter?
Dialogue: Wakka? What's the matter?

Original: Wakka:Nice timing! There's a monster over there. Come on, help me out!
Dialogue: Nice timing! There's a monster over there. Come on, help me out!

Original: Lulu:Wakka! There you are!
Dialogue: Wakka! There you are!

Original: Wakka:It's a good thing you're here. My ball just doesn't seem to do the trick.
Dialogue: It's a good thing you're here. My ball just doesn't seem to do the trick.

Original: Wakka:I need your help, Lu!
Dialogue: I need your help, Lu!

Original: Penelo:Wow! So your magic could do more than just make that doll move!
Dialogue: Wow! So your magic could do more than just make that doll move!

Original: Lulu:Where is Yuna? Is she safe?
Dialogue: Where is Yuna? Is she safe?

Original: Wakka:Take it easy. She's with us.
Dialogue: Take it easy. She's with us.

Original: Lulu:Thank goodness.
Dialogue: Thank goodness.

Original: Shantotto:So that's the summoner you were looking for. Finding her among so many would've been a chore.
Dialogue: So that's the summoner you were looking for. Finding her among so many would've been a chore.

Original: Seven:We should've brought Yuna with us. When we get back to the airship, you'll be able to see her.
Dialogue: We should've brought Yuna with us. When we get back to the airship, you'll be able to see her.

Original: Lulu:Please don't apologize. Thank you for bringing me with you.
Dialogue: Please don't apologize. Thank you for bringing me with you.

Original: Lulu:If Yuna is here, I will gladly fight alongside you.
Dialogue: If Yuna is here, I will gladly fight alongside you.

Original: Lulu:Yuna! I'm so glad you're okay.
Dialogue: Yuna! I'm so glad you're okay.

Original: Yuna:Lulu! I'm so happy to see you! When I heard that you were all alone, I was so worried.
Dialogue: Lulu! I'm so happy to see you! When I heard that you were all alone, I was so worried.

Original: Lulu:You have my apologies.
Dialogue: You have my apologies.

Original: Lulu:I regret not finding you here sooner.
Dialogue: I regret not finding you here sooner.

Original: Yuna:I'm fine. I've made it this far thanks to all my new friends.
Dialogue: I'm fine. I've made it this far thanks to all my new friends.

Original: Yuna:I didn't want you or the other guardians to worry about me.
Dialogue: I didn't want you or the other guardians to worry about me.

Original: Lulu:You've gotten stronger while I was away, haven't you?
Dialogue: You've gotten stronger while I was away, haven't you?

Original: Yuna:You think so?
Dialogue: You think so?

Original: Lulu:...On second thought, maybe not.
Dialogue: ...On second thought, maybe not.

Original: Lulu:Hehe.
Dialogue: Hehe.

Original: Jecht:But we need to fix whatever's goin' on in this world before you guys can go home.
Dialogue: But we need to fix whatever's goin' on in this world before you guys can go home.

Original: Jecht:And it won't be easy.
Dialogue: And it won't be easy.

Original: Lulu:What!? What are you doing here!?
Dialogue: What!? What are you doing here!?

Original: Jecht:Didn't mean to surprise ya. Not even I understand everything at work here.
Dialogue: Didn't mean to surprise ya. Not even I understand everything at work here.

Original: Jecht:But I can move my own body and haven't lost control yet.
Dialogue: But I can move my own body and haven't lost control yet.

Original: Yuna:Sir Jecht is also one of our allies now.
Dialogue: Sir Jecht is also one of our allies now.

Original: Lulu:I see... ......
Lulu:I can put my faith in you as a legendary guardian, can't I?
Dialogue: I can put my faith in you as a legendary guardian, can't I?

Original: Jecht:Course ya can!
Dialogue: Course ya can!

Original: Yuna:Yes. Both Sir Jecht and Sir Auron were legendary guardians.
Dialogue: Yes. Both Sir Jecht and Sir Auron were legendary guardians.

Original: Lion:So this is like a dream team!
Dialogue: So this is like a dream team!

Original: Layle:We've been traveling with Jecht for so long, it's hard to believe he's some kind of legend...
Dialogue: We've been traveling with Jecht for so long, it's hard to believe he's some kind of legend...

Original: Jecht:Alright, 'nuff talk about dreams.
Dialogue: Alright, 'nuff talk about dreams.

Original: Lulu:I guess you're right. Though our journey was somewhat of a dream...
Dialogue: I guess you're right. Though our journey was somewhat of a dream...

Original: Vaan:Auron is always composed, so I'd believe someone if they told me he's some sort of legend, but...
Dialogue: Auron is always composed, so I'd believe someone if they told me he's some sort of legend, but...

Original: Vaan:Jecht is a different story.
Dialogue: Jecht is a different story.

Original: Jecht:Hey! I don't care about bein' a legend! Normal's fine with me!
Dialogue: Hey! I don't care about bein' a legend! Normal's fine with me!

Original: Lulu:Guardians, Sir Jecht, and all those from other worlds...
Dialogue: Guardians, Sir Jecht, and all those from other worlds...

Original: Lulu:I will do my best to protect you.
Dialogue: I will do my best to protect you.

Original: Vivi:You use dolls instead of rods to cast magic, don't you, Miss Lulu?
Dialogue: You use dolls instead of rods to cast magic, don't you, Miss Lulu?

Original: Vivi:It's so rare to see, so it's neat to get to travel with you.
Dialogue: It's so rare to see, so it's neat to get to travel with you.

Original: Lulu:Is that so? I never really thought about it.
Dialogue: Is that so? I never really thought about it.

Original: Vivi:I wonder how it works. You're a black mage too, aren't you?
Dialogue: I wonder how it works. You're a black mage too, aren't you?

Original: Lulu:There are things even I don't understand about it. I do it because it was needed on our journey thus far.
Dialogue: There are things even I don't understand about it. I do it because it was needed on our journey thus far.

Original: Vivi:It's really cool the way other people cast magic.
Dialogue: It's really cool the way other people cast magic.

Original: Shantotto:Are you saying you are not awed by magic cast with a rod?
Dialogue: Are you saying you are not awed by magic cast with a rod?

Original: Shantotto:No tool is better or worse when reciting a magical verse.
Dialogue: No tool is better or worse when reciting a magical verse.

Original: Lulu:She's right. It is a mere coincidence that I happen to use dolls.
Dialogue: She's right. It is a mere coincidence that I happen to use dolls.

Original: Vivi:I see. I guess there are lots of ways to use magic out there.
Dialogue: I see. I guess there are lots of ways to use magic out there.

Original: Papalymo:Rods and wands were originally used to heighten the caster's concentration and magic abilities.
Dialogue: Rods and wands were originally used to heighten the caster's concentration and magic abilities.

Original: Papalymo:If anything, it allows one who has the disposition for it to use magic. How does your magic work, Edge?
Dialogue: If anything, it allows one who has the disposition for it to use magic. How does your magic work, Edge?

Original: Edge:I don't use magic! I useEblanninjutsu.
Dialogue: I don't use magic! I use Eblan ninjutsu.

Original: Edge:I'm no mage. I can't do what Rydia and Rosa do.
Dialogue: I'm no mage. I can't do what Rydia and Rosa do.

Original: Shantotto:At least according toVana'diel'srules,ninjacast something like spells with tools.
Dialogue: At least according to Vana'diel's rules, ninja cast something like spells with tools.

Original: Shantotto:But how do these arts work in other parts?
Dialogue: But how do these arts work in other parts?

Original: Shantotto:The flames of my interest have been fanned.
Dialogue: The flames of my interest have been fanned.

Original: Shantotto:So would you mind lending me a hand?
Dialogue: So would you mind lending me a hand?

Original: Edge:N-no way!
Dialogue: N-no way!

Original: Edge:The Eblan ninja arts are a royal secret!
Dialogue: The Eblan ninja arts are a royal secret!

Original: Shantotto:I have no interest in your traditions. This is for the sake of knowledge acquisition.
Dialogue: I have no interest in your traditions. This is for the sake of knowledge acquisition.

Original: Edge:Give me a break!
Dialogue: Give me a break!

Original: Papalymo:...I suppose there's no sating her curiosity. Forgive me for my question earlier.
Dialogue: ...I suppose there's no sating her curiosity. Forgive me for my question earlier.

Original: Lulu:Do not worry about it.
Dialogue: Do not worry about it.

Original: Lulu:Our home world, Spira, was full of danger.
Dialogue: Our home world, Spira, was full of danger.

Original: Lulu:Magic was a way of fighting those dangers. I never thought of it as something to be researched.
Dialogue: Magic was a way of fighting those dangers. I never thought of it as something to be researched.

Original: Papalymo:Regrettable that you only ever considered one side of your power.
Dialogue: Regrettable that you only ever considered one side of your power.

Original: Lulu:It seems like you all have very inquiring minds.
Dialogue: It seems like you all have very inquiring minds.

Original: Papalymo:I also quite enjoy the pursuit of knowledge.
Dialogue: I also quite enjoy the pursuit of knowledge.

Original: Lulu:I never had the chance to talk so genuinely about magic. It's...fun.
Dialogue: I never had the chance to talk so genuinely about magic. It's...fun.

Original: Papalymo:I am glad to hear it. Traveling together will give us many more chances to enrich the other.
Dialogue: I am glad to hear it. Traveling together will give us many more chances to enrich the other.

Original: Eiko:I'll play with you! What do you want to do?
Dialogue: I'll play with you! What do you want to do?

Original: Lenna:...It doesn't talk after all.
Dialogue: ...It doesn't talk after all.

Original: Aphmau:It seems like Lulu is the one moving it, so it might be difficult for it to talk.
Dialogue: It seems like Lulu is the one moving it, so it might be difficult for it to talk.

Original: Eiko:...I don't understand how stuff works in other worlds. Does it really move by magic?
Dialogue: ...I don't understand how stuff works in other worlds. Does it really move by magic?

Original: Eiko:There's nothing else moving it? Like a machine, or an animal on the inside?
Dialogue: There's nothing else moving it? Like a machine, or an animal on the inside?

Original: Aphmau:My automatons,OvjangandMnejing, are my precious friends.
Dialogue: My automatons, Ovjang and Mnejing, are my precious friends.

Original: Eiko:Wow! If they're your friends, you must feel safe even when you're alone.
Dialogue: Wow! If they're your friends, you must feel safe even when you're alone.

Original: Lulu:But...is it so unbelievable that it moves by magic? How can I prove it to you?
Dialogue: But...is it so unbelievable that it moves by magic? How can I prove it to you?

Original: Ace:We don't need you to prove it.
Dialogue: We don't need you to prove it.

Original: Ace:There were moogles like that in Eiko's world, too. Your doll might be the same.
Dialogue: There were moogles like that in Eiko's world, too. Your doll might be the same.

Original: Eiko:Yeah! So if your doll ever wants to make friends, let me know!
Dialogue: Yeah! So if your doll ever wants to make friends, let me know!

Original: Eiko:What do you think, Cait Sith?
Dialogue: What do you think, Cait Sith?

Original: Lulu:(Now that they mention it...there are beings like Cait Sith in other worlds. Perhaps a misunderstanding was unavoidable.)
Dialogue: (Now that they mention it...there are beings like Cait Sith in other worlds. Perhaps a misunderstanding was unavoidable.)

Original: Cait Sith:Hm... I don't understand other worlds very well.
Dialogue: Hm... I don't understand other worlds very well.

Original: Cait Sith:But whether they're alive or not, or a doll, monster, or beast...if they're a friend, you need to take good care of them!
Dialogue: But whether they're alive or not, or a doll, monster, or beast...if they're a friend, you need to take good care of them!

Original: Aphmau:That's right! It doesn't matter if they're a doll. The most important part is how you've been together, and that you want to continue being together.
Dialogue: That's right! It doesn't matter if they're a doll. The most important part is how you've been together, and that you want to continue being together.

Original: Eiko:Well, will you keep being our friend, Cait Sith?
Dialogue: Well, will you keep being our friend, Cait Sith?

Original: Cait Sith:Huh? Well, I wouldn't mind being friends with all my companions here...
Dialogue: Huh? Well, I wouldn't mind being friends with all my companions here...

Original: Ace:Cait Sith said so himself. Even dolls can be friends.
Dialogue: Cait Sith said so himself. Even dolls can be friends.

Original: Lenna:Yes. There is more to friendship than just exchanging words.
Dialogue: Yes. There is more to friendship than just exchanging words.

Original: Eiko:Hehe. Thanks, Cait Sith!
Dialogue: Hehe. Thanks, Cait Sith!

Original: Aphmau:I want to be friends, too! I don't have any other automaton friends besides Ovjang and Mnejing.
Dialogue: I want to be friends, too! I don't have any other automaton friends besides Ovjang and Mnejing.

Original: Cait Sith:Of course! We're all friends here.
Dialogue: Of course! We're all friends here.

Original: Aphmau:Yay! Thank you, Cait Sith!
Dialogue: Yay! Thank you, Cait Sith!

Original: Lulu:...Even if our worlds are different, similar magic exists.
Dialogue: ...Even if our worlds are different, similar magic exists.

Original: Cait Sith:Magic? What do you mean? I'm a fortune-telling machine.
Dialogue: Magic? What do you mean? I'm a fortune-telling machine.

Original: Lulu:To think that a machine can move and have feeling towards friends... Technology is incredible.
Dialogue: To think that a machine can move and have feeling towards friends... Technology is incredible.

Original: Cait Sith:Now Lulu, don't go spoiling the kiddos' dreams.
Dialogue: Now Lulu, don't go spoiling the kiddos' dreams.

Original: Lulu:I suppose you're right. The similarities were just too hard to ignore. I apologize.
Dialogue: I suppose you're right. The similarities were just too hard to ignore. I apologize.

Original: Lulu:But no matter what kind of person you are, you are still a friend.
Dialogue: But no matter what kind of person you are, you are still a friend.

Original: Cait Sith:I'm a machine with a capital M! But I'm happy to be called a friend.
Dialogue: I'm a machine with a capital M! But I'm happy to be called a friend.

Original: Lulu:Hehe... I really do enjoy it here.
Dialogue: Hehe... I really do enjoy it here.

Original: ???:AHHHHHH!
Dialogue: AHHHHHH!

Original: Snow:Did you hear that?
Dialogue: Did you hear that?

Original: Terra:Yes, but I don't recognize that voice.
Dialogue: Yes, but I don't recognize that voice.

Original: Warrior of Light:It was a scream. We must hurry.
Dialogue: It was a scream. We must hurry.

Original: Lann:Ouch! What the honk!? That hurts!
Dialogue: Ouch! What the honk!? That hurts!

Original: Lann:Here we go!
Dialogue: Here we go!

Original: Lann:A persimmon! If only I had a way to slice this up!
Dialogue: A persimmon! If only I had a way to slice this up!

Original: Lann:...Wait a second. Where's my prism!?
Dialogue: ...Wait a second. Where's my prism!?

Original: Lann:And who put a persimmon in my pocket!? Was itTama?Serafie?
Dialogue: And who put a persimmon in my pocket!? Was it Tama? Serafie?

Original: Squall:What's going on here...?
Dialogue: What's going on here...?

Original: Terra:It doesn't matter. He's in trouble. We have to help him!
Dialogue: It doesn't matter. He's in trouble. We have to help him!

Original: Lann:Whew! You really rescued my rear back there. Thanks!
Dialogue: Whew! You really rescued my rear back there. Thanks!

Original: Lann:But I am glad to see you guys again! You've got great timing!
Dialogue: But I am glad to see you guys again! You've got great timing!

Original: Snow:Do we...know you?
Dialogue: Do we...know you?

Original: Squall:I don't remember him at all...
Dialogue: I don't remember him at all...

Original: Lann:What!? It's me, Lann!
Dialogue: What!? It's me, Lann!

Original: Lann:Why are you all suddenly Jiants, too!?
Dialogue: Why are you all suddenly Jiants, too!?

Original: Lann:Yeah! Why didn't you tell me you could do that!?
Dialogue: Yeah! Why didn't you tell me you could do that!?

Original: Lann:Well, it's a bit awkward talking to you from down here, so...up I go! ...Huh?
Dialogue: Well, it's a bit awkward talking to you from down here, so...up I go! ...Huh?

Original: Lann:What the what!? Why can't I turn into a Jiant!?
Dialogue: What the what!? Why can't I turn into a Jiant!?

Original: Lann:...And where are we?
Dialogue: ...And where are we?

Original: Snow:All right, little guy, calm down. We'll explain everything.
Dialogue: All right, little guy, calm down. We'll explain everything.

Original: Terra:And that's why we've got to solve this problem.
Dialogue: And that's why we've got to solve this problem.

Original: Warrior of Light:Indeed. In order to protect our own worlds, we must first protect this one.
Dialogue: Indeed. In order to protect our own worlds, we must first protect this one.

Original: Lann:I get it...
Dialogue: I get it...

Original: Lann:On second thought, I don't. Could you run that by me one more time?
Dialogue: On second thought, I don't. Could you run that by me one more time?

Original: Snow:I guess we went too fast. Where did you get lost?
Dialogue: I guess we went too fast. Where did you get lost?

Original: Lann:Somewhere around the time you said..."We'll explain everything."
Dialogue: Somewhere around the time you said..."We'll explain everything."

Original: Snow:That was even before we started!
Dialogue: That was even before we started!

Original: Squall:(Why even bother explaining? This kid's a lost cause...)
Dialogue: (Why even bother explaining? This kid's a lost cause...)

Original: Terra:Why don't we explain it again later when we can take our time?
Dialogue: Why don't we explain it again later when we can take our time?

Original: Warrior of Light:Agreed. We must get moving. Will you join us?
Dialogue: Agreed. We must get moving. Will you join us?

Original: Lann:Do you even have to ask? It'll be just like old times!
Dialogue: Do you even have to ask? It'll be just like old times!

Original: Squall:("Old times"? What a weird kid...)
Dialogue: ("Old times"? What a weird kid...)

Original: Edgar:Welcome back. And it looks like you brought a new friend!
Dialogue: Welcome back. And it looks like you brought a new friend!

Original: Reynn:Lann, there you are! I knew you got lost somewhere!
Dialogue: Lann, there you are! I knew you got lost somewhere!

Original: Lann:Sis, did you see? Everyone's a Jiant now!
Dialogue: Sis, did you see? Everyone's a Jiant now!

Original: Reynn:Ugh... Of course I've seen!
Dialogue: Ugh... Of course I've seen!

Original: Lann:Isn't it awesomely weird?
Dialogue: Isn't it awesomely weird?

Original: Reynn:...I'm sorry if you wasted your breath explaining things to my brother. He was born a dummy.
Dialogue: ...I'm sorry if you wasted your breath explaining things to my brother. He was born a dummy.

Original: Terra:Don't worry about it. There's always bound to be confusion in the beginning.
Dialogue: Don't worry about it. There's always bound to be confusion in the beginning.

Original: Reynn:If it were just the beginning, that'd be fine...
Dialogue: If it were just the beginning, that'd be fine...

Original: Tifa:You must be Reynn's brother. It's nice to meet you.
Dialogue: You must be Reynn's brother. It's nice to meet you.

Original: Lann:Oh, uh, nice to meet you too, I guess? Looks like you've also grown into a Jiant, Tifa.
Dialogue: Oh, uh, nice to meet you too, I guess? Looks like you've also grown into a Jiant, Tifa.

Original: Tifa:So we've also met before.
Dialogue: So we've also met before.

Original: Tifa:Reynn also knew my name, though she did call me a ghost and try to run away at first...
Dialogue: Reynn also knew my name, though she did call me a ghost and try to run away at first...

Original: Lann:Aww, you poor thing, Sis. Thankfully someone was around to save the day!
Dialogue: Aww, you poor thing, Sis. Thankfully someone was around to save the day!

Original: Reynn:And what happened to you, huh!?
Dialogue: And what happened to you, huh!?

Original: Terra:He was being attacked by monsters.
Dialogue: He was being attacked by monsters.

Original: Edgar:I'm glad you escaped unscathed.
Dialogue: I'm glad you escaped unscathed.

Original: Terra:He was saying something about a persimmon in his pocket when we found him...
Dialogue: He was saying something about a persimmon in his pocket when we found him...

Original: Lann:Y-you saw that!?
Dialogue: Y-you saw that!?

Original: Edgar:And just what did you intend to do with that persimmon?
Dialogue: And just what did you intend to do with that persimmon?

Original: Reynn:Don't tell me you were looking for a prism, but pulled out a persimmon instead...
Dialogue: Don't tell me you were looking for a prism, but pulled out a persimmon instead...

Original: Lann:How did you know that!?
Dialogue: How did you know that!?

Original: Edgar:I'm happy to see you two having fun, but I must remind you that this is a different world than the one you're familiar with.
Dialogue: I'm happy to see you two having fun, but I must remind you that this is a different world than the one you're familiar with.

Original: Tifa:He's right. And even though you may have met us before, it's still the first time for us.
Dialogue: He's right. And even though you may have met us before, it's still the first time for us.

Original: Terra:I still have no idea what a "Jiant" is...
Dialogue: I still have no idea what a "Jiant" is...

Original: Edgar:And forgive me for asking, but is the form you take...normal in your world?
Dialogue: And forgive me for asking, but is the form you take...normal in your world?

Original: Reynn:We're usually the same size as the rest of you, but we had to change to this form to fit the world we traveled to.
Dialogue: We're usually the same size as the rest of you, but we had to change to this form to fit the world we traveled to.

Original: Reynn:And for some reason, it seems like we just can't change back...
Dialogue: And for some reason, it seems like we just can't change back...

Original: Edgar:It sounds complicated, and it seems like you're in a tight spot as well. Let us help.
Dialogue: It sounds complicated, and it seems like you're in a tight spot as well. Let us help.

Original: Reynn:Thank you!
Dialogue: Thank you!

Original: Lann:I see...
Dialogue: I see...

Original: Reynn:Are you sure about that?
Dialogue: Are you sure about that?

Original: Lann:Aha ha ha! Of course I am! Someone, you know, needs our help!
Dialogue: Aha ha ha! Of course I am! Someone, you know, needs our help!

Original: Reynn:Yeah, and that person is YOU!
Dialogue: Yeah, and that person is YOU!

Original: Bartz:Haha! You guys are funny!
Dialogue: Haha! You guys are funny!

Original: Reynn:Me? Funny!?
Dialogue: Me? Funny!?

Original: Lann:It's so weird to see you without Boko, Bartz!
Dialogue: It's so weird to see you without Boko, Bartz!

Original: Bartz:You know Boko?
Dialogue: You know Boko?

Original: Lann:Of course! You two are always together!
Dialogue: Of course! You two are always together!

Original: Edgar:...So versions of us really do exist in your world.
Dialogue: ...So versions of us really do exist in your world.

Original: Edgar:And their similarities to us go far beyond our names and appearances.
Dialogue: And their similarities to us go far beyond our names and appearances.

Original: Tifa:Did you hear that? It sounds like there are monsters nearby!
Dialogue: Did you hear that? It sounds like there are monsters nearby!

Original: Edgar:You two had better hide.
Dialogue: You two had better hide.

Original: Lann:You got that right! We're not about to let you guys have all the fun.
Dialogue: You got that right! We're not about to let you guys have all the fun.

Original: Lann:Let's do this, Sis.
Dialogue: Let's do this, Sis.

Original: Reynn:Do you think we can win?
Dialogue: Do you think we can win?

Original: Lann:No doubt about it! Remember, we're not alone.
Dialogue: No doubt about it! Remember, we're not alone.

Original: Reynn:You're right. Let's go!
Dialogue: You're right. Let's go!

Original: Tidus:Whew! That should calm things down around here for a bit.
Dialogue: Whew! That should calm things down around here for a bit.

Original: Lann:Over already? Things really get done quick with you guys around!
Dialogue: Over already? Things really get done quick with you guys around!

Original: Quistis:We're happy to be of service.
Dialogue: We're happy to be of service.

Original: Lann:I guess we'll be seeing you guys around.
Dialogue: I guess we'll be seeing you guys around.

Original: Lightning:You're leaving?
Dialogue: You're leaving?

Original: Lann:Yep! But we'll be back soon.
Dialogue: Yep! But we'll be back soon.

Original: Quistis:Does that mean you've found a way to return to your world!?
Dialogue: Does that mean you've found a way to return to your world!?

Original: Lann:Yeah. Usually we just pass through the gate and... What the!? Where's the gate!?
Dialogue: Yeah. Usually we just pass through the gate and... What the!? Where's the gate!?

Original: Lann:How weird... The gate should be right here!
Dialogue: How weird... The gate should be right here!

Original: Reynn:You really weren't listening, were you? There's something we have to do in this world first.
Dialogue: You really weren't listening, were you? There's something we have to do in this world first.

Original: Lann:Seriously!? You mean no more shortcut? My legs are tired just thinking about it!
Dialogue: Seriously!? You mean no more shortcut? My legs are tired just thinking about it!

Original: Faris:What shortcut is he talking about?
Dialogue: What shortcut is he talking about?

Original: Reynn:Sorry about that. Just ignore him.
Dialogue: Sorry about that. Just ignore him.

Original: Faris:In any case, it looks like you two are also stuck here.
Dialogue: In any case, it looks like you two are also stuck here.

Original: Reynn:Yeah, I guess so.
Dialogue: Yeah, I guess so.

Original: Tidus:That means you're staying with us, right?
Dialogue: That means you're staying with us, right?

Original: Reynn:Yes! There's still so much I wanna know. It'll be nice traveling together again.
Dialogue: Yes! There's still so much I wanna know. It'll be nice traveling together again.

Original: Lightning:What's on your mind? Shocked you can't go home yet?
Dialogue: What's on your mind? Shocked you can't go home yet?

Original: Lann:No, it's not that. I've just noticed something terrible...
Dialogue: No, it's not that. I've just noticed something terrible...

Original: Quistis:What's that?
Dialogue: What's that?

Original: Lann:This isn't Grymoire, so we can't use the gate!
Dialogue: This isn't Grymoire, so we can't use the gate!

Original: Reynn:What do you mean you just noticed that? I said that a few minutes ago!
Dialogue: What do you mean you just noticed that? I said that a few minutes ago!

Original: Lann:Wh-what!? You mean everyone else knew?
Dialogue: Wh-what!? You mean everyone else knew?

Original: Reynn:...You'll have to forgive my brother. He can be a bit...slow at times.
Dialogue: ...You'll have to forgive my brother. He can be a bit...slow at times.

Original: Agrias:We are to work with the other team and bring down the band of monsters ahead with a pincer maneuver.
Dialogue: We are to work with the other team and bring down the band of monsters ahead with a pincer maneuver.

Original: Lann:A band of monsters? Well, that doesn't sound so bad. I wonder what kind of instruments they play!
Dialogue: A band of monsters? Well, that doesn't sound so bad. I wonder what kind of instruments they play!

Original: Reynn:You can't be serious right now!
Dialogue: You can't be serious right now!

Original: King:We're working out our battle tactics. A full-frontal attack would do nothing but tire us out.
Dialogue: We're working out our battle tactics. A full-frontal attack would do nothing but tire us out.

Original: Lann:Tire us out...? But I don't wanna get squished by tires!
Dialogue: Tire us out...? But I don't wanna get squished by tires!

Original: Reynn:It means "exhausted," not being flattened by wheels!
Dialogue: It means "exhausted," not being flattened by wheels!

Original: Reynn:Just nod and say "uh-huh," Lann.
Dialogue: Just nod and say "uh-huh," Lann.

Original: Reynn:We're getting nowhere fast by you asking these questions. Got it?
Dialogue: We're getting nowhere fast by you asking these questions. Got it?

Original: Zell:Let's leave the strategizing to them, Lann. I know they'll do a good job.
Dialogue: Let's leave the strategizing to them, Lann. I know they'll do a good job.

Original: Reynn:Now then, with the distractions out of the way, let's get on with the strategy meeting.
Dialogue: Now then, with the distractions out of the way, let's get on with the strategy meeting.

Original: Agrias:...Very well then.
Dialogue: ...Very well then.

Original: King:A pincer attack will only gather our enemies and give them the advantage of numbers.
Dialogue: A pincer attack will only gather our enemies and give them the advantage of numbers.

Original: Agrias:Precisely. It is an unwise plan for us, with so few people.
Dialogue: Precisely. It is an unwise plan for us, with so few people.

Original: Reynn:Why don't we lure in our enemies, starting with the closest, and shave off their numbers that way?
Dialogue: Why don't we lure in our enemies, starting with the closest, and shave off their numbers that way?

Original: King:Then I'll lure them in. I can grab their attention without getting too close.
Dialogue: Then I'll lure them in. I can grab their attention without getting too close.

Original: Agrias:If you lead them to us, we can thin them out by dropping rocks on them from our vantage point.
Dialogue: If you lead them to us, we can thin them out by dropping rocks on them from our vantage point.

Original: Zell:Lann and I could do the heavy lifting.
Dialogue: Lann and I could do the heavy lifting.

Original: Reynn:You can say more than "uh-huh" if you actually understand, you know.
Dialogue: You can say more than "uh-huh" if you actually understand, you know.

Original: Lann:Even though you told me not to!?
Dialogue: Even though you told me not to!?

Original: Agrias:Do not worry. I will go with you.
Dialogue: Do not worry. I will go with you.

Original: Reynn:I'll help King.
Dialogue: I'll help King.

Original: Agrias:Then let us commence the operation: eliminate the monsters.
Dialogue: Then let us commence the operation eliminate the monsters.

Original: Zell:It means we're going to bring down all the baddies.
Dialogue: It means we're going to bring down all the baddies.

Original: Lann:I get it! Your explanations are so easy to understand, Zell!
Dialogue: I get it! Your explanations are so easy to understand, Zell!

Original: Reynn:I don't think you really understand what's going on here, Lann...
Dialogue: I don't think you really understand what's going on here, Lann...

Original: Lann:Give me more credit than that! I was listening the whole time!
Dialogue: Give me more credit than that! I was listening the whole time!

Original: Zell:Then there's nothing to worry about. Let's do it, Lann.
Dialogue: Then there's nothing to worry about. Let's do it, Lann.

Original: Reynn:Really...? I'm not so sure, so could you stick with the
Dialogue: Really...? I'm not so sure, so could you stick with the—

Original: Lann:We're gonna beat down the baddies! Let's go!
Dialogue: We're gonna beat down the baddies! Let's go!

Original: Zell:Lann? Where are you going!?
Dialogue: Lann? Where are you going!?

Original: Reynn:I knew it! He has no idea what's going on! Lann!
Dialogue: I knew it! He has no idea what's going on! Lann!

Original: Vaan:What's going on!? Lann just ran straight at the enemy!
Dialogue: What's going on!? Lann just ran straight at the enemy!

Original: Agrias:What...! Could you let everyone know there's been a change of plans? A full-frontal assault...
Dialogue: What...! Could you let everyone know there's been a change of plans? A full-frontal assault...

Original: King:That fool... He reminds me of someone else I know...
Dialogue: That fool... He reminds me of someone else I know...

Original: Reynn:I'm really sorry for my brother...
Dialogue: I'm really sorry for my brother...

Original: Palom:Alright! Let's get out of here!
Dialogue: Alright! Let's get out of here!

Original: Lann:This is what happens when you scribble on monsters!
Dialogue: This is what happens when you scribble on monsters!

Original: Yuri:Phew... That was fun!
Dialogue: Phew... That was fun!

Original: Chelinka:Yuri! Where were you!? I heard something worrying about "scribbles"...
Dialogue: Yuri! Where were you!? I heard something worrying about "scribbles"...

Original: Yuri:Huh? Oh... We didn't do anything! Right?
Dialogue: Huh? Oh... We didn't do anything! Right?

Original: Lann:YES. WE DIDN'T. DO ANYTHING.
Dialogue: YES. WE DIDN'T. DO ANYTHING.

Original: Reynn:Blatantly suspicious...
Dialogue: Blatantly suspicious...

Original: Reynn:Could it be that someone was messing around with monsters, got found out, then tried to fight them...
Dialogue: Could it be that someone was messing around with monsters, got found out, then tried to fight them...

Original: Reynn:...Only to realize they were surrounded, then notice they were lost in a monster's den, and panicked...
Dialogue: ...Only to realize they were surrounded, then notice they were lost in a monster's den, and panicked...

Original: Reynn:...Then ran all the way back here trying to act like nothing at all happened?
Dialogue: ...Then ran all the way back here trying to act like nothing at all happened?

Original: Lann:That's so specific, Sis!
Dialogue: That's so specific, Sis!

Original: Lann:But, even if that were the case, we're totally fine! Right, Palom? Yuri?
Dialogue: But, even if that were the case, we're totally fine! Right, Palom? Yuri?

Original: Palom:Yeah! We're totally fine!
Dialogue: Yeah! We're totally fine!

Original: Reynn:I've got my hands full enough with Lann, but now these two, too...
Dialogue: I've got my hands full enough with Lann, but now these two, too...

Original: Chelinka:Hehe. I've been here for a while, so I'm used to it. But I know how you feel.
Dialogue: Hehe. I've been here for a while, so I'm used to it. But I know how you feel.

Original: Lann:Why are you on Chelinka's side anyway? She's so responsible.
Dialogue: Why are you on Chelinka's side anyway? She's so responsible.

Original: Reynn:What do you mean? I'm responsible, too, aren't I?
Dialogue: What do you mean? I'm responsible, too, aren't I?

Original: Chelinka:Yes, you definitely are!
Dialogue: Yes, you definitely are!

Original: Chelinka:I think we're the same. Though I don't know what happened to you two in the past...
Dialogue: I think we're the same. Though I don't know what happened to you two in the past...

Original: Yuri:I think so, too. I'm sure you've overcome some similar difficulties.
Dialogue: I think so, too. I'm sure you've overcome some similar difficulties.

Original: Yuri:And you're both scared of ghosts, too!
Dialogue: And you're both scared of ghosts, too!

Original: Chelinka:That has nothing to do with this! But...I'm sure there's something different about us, too.
Dialogue: That has nothing to do with this! But...I'm sure there's something different about us, too.

Original: Chelinka:It seems like Reynn kind of enjoys Lann's mischievousness.
Dialogue: It seems like Reynn kind of enjoys Lann's mischievousness.

Original: Lann:Really, Sis!?
Dialogue: Really, Sis!?

Original: Reynn:No no no no no! You've got it all wrong!
Dialogue: No no no no no! You've got it all wrong!

Original: Reynn:I wish you could calm down a bit and learn some manners, or at the very least not be a nuisance to others...
Dialogue: I wish you could calm down a bit and learn some manners, or at the very least not be a nuisance to others...

Original: Lann:That's mean!
Dialogue: That's mean!

Original: Palom:You're way too spoiled by your sisters.
Dialogue: You're way too spoiled by your sisters.

Original: Palom:Yeah, but I'm plenty responsible. She doesn't need to worry about me at all!
Dialogue: Yeah, but I'm plenty responsible. She doesn't need to worry about me at all!

Original: Palom:It must be hard having such immature little brothers.
Dialogue: It must be hard having such immature little brothers.

Original: Reynn:You know it.
Dialogue: You know it.

Original: Lann:I don't wanna hear that from Palom...
Dialogue: I don't wanna hear that from Palom...

Original: Yuri:I'm trying my best to be responsible...
Dialogue: I'm trying my best to be responsible...

Original: Chelinka:Palom's sister...
Dialogue: Palom's sister...

Original: Reynn:Hm? What about her?
Dialogue: Hm? What about her?

Original: Chelinka:I just thought it would be so much fun to meet her. I think we'd get along very well.
Dialogue: I just thought it would be so much fun to meet her. I think we'd get along very well.

Original: Palom:I'm sure she's around here somewhere. When you find her, I'm sure you'll be great friends!
Dialogue: I'm sure she's around here somewhere. When you find her, I'm sure you'll be great friends!

Original: Reynn:Yeah! Let's go find her on the double!
Dialogue: Yeah! Let's go find her on the double!

Original: Lann:Right! We don't want Palom to feel lonely being separated from his big sister for too long!
Dialogue: Right! We don't want Palom to feel lonely being separated from his big sister for too long!

Original: Lann:What?
Dialogue: What?

Original: Reynn:Nothing. Don't mind me!
Dialogue: Nothing. Don't mind me!

Original: The Emperor:So you, too, are siding with them? Those worthless worms...
Dialogue: So you, too, are siding with them? Those worthless worms...

Original: Vayne:How to keep the peace is an integral part in the upbringing of the men ofHouse Solidor.
Dialogue: How to keep the peace is an integral part in the upbringing of the men of House Solidor.

Original: Vayne:Those who stand above exist for those below them.
Dialogue: Those who stand above exist for those below them.

Original: Vayne:We must now reassess our duties with the crystal core of light gone.
Dialogue: We must now reassess our duties with the crystal core of light gone.

Original: The Emperor:Hmph... What role has duty when one has dominion?
Dialogue: Hmph... What role has duty when one has dominion?

Original: Firion:This looks like theplace where we met Cait Sithand the others.
Dialogue: This looks like the place where we met Cait Sith and the others.

Original: Onion Knight:It must have been created based on someone's home.
Dialogue: It must have been created based on someone's home.

Original: Vaan:It feels...imperial...
Dialogue: It feels...imperial...

Original: Ashe:It seems places like this are normal in other worlds.
Dialogue: It seems places like this are normal in other worlds.

Original: Vaan:Normal, huh...
Dialogue: Normal, huh...

Original: Mog:Why are you here, kupo!?
Dialogue: Why are you here, kupo!?

Original: Vayne:I understand you're distrustful of me.
Dialogue: I understand you're distrustful of me.

Original: Ashe:What are you doing here, Vayne!?
Dialogue: What are you doing here, Vayne!?

Original: Vayne:...I would like you to think of my appearance as my way of showing you my resolve.
Dialogue: ...I would like you to think of my appearance as my way of showing you my resolve.

Original: Vayne:If we continue to focus on our petty grudges, we will all miss out on the larger problem at hand.
Dialogue: If we continue to focus on our petty grudges, we will all miss out on the larger problem at hand.

Original: Vayne:However, I do not expect you to readily comprehend my meaning.
Dialogue: However, I do not expect you to readily comprehend my meaning.

Original: Onion Knight:Well, of course not. You need to tell us what you're talking about first before we can understand it.
Dialogue: Well, of course not. You need to tell us what you're talking about first before we can understand it.

Original: Firion:But considering how things got this way, it might not be easy...
Dialogue: But considering how things got this way, it might not be easy...

Original: Vaan:Like we could ever see eye to eye!
Dialogue: Like we could ever see eye to eye!

Original: Vaan:We don't have to listen to you!
Dialogue: We don't have to listen to you!

Original: Vayne:My aim is to protect my home, nothing more.
Dialogue: My aim is to protect my home, nothing more.

Original: Ashe:Do you know how much blood has been shed for that very reason!?
Dialogue: Do you know how much blood has been shed for that very reason!?

Original: Vayne:Not just the boy, but the princess, too... I suppose we cannot talk like civilized people with all that blood rushing to your head.
Dialogue: Not just the boy, but the princess, too... I suppose we cannot talk like civilized people with all that blood rushing to your head.

Original: Vayne:Be that as it may...
Dialogue: Be that as it may...

Original: Vayne:I'm afraid I must insist on you seeing the larger problem looming above us.
Dialogue: I'm afraid I must insist on you seeing the larger problem looming above us.

Original: Vayne:And to that aim, I will first give you the fight you want.
Dialogue: And to that aim, I will first give you the fight you want.

Original: Vaan:You'll pay for what you've done, Vayne!
Dialogue: You'll pay for what you've done, Vayne!

Original: Vaan:Ashe! Are you okay?
Dialogue: Ashe! Are you okay?

Original: Onion Knight:Is this your way of insisting? Just what is your purpose here?
Dialogue: Is this your way of insisting? Just what is your purpose here?

Original: Vayne:I've already told you: I must protect my home.
Dialogue: I've already told you I must protect my home.

Original: Vayne:This is for that purpose alone.
Dialogue: This is for that purpose alone.

Original: Firion:Mog, summon our allies.
Dialogue: Mog, summon our allies.

Original: Mog:I'm on it, kupo!
Dialogue: I'm on it, kupo!

Original: Onion Knight:I thought you were here to talk...but if it's a fight you want, it's a fight you'll get!
Dialogue: I thought you were here to talk...but if it's a fight you want, it's a fight you'll get!

Original: Vayne:I wouldn't have it any other way. Show me what you can do.
Dialogue: I wouldn't have it any other way. Show me what you can do.

Original: Vayne:I will discern for myself whether your strength is of any use to me.
Dialogue: I will discern for myself whether your strength is of any use to me.

Original: Vaan:Urgh!
Dialogue: Urgh!

Original: Balthier:Can you stand?
Dialogue: Can you stand?

Original: Vaan:Just what do you want!?
Dialogue: Just what do you want!?

Original: Vayne:I have already obtained what I want.
Dialogue: I have already obtained what I want.

Original: Onion Knight:What do you mean? Are you going to run away again?
Dialogue: What do you mean? Are you going to run away again?

Original: Vayne:Spirit moogle. These are my dimensional coordinates.
Dialogue: Spirit moogle. These are my dimensional coordinates.

Original: Mog:You mean you'll be our ally, kupo!?
Dialogue: You mean you'll be our ally, kupo!?

Original: Vayne:Call me freely should the need arise.
Dialogue: Call me freely should the need arise.

Original: Vaan:Just what are you scheming!?
Dialogue: Just what are you scheming!?

Original: Vayne:I no longer wish to play puppet to the gods.
Dialogue: I no longer wish to play puppet to the gods.

Original: Vaan:Answer the question!
Dialogue: Answer the question!

Original: Cait Sith:Let's settle down a bit, Vaan, hm?
Dialogue: Let's settle down a bit, Vaan, hm?

Original: Vaan:Why? Do you know something, Cait Sith?
Dialogue: Why? Do you know something, Cait Sith?

Original: Cait Sith:No. But if you won't let Vayne explain, none of us will ever know.
Dialogue: No. But if you won't let Vayne explain, none of us will ever know.

Original: Vaan:I see... So he hasn't even told you.
Dialogue: I see... So he hasn't even told you.

Original: Vayne:However, despite the shattering of the crystal core of light, everything here remains unchanged.
Dialogue: However, despite the shattering of the crystal core of light, everything here remains unchanged.

Original: Vayne:How things fare in our own worlds is yet a mystery to me.
Dialogue: How things fare in our own worlds is yet a mystery to me.

Original: Onion Knight:Materia said the crystal core of darkness is sustaining the world...for now.
Dialogue: Materia said the crystal core of darkness is sustaining the world...for now.

Original: Vayne:I am looking for the crystal core of darkness.
Dialogue: I am looking for the crystal core of darkness.

Original: Vayne:I cannot grasp the size of the threat looming over my homeworld. It is an unfortunately grave state of affairs.
Dialogue: I cannot grasp the size of the threat looming over my homeworld. It is an unfortunately grave state of affairs.

Original: Vayne:We need more information before we decide a course of action.
Dialogue: We need more information before we decide a course of action.

Original: Vayne:The fight against you earlier was a test of your strength. Of course, I leave the choice to call me to your discretion.
Dialogue: The fight against you earlier was a test of your strength. Of course, I leave the choice to call me to your discretion.

Original: Vayne:But I am not your enemy. Nor am I your ally. However, this arrangement works to our mutual advantage.
Dialogue: But I am not your enemy. Nor am I your ally. However, this arrangement works to our mutual advantage.

Original: Cait Sith:You certainly are a lad who loves his world. Even coming this far for it...
Dialogue: You certainly are a lad who loves his world. Even coming this far for it...

Original: Vaan:I can't accept this. I know he'll just get in our way again.
Dialogue: I can't accept this. I know he'll just get in our way again.

Original: Vaan:Throw those coordinates away, Mog. I refuse to fight alongside him.
Dialogue: Throw those coordinates away, Mog. I refuse to fight alongside him.

Original: Balthier:That's enough, Vaan. We're not throwing anything away.
Dialogue: That's enough, Vaan. We're not throwing anything away.

Original: Balthier:His Majesty went out of his way to present us a gift. We ought to accept it.
Dialogue: His Majesty went out of his way to present us a gift. We ought to accept it.

Original: Mog:In that case, I'll hold onto it...
Dialogue: In that case, I'll hold onto it...

Original: Vayne:It will be an honor to be of service.
Dialogue: It will be an honor to be of service.

Original: Balthier:Don't think this means we like it, though.
Dialogue: Don't think this means we like it, though.

Original: Vayne:It matters not to me. I wholeheartedly accept your hatred. I use my powers for Ivalice, not for the sake of friendship.
Dialogue: It matters not to me. I wholeheartedly accept your hatred. I use my powers for Ivalice, not for the sake of friendship.

Original: Vayne:But there are objectives I cannot fulfill with those summoned by Spiritus.
Dialogue: But there are objectives I cannot fulfill with those summoned by Spiritus.

Original: Vayne:Which is why I offer my power to you, in exchange for information.
Dialogue: Which is why I offer my power to you, in exchange for information.

Original: Balthier:Understand that we're not the ones being used. You are.
Dialogue: Understand that we're not the ones being used. You are.

Original: Vayne:Then I pray you use my power well.
Dialogue: Then I pray you use my power well.

Original: Balthier:Is it so hard for you to accept Vayne's help?
Dialogue: Is it so hard for you to accept Vayne's help?

Original: Vaan:Of course it is! Why isn't it for you?
Dialogue: Of course it is! Why isn't it for you?

Original: Ashe:Vayne is our enemy. It's not like we can readily fight alongside him...
Dialogue: Vayne is our enemy. It's not like we can readily fight alongside him...

Original: Cait Sith:Hmm... Think of it as insurance.
Dialogue: Hmm... Think of it as insurance.

Original: Balthier:Yes, I suppose that's one way to think about it.
Dialogue: Yes, I suppose that's one way to think about it.

Original: Penelo:What do you mean?
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Original: Cait Sith:Vayne's goal is clear.
Dialogue: Vayne's goal is clear.

Original: Cait Sith:If we do nothing about the disorder in this world, it could affect our homes.
Dialogue: If we do nothing about the disorder in this world, it could affect our homes.

Original: Cait Sith:And if harm is done to our homeworlds, then...
Dialogue: And if harm is done to our homeworlds, then...

Original: Cait Sith:This world and all the warriors within it could be erased.
Dialogue: This world and all the warriors within it could be erased.

Original: Cait Sith:Or at least that's what he told me before.
Dialogue: Or at least that's what he told me before.

Original: Vaan:We can't let that happen...
Dialogue: We can't let that happen...

Original: Balthier:Then you understand. The time to put that grudge to pasture is now at hand.
Dialogue: Then you understand. The time to put that grudge to pasture is now at hand.

Original: Balthier:We have his dimensional coordinates, which means we know where he is.
Dialogue: We have his dimensional coordinates, which means we know where he is.

Original: Balthier:It's better than not knowing, correct?
Dialogue: It's better than not knowing, correct?

Original: Ashe:Even so... It's hard to just put all that history behind us...
Dialogue: Even so... It's hard to just put all that history behind us...

Original: Cait Sith:Spiritus's warriors always have all our info, so all the more reason to put it behind you.
Dialogue: Spiritus's warriors always have all our info, so all the more reason to put it behind you.

Original: Vincent:Information even they can't know...
Dialogue: Information even they can't know...

Original: Balthier:After all, it's not like they'll come together to decide their next move.
Dialogue: After all, it's not like they'll come together to decide their next move.

Original: Vincent:Indeed. Our enemies move alone. And we'll have more options if we can keep an eye on them.
Dialogue: Indeed. Our enemies move alone. And we'll have more options if we can keep an eye on them.

Original: Vincent:Cait Sith... You're acquainted with him.
Dialogue: Cait Sith... You're acquainted with him.

Original: Cait Sith:You got the right of it, Vincent!
Dialogue: You got the right of it, Vincent!

Original: Cait Sith:I'll keep my eyes on the man! Just leave it to Cait Sith!
Dialogue: I'll keep my eyes on the man! Just leave it to Cait Sith!

Original: Cait Sith:I know how politicians like him work.
Dialogue: I know how politicians like him work.

Original: Penelo:Still, I can't help but worry...
Dialogue: Still, I can't help but worry...

Original: Vincent:Don't force yourselves to accept it. The fact that he's an enemy won't change.
Dialogue: Don't force yourselves to accept it. The fact that he's an enemy won't change.

Original: Balthier:As does the fact that our troubles never cease to multiply.
Dialogue: As does the fact that our troubles never cease to multiply.

Original: Balthier:Nevertheless, we'll keep an eye on Vayne while saving the world. Playing the leading man was never an easy job.
Dialogue: Nevertheless, we'll keep an eye on Vayne while saving the world. Playing the leading man was never an easy job.

Original: Cait Sith:We know that your feelings toward him aren't wrong. But leave it to me. I'll find out his true intentions.
Dialogue: We know that your feelings toward him aren't wrong. But leave it to me. I'll find out his true intentions.

Original: Wakka:Oh no! There's that guy again!
Dialogue: Oh no! There's that guy again!

Original: Lightning:Why are you here? We didn't call you.
Dialogue: Why are you here? We didn't call you.

Original: Vayne:I have no intention of hindering you here and now.
Dialogue: I have no intention of hindering you here and now.

Original: Vayne:I am simply interested in the memories you hold.
Dialogue: I am simply interested in the memories you hold.

Original: Serah:Our memories?
Dialogue: Our memories?

Original: Vayne:I heard that people from the same world don't always have the same memories.
Dialogue: I heard that people from the same world don't always have the same memories.

Original: Lightning:Word gets around quickly, I see.
Dialogue: Word gets around quickly, I see.

Original: Vayne:I had my doubts, but if you say it to be true...
Dialogue: I had my doubts, but if you say it to be true...

Original: Serah:What do you get by poking your nose in our business?
Dialogue: What do you get by poking your nose in our business?

Original: Vayne:...Forgive me. I am not free to choose my purpose.
Dialogue: ...Forgive me. I am not free to choose my purpose.

Original: Lightning:There is nothing I know that you don't already.
Dialogue: There is nothing I know that you don't already.

Original: Lightning:What you want to believe is up to you.
Dialogue: What you want to believe is up to you.

Original: Vayne:...I choose to believe you.
Dialogue: ...I choose to believe you.

Original: Vayne:What say you two? Have you any abnormalities in your memories?
Dialogue: What say you two? Have you any abnormalities in your memories?

Original: Wakka:What am I supposed to say to that, huh? ...Any idea, Yuna?
Dialogue: What am I supposed to say to that, huh? ...Any idea, Yuna?

Original: Yuna:I wonder. I feel like I'm still missing something...
Dialogue: I wonder. I feel like I'm still missing something...

Original: Wakka:You serious!? ...Hmm, I don't know.
Dialogue: You serious!? ...Hmm, I don't know.

Original: Lightning:There's no point in worrying about what we don't know. What are you scheming?
Dialogue: There's no point in worrying about what we don't know. What are you scheming?

Original: Vayne:I am interested in the memory discrepancies of the warriors here.
Dialogue: I am interested in the memory discrepancies of the warriors here.

Original: Vayne:Notwithstanding the circumstances of Ivalice...of House Solidor and my homeland, there may be things I have forgotten.
Dialogue: Notwithstanding the circumstances of Ivalice...of House Solidor and my homeland, there may be things I have forgotten.

Original: Wakka:You mean even Spiritus's warriors have lost their memories?
Dialogue: You mean even Spiritus's warriors have lost their memories?

Original: Vayne:...The key to retrieving your lost memories lies in brilliance, does it not?
Dialogue: ...The key to retrieving your lost memories lies in brilliance, does it not?

Original: Lightning:And what if it does? Gathering brilliance will revive the crystal core. It doesn't suit your purposes.
Dialogue: And what if it does? Gathering brilliance will revive the crystal core. It doesn't suit your purposes.

Original: Vayne:Just because it fails to suit my purposes doesn't make it extraneous. All the more when it comes to my own memories.
Dialogue: Just because it fails to suit my purposes doesn't make it extraneous. All the more when it comes to my own memories.

Original: Vayne:I want to know the current state of my homeland. I must remember what I did, at the very least.
Dialogue: I want to know the current state of my homeland. I must remember what I did, at the very least.

Original: Vayne:Matters of this world will come later.
Dialogue: Matters of this world will come later.

Original: Vayne:Thank you for your time.
Dialogue: Thank you for your time.

Original: Yuna:You're quite the conversationalist.
Dialogue: You're quite the conversationalist.

Original: Vayne:Despite appearances...
Dialogue: Despite appearances...

Original: Vayne:The conflict in my homeworld was due merely to a difference of opinions.
Dialogue: The conflict in my homeworld was due merely to a difference of opinions.

Original: Vayne:Now, I think we ought to be building a partnership. I intend to tell you what I can.
Dialogue: Now, I think we ought to be building a partnership. I intend to tell you what I can.

Original: Vayne:You may not believe me now, but there may come a day when we join hands.
Dialogue: You may not believe me now, but there may come a day when we join hands.

Original: Bartz:This one won't go down easy!
Dialogue: This one won't go down easy!

Original: Lion:It's not that tough... Can you keep going?
Dialogue: It's not that tough... Can you keep going?

Original: Hope:Haha, I'm not so sure...
Dialogue: Haha, I'm not so sure...

Original: Lion:What are you doing!? You can't just appear in front of us like that!
Dialogue: What are you doing!? You can't just appear in front of us like that!

Original: Warrior of Light:We must all work together to stop an opponent this strong.
Dialogue: We must all work together to stop an opponent this strong.

Original: Bartz:You don't have to tell me that! I know we can't let this thing roam around free!
Dialogue: You don't have to tell me that! I know we can't let this thing roam around free!

Original: Hope:Another attack!? At this rate...
Dialogue: Another attack!? At this rate...

Original: Vayne:Stand back.
Dialogue: Stand back.

Original: Vayne:I will take the front lines while you catch your breath.
Dialogue: I will take the front lines while you catch your breath.

Original: Hope:You came to help us?
Dialogue: You came to help us?

Original: Lion:Just what are you trying to do?
Dialogue: Just what are you trying to do?

Original: Vayne:It would be problematic for me if you fell in battle here.
Dialogue: It would be problematic for me if you fell in battle here.

Original: Vayne:I would hate to see mankind's history end in this world...!
Dialogue: I would hate to see mankind's history end in this world...!

Original: Bartz:So you're our ally now?
Dialogue: So you're our ally now?

Original: Vayne:At present, I am merely not your enemy.
Dialogue: At present, I am merely not your enemy.

Original: Warrior of Light:I'm ready. Let's go!
Dialogue: I'm ready. Let's go!

Original: Bartz:Looks like we cleaned that up!
Dialogue: Looks like we cleaned that up!

Original: Lion:That was a close one, though. Thank you...Vayne...?
Dialogue: That was a close one, though. Thank you...Vayne...?

Original: Hope:I don't see him anywhere.
Dialogue: I don't see him anywhere.

Original: Warrior of Light:It seems he left.
Dialogue: It seems he left.

Original: Hope:He really did come to help us this time.
Dialogue: He really did come to help us this time.

Original: Lion:That might just be hi way of doing things. He's a politician, right? It's possible he's trying to win us over somehow.
Dialogue: That might just be hi way of doing things. He's a politician, right? It's possible he's trying to win us over somehow.

Original: Lion:Though it could just be a way of furthering his own ends.
Dialogue: Though it could just be a way of furthering his own ends.

Original: Hope:Well, he's definitely got the eloquence and actions to bring people together...
Dialogue: Well, he's definitely got the eloquence and actions to bring people together...

Original: Lion:Even so, he started a war and killed lots of people in Vaan's world.
Dialogue: Even so, he started a war and killed lots of people in Vaan's world.

Original: Warrior of Light:...He's willing to do whatever it takes for his own purposes.
Dialogue: ...He's willing to do whatever it takes for his own purposes.

Original: Warrior of Light:He is always thinking of a way to fulfill his duties, even if it means hurting people...
Dialogue: He is always thinking of a way to fulfill his duties, even if it means hurting people...

Original: Warrior of Light:You might say he has an ominous light about him.
Dialogue: You might say he has an ominous light about him.

Original: Bartz:For now, he said he's not our enemy. He saved us, so...let's just go with that.
Dialogue: For now, he said he's not our enemy. He saved us, so...let's just go with that.

Original: Bartz:But if he dares hurt Vaan, Penelo, or any of the others...I won't hesitate to fight.
Dialogue: But if he dares hurt Vaan, Penelo, or any of the others...I won't hesitate to fight.

Original: Lion:Of course. I can't just sit back and watch while others get hurt.
Dialogue: Of course. I can't just sit back and watch while others get hurt.

Original: Lion:Why don't we head back now? It's time we got some rest!
Dialogue: Why don't we head back now? It's time we got some rest!

Original: Prishe:Not again...!
Dialogue: Not again...!

Original: Prishe:No matter which way we go, we just can't get through.
Dialogue: No matter which way we go, we just can't get through.

Original: Maria:It seems like we're in the depths of the forest now.
Dialogue: It seems like we're in the depths of the forest now.

Original: Freya:Indeed. The structure has become unexpectedly complex.
Dialogue: Indeed. The structure has become unexpectedly complex.

Original: Auron:We've walked quite a distance. Have we lost anyone?
Dialogue: We've walked quite a distance. Have we lost anyone?

Original: Y'shtola:...No. Everyone's accounted for.
Dialogue: ...No. Everyone's accounted for.

Original: Prishe:I've had enough of this place! It's taking ages just to find the way out.
Dialogue: I've had enough of this place! It's taking ages just to find the way out.

Original: Prishe:Let's just knock these trees down and friggin' make our own path!
Dialogue: Let's just knock these trees down and friggin' make our own path!

Original: Fran:You will only anger the wood.
Dialogue: You will only anger the wood.

Original: Prishe:Who are you?
Dialogue: Who are you?

Original: Y'shtola:Are you familiar with these woods?
Dialogue: Are you familiar with these woods?

Original: Fran:Walk that way and you will be free of this place.
Dialogue: Walk that way and you will be free of this place.

Original: Maria:Just who are you?
Dialogue: Just who are you?

Original: Fran:You need not believe me if you wish not to do so.
Dialogue: You need not believe me if you wish not to do so.

Original: Auron:I don't feel like you would lead us astray...
Dialogue: I don't feel like you would lead us astray...

Original: Fran:Such a feeling is for you to decide.
Dialogue: Such a feeling is for you to decide.

Original: Prishe:Well, let's give it a try! Not like we have any other choices!
Dialogue: Well, let's give it a try! Not like we have any other choices!

Original: Freya:You make a fair point. Let us put our faith in this woman's words.
Dialogue: You make a fair point. Let us put our faith in this woman's words.

Original: Fran:Then I will be on my way.
Dialogue: Then I will be on my way.

Original: Maria:Why don't you come with us? There's safety in numbers.
Dialogue: Why don't you come with us? There's safety in numbers.

Original: Fran:I must decline.
Dialogue: I must decline.

Original: Freya:...I see. Thank you for your help.
Dialogue: ...I see. Thank you for your help.

Original: Maria:Are you sure? Don't you think she could be a friend of someone? Is it okay for us to just leave her?
Dialogue: Are you sure? Don't you think she could be a friend of someone? Is it okay for us to just leave her?

Original: Y'shtola:...I think she'll be fine on her own.
Dialogue: ...I think she'll be fine on her own.

Original: Freya:...Then we will take our leave. Until our paths meet again.
Dialogue: ...Then we will take our leave. Until our paths meet again.

Original: Fran:Yes. Until that time...
Dialogue: Yes. Until that time...

Original: Vanille:Well, that was easy! And we have that woman to thank for it.
Dialogue: Well, that was easy! And we have that woman to thank for it.

Original: Edgar:She sounds like an absolute beauty. I would love to thank her in person!
Dialogue: She sounds like an absolute beauty. I would love to thank her in person!

Original: Fran:It seems you made it out fine.
Dialogue: It seems you made it out fine.

Original: Zidane:Are you the mysterious lady who helped them out?
Dialogue: Are you the mysterious lady who helped them out?

Original: Balthier:Aha. So it was you, Fran.
Dialogue: Aha. So it was you, Fran.

Original: Cid:You know her?
Dialogue: You know her?

Original: Balthier:But of course. She's my partner.
Dialogue: But of course. She's my partner.

Original: Cid:Huh? This lady, YOUR partner?
Dialogue: Huh? This lady, YOUR partner?

Original: Vanille:If we had known you were partners, we would have brought you along!
Dialogue: If we had known you were partners, we would have brought you along!

Original: Fran:I did not think you one to wander the earth so.
Dialogue: I did not think you one to wander the earth so.

Original: Balthier:It's nice to gaze up at the heavens once in a while.
Dialogue: It's nice to gaze up at the heavens once in a while.

Original: Cid:What's the point in lyin'? Ain't got one fit for flyin' is all...
Dialogue: What's the point in lyin'? Ain't got one fit for flyin' is all...

Original: Zidane:But if Balthier's a sky pirate...
Dialogue: But if Balthier's a sky pirate...

Original: Vanille:And Fran's his partner, then that makes her one, too!
Dialogue: And Fran's his partner, then that makes her one, too!

Original: Edgar:If you knew Balthier was here, why didn't you join him?
Dialogue: If you knew Balthier was here, why didn't you join him?

Original: Balthier:You did not take Materia on her word and were biding your time observing us until you were sure.
Dialogue: You did not take Materia on her word and were biding your time observing us until you were sure.

Original: Fran:That's right.
Dialogue: That's right.

Original: Zidane:Well, if you're a friend of Balthier's, you're a friend of ours.
Dialogue: Well, if you're a friend of Balthier's, you're a friend of ours.

Original: Balthier:That is up to Fran to decide.
Dialogue: That is up to Fran to decide.

Original: Vanille:In any case, you really knew your way around that forest.
Dialogue: In any case, you really knew your way around that forest.

Original: Edgar:Thanks to you, we can all move forward together now.
Dialogue: Thanks to you, we can all move forward together now.

Original: Balthier:Try as you may, Edgar, but this one is no easy prey.
Dialogue: Try as you may, Edgar, but this one is no easy prey.

Original: Balthier:Now then, you've probably already realized it, but it's as the goddess said: this is a different world.
Dialogue: Now then, you've probably already realized it, but it's as the goddess said this is a different world.

Original: Balthier:Can you hear the voice of the wood here?
Dialogue: Can you hear the voice of the wood here?

Original: Fran:No, I cannot. I know only the way through...
Dialogue: No, I cannot. I know only the way through...

Original: Fran:But it seems that unwanted guests followed you out of the woods.
Dialogue: But it seems that unwanted guests followed you out of the woods.

Original: Balthier:Are you certain they didn't follow you?
Dialogue: Are you certain they didn't follow you?

Original: Fran:Does it matter now?
Dialogue: Does it matter now?

Original: Fran:I will take care of them. Stand back.
Dialogue: I will take care of them. Stand back.

Original: Zidane:We'll fight with you!
Dialogue: We'll fight with you!

Original: Edgar:We must repay you for showing our friends the way out of the woods.
Dialogue: We must repay you for showing our friends the way out of the woods.

Original: Vanille:That's right!
Dialogue: That's right!

Original: Balthier:...How about it, Fran? Will you join our ranks?
Dialogue: ...How about it, Fran? Will you join our ranks?

Original: Fran:I will. You are here, too, after all.
Dialogue: I will. You are here, too, after all.

Original: Yda:Thanks to Fran, we were able to make it this deep into the woods!
Dialogue: Thanks to Fran, we were able to make it this deep into the woods!

Original: Yda:Now we can get back without getting lost!
Dialogue: Now we can get back without getting lost!

Original: Onion Knight:That's a relief. It's dangerous wandering around here for too long.
Dialogue: That's a relief. It's dangerous wandering around here for too long.

Original: Garnet:I'm happy we have such a skilled ally among us now.
Dialogue: I'm happy we have such a skilled ally among us now.

Original: Yda:I wish we had met her sooner!
Dialogue: I wish we had met her sooner!

Original: Fran:Hearing such praise is pleasant. But know that I do not know my way around every forest.
Dialogue: Hearing such praise is pleasant. But know that I do not know my way around every forest.

Original: Yda:What do you mean?
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Original: Onion Knight:The fact that you followed us without saying a word means you know the way back, right?
Dialogue: The fact that you followed us without saying a word means you know the way back, right?

Original: Fran:I assumed the one at the front knew the way.
Dialogue: I assumed the one at the front knew the way.

Original: Garnet:Oh no! At this rate, we'll all get lost...
Dialogue: Oh no! At this rate, we'll all get lost...

Original: Yda:Let's go back, then! If we keep going forward, we'll forget how we got here.
Dialogue: Let's go back, then! If we keep going forward, we'll forget how we got here.

Original: Papalymo:Fret not, Yda. I know the way back.
Dialogue: Fret not, Yda. I know the way back.

Original: Papalymo:As do you. Am I right?
Dialogue: As do you. Am I right?

Original: Fran:You are. My apologies for toying with you.
Dialogue: You are. My apologies for toying with you.

Original: Fran:There is no need to rush back. Panic will lead you down the wrong path.
Dialogue: There is no need to rush back. Panic will lead you down the wrong path.

Original: Garnet:What a relief... I'm sorry for panicking.
Dialogue: What a relief... I'm sorry for panicking.

Original: Fran:But please do not assume I know everything about the woods.
Dialogue: But please do not assume I know everything about the woods.

Original: Fran:I can no longer hear the green word...
Dialogue: I can no longer hear the green word...

Original: Papalymo:You needn't say anything if you do not wish to.
Dialogue: You needn't say anything if you do not wish to.

Original: Fran:...Thank you.
Dialogue: ...Thank you.

Original: Onion Knight:So what do we do now? Should we go back?
Dialogue: So what do we do now? Should we go back?

Original: Papalymo:There is no need for that. Both Fran and I know the way.
Dialogue: There is no need for that. Both Fran and I know the way.

Original: Onion Knight:Then let's explore a little more. I'll lead the way!
Dialogue: Then let's explore a little more. I'll lead the way!

Original: Yda:We're going to keep going? Well, could you let us know before we reach the point of no return!?
Dialogue: We're going to keep going? Well, could you let us know before we reach the point of no return!?

Original: Garnet:We'll do our best to help.
Dialogue: We'll do our best to help.

Original: Fran:...A lively bunch.
Dialogue: ...A lively bunch.

Original: Papalymo:But they're friendly, aren't they?
Dialogue: But they're friendly, aren't they?

Original: Papalymo:And you made a choice to lend us your powers when you decided to travel with us.
Dialogue: And you made a choice to lend us your powers when you decided to travel with us.

Original: Fran:...I have no regrets. I look forward to seeing what this world has to offer.
Dialogue: ...I have no regrets. I look forward to seeing what this world has to offer.

Original: Lion:Huh? What could Cater and Wakka be talking about?
Dialogue: Huh? What could Cater and Wakka be talking about?

Original: Y'shtola:Idle banter, most likely.
Dialogue: Idle banter, most likely.

Original: Fran:Though it seems as if they wish to keep it a secret.
Dialogue: Though it seems as if they wish to keep it a secret.

Original: Freya:If they have gone through the trouble of coming all the way here, we best not interfere.
Dialogue: If they have gone through the trouble of coming all the way here, we best not interfere.

Original: Cater:Did you hear us!?
Dialogue: Did you hear us!?

Original: Wakka:That's why I told you to give up already.
Dialogue: That's why I told you to give up already.

Original: Fran:You were talking about our ears, weren't you?
Dialogue: You were talking about our ears, weren't you?

Original: Cater:So you did hear us!
Dialogue: So you did hear us!

Original: Y'shtola:I suppose it's safe to say our kind aren't very common in your worlds.
Dialogue: I suppose it's safe to say our kind aren't very common in your worlds.

Original: Freya:Does it not interest you, Lion?
Dialogue: Does it not interest you, Lion?

Original: Cater:We weren't talking about anything weird, just so you know.
Dialogue: We weren't talking about anything weird, just so you know.

Original: Cater:I just wanted to know...if I can touch your ears. So can I?
Dialogue: I just wanted to know...if I can touch your ears. So can I?

Original: Wakka:I told you it's not gonna happen. They have pride, too, y'know.
Dialogue: I told you it's not gonna happen. They have pride, too, y'know.

Original: Wakka:You gotta respect that.
Dialogue: You gotta respect that.

Original: Cater:I know, but...
Dialogue: I know, but...

Original: Fran:No, indeed.
Dialogue: No, indeed.

Original: Y'shtola:I will have to decline as well.
Dialogue: I will have to decline as well.

Original: Freya:As will I.
Dialogue: As will I.

Original: Wakka:I told you so.
Dialogue: I told you so.

Original: Cater:But it's too soon to give up. Maybe when they're asleep...
Dialogue: But it's too soon to give up. Maybe when they're asleep...

Original: Wakka:C'mon, you can't do that!
Dialogue: C'mon, you can't do that!

Original: Lion:You seem pretty terrible at keeping secrets. Your plan sounds doomed to fail.
Dialogue: You seem pretty terrible at keeping secrets. Your plan sounds doomed to fail.

Original: Fran:But I believe it good to be interested in species other than our own.
