Original: Onion Knight:Don't worry about it. Are you looking for someone? Maybe we can help.
Dialogue: Don't worry about it. Are you looking for someone? Maybe we can help.

Original: Papalymo:An automaton...? Isn't that a puppet weapon?
Dialogue: An automaton...? Isn't that a puppet weapon?

Original: Papalymo:...I see. If you're looking for them, then that must mean you've lost control of them.
Dialogue: ...I see. If you're looking for them, then that must mean you've lost control of them.

Original: Aphmau:For other automatons, that might be the case. But not mine.
Dialogue: For other automatons, that might be the case. But not mine.

Original: Aphmau:They move on their own will. But they won't harm others, so don't be afraid.
Dialogue: They move on their own will. But they won't harm others, so don't be afraid.

Original: Vivi:They're puppets with their own will?
Dialogue: They're puppets with their own will?

Original: Vivi:So they have souls, too...
Dialogue: So they have souls, too...

Original: Warrior of Light:Existences without wills can still have souls...
Dialogue: Existences without wills can still have souls...

Original: Papalymo:...Understood. We believe you. Where did you lose sight of them?
Dialogue: ...Understood. We believe you. Where did you lose sight of them?

Original: Aphmau:I'm not sure... When I came to, I couldn't hear their voices anymore.
Dialogue: I'm not sure... When I came to, I couldn't hear their voices anymore.

Original: Onion Knight:Do you know which direction you came from? We can go back together.
Dialogue: Do you know which direction you came from? We can go back together.

Original: Vivi:Aht Urhgan... Is that where you live?
Dialogue: Aht Urhgan... Is that where you live?

Original: Aphmau:You haven't heard of Aht Urhgan?
Dialogue: You haven't heard of Aht Urhgan?

Original: Aphmau:Just how far from home am I...?
Dialogue: Just how far from home am I...?

Original: Warrior of Light:You may be the only one familiar with that place.
Dialogue: You may be the only one familiar with that place.

Original: Papalymo:...Hmm. Perhaps she got separated from her automatons before arriving here.
Dialogue: ...Hmm. Perhaps she got separated from her automatons before arriving here.

Original: Onion Knight:But if she can't remember when they last saw each other, they might be here.
Dialogue: But if she can't remember when they last saw each other, they might be here.

Original: Onion Knight:And from the looks of it, she hasn't spoken to Materia...
Dialogue: And from the looks of it, she hasn't spoken to Materia...

Original: Aphmau:What's that? Did you figure something out?
Dialogue: What's that? Did you figure something out?

Original: Onion Knight:Well... We need to tell you something that might be a bit hard to believe, but rest assured your automatons are probably fine.
Dialogue: Well... We need to tell you something that might be a bit hard to believe, but rest assured your automatons are probably fine.

Original: Aphmau:Since you were nice enough to believe me, I'll listen as best as I can.
Dialogue: Since you were nice enough to believe me, I'll listen as best as I can.

Original: Onion Knight:Great. It's a long story, but...
Dialogue: Great. It's a long story, but...

Original: Aphmau:W-what!? A different world... Will I ever get back home?
Dialogue: W-what!? A different world... Will I ever get back home?

Original: Zidane:We're sorry. Please don't cry...
Dialogue: We're sorry. Please don't cry...

Original: Snow:Stay calm. Breathe in... Now breathe out and release all your worries.
Dialogue: Stay calm. Breathe in... Now breathe out and release all your worries.

Original: Aphmau:I left my friends behind... Oh no...
Dialogue: I left my friends behind... Oh no...

Original: Firion:I understand. It must be hard being separated from those close to you...
Dialogue: I understand. It must be hard being separated from those close to you...

Original: Firion:But there's no need to worry. I was reunited with my friends here, too.
Dialogue: But there's no need to worry. I was reunited with my friends here, too.

Original: Aphmau:You're right... I'm sure someone will Ah!
Dialogue: You're right... I'm sure someone will— Ah!

Original: Aphmau:What should I do? What if they find out I snuck out in disguise...!?
Dialogue: What should I do? What if they find out I snuck out in disguise...!?

Original: Aphmau:I need to get back quickly.
Dialogue: I need to get back quickly.

Original: Penelo:We're looking for a way home now. If you come with us, you're sure to get back.
Dialogue: We're looking for a way home now. If you come with us, you're sure to get back.

Original: Aphmau:Everyone? In that case, I'll go with you.
Dialogue: Everyone? In that case, I'll go with you.

Original: Zidane:When you say you snuck out in disguise...does that mean you're a princess or something?
Dialogue: When you say you snuck out in disguise...does that mean you're a princess or something?

Original: Aphmau:Me!? N-no... Definitely not...
Dialogue: Me!? N-no... Definitely not...

Original: Zidane:Alright. Sorry for the dumb question. We'll just assume you're an ordinary girl.
Dialogue: Alright. Sorry for the dumb question. We'll just assume you're an ordinary girl.

Original: Penelo:...Actually, you're wearing some very pretty clothes, so I thought you were someone of social status.
Dialogue: ...Actually, you're wearing some very pretty clothes, so I thought you were someone of social status.

Original: Penelo:But if you don't want anyone to know, we won't ask anymore. Everyone has their reasons.
Dialogue: But if you don't want anyone to know, we won't ask anymore. Everyone has their reasons.

Original: Aphmau:Really...? I'm happy that people from different worlds are nice, too.
Dialogue: Really...? I'm happy that people from different worlds are nice, too.

Original: Firion:Well, it doesn't seem like you would lie to us. And it's not like you're trying to set us up or anything, right?
Dialogue: Well, it doesn't seem like you would lie to us. And it's not like you're trying to set us up or anything, right?

Original: Firion:...Hm? What's the matter?
Dialogue: ...Hm? What's the matter?

Original: Aphmau:Different worlds...
Dialogue: Different worlds...

Original: Aphmau:This is a different world...!
Dialogue: This is a different world...!

Original: Snow:What's up? You seem happy all of a sudden.
Dialogue: What's up? You seem happy all of a sudden.

Original: Aphmau:You don't know who I am, so I can act however I want, right?
Dialogue: You don't know who I am, so I can act however I want, right?

Original: Penelo:What do you mean?
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Original: Aphmau:Normally, I can't be myself. If I don't conduct myself with dignity, I get scolded.
Dialogue: Normally, I can't be myself. If I don't conduct myself with dignity, I get scolded.

Original: Zidane:So you're just playing a part. There's no need for that here.
Dialogue: So you're just playing a part. There's no need for that here.

Original: Penelo:I see... You can't walk about normally...
Dialogue: I see... You can't walk about normally...

Original: Penelo:You don't have to hold back here.
Dialogue: You don't have to hold back here.

Original: Aphmau:Thank you. I feel so much more at ease!
Dialogue: Thank you. I feel so much more at ease!

Original: Aphmau:Even if I cry, my problems won't be solved...
Dialogue: Even if I cry, my problems won't be solved...

Original: Aphmau:So until I find a way home, I'll enjoy this world to the fullest!
Dialogue: So until I find a way home, I'll enjoy this world to the fullest!

Original: Snow:That's the spirit! I'm happy you could turn this around.
Dialogue: That's the spirit! I'm happy you could turn this around.

Original: Aphmau:It's my friends' advice, so I don't want to prove them wrong.
Dialogue: It's my friends' advice, so I don't want to prove them wrong.

Original: Aphmau:Wow! You defeated them so quickly! You guys are amazing!
Dialogue: Wow! You defeated them so quickly! You guys are amazing!

Original: Setzer:Hey... I thought I told you to be careful...
Dialogue: Hey... I thought I told you to be careful...

Original: Bartz:What's going on here? Looks like you're all having fun!
Dialogue: What's going on here? Looks like you're all having fun!

Original: Setzer:Don't be ridiculous. We came here to help.
Dialogue: Don't be ridiculous. We came here to help.

Original: Setzer:This lady carelessly brought monsters along with her.
Dialogue: This lady carelessly brought monsters along with her.

Original: Aphmau:I was so curious what was back there, so I just had to check it out!
Dialogue: I was so curious what was back there, so I just had to check it out!

Original: Bartz:A curious kid, I see... I understand. I also want to explore the world.
Dialogue: A curious kid, I see... I understand. I also want to explore the world.

Original: Bartz:Your elders just need to keep an eye out for you.
Dialogue: Your elders just need to keep an eye out for you.

Original: Cater:I know how you feel, too, but next time you should go with someone.
Dialogue: I know how you feel, too, but next time you should go with someone.

Original: Ramza:Agreed. We must scout ahead and look for danger. Thoughtless actions could put our comrades at risk.
Dialogue: Agreed. We must scout ahead and look for danger. Thoughtless actions could put our comrades at risk.

Original: Aphmau:You're right... I'm sorry. I always get scolded for being careless...
Dialogue: You're right... I'm sorry. I always get scolded for being careless...

Original: Aphmau:Even though I try to do good, I always end up making a mess of things...
Dialogue: Even though I try to do good, I always end up making a mess of things...

Original: Ramza:If you really think so, you should consider your actions more carefully. People scold you because they care.
Dialogue: If you really think so, you should consider your actions more carefully. People scold you because they care.

Original: Aphmau:Because they care... I see. I don't want them to worry.
Dialogue: Because they care... I see. I don't want them to worry.

Original: Bartz:I think it's fine to do whatever you want.
Dialogue: I think it's fine to do whatever you want.

Original: Bartz:There are things that move you down to your core. You shouldn't suppress those feelings.
Dialogue: There are things that move you down to your core. You shouldn't suppress those feelings.

Original: Setzer:True... I occasionally indulged in dangerous pastimes long ago. You don't look before you leap when you're young.
Dialogue: True... I occasionally indulged in dangerous pastimes long ago. You don't look before you leap when you're young.

Original: Ramza:Not you too, Setzer...
Dialogue: Not you too, Setzer...

Original: Aphmau:Hehe. I'm happy it's not just me!
Dialogue: Hehe. I'm happy it's not just me!

Original: Ramza:But still, you can't go on your own, especially to dangerous places like these.
Dialogue: But still, you can't go on your own, especially to dangerous places like these.

Original: Cater:Well, aren't we overprotective?
Dialogue: Well, aren't we overprotective?

Original: Ramza:Yes... You two are around the same age, so I'm sorry if I said too much.
Dialogue: Yes... You two are around the same age, so I'm sorry if I said too much.

Original: Aphmau:Don't worry about it. Thank you. I can't go making you sad, now can I?
Dialogue: Don't worry about it. Thank you. I can't go making you sad, now can I?

Original: Aphmau:I'll be sure to invite you guys the next time I go out!
Dialogue: I'll be sure to invite you guys the next time I go out!

Original: Cater:There we go! Good going, "Big Brother"!
Dialogue: There we go! Good going, "Big Brother"!

Original: Aphmau:...And that's why Ovjang and Mnejing can speak.
Dialogue: ...And that's why Ovjang and Mnejing can speak.

Original: Vanille:It's so amazing that they can talk! I would love to meet them someday!
Dialogue: It's so amazing that they can talk! I would love to meet them someday!

Original: Prompto:Looks like you guys are having fun! Mind if we join the party?
Dialogue: Looks like you guys are having fun! Mind if we join the party?

Original: Yang:These two have puppet friends who move and speak on their own... But I cannot think of them as cute no matter how I try.
Dialogue: These two have puppet friends who move and speak on their own... But I cannot think of them as cute no matter how I try.

Original: Shantotto:Since you seem interested, allow me to reveal: puppets like hers are common in Vana'diel.
Dialogue: Since you seem interested, allow me to reveal puppets like hers are common in Vana'diel.

Original: Aphmau:You! Please don't get in our way!
Dialogue: You! Please don't get in our way!

Original: Shantotto:Ohohohoho! There's no need to pick a fight. I just thought I'd shed some light.
Dialogue: Ohohohoho! There's no need to pick a fight. I just thought I'd shed some light.

Original: Prompto:So can anyone make puppets like that in your world, Shantotto?
Dialogue: So can anyone make puppets like that in your world, Shantotto?

Original: Shantotto:The technology to produce was originally only for military use.
Dialogue: The technology to produce was originally only for military use.

Original: Prompto:Military... So I guess not everyone can make them, huh.
Dialogue: Military... So I guess not everyone can make them, huh.

Original: Shantotto:But later that technology became widely known. So with the right knowledge, you could make one of your own.
Dialogue: But later that technology became widely known. So with the right knowledge, you could make one of your own.

Original: Prompto:That's great news!
Dialogue: That's great news!

Original: Shantotto:You seem drawn to making automatons.
Dialogue: You seem drawn to making automatons.

Original: Prompto:Well, Vivi and I were talking and thought about making Aphmau's friends if it was possible.
Dialogue: Well, Vivi and I were talking and thought about making Aphmau's friends if it was possible.

Original: Vivi:We thought you might be lonely without Ovjang and Mnejing.
Dialogue: We thought you might be lonely without Ovjang and Mnejing.

Original: Prompto:Right! And friends are important! I'll bet Noct was probably super lonely until I got here!
Dialogue: Right! And friends are important! I'll bet Noct was probably super lonely until I got here!

Original: Shantotto:But I must confess, the ways to make automatons are countless.
Dialogue: But I must confess, the ways to make automatons are countless.

Original: Shantotto:You may find your plan unfurled just gathering materials in this world.
Dialogue: You may find your plan unfurled just gathering materials in this world.

Original: Shantotto:You best give up before it ends in dismay.
Dialogue: You best give up before it ends in dismay.

Original: Shantotto:And with that, I bid you good day.
Dialogue: And with that, I bid you good day.

Original: Prompto:D-don't worry about it, Vivi! She never said it was impossible!
Dialogue: D-don't worry about it, Vivi! She never said it was impossible!

Original: Prompto:She only made it seem really...difficult...
Dialogue: She only made it seem really...difficult...

Original: Aphmau:...Thank you.
Dialogue: ...Thank you.

Original: Prompto:...For what?
Dialogue: ...For what?

Original: Aphmau:I am sad without my friends, but...
Dialogue: I am sad without my friends, but...

Original: Aphmau:Here, I'm surrounded by people who care about me.
Dialogue: Here, I'm surrounded by people who care about me.

Original: Aphmau:So I'm not alone.
Dialogue: So I'm not alone.

Original: Prompto:Then you should thank Vivi! He's the one who came up with the idea.
Dialogue: Then you should thank Vivi! He's the one who came up with the idea.

Original: Aphmau:Vivi... Thank you. I'm happy to have such good friends in this world.
Dialogue: Vivi... Thank you. I'm happy to have such good friends in this world.

Original: Vivi:You're not lonely, Miss Aphmau?
Dialogue: You're not lonely, Miss Aphmau?

Original: Aphmau:No, I'm alright. You're my friend, too, aren't you?
Dialogue: No, I'm alright. You're my friend, too, aren't you?

Original: Vivi:O-of course!
Dialogue: O-of course!

Original: Vanille:Don't forget about me, Aphmau!
Dialogue: Don't forget about me, Aphmau!

Original: Yang:Friendship is truly a beautiful thing...
Dialogue: Friendship is truly a beautiful thing...

Original: Prompto:Are you fine without being her friend, Yang?
Dialogue: Are you fine without being her friend, Yang?

Original: Yang:I think that is best left to the young. We can watch over them from afar.
Dialogue: I think that is best left to the young. We can watch over them from afar.

Original: Prompto:I guess you're right... Wait a second. I'm young, too!
Dialogue: I guess you're right... Wait a second. I'm young, too!

Original: ???:And no sign of Aphmau anywhere!
Dialogue: And no sign of Aphmau anywhere!

Original: Ovjang:How can you ask me to be calm? Are you fine without seeing Aphmau, Mnejing!?
Dialogue: How can you ask me to be calm? Are you fine without seeing Aphmau, Mnejing!?

Original: Mnejing:Of course not! But walking around aimlessly like this is..
Dialogue: Of course not! But walking around aimlessly like this is..

Original: Kuja:Who are you? ...Puppets?
Dialogue: Who are you? ...Puppets?

Original: Mnejing:And who are you, dressed like that...?
Dialogue: And who are you, dressed like that...?

Original: Kuja:I see... So you're looking for someone named Aphmau.
Dialogue: I see... So you're looking for someone named Aphmau.

Original: Kuja:I've seen a girl like the one you described with Zidane and his friends.
Dialogue: I've seen a girl like the one you described with Zidane and his friends.

Original: Kuja:I'm sure my acquaintance knows her.
Dialogue: I'm sure my acquaintance knows her.

Original: Ovjang:I-I see. Could you take us to them?
Dialogue: I-I see. Could you take us to them?

Original: Kuja:...No. I do not take orders from lowly puppets.
Dialogue: ...No. I do not take orders from lowly puppets.

Original: Kuja:A jest. But knowing you are puppets, I had my reasons.
Dialogue: A jest. But knowing you are puppets, I had my reasons.

Original: Kuja:You too were created by the gods, made to dance upon their stage. In order to change that destiny...
Dialogue: You too were created by the gods, made to dance upon their stage. In order to change that destiny...

Original: Kuja:You will become my pawns...
Dialogue: You will become my pawns...

Original: Kuja:Go forth from here and you will find who you seek.
Dialogue: Go forth from here and you will find who you seek.

Original: Ovjang:...You look weird and say some strange things, but you seem like a nice person.
Dialogue: ...You look weird and say some strange things, but you seem like a nice person.

Original: Kuja:...I changed my mind.
Dialogue: ...I changed my mind.

Original: Mnejing:I'm sorry! I'll talk to Ovjang about it myself. Thank you, Kuja!
Dialogue: I'm sorry! I'll talk to Ovjang about it myself. Thank you, Kuja!

Original: Kuja:...What am I doing, helping puppets?
Dialogue: ...What am I doing, helping puppets?

Original: Aphmau:Did you guys hear something?
Dialogue: Did you guys hear something?

Original: Zidane:There are two little things running this way... Maybe they're those friends of yours.
Dialogue: There are two little things running this way... Maybe they're those friends of yours.

Original: Aphmau:Ovjang! Mnejing!
Dialogue: Ovjang! Mnejing!

Original: Aphmau:I've been looking all over for you! I'm so happy to see you!
Dialogue: I've been looking all over for you! I'm so happy to see you!

Original: Mnejing:We're sorry. We've been wandering around here for ages...
Dialogue: We're sorry. We've been wandering around here for ages...

Original: Ovjang:This weird guy named Kuja told us we could find you here!
Dialogue: This weird guy named Kuja told us we could find you here!

Original: Aphmau:I see. I better thank him, then.
Dialogue: I see. I better thank him, then.

Original: Zidane:Kuja helped you guys?
Dialogue: Kuja helped you guys?

Original: Mnejing:Yes. He seems like a nice man!
Dialogue: Yes. He seems like a nice man!

Original: Vivi:Kuja... I wonder if he's had a change of heart.
Dialogue: Kuja... I wonder if he's had a change of heart.

Original: Zidane:I don't know about that... But it seems like he's definitely changed.
Dialogue: I don't know about that... But it seems like he's definitely changed.

Original: Aphmau:Now we can travel around this world together!
Dialogue: Now we can travel around this world together!

Original: Ovjang:"This world"?
Dialogue: "This world"?

Original: Mnejing:What are you saying, Aphmau?
Dialogue: What are you saying, Aphmau?

Original: Aphmau:Hehe. I guess you're right! I've got a lot of explaining to do.
Dialogue: Hehe. I guess you're right! I've got a lot of explaining to do.

Original: Aphmau:Hmm... Where should I begin?
Dialogue: Hmm... Where should I begin?

Original: Zidane:I guess we better get the princess's friends up to date!
Dialogue: I guess we better get the princess's friends up to date!

Original: Vivi:Right. I hope we can become friends...
Dialogue: Right. I hope we can become friends...

Original: Zidane:I'm sure we will, Vivi. You can start by teaching them all about this place.
Dialogue: I'm sure we will, Vivi. You can start by teaching them all about this place.

Original: Vivi:N-nice to meet you two! Um, well, this world was made by gods...
Dialogue: N-nice to meet you two! Um, well, this world was made by gods...

Original: Sherlotta:Where am I?
Dialogue: Where am I?

Original: Sherlotta:I've never seen this forest before.
Dialogue: I've never seen this forest before.

Original: Sherlotta:Could this be that strange woman's doing...?
Dialogue: Could this be that strange woman's doing...?

Original: Sherlotta:Hmm... What to do...
Dialogue: Hmm... What to do...

Original: Sherlotta:Ooh, sounds like there's someone in here! It'd be nice if it weren't a monster...
Dialogue: Ooh, sounds like there's someone in here! It'd be nice if it weren't a monster...

Original: Vaan:I thought we could get out of here if we kept walking, but...
Dialogue: I thought we could get out of here if we kept walking, but...

Original: Vaan:I guess it's no surprise we keep running into monsters.
Dialogue: I guess it's no surprise we keep running into monsters.

Original: Warrior of Light:It can't be helped if they keep blocking our path.
Dialogue: It can't be helped if they keep blocking our path.

Original: Yuffie:I'm getting sick of this!
Dialogue: I'm getting sick of this!

Original: Vincent:Would you prefer becoming monster food?
Dialogue: Would you prefer becoming monster food?

Original: Sherlotta:So I'm not alone after all. This is great!
Dialogue: So I'm not alone after all. This is great!

Original: Sherlotta:I was thrown into this forest and had no idea where to go.
Dialogue: I was thrown into this forest and had no idea where to go.

Original: Sherlotta:...What are you guys doing?
Dialogue: ...What are you guys doing?

Original: Vaan:Umm... Well...
Dialogue: Umm... Well...

Original: Vaan:We're in the middle of a battle!
Dialogue: We're in the middle of a battle!

Original: Sherlotta:Well, I can see that.
Dialogue: Well, I can see that.

Original: Sherlotta:I wanted to know what you're doing here.
Dialogue: I wanted to know what you're doing here.

Original: Yuffie:This is kind of a bad time!
Dialogue: This is kind of a bad time!

Original: Vincent:Yuffie, stay focused. This is no time for chitchat.
Dialogue: Yuffie, stay focused. This is no time for chitchat.

Original: Yuffie:Chitchat!? I'm totally fighting here!
Dialogue: Chitchat!? I'm totally fighting here!

Original: Warrior of Light:Our apologies, but could we explain the situation to you later?
Dialogue: Our apologies, but could we explain the situation to you later?

Original: Vaan:This'll be over in a flash, so go and wait somewhere safe for us!
Dialogue: This'll be over in a flash, so go and wait somewhere safe for us!

Original: Warrior of Light:Is everyone alright?
Dialogue: Is everyone alright?

Original: Vaan:Sorry for the wait. Are you hurt?
Dialogue: Sorry for the wait. Are you hurt?

Original: Sherlotta:Of course not. I was just watching.
Dialogue: Of course not. I was just watching.

Original: Sherlotta:So could you tell me now? Just what is this place?
Dialogue: So could you tell me now? Just what is this place?

Original: Vaan:We've got some people who are better at explaining. Why don't you come to the airship with us?
Dialogue: We've got some people who are better at explaining. Why don't you come to the airship with us?

Original: Sherlotta:Air...ship? What's that?
Dialogue: Air...ship? What's that?

Original: Vaan:You don't know what an airship is? Uh, well... You'll understand once you get on.
Dialogue: You don't know what an airship is? Uh, well... You'll understand once you get on.

Original: Sherlotta:O-oh... It's...flying. I'm flying!
Dialogue: O-oh... It's...flying. I'm flying!

Original: Balthier:Are they rare where you come from?
Dialogue: Are they rare where you come from?

Original: Sherlotta:This is the first time I've seen one! But this isn't what I came here for.
Dialogue: This is the first time I've seen one! But this isn't what I came here for.

Original: Sherlotta:Where did this technology come from? Just what did you have to sacrifice...?
Dialogue: Where did this technology come from? Just what did you have to sacrifice...?

Original: Balthier:A fine question. I regrettably don't know what drives it.
Dialogue: A fine question. I regrettably don't know what drives it.

Original: Onion Knight:In this world, the power of our wills becomes energy. So maybe the airship is the same.
Dialogue: In this world, the power of our wills becomes energy. So maybe the airship is the same.

Original: Sherlotta:Hmm... The power of wills...
Dialogue: Hmm... The power of wills...

Original: Sherlotta:Well, that sure sounds suspicious! Is this some kind of religious thing...?
Dialogue: Well, that sure sounds suspicious! Is this some kind of religious thing...?

Original: Balthier:An unknown form of power is understandably dubious.
Dialogue: An unknown form of power is understandably dubious.

Original: Sherlotta:...But I guess it makes sense. Feelings and wills can give birth to all kinds of power.
Dialogue: ...But I guess it makes sense. Feelings and wills can give birth to all kinds of power.

Original: Sherlotta:There was someone I watched over for a long time...
Dialogue: There was someone I watched over for a long time...

Original: Laguna:A love interest?
Dialogue: A love interest?

Original: Sherlotta:And whenever I thought about that child, I could do anything.
Dialogue: And whenever I thought about that child, I could do anything.

Original: Sherlotta:My "feelings" had that kind of power.
Dialogue: My "feelings" had that kind of power.

Original: Laguna:In that case, you need to help us defend this world in order to protect that child.
Dialogue: In that case, you need to help us defend this world in order to protect that child.

Original: Sherlotta:But that kiddo's all grown up.
Dialogue: But that kiddo's all grown up.

Original: Sherlotta:My help's no longer needed.
Dialogue: My help's no longer needed.

Original: Sazh:...Don't say such sad things. Just because someone you want to protect is independent...
Dialogue: ...Don't say such sad things. Just because someone you want to protect is independent...

Original: Sazh:It doesn't change the fact that they're important to you, does it?
Dialogue: It doesn't change the fact that they're important to you, does it?

Original: Sazh:That kid may be tough, but even so... It won't change a parent's love.
Dialogue: That kid may be tough, but even so... It won't change a parent's love.

Original: Sherlotta:That's true, but...
Dialogue: That's true, but...

Original: Laguna:He's right! You should treasure those feelings.
Dialogue: He's right! You should treasure those feelings.

Original: Sazh:I've got the same ones, too.
Dialogue: I've got the same ones, too.

Original: Sazh:But if you feel the way Jecht does as a parent, then it's hard for your kid to understand...
Dialogue: But if you feel the way Jecht does as a parent, then it's hard for your kid to understand...

Original: Sazh:But you still want to protect them. And you'd give your life to make sure they're safe.
Dialogue: But you still want to protect them. And you'd give your life to make sure they're safe.

Original: Laguna:I think you mean "go back alive" rather than "give up your life," right?
Dialogue: I think you mean "go back alive" rather than "give up your life," right?

Original: Laguna:For the sake of your cute little kid.
Dialogue: For the sake of your cute little kid.

Original: Sazh:Wh-what are you doing, glaring like that?
Dialogue: Wh-what are you doing, glaring like that?

Original: Sherlotta:I'm not glaring.
Dialogue: I'm not glaring.

Original: Sherlotta:I was just thinking how serious you can be compared to that hairdo of yours.
Dialogue: I was just thinking how serious you can be compared to that hairdo of yours.

Original: Sherlotta:I guess you can't judge a book by its cover.
Dialogue: I guess you can't judge a book by its cover.

Original: Sherlotta:...Thank you. I decided to lend you guys a hand.
Dialogue: ...Thank you. I decided to lend you guys a hand.

Original: Sherlotta:You can call me Sherlotta.
Dialogue: You can call me Sherlotta.

Original: Chelinka:Were you summoned by Materia, too?
Dialogue: Were you summoned by Materia, too?

Original: Sherlotta:...Who's Materia?
Dialogue: ...Who's Materia?

Original: Layle:A goddess who made this world. You haven't met?
Dialogue: A goddess who made this world. You haven't met?

Original: Sherlotta:Before I met up with you guys, I was lying on my back in front of a crystal. The only person I met was this weird, self-important lady.
Dialogue: Before I met up with you guys, I was lying on my back in front of a crystal. The only person I met was this weird, self-important lady.

Original: Layle:...That's Materia.
Dialogue: ...That's Materia.

Original: Sherlotta:Oho! I didn't know she was a goddess!
Dialogue: Oho! I didn't know she was a goddess!

Original: Yuri:Did she tell you anything?
Dialogue: Did she tell you anything?

Original: Sherlotta:Not really.
Dialogue: Not really.

Original: Layle:"Not really"? Didn't you talk about anything?
Dialogue: "Not really"? Didn't you talk about anything?

Original: Sherlotta:She just kept talking. She was strange and I had things to do, so I decided to go home.
Dialogue: She just kept talking. She was strange and I had things to do, so I decided to go home.

Original: Yuri:You made it back home all on your own!?
Dialogue: You made it back home all on your own!?

Original: Sherlotta:Well, as you can see, I'm here and not at home.
Dialogue: Well, as you can see, I'm here and not at home.

Original: Sherlotta:...But I really have to get home. I've got better things to do than this.
Dialogue: ...But I really have to get home. I've got better things to do than this.

Original: Layle:Ha! Materia's summoned a live one this time.
Dialogue: Ha! Materia's summoned a live one this time.

Original: Sherlotta:...By the way, I've been wondering. Is that a crystal on your face?
Dialogue: ...By the way, I've been wondering. Is that a crystal on your face?

Original: Layle:If you recognize this, it must mean you have them in your world, too. Can you use crystals?
Dialogue: If you recognize this, it must mean you have them in your world, too. Can you use crystals?

Original: Sherlotta:A crystal is something that's part of you.
Dialogue: A crystal is something that's part of you.

Original: Sherlotta:Now that I think about it, after I gave that kiddo the crystal, they were always together.
Dialogue: Now that I think about it, after I gave that kiddo the crystal, they were always together.

Original: Sherlotta:Hm? Is that a crystal, too, Chelinka?
Dialogue: Hm? Is that a crystal, too, Chelinka?

Original: Yuri:It sure is.
Dialogue: It sure is.

Original: Chelinka:I was born with it.
Dialogue: I was born with it.

Original: Sherlotta:What!? How many other worlds have crystals, too!?
Dialogue: What!? How many other worlds have crystals, too!?

Original: Sherlotta:But...I see. You all have a responsibility that comes with it.
Dialogue: But...I see. You all have a responsibility that comes with it.

Original: Sherlotta:That kiddo also had a very important role to play. All those tied to the crystals do...
Dialogue: That kiddo also had a very important role to play. All those tied to the crystals do...

Original: Chelinka:I can tell this child is very special to you. What were they like?
Dialogue: I can tell this child is very special to you. What were they like?

Original: Sherlotta:Do you want to know? I'm sure you do! There's so much to tell! Get comfortable!
Dialogue: Do you want to know? I'm sure you do! There's so much to tell! Get comfortable!

Original: Chelinka:I have a feeling this will take some time...
Dialogue: I have a feeling this will take some time...

Original: Sherlotta:I could tell you everything starting from the baby years, but...there just aren't enough hours in a day!
Dialogue: I could tell you everything starting from the baby years, but...there just aren't enough hours in a day!

Original: Sherlotta:Don't you have a crystal, Yuri? I can feel the same power coming from you...
Dialogue: Don't you have a crystal, Yuri? I can feel the same power coming from you...

Original: Yuri:I'm borrowing Chelinka's powers.
Dialogue: I'm borrowing Chelinka's powers.

Original: Chelinka:Well, not quite... Without Yuri, I can't draw out the crystal's powers very well.
Dialogue: Well, not quite... Without Yuri, I can't draw out the crystal's powers very well.

Original: Sherlotta:Interesting... Now that you mention it, the crystal's power does flow a lot more smoothly when you two are together.
Dialogue: Interesting... Now that you mention it, the crystal's power does flow a lot more smoothly when you two are together.

Original: Sherlotta:Whenever we're together, too, I'm at my best!
Dialogue: Whenever we're together, too, I'm at my best!

Original: Layle:You can't help but compete, can you?
Dialogue: You can't help but compete, can you?

Original: Sherlotta:The crystal... Nevermind. I don't want to talk about this anymore.
Dialogue: The crystal... Nevermind. I don't want to talk about this anymore.

Original: Sherlotta:What do we have to do to go back home? Destroy the root of all evil?
Dialogue: What do we have to do to go back home? Destroy the root of all evil?

Original: Yuri:Unfortunately, there are lots more roots than you think. First we have to find them before we can destroy them.
Dialogue: Unfortunately, there are lots more roots than you think. First we have to find them before we can destroy them.

Original: Yuri:It's like Bartz says: if you follow where the wind blows, you'll get to the end eventually.
Dialogue: It's like Bartz says if you follow where the wind blows, you'll get to the end eventually.

Original: Sherlotta:But that could take ages. I want to go home sooner than that.
Dialogue: But that could take ages. I want to go home sooner than that.

Original: Sherlotta:I've got a kid to wake up on time, send to bathe, feed properly...
Dialogue: I've got a kid to wake up on time, send to bathe, feed properly...

Original: Sherlotta:I want to make sure everything's okay...
Dialogue: I want to make sure everything's okay...

Original: Layle:Haha. Then we'd better get a move on so you can get back sooner.
Dialogue: Haha. Then we'd better get a move on so you can get back sooner.

Original: Yuri:It'll go even faster now with you around!
Dialogue: It'll go even faster now with you around!

Original: Sherlotta:But of course.
Dialogue: But of course.

Original: Sherlotta:...I didn't think I needed to be so close anymore, but I want to be as much as I can.
Dialogue: ...I didn't think I needed to be so close anymore, but I want to be as much as I can.

Original: Sherlotta:Alright! Thoughts of being together back home will keep me going until I get there!
Dialogue: Alright! Thoughts of being together back home will keep me going until I get there!

Original: Lann:Hey, Sherlotta! Long time no see!
Dialogue: Hey, Sherlotta! Long time no see!

Original: Sherlotta:Do I...know you?
Dialogue: Do I...know you?

Original: Reynn:Don't scare her like that, Lann.
Dialogue: Don't scare her like that, Lann.

Original: Lann:So you're saying we haven't met!?
Dialogue: So you're saying we haven't met!?

Original: Sherlotta:...Are you trying to hit on me?
Dialogue: ...Are you trying to hit on me?

Original: Bartz:There were people similar to us in Reynn and Lann's world.
Dialogue: There were people similar to us in Reynn and Lann's world.

Original: Bartz:It sounds like they met someone like you, too.
Dialogue: It sounds like they met someone like you, too.

Original: Tifa:I know how you feel, Sherlotta. I was surprised to hear that there's someone like me in another world, too.
Dialogue: I know how you feel, Sherlotta. I was surprised to hear that there's someone like me in another world, too.

Original: Snow:Well, the more we hear about those people, the more it seems like they're not just similar to us. They are us.
Dialogue: Well, the more we hear about those people, the more it seems like they're not just similar to us. They are us.

Original: Sherlotta:If everyone says that, it must be true. It's a little surprising, but...tell me more about this other me.
Dialogue: If everyone says that, it must be true. It's a little surprising, but...tell me more about this other me.

Original: Reynn:You let us stay at your inn.
Dialogue: You let us stay at your inn.

Original: Sherlotta:I've never run an inn before. Maybe I'll give it a try when I get back home.
Dialogue: I've never run an inn before. Maybe I'll give it a try when I get back home.

Original: Reynn:Nothing ever surprised you, plus you were really well-known. It helped us out a lot.
Dialogue: Nothing ever surprised you, plus you were really well-known. It helped us out a lot.

Original: Sherlotta:Sounds like me alright! She must have been wonderful.
Dialogue: Sounds like me alright! She must have been wonderful.

Original: Lann:But I was super shocked when I stepped on you.
Dialogue: But I was super shocked when I stepped on you.

Original: Sherlotta:You stepped on me...?
Dialogue: You stepped on me...?

Original: Snow:How did that happen? Did she fall in battle?
Dialogue: How did that happen? Did she fall in battle?

Original: Reynn:Actually, Sherlotta
Dialogue: Actually, Sherlotta—

Original: Sherlotta:Stop right there!
Dialogue: Stop right there!

Original: Lann:What? Why!?
Dialogue: What? Why!?

Original: Sherlotta:I wouldn't want you spilling any of my little secrets now.
Dialogue: I wouldn't want you spilling any of my little secrets now.

Original: Lann:Uh-oh... She's totally glaring at me.
Dialogue: Uh-oh... She's totally glaring at me.

Original: Lann:I... I'm so sorry!
Dialogue: I... I'm so sorry!

Original: Reynn:Please forgive me, too. I almost let it slip!
Dialogue: Please forgive me, too. I almost let it slip!

Original: Sherlotta:Hehe. I'll forgive you this time.
Dialogue: Hehe. I'll forgive you this time.

Original: Sherlotta:...The water's close.
Dialogue: ...The water's close.

Original: Vanille:How can you tell?
Dialogue: How can you tell?

Original: Sherlotta:It's easy-peasy when you're me.
Dialogue: It's easy-peasy when you're me.

Original: Faris:It doesn't smell like the sea.
Dialogue: It doesn't smell like the sea.

Original: Sherlotta:It's not the sea. It's a river.
Dialogue: It's not the sea. It's a river.

Original: Vanille:Is it this way?
Dialogue: Is it this way?

Original: King:It shouldn't be that easy to locate a river in this terrain. How can you be so sure?
Dialogue: It shouldn't be that easy to locate a river in this terrain. How can you be so sure?

Original: Sherlotta:No reason you kiddos could understand. You're nowhere near as skilled as I am! Hehe.
Dialogue: No reason you kiddos could understand. You're nowhere near as skilled as I am! Hehe.

Original: Steiner:I should have sufficient experience after all my years, but not even I could locate it.
Dialogue: I should have sufficient experience after all my years, but not even I could locate it.

Original: Steiner:The waterside is important for supply routes. Please, teach me your ways!
Dialogue: The waterside is important for supply routes. Please, teach me your ways!

Original: Vanille:Yes! I would love to learn!
Dialogue: Yes! I would love to learn!

Original: Sherlotta:You could be a little resentful, you know?
Dialogue: You could be a little resentful, you know?

Original: King:If you were lying, I might be. But I don't get that feeling from you.
Dialogue: If you were lying, I might be. But I don't get that feeling from you.

Original: Krile:Yeah. You may not look much older than me, but...
Dialogue: Yeah. You may not look much older than me, but...

Original: Sherlotta:Alright, that's enough! I have an image to uphold!
Dialogue: Alright, that's enough! I have an image to uphold!

Original: Sherlotta:I may have kept it a secret, but it's not that tough. I heard it from the animals passing by.
Dialogue: I may have kept it a secret, but it's not that tough. I heard it from the animals passing by.

Original: Sherlotta:Pretty simple, right?
Dialogue: Pretty simple, right?

Original: Vanille:You can understand animals?
Dialogue: You can understand animals?

Original: Krile:I can, too! I'm so happy to have more friends like me!
Dialogue: I can, too! I'm so happy to have more friends like me!

Original: Steiner:...Though it's nothing I can so easily imitate.
Dialogue: ...Though it's nothing I can so easily imitate.

Original: King:Then be glad to have another powerful ally in our ranks. We just need to do what we can.
Dialogue: Then be glad to have another powerful ally in our ranks. We just need to do what we can.

Original: Sherlotta:Right. There's no need for everyone to be able to do the same things.
Dialogue: Right. There's no need for everyone to be able to do the same things.

Original: Sherlotta:Besides, you hear some pretty useless things, too. I can't exactly say it's always the most convenient power.
Dialogue: Besides, you hear some pretty useless things, too. I can't exactly say it's always the most convenient power.

Original: Krile:Yeah, you're right...
Dialogue: Yeah, you're right...

Original: Vanille:You must overhear some pretty scary things, too.
Dialogue: You must overhear some pretty scary things, too.

Original: Sherlotta:Exactly. Some voices are threatening. But I just threaten them right back!
Dialogue: Exactly. Some voices are threatening. But I just threaten them right back!

Original: Krile:But at those times, you give them a proper talking to, don't you?
Dialogue: But at those times, you give them a proper talking to, don't you?

Original: Krile:You're like a kind mother always thinking about her children!
Dialogue: You're like a kind mother always thinking about her children!

Original: Sherlotta:Wh-what? A...a mother? K-kind...!?
Dialogue: Wh-what? A...a mother? K-kind...!?

Original: Krile:It's okay, Sherlotta. I know how sweet you are.
Dialogue: It's okay, Sherlotta. I know how sweet you are.

Original: Sherlotta:Stop that... You won't get anything for praising me...
Dialogue: Stop that... You won't get anything for praising me...

Original: Sherlotta:Hehe. But it's not a bad feeling. Thank you, Krile.
Dialogue: Hehe. But it's not a bad feeling. Thank you, Krile.

Original: Sherlotta:I'll keep giving it my all...like a good mother to that kiddo.
Dialogue: I'll keep giving it my all...like a good mother to that kiddo.

Original: The Emperor:Where are you going?
Dialogue: Where are you going?

Original: Garland:Have we anywhere else to go but the battlefield?
Dialogue: Have we anywhere else to go but the battlefield?

Original: Garland:I care not about the will of the gods. You are the same, no?
Dialogue: I care not about the will of the gods. You are the same, no?

Original: Garland:My desire for war is not unlike yours for dominion.
Dialogue: My desire for war is not unlike yours for dominion.

Original: Garland:In that sense, we are kin.
Dialogue: In that sense, we are kin.

Original: The Emperor:A warrior who cares only for the fight...calls me "kin"?
Dialogue: A warrior who cares only for the fight...calls me "kin"?

Original: Ashe:It looks like we managed to drive back the enemy.
Dialogue: It looks like we managed to drive back the enemy.

Original: Warrior of Light:They must have been lying in wait to have attacked so suddenly. We can't let our guard down.
Dialogue: They must have been lying in wait to have attacked so suddenly. We can't let our guard down.

Original: Faris:But there's no way we'd be bested in a place like this!
Dialogue: But there's no way we'd be bested in a place like this!

Original: Mog:Great job, kupo! I feel so at ease with so many friends on our side!
Dialogue: Great job, kupo! I feel so at ease with so many friends on our side!

Original: Warrior of Light:Indeed. No matter what trials we may face, we can overcome them together.
Dialogue: Indeed. No matter what trials we may face, we can overcome them together.

Original: ???:Then overcome this!
Dialogue: Then overcome this!

Original: Faris:Garland!? You've got some brass launching a surprise attack like that!
Dialogue: Garland!? You've got some brass launching a surprise attack like that!

Original: Garland:Those who do not tirelessly seek war have no place in this world.
Dialogue: Those who do not tirelessly seek war have no place in this world.

Original: Ashe:What do you mean?
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Original: Warrior of Light:Are you still devoting yourself to the cycle of war?
Dialogue: Are you still devoting yourself to the cycle of war?

Original: Garland:Of course.
Dialogue: Of course.

Original: Garland:It is what I hoped for. If this world was made the same way, then isn't that the answer?
Dialogue: It is what I hoped for. If this world was made the same way, then isn't that the answer?

Original: Faris:What's wrong with this guy?
Dialogue: What's wrong with this guy?

Original: Garland:Oh?
Dialogue: Oh?

Original: Warrior of Light:We will use the light gathered here to end your cycle!
Dialogue: We will use the light gathered here to end your cycle!

Original: Garland:Very well... Then come!
Dialogue: Very well... Then come!

Original: Ashe:Huff, huff... What a powerful attack...
Dialogue: Huff, huff... What a powerful attack...

Original: Faris:Are you okay, Ashe? You can pull back if you need to.
Dialogue: Are you okay, Ashe? You can pull back if you need to.

Original: Garland:As I expected. You enjoy this, don't you?
Dialogue: As I expected. You enjoy this, don't you?

Original: Ace:Are you guys okay!?
Dialogue: Are you guys okay!?

Original: Zidane:Is that Garland!?
Dialogue: Is that Garland!?

Original: Garland:Hahaha! Let us continue the battle!
Dialogue: Hahaha! Let us continue the battle!

Original: Ace:Dark manikins...
Dialogue: Dark manikins...

Original: Zidane:We'll take you on!
Dialogue: We'll take you on!

Original: Garland:I see... I am not the only one who desires war.
Dialogue: I see... I am not the only one who desires war.

Original: Garland:Our fight is for us. I do not wish for others to get in our way.
Dialogue: Our fight is for us. I do not wish for others to get in our way.

Original: Garland:But I had forgotten. When I dedicated myself to the cycle of war...
Dialogue: But I had forgotten. When I dedicated myself to the cycle of war...

Original: Garland:Strangers like these were a part of the cycle, too.
Dialogue: Strangers like these were a part of the cycle, too.

Original: Garland:Take my coordinates.
Dialogue: Take my coordinates.

Original: Mog:Kupo!? You mean you'll work with us!?
Dialogue: Kupo!? You mean you'll work with us!?

Original: Warrior of Light:What is the meaning of this!?
Dialogue: What is the meaning of this!?

Original: Garland:I yearn for battle.
Dialogue: I yearn for battle.

Original: Garland:It's like he said. We are naught but performers.
Dialogue: It's like he said. We are naught but performers.

Original: Garland:I wish to stage the grandest of battles upon those gods' stage.
Dialogue: I wish to stage the grandest of battles upon those gods' stage.

Original: Zidane:Don't try to lump yourself in with Kuja!
Dialogue: Don't try to lump yourself in with Kuja!

Original: Garland:It changes nothing. War is the fate from which we cannot escape.
Dialogue: It changes nothing. War is the fate from which we cannot escape.

Original: Garland:That's why...I wish you to summon me to your battles.
Dialogue: That's why...I wish you to summon me to your battles.

Original: Garland:And come for my life whenever you wish!
Dialogue: And come for my life whenever you wish!

Original: Garland:All war will become mine.
Dialogue: All war will become mine.

Original: Faris:What just happened here? Why did he give us his coordinates?
Dialogue: What just happened here? Why did he give us his coordinates?

Original: Warrior of Light:This is dangerous. I cannot imagine that he truly wishes to cooperate with us.
Dialogue: This is dangerous. I cannot imagine that he truly wishes to cooperate with us.

Original: Zidane:Yeah. Even going so far as to mention Kuja...
Dialogue: Yeah. Even going so far as to mention Kuja...

Original: Ace:And I highly doubt he wants to be our friend.
Dialogue: And I highly doubt he wants to be our friend.

Original: Ace:Garland is trapped. The cycle of war is not just his problem.
Dialogue: Garland is trapped. The cycle of war is not just his problem.

Original: Ace:People seek strife... War repeats itself...
Dialogue: People seek strife... War repeats itself...

Original: Ashe:So shall we leave him be...?
Dialogue: So shall we leave him be...?

Original: Ace:No. That's not what I meant...
Dialogue: No. That's not what I meant...

Original: Faris:He means it in a wide sense. Even you should understand, Princess.
Dialogue: He means it in a wide sense. Even you should understand, Princess.

Original: Ashe:Well, when you put it that way...
Dialogue: Well, when you put it that way...

Original: Warrior of Light:Everyone shares the fate of fighting. Garland is a mirror that reflects light...
Dialogue: Everyone shares the fate of fighting. Garland is a mirror that reflects light...

Original: Kuja:How tasteless of you. I have no desire to put you upon my stage.
Dialogue: How tasteless of you. I have no desire to put you upon my stage.

Original: Garland:Then you must force me down.
Dialogue: Then you must force me down.

Original: Kuja:...Do you truly intend to perform?
Dialogue: ...Do you truly intend to perform?

Original: Kuja:Then I'll have to find a suitable role for you.
Dialogue: Then I'll have to find a suitable role for you.

Original: Garland:My only role is that of war. It shall make for a grand spectacle...
Dialogue: My only role is that of war. It shall make for a grand spectacle...

Original: Firion:I can't believe that...
Dialogue: I can't believe that...

Original: Snow:You don't think Garland could've had a change of heart?
Dialogue: You don't think Garland could've had a change of heart?

Original: Warrior of Light:I can't imagine so.
Dialogue: I can't imagine so.

Original: Cecil:Neither can I see him as a friend.
Dialogue: Neither can I see him as a friend.

Original: Firion:But then why would he give us his coordinates?
Dialogue: But then why would he give us his coordinates?

Original: Warrior of Light:To put himself in the battle. He wants to make our fight his, too.
Dialogue: To put himself in the battle. He wants to make our fight his, too.

Original: Snow:War is...not normal.
Dialogue: War is...not normal.

Original: Cecil:If you're uncertain, it's best not to use his coordinates.
Dialogue: If you're uncertain, it's best not to use his coordinates.

Original: Warrior of Light:I continued my fight with Garland in hopes of ending the cycle of war.
Dialogue: I continued my fight with Garland in hopes of ending the cycle of war.

Original: Warrior of Light:But there may be some things that cannot be ended with the two of us fighting.
Dialogue: But there may be some things that cannot be ended with the two of us fighting.

Original: Warrior of Light:Ace said the same. We're also in a cycle of war.
Dialogue: Ace said the same. We're also in a cycle of war.

Original: Snow:A cycle, huh... You might be right.
Dialogue: A cycle, huh... You might be right.

Original: Snow:But we're different from Garland. We don't want to fight. We have to.
Dialogue: But we're different from Garland. We don't want to fight. We have to.

Original: Snow:There are people that need to be stopped, and we just happen to be the only ones who can do it.
Dialogue: There are people that need to be stopped, and we just happen to be the only ones who can do it.

Original: Firion:The reason you take up arms will become your faith.
Dialogue: The reason you take up arms will become your faith.

Original: Firion:I feel that in you. I will fight beside you until you find acceptance.
Dialogue: I feel that in you. I will fight beside you until you find acceptance.

Original: Cecil:I believe your light will reach Garland someday.
Dialogue: I believe your light will reach Garland someday.

Original: Warrior of Light:Faith... Yes, thank you.
Dialogue: Faith... Yes, thank you.

Original: Warrior of Light:If Garland's actions are heading toward a different end than in the past...
Dialogue: If Garland's actions are heading toward a different end than in the past...

Original: Warrior of Light:We must keep going forward until that time.
Dialogue: We must keep going forward until that time.

Original: Porom:So that Garland guy is our ally now...
Dialogue: So that Garland guy is our ally now...

Original: Mog:Even I'm surprised, kupo!
Dialogue: Even I'm surprised, kupo!

Original: Lulu:Though it seems we can't yet call him a friend, nor do we have a united front...
Dialogue: Though it seems we can't yet call him a friend, nor do we have a united front...

Original: Zack:Enemies have fought on our side before, but...
Dialogue: Enemies have fought on our side before, but...

Original: Hope:I have a hard time believing we have a common interest.
Dialogue: I have a hard time believing we have a common interest.

Original: Zack:Garland wants to battle, right? Maybe he wants to get stronger?
Dialogue: Garland wants to battle, right? Maybe he wants to get stronger?

Original: Sabin:I would understand if that were the case. To get strong, you need to fight strong opponents.
Dialogue: I would understand if that were the case. To get strong, you need to fight strong opponents.

Original: Hope:Getting strong and seeking out strife are two different things.
Dialogue: Getting strong and seeking out strife are two different things.

Original: Hope:In war, thoughts and feelings collide, then some get weeded out.
Dialogue: In war, thoughts and feelings collide, then some get weeded out.

Original: Hope:That goes against our ways.
Dialogue: That goes against our ways.

Original: Sabin:War is definitely different. My brother often struggles in such situations.
Dialogue: War is definitely different. My brother often struggles in such situations.

Original: Lulu:But conflict without a purpose... That in itself may be a pure sentiment.
Dialogue: But conflict without a purpose... That in itself may be a pure sentiment.

Original: Hope:A "pure" sentiment for which things are lost.
Dialogue: A "pure" sentiment for which things are lost.

Original: Lulu:My apologies. I don't mean to say I agree.
Dialogue: My apologies. I don't mean to say I agree.

Original: Lulu:Just that, since we know where to draw the line, we're able to empathize with our opponents.
Dialogue: Just that, since we know where to draw the line, we're able to empathize with our opponents.

Original: Lulu:Because we believe that to be right, even if it means suppressing our own wills.
Dialogue: Because we believe that to be right, even if it means suppressing our own wills.

Original: Porom:Does that mean sticking to your own ideas can hurt others?
Dialogue: Does that mean sticking to your own ideas can hurt others?

Original: Lulu:I wonder. I think sticking to your beliefs is necessary.
Dialogue: I wonder. I think sticking to your beliefs is necessary.

Original: Hope:I'm sorry... I know what you mean, Lulu.
Dialogue: I'm sorry... I know what you mean, Lulu.

Original: Zack:Thinking about these things dosn't make it easier, either. In the end, it's hard to know what's best.
Dialogue: Thinking about these things dosn't make it easier, either. In the end, it's hard to know what's best.

Original: Sabin:If you can't figure it out, move your body! It'll clear your head!
Dialogue: If you can't figure it out, move your body! It'll clear your head!

Original: Zack:Now we're talkin'! Great idea, Sabin!
Dialogue: Now we're talkin'! Great idea, Sabin!

Original: Porom:I get the feeling you just don't want to think...
Dialogue: I get the feeling you just don't want to think...

Original: Porom:Still, I agree. But let's not go overboard.
Dialogue: Still, I agree. But let's not go overboard.

Original: Garland:Pathetic!
Dialogue: Pathetic!

Original: Vaan:...You really are fighting with us.
Dialogue: ...You really are fighting with us.

Original: Garland:Are you dissatisfied?
Dialogue: Are you dissatisfied?

Original: Cyan:Though we are supposed to be fighting side by side...
Dialogue: Though we are supposed to be fighting side by side...

Original: Cyan:I must admit I cannot overcome my fear of thy blade piercing my back.
Dialogue: I must admit I cannot overcome my fear of thy blade piercing my back.

Original: Garland:Hahaha! Nor should you!
Dialogue: Hahaha! Nor should you!

Original: Garland:I will strike you down the instant your guard falls. We are not friends, after all.
Dialogue: I will strike you down the instant your guard falls. We are not friends, after all.

Original: Cyan:Art thou mad!?
Dialogue: Art thou mad!?

Original: Garland:I should ask you the same, sheathing your swords before me.
Dialogue: I should ask you the same, sheathing your swords before me.

Original: Lightning:Do you really think you could win alone?
Dialogue: Do you really think you could win alone?

Original: Garland:Neither victory nor defeat matters to me. Nothing ends in war.
Dialogue: Neither victory nor defeat matters to me. Nothing ends in war.

Original: Garland:I would enjoy crossing blades with you in war.
Dialogue: I would enjoy crossing blades with you in war.

Original: Vaan:If you want a fight, you'll get one!
Dialogue: If you want a fight, you'll get one!

Original: Zell:Hold it! We defeated the enemy, so let's calm down.
Dialogue: Hold it! We defeated the enemy, so let's calm down.

Original: Lightning:Say that to the one who started it.
Dialogue: Say that to the one who started it.

Original: Cyan:Indeed... We will not be brought down.
Dialogue: Indeed... We will not be brought down.

Original: Zell:But that doesn't have to be now!
Dialogue: But that doesn't have to be now!

Original: Garland:Despite trying to foolishly stop the fighting, you do not leave yourself open.
Dialogue: Despite trying to foolishly stop the fighting, you do not leave yourself open.

Original: Zell:Getting riled would be playing right into your hands.
Dialogue: Getting riled would be playing right into your hands.

Original: Lightning:That's one way of seeing it, I suppose.
Dialogue: That's one way of seeing it, I suppose.

Original: Cyan:I will relent out of respect for Sir Zell.
Dialogue: I will relent out of respect for Sir Zell.

Original: Garland:How interesting! It seems like there is yet more to be enjoyed!
Dialogue: How interesting! It seems like there is yet more to be enjoyed!

Original: Zell:Phew... I had no idea what would happen.
Dialogue: Phew... I had no idea what would happen.

Original: Lightning:I guess we had you worried.
Dialogue: I guess we had you worried.

Original: Zell:That's fine. I just didn't want to keep fighting.
Dialogue: That's fine. I just didn't want to keep fighting.

Original: Zell:But if you don't want me to be worried, it'd be nice of you to withdraw earlier.
Dialogue: But if you don't want me to be worried, it'd be nice of you to withdraw earlier.

Original: Lightning:I'll try.
Dialogue: I'll try.

Original: Zell:That's good enough for me. Thanks.
Dialogue: That's good enough for me. Thanks.

Original: Kefka:Those blasted humans... How dare they harm my adorable Blackened Wills!?
Dialogue: Those blasted humans... How dare they harm my adorable Blackened Wills!?

Original: Kefka:They'll pay for this! I will have my revenge yet!
Dialogue: They'll pay for this! I will have my revenge yet!

Original: Kefka:Wellllll, if it isn't Madam Sorceress! What brings you here?
Dialogue: Wellllll, if it isn't Madam Sorceress! What brings you here?

Original: Kefka:Not that I can help. I'm a bit busy, so if you could kindly BUZZ OFF, I'd be much obliged!
Dialogue: Not that I can help. I'm a bit busy, so if you could kindly BUZZ OFF, I'd be much obliged!

Original: Ultimecia:Materia's warriors grow stronger by the day.
Dialogue: Materia's warriors grow stronger by the day.

Original: Ultimecia:It would be unwise of you to attack them head-on again.
Dialogue: It would be unwise of you to attack them head-on again.

Original: Kefka:You ruin all my fun! Well then, what's your bright idea?
Dialogue: You ruin all my fun! Well then, what's your bright idea?

Original: Ultimecia:Their power stems from will. You need only manipulate that.
Dialogue: Their power stems from will. You need only manipulate that.

Original: Kefka:Yikes! Your face says you're up to no good!
Dialogue: Yikes! Your face says you're up to no good!

Original: Leon:Are you alright, Noel? Can you hear that woman's voice again?
Dialogue: Are you alright, Noel? Can you hear that woman's voice again?

Original: Noel:You mean Ultimecia? No, not at all...
Dialogue: You mean Ultimecia? No, not at all...

Original: Selphie:Seems like she's given up. That's a relief!
Dialogue: Seems like she's given up. That's a relief!

Original: Leon:There is nothing for you to fear. We are here for you.
Dialogue: There is nothing for you to fear. We are here for you.

Original: Noel:You're right.
Dialogue: You're right.

Original: Selphie:A monster! I'll get rid of it on the double!
Dialogue: A monster! I'll get rid of it on the double!

Original: Selphie:Another one!?
Dialogue: Another one!?

Original: Selphie:Alrighty! I guess we just need to clean this one up, too!
Dialogue: Alrighty! I guess we just need to clean this one up, too!

Original: Selphie:They sure are persistent... Just how many are there?
Dialogue: They sure are persistent... Just how many are there?

Original: Noel:This is weird. It was calm until just a minute ago...
Dialogue: This is weird. It was calm until just a minute ago...

Original: Leon:It appears something is summoning them.
Dialogue: It appears something is summoning them.

Original: Leon:And this aura... It feels like the Emperor...
Dialogue: And this aura... It feels like the Emperor...

Original: Ultimecia:You seem to be in a difficult spot. Allow me to aid you.
Dialogue: You seem to be in a difficult spot. Allow me to aid you.

Original: Noel:It's you!
Dialogue: It's you!

Original: Selphie:No way! YOU rescued us!? Why!?
Dialogue: No way! YOU rescued us!? Why!?

Original: Leon:If she is not here to fight us, let us get our answers later. We must deal with these enemies first.
Dialogue: If she is not here to fight us, let us get our answers later. We must deal with these enemies first.

Original: Ultimecia:The battle is won.
Dialogue: The battle is won.

Original: Ultimecia:You did well, children of light. You are stronger than before.
Dialogue: You did well, children of light. You are stronger than before.

Original: Relm:Umm... Thanks for your help?
Dialogue: Umm... Thanks for your help?

Original: Relm:But I don't get it. Aren't you that quiet guy's enemy?
Dialogue: But I don't get it. Aren't you that quiet guy's enemy?

Original: Squall:...Why are you helping us?
Dialogue: ...Why are you helping us?

Original: Ultimecia:I have no intention of fighting you here and now.
Dialogue: I have no intention of fighting you here and now.

Original: Ultimecia:I've been detested since birth as an evil sorceress. I spent my entire life alone and unloved.
Dialogue: I've been detested since birth as an evil sorceress. I spent my entire life alone and unloved.

Original: Ultimecia:Can you fathom my loneliness?
Dialogue: Can you fathom my loneliness?

Original: Balthier:We don't have time for long-winded explanations.
Dialogue: We don't have time for long-winded explanations.

Original: Ultimecia:...You understand, don't you? Solitude eats away at you...
Dialogue: ...You understand, don't you? Solitude eats away at you...

Original: Ultimecia:You found hope in talking to me, did you not?
Dialogue: You found hope in talking to me, did you not?

Original: Ultimecia:I am the same...
Dialogue: I am the same...

Original: Squall:Don't listen to her.
Dialogue: Don't listen to her.

Original: Ultimecia:You leave me with no choice...
Dialogue: You leave me with no choice...

Original: Ultimecia:I cannot imagine you will believe me so easily. Take this.
Dialogue: I cannot imagine you will believe me so easily. Take this.

Original: Mog:Y-your dimensional coordinates, kupo!?
Dialogue: Y-your dimensional coordinates, kupo!?

Original: Ultimecia:I want you to know the true me...
Dialogue: I want you to know the true me...

Original: Ultimecia:I will lend you my strength, whenever you so desire.
Dialogue: I will lend you my strength, whenever you so desire.

Original: Relm:The "true" her? Is there some kind of misunderstanding?
Dialogue: The "true" her? Is there some kind of misunderstanding?

Original: Squall:...No. This must be a trap.
Dialogue: ...No. This must be a trap.

Original: Balthier:This is not unprecedented... Let us use what we can.
Dialogue: This is not unprecedented... Let us use what we can.

Original: Balthier:But we should prepare ourselves for when she shows her true colors.
Dialogue: But we should prepare ourselves for when she shows her true colors.

Original: Squall:You don't understand anything!
Dialogue: You don't understand anything!

Original: Balthier:It's natural I don't understand anything of your world.
Dialogue: It's natural I don't understand anything of your world.

Original: Balthier:But I understand that in this world, we can fight side-by-side with our enemies.
Dialogue: But I understand that in this world, we can fight side-by-side with our enemies.

Original: Noel:I know it must be hard for you to hear, but...
Dialogue: I know it must be hard for you to hear, but...

Original: Noel:She really saved us.
Dialogue: She really saved us.

Original: Relm:That's for sure.
Dialogue: That's for sure.

Original: Mog:I took it without thinking, kupo...
Dialogue: I took it without thinking, kupo...

Original: Balthier:We just need to get used to it.
Dialogue: We just need to get used to it.

Original: Balthier:We had best prepare ourselves for anything that can come our way.
Dialogue: We had best prepare ourselves for anything that can come our way.

Original: Balthier:But understand this, Noel: this doesn't mean we support that sorceress.
Dialogue: But understand this, Noel this doesn't mean we support that sorceress.

Original: Noel:I understand. We're just "using" her...
Dialogue: I understand. We're just "using" her...

Original: Rydia:I have to admit...her magic is incredible.
Dialogue: I have to admit...her magic is incredible.

Original: Zell:Don't be fooled, Rydia! That's just what she wants you to think!
Dialogue: Don't be fooled, Rydia! That's just what she wants you to think!

Original: Rydia:Is it?
Dialogue: Is it?

Original: Ultimecia:What seems to be the matter over here?
Dialogue: What seems to be the matter over here?

Original: Seifer:Don't play dumb. I know what you're up to.
Dialogue: Don't play dumb. I know what you're up to.

Original: Seifer:Ever since you arrived, monsters have been appearing like crazy.
Dialogue: Ever since you arrived, monsters have been appearing like crazy.

Original: Zell:That's right! You're just putting on an act, aren't you!?
Dialogue: That's right! You're just putting on an act, aren't you!?

Original: Squall:(Wow, sharp...)
Dialogue: (Wow, sharp...)

Original: Ultimecia:...Your accusations are disheartening. I see you do not trust me yet.
Dialogue: ...Your accusations are disheartening. I see you do not trust me yet.

Original: Noel:You've saved us. That much I know for sure.
Dialogue: You've saved us. That much I know for sure.

Original: Noel:But I also know that you're an enemy to Squall and his friends...
Dialogue: But I also know that you're an enemy to Squall and his friends...

Original: Zell:Yeah! I might not remember you at all, but...
Dialogue: Yeah! I might not remember you at all, but...

Original: Zell:I know you're up to something!
Dialogue: I know you're up to something!

Original: Seifer:I dedicated myself to being your knight and you betrayed me. There's no way I could ever trust you.
Dialogue: I dedicated myself to being your knight and you betrayed me. There's no way I could ever trust you.

Original: Squall:(...He's right.)
Dialogue: (...He's right.)

Original: Ultimecia:...I understand.
Dialogue: ...I understand.

Original: Ultimecia:But remember this: my heart is always on your side.
Dialogue: But remember this my heart is always on your side.

Original: Noel:The lonely sorceress... Squall's enemy...
Dialogue: The lonely sorceress... Squall's enemy...

Original: Noel:But she saved me from my own solitude. I don't understand her goal...
Dialogue: But she saved me from my own solitude. I don't understand her goal...

Original: Seifer:Hmph. She's trying to trick us.
Dialogue: Hmph. She's trying to trick us.

Original: Zell:Even though I can't remember her, I feel so annoyed! Just how bad will it be when I actually remember!?
Dialogue: Even though I can't remember her, I feel so annoyed! Just how bad will it be when I actually remember!?

Original: Rydia:Calm down, you two.
Dialogue: Calm down, you two.

Original: Squall:(Just what is Ultimecia planning...?)
Dialogue: (Just what is Ultimecia planning...?)

Original: Kefka:Welcome back, Madam Sorceress!
Dialogue: Welcome back, Madam Sorceress!

Original: Kefka:I saw it all! From beginning to end!
Dialogue: I saw it all! From beginning to end!

Original: Kefka:Getting their sympathy, taking advantage of their kind hearts! You are, indeed, a cunning sorceress!
Dialogue: Getting their sympathy, taking advantage of their kind hearts! You are, indeed, a cunning sorceress!

Original: Ultimecia:I have no need to be understood by you.
Dialogue: I have no need to be understood by you.

Original: Kefka:Yes, yes! I get it!
Dialogue: Yes, yes! I get it!

Original: Kefka:You'll get them to lower their guard, then hit them where it hurts most!
Dialogue: You'll get them to lower their guard, then hit them where it hurts most!

Original: Ultimecia:I would have accomplished my goal had they not been there...
Dialogue: I would have accomplished my goal had they not been there...

Original: Ultimecia:You and I are different, clown. I did not destroy everything.
Dialogue: You and I are different, clown. I did not destroy everything.

Original: Ultimecia:Nevertheless, the world sees me as evil because of those children...
Dialogue: Nevertheless, the world sees me as evil because of those children...

Original: Kefka:Wow, how outrageous! Isn't being despised just the greatest?
Dialogue: Wow, how outrageous! Isn't being despised just the greatest?

Original: Kefka:You're so full of hate and sadness! You really are scary!
Dialogue: You're so full of hate and sadness! You really are scary!

Original: Ultimecia:...But the eyes of that boy who said he believes me...
Dialogue: ...But the eyes of that boy who said he believes me...

Original: Ultimecia:Hmph... It's just my imagination.
Dialogue: Hmph... It's just my imagination.

Original: Lilisette:Hmm... I just don't get it.
Dialogue: Hmm... I just don't get it.

Original: Cinque:Thinking about it makes Cinquey's noodle hurt...
Dialogue: Thinking about it makes Cinquey's noodle hurt...

Original: Vaan:Hey. What's with the long faces?
Dialogue: Hey. What's with the long faces?

Original: Papalymo:We were just mulling over Ultimecia's behavior.
Dialogue: We were just mulling over Ultimecia's behavior.

Original: Fran:We thought she may have some ulterior motive, but nothing has happened yet.
Dialogue: We thought she may have some ulterior motive, but nothing has happened yet.

Original: Eiko:I wonder if she really is just lonely.
Dialogue: I wonder if she really is just lonely.

Original: Lilisette:Didn't Squall say that she was trying to compress past, present, and future...
Dialogue: Didn't Squall say that she was trying to compress past, present, and future...

Original: Lilisette:And create a world where only she can exist?
Dialogue: And create a world where only she can exist?

Original: Lilisette:Not simply traveling through time to change the future, but eliminating all time that should be...
Dialogue: Not simply traveling through time to change the future, but eliminating all time that should be...

Original: Lilisette:Any way you look at it, it's terrible!
Dialogue: Any way you look at it, it's terrible!

Original: Cinque:Sounds like a big bad meanie to me! Can she really do that, though?
Dialogue: Sounds like a big bad meanie to me! Can she really do that, though?

Original: Fran:Changing the world changes its principles... Anything is possible.
Dialogue: Changing the world changes its principles... Anything is possible.

Original: Vaan:But that's only in Squall's world, right?
Dialogue: But that's only in Squall's world, right?

Original: Vaan:Would it even work if she tried to do that here?
Dialogue: Would it even work if she tried to do that here?

Original: Papalymo:That is precisely what we are discussing.
Dialogue: That is precisely what we are discussing.

Original: Papalymo:Heretofore, her reasons for shadowing us were clear...
Dialogue: Heretofore, her reasons for shadowing us were clear...

Original: Papalymo:She planned to use Mog,possessed by the Blackened Will, as a foundation for her time compression.
Dialogue: She planned to use Mog, possessed by the Blackened Will, as a foundation for her time compression.

Original: Cinque:But that evil will's gone bye-bye and Moglin's A-okay now!
Dialogue: But that evil will's gone bye-bye and Moglin's A-okay now!

Original: Fran:So she no longer has reason to pursue us.
Dialogue: So she no longer has reason to pursue us.

Original: Papalymo:And even less to help us in battle.
Dialogue: And even less to help us in battle.

Original: Eiko:But I still don't get why she would say she's lonely, then try to erase everyone else!
Dialogue: But I still don't get why she would say she's lonely, then try to erase everyone else!

Original: Eiko:Isn't this what they call a...contra...contradiction?
Dialogue: Isn't this what they call a...contra...contradiction?

Original: Fran:...One feels loneliness only because of the presence of others.
Dialogue: ...One feels loneliness only because of the presence of others.

Original: Eiko:What? Really?
Dialogue: What? Really?

Original: Lilisette:Ahaha! I guess it's hard for a kid like Eiko to understand.
Dialogue: Ahaha! I guess it's hard for a kid like Eiko to understand.

Original: Eiko:Hey! I'm not a kid!
Dialogue: Hey! I'm not a kid!

Original: Vaan:...I was an orphan, too, so I can understand.
Dialogue: ...I was an orphan, too, so I can understand.

Original: Vaan:When you realize you really are all alone, nothing matters anymore...
Dialogue: When you realize you really are all alone, nothing matters anymore...

Original: Lilisette:So you mean Ultimecia is getting desperate?
Dialogue: So you mean Ultimecia is getting desperate?

Original: Cinque:That's scary! There's no telling what she'll do next!
Dialogue: That's scary! There's no telling what she'll do next!

Original: Cinque:So? Any idea what might she be up to?
Dialogue: So? Any idea what might she be up to?

Original: Fran:...We are back to where we started.
Dialogue: ...We are back to where we started.

Original: Papalymo:At the very least, we must keep our wits about us.
Dialogue: At the very least, we must keep our wits about us.

Original: Papalymo:I will not say to not sympathize, though...
Dialogue: I will not say to not sympathize, though...

Original: Yuna:Here I go!
Dialogue: Here I go!

Original: Garnet:Me too!
Dialogue: Me too!

Original: Ultimecia:...You both have great skill in magic.
Dialogue: ...You both have great skill in magic.

Original: Ultimecia:Continue to devote yourself to magic. I will support you from the shadows...
Dialogue: Continue to devote yourself to magic. I will support you from the shadows...

Original: Wakka:Yuna!
Dialogue: Yuna!

Original: Steiner:My apologies for being so late! Please tell me Ultimecia has not laid a finger on you!
Dialogue: My apologies for being so late! Please tell me Ultimecia has not laid a finger on you!

Original: Garnet:I'm fine, Steiner.
Dialogue: I'm fine, Steiner.

Original: Lulu:And you, Yuna? Nothing, I hope.
Dialogue: And you, Yuna? Nothing, I hope.

Original: Yuna:No need to worry. But thank you, Lulu.
Dialogue: No need to worry. But thank you, Lulu.

Original: Wakka:I can't tell what she's thinking... But there's no need for you to worry.
Dialogue: I can't tell what she's thinking... But there's no need for you to worry.

Original: Steiner:Exactly! Whatever happens, we will be here to protect you!
Dialogue: Exactly! Whatever happens, we will be here to protect you!

Original: Seifer:...How pathetic. Making a show out of it...
Dialogue: ...How pathetic. Making a show out of it...

Original: Wakka:What are you talking about?
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Original: Seifer:You! Fawning over your masters like a bunch of lapdogs.
Dialogue: You! Fawning over your masters like a bunch of lapdogs.

Original: Seifer:Like you don't have any will of your own! It's annoying just looking at you!
Dialogue: Like you don't have any will of your own! It's annoying just looking at you!

Original: Wakka:You're just trying to pick a fight now!
Dialogue: You're just trying to pick a fight now!

Original: Lulu:I think he's jealous, no longer the sorceress's knight.
Dialogue: I think he's jealous, no longer the sorceress's knight.

Original: Seifer:Shut it! Unless you want me to shut it for you!
Dialogue: Shut it! Unless you want me to shut it for you!

Original: Yuna:Please, stop this.
Dialogue: Please, stop this.

Original: Steiner:I protect the princess because of her graciousness!
Dialogue: I protect the princess because of her graciousness!

Original: Steiner:Make no mistake: it is not only out of duty as a knight!
Dialogue: Make no mistake it is not only out of duty as a knight!

Original: Wakka:Lu and I are the same. Before we were guardians, we were her family.
Dialogue: Lu and I are the same. Before we were guardians, we were her family.

Original: Lulu:We are just protecting our family... I hope you understand that.
Dialogue: We are just protecting our family... I hope you understand that.

Original: Seifer:Tch... Did I ask you for excuses?
Dialogue: Tch... Did I ask you for excuses?

Original: Garnet:Listen to what you're saying...
