Dialogue: I have no need for those who question everything. A pawn should move as directed, without a second thought.

Original: Quistis:What a way of thinking... Is this what dictators are like?
Dialogue: What a way of thinking... Is this what dictators are like?

Original: Cecil:Emperor! I have no intention of siding with you!
Dialogue: Emperor! I have no intention of siding with you!

Original: Kain:And I am the same. I will sully the title of dragoon no further. I will not betray my friends again!
Dialogue: And I am the same. I will sully the title of dragoon no further. I will not betray my friends again!

Original: The Emperor:Hmph. Swayed by sentiment, I see. You truly are fools...
Dialogue: Hmph. Swayed by sentiment, I see. You truly are fools...

Original: The Emperor:Then you will regret your folly! Haaaaaa...!
Dialogue: Then you will regret your folly! Haaaaaa...!

Original: Palom:Yikes! Does he really want to fight us!?
Dialogue: Yikes! Does he really want to fight us!?

Original: Onion Knight:That's fine with me. He's really getting on my nerves.
Dialogue: That's fine with me. He's really getting on my nerves.

Original: Quistis:Indeed. Let's teach him a lesson...!
Dialogue: Indeed. Let's teach him a lesson...!

Original: ???:So this is a different world fromOrience...
Dialogue: So this is a different world from Orience...

Original: ???:For a place created to give "respite," it looks an awful lot like a battlefield.
Dialogue: For a place created to give "respite," it looks an awful lot like a battlefield.

Original: ???:Huh? Are those...
Dialogue: Huh? Are those...

Original: ???:Magic bullets! Are these from Cater's pistol...?
Dialogue: Magic bullets! Are these from Cater's pistol...?

Original: ???:These are Ace's cards! Used in battle, no less.
Dialogue: These are Ace's cards! Used in battle, no less.

Original: ???:So they're here, too...
Dialogue: So they're here, too...

Original: ???:That goddess was telling the truth after all.
Dialogue: That goddess was telling the truth after all.

Original: Kefka:Well, well, what do we have here?
Dialogue: Well, well, what do we have here?

Original: ???:Who're you?
Dialogue: Who're you?

Original: ???:Cadets? So you know Ace and the others?
Dialogue: Cadets? So you know Ace and the others?

Original: Kefka:Know them? Yes! I absolutely, positively abhor them!
Dialogue: Know them? Yes! I absolutely, positively abhor them!

Original: Kefka:They're always meddling in my plans! And there're so many of them, babbling on about friendship and bonds! Blargh!
Dialogue: They're always meddling in my plans! And there're so many of them, babbling on about friendship and bonds! Blargh!

Original: Kefka:Andnot too long ago... Why, my poor baby Blackened Wills...!
Dialogue: And not too long ago... Why, my poor baby Blackened Wills...!

Original: Kefka:Ooh! Just thinking about it makes me want to scream!
Dialogue: Ooh! Just thinking about it makes me want to scream!

Original: ???:(There's no mistaking it. He's definitely an enemy.)
Dialogue: (There's no mistaking it. He's definitely an enemy.)

Original: Kefka:Which is why you, my fresh-faced foe, will be paying the price for your friends' transgressions!
Dialogue: Which is why you, my fresh-faced foe, will be paying the price for your friends' transgressions!

Original: Kefka:If you want to hate someone, hate your dear friends! Prepare for a whooping!
Dialogue: If you want to hate someone, hate your dear friends! Prepare for a whooping!

Original: ???:(Let's see if I can't turn this around...)
Dialogue: (Let's see if I can't turn this around...)

Original: ???:P-please, don't hurt me!
Dialogue: P-please, don't hurt me!

Original: Kefka:...Oh? What's this now?
Dialogue: ...Oh? What's this now?

Original: ???:I'm unarmed! I'm no threat to you!
Dialogue: I'm unarmed! I'm no threat to you!

Original: Kefka:What's wrong with you!? You're nothing but a coward!
Dialogue: What's wrong with you!? You're nothing but a coward!

Original: Kefka:How annoying! You've ruined all my fun!
Dialogue: How annoying! You've ruined all my fun!

Original: ???:So you'll let me go?
Dialogue: So you'll let me go?

Original: Kefka:Puh-leez. Where's the fun in that?
Dialogue: Puh-leez. Where's the fun in that?

Original: Kefka:There's no way I'm letting you get away so easily!
Dialogue: There's no way I'm letting you get away so easily!

Original: Kefka:I'm sure there's something we can do...
Dialogue: I'm sure there's something we can do...

Original: Kefka:Oho, I have a great idea! Watch this!
Dialogue: Oho, I have a great idea! Watch this!

Original: ???:(...What a fool.)
Dialogue: (...What a fool.)

Original: Kefka:Heh heh heh!
Dialogue: Heh heh heh!

Original: Auron:To what do we owe this unexpected visit?
Dialogue: To what do we owe this unexpected visit?

Original: Kefka:Ladies and gentlemen, today is a special day!
Dialogue: Ladies and gentlemen, today is a special day!

Original: Kefka:I've come to give you my heartfelt thanks!
Dialogue: I've come to give you my heartfelt thanks!

Original: Cater:What are you talking about?
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Original: Kefka:Not long ago, you had the audacity of trouncing my Wilburinos!
Dialogue: Not long ago, you had the audacity of trouncing my Wilburinos!

Original: Ace:Not this again...
Dialogue: Not this again...

Original: Yang:We will destroy them however many times it takes. When will you learn your lesson?
Dialogue: We will destroy them however many times it takes. When will you learn your lesson?

Original: Kefka:Nobody asked you! Go jump in a lake!
Dialogue: Nobody asked you! Go jump in a lake!

Original: Kefka:Now then, I have a question for you.
Dialogue: Now then, I have a question for you.

Original: Kefka:Can you still keep that cheeky attitude up after seeing this?
Dialogue: Can you still keep that cheeky attitude up after seeing this?

Original: Cater:How did you get captured by Kefka!?
Dialogue: How did you get captured by Kefka!?

Original: Eight:Hey, Cater! Looks like you're doing well.
Dialogue: Hey, Cater! Looks like you're doing well.

Original: Cater:This isn't the time for casual greetings!
Dialogue: This isn't the time for casual greetings!

Original: Yang:It appears he is a friend of Ace and the others.
Dialogue: It appears he is a friend of Ace and the others.

Original: Auron:This is troublesome...
Dialogue: This is troublesome...

Original: Kefka:Heh heh heh! Feeling helpless yet?
Dialogue: Heh heh heh! Feeling helpless yet?

Original: Kefka:If you value this chump's life, you'll let me beat you up for what you've done!
Dialogue: If you value this chump's life, you'll let me beat you up for what you've done!

Original: Cater:Kefka, you coward!
Dialogue: Kefka, you coward!

Original: Ace:You fiend...
Dialogue: You fiend...

Original: Kefka:Oh, thank you! Thank you! What high praise!
Dialogue: Oh, thank you! Thank you! What high praise!

Original: Eight:Alright. I guess I've been in here long enough...
Dialogue: Alright. I guess I've been in here long enough...

Original: Kefka:Wh-what!? Did you just get out of my prison!?
Dialogue: Wh-what!? Did you just get out of my prison!?

Original: Ace:Are you alright, Eight?
Dialogue: Are you alright, Eight?

Original: Eight:I'm fine.
Dialogue: I'm fine.

Original: Eight:He was nice enough to take me to you guys.
Dialogue: He was nice enough to take me to you guys.

Original: Kefka:You, you...used me! How dare you!?
Dialogue: You, you...used me! How dare you!?

Original: Eight:Thanks to you, we were reunited. Much obliged, Mr. Kefka, sir!
Dialogue: Thanks to you, we were reunited. Much obliged, Mr. Kefka, sir!

Original: Kefka:Damn you! You told me you were unarmed!
Dialogue: Damn you! You told me you were unarmed!

Original: Eight:I'm not really unarmed...
Dialogue: I'm not really unarmed...

Original: Eight:My weapons are...my fists!
Dialogue: My weapons are...my fists!

Original: Kefka:Why you why you why you little! You're gonna pay for making a dupe out of me!
Dialogue: Why you why you why you little—! You're gonna pay for making a dupe out of me!

Original: Eight:Maybe this will teach you to judge your hostages better.
Dialogue: Maybe this will teach you to judge your hostages better.

Original: Kefka:Oooh! I've had it with you and your cheek!
Dialogue: Oooh! I've had it with you and your cheek!

Original: Eight:Mission complete!
Dialogue: Mission complete!

Original: King:Good job, Eight. Seems you haven't lost your touch.
Dialogue: Good job, Eight. Seems you haven't lost your touch.

Original: Deuce:I'm happy to see you unharmed, and to fight beside you again.
Dialogue: I'm happy to see you unharmed, and to fight beside you again.

Original: Zell:Looks like you pack quite the punch!
Dialogue: Looks like you pack quite the punch!

Original: Sabin:I'm sure you can knock some sense into your enemies with those fists. You must have trained very hard!
Dialogue: I'm sure you can knock some sense into your enemies with those fists. You must have trained very hard!

Original: Eight:So you're the warriors from other worlds. I heard about you from the goddess.
Dialogue: So you're the warriors from other worlds. I heard about you from the goddess.

Original: Relm:I thought you'd be a total weakling because you got captured by that silly clown!
Dialogue: I thought you'd be a total weakling because you got captured by that silly clown!

Original: Eight:Clever plan, wasn't it? I was able to turn the tide in my favor.
Dialogue: Clever plan, wasn't it? I was able to turn the tide in my favor.

Original: Zell:You managed to stay so calm, even though you just got to this world. It's amazing!
Dialogue: You managed to stay so calm, even though you just got to this world. It's amazing!

Original: King:He's known for his quick wit, even among the other Class Zero students.
Dialogue: He's known for his quick wit, even among the other Class Zero students.

Original: Deuce:No matter what happens on the battlefield, he never loses his cool.
Dialogue: No matter what happens on the battlefield, he never loses his cool.

Original: Relm:How awesome!
Dialogue: How awesome!

Original: Relm:Your fighting style's like the overfed muscle-man and the rowdy punk, but your personality is completely different!
Dialogue: Your fighting style's like the overfed muscle-man and the rowdy punk, but your personality is completely different!

Original: Zell:Hey! Who're you calling rowdy!?
Dialogue: Hey! Who're you calling rowdy!?

Original: Sabin:Hahaha! She has a point. We're more likely to act first, then think later.
Dialogue: Hahaha! She has a point. We're more likely to act first, then think later.

Original: Sabin:All the more reason that martial arts was the right path for me to walk! A perfect match, don't you think?
Dialogue: All the more reason that martial arts was the right path for me to walk! A perfect match, don't you think?

Original: Deuce:Well, when you put it that way...
Dialogue: Well, when you put it that way...

Original: King:Zell, Sabin, Yang, Snow...
Dialogue: Zell, Sabin, Yang, Snow...

Original: King:There certainly are a lot of hot-blooded martial artists from the other worlds.
Dialogue: There certainly are a lot of hot-blooded martial artists from the other worlds.

Original: Zell:So why did you decide to become a martial artist, Eight?
Dialogue: So why did you decide to become a martial artist, Eight?

Original: Relm:I want to know, too! Tell us!
Dialogue: I want to know, too! Tell us!

Original: Eight:Hmm... Well, if I had to say, it's because of my beliefs.
Dialogue: Hmm... Well, if I had to say, it's because of my beliefs.

Original: Sabin:Your beliefs?
Dialogue: Your beliefs?

Original: Eight:Having a weapon that easily takes the life of others doesn't suit me.
Dialogue: Having a weapon that easily takes the life of others doesn't suit me.

Original: Eight:That's why I want to remember my opponents through the pain in my fists.
Dialogue: That's why I want to remember my opponents through the pain in my fists.

Original: Zell:You've got so much passion! Why didn't you say anything sooner?
Dialogue: You've got so much passion! Why didn't you say anything sooner?

Original: Sabin:We've been waiting for someone like you!
Dialogue: We've been waiting for someone like you!

Original: Relm:Whoa, they're so moved!
Dialogue: Whoa, they're so moved!

Original: Zell:C'mon, let's not wait another second! Let's get to talkingwith our fists!
Dialogue: C'mon, let's not wait another second! Let's get to talking—with our fists!

Original: Sabin:We'll introduce you to the others and start training right away!
Dialogue: We'll introduce you to the others and start training right away!

Original: Eight:I like the sound of that.
Dialogue: I like the sound of that.

Original: Deuce:Their personalities are total opposites...
Dialogue: Their personalities are total opposites...

Original: King:But it seems like their hearts understand each other.
Dialogue: But it seems like their hearts understand each other.

Original: Snow:Alright, alright! Here I go!
Dialogue: Alright, alright! Here I go!

Original: Yang:I won't hold back...!
Dialogue: I won't hold back...!

Original: Eight:I think my fists will get plenty of good training in this world.
Dialogue: I think my fists will get plenty of good training in this world.

Original: Kimahri:Hyah!
Dialogue: Hyah!

Original: Eight:Nice one. I could never hope to put such force behind an attack...
Dialogue: Nice one. I could never hope to put such force behind an attack...

Original: Cater:Oh, what's that I hear? Is that jealousy in your voice? Sad you aren't as big as our friend here?
Dialogue: Oh, what's that I hear? Is that jealousy in your voice? Sad you aren't as big as our friend here?

Original: Eight:...No, that's not it.
Dialogue: ...No, that's not it.

Original: Lann:Now that you mention it, Eight is pretty small compared to King and your other classmates.
Dialogue: Now that you mention it, Eight is pretty small compared to King and your other classmates.

Original: Reynn:Hah! Like you have any right to call someone small!
Dialogue: Hah! Like you have any right to call someone small!

Original: Cater:Well, he has grown a little since we first met. Just a little...
Dialogue: Well, he has grown a little since we first met. Just a little...

Original: Eight:You've been keeping track, huh?
Dialogue: You've been keeping track, huh?

Original: Zidane:Hahaha! Don't take it personally, Eight!
Dialogue: Hahaha! Don't take it personally, Eight!

Original: Zidane:What Eight and I lack in size, we make up for in speed, right? No need to be ashamed of that.
Dialogue: What Eight and I lack in size, we make up for in speed, right? No need to be ashamed of that.

Original: Reynn:Uh...like what?
Dialogue: Uh...like what?

Original: Lann:Um... Well...
Dialogue: Um... Well...

Original: Lann:Ah! We're cuter!
Dialogue: Ah! We're cuter!

Original: Cater:Really!? I find that hard to believe!
Dialogue: Really!? I find that hard to believe!

Original: Zidane:I guess it goes to show you there are all sorts of places out there.
Dialogue: I guess it goes to show you there are all sorts of places out there.

Original: Kimahri:Kimahri small, so he must train harder than all other Ronso. That is how Kimahri become strong.
Dialogue: Kimahri small, so he must train harder than all other Ronso. That is how Kimahri become strong.

Original: Eight:Right. Size isn't everything. Training is where true strength lies.
Dialogue: Right. Size isn't everything. Training is where true strength lies.

Original: Eight:Effort is how the wheat is separated from the chaff. And we can prove that.
Dialogue: Effort is how the wheat is separated from the chaff. And we can prove that.

Original: Zidane:Now you're talking! I like the sound of that!
Dialogue: Now you're talking! I like the sound of that!

Original: Lann:Yeah, we can stand toe-to-toe with the biggest of them! Team Mighty Minis assemble!
Dialogue: Yeah, we can stand toe-to-toe with the biggest of them! Team Mighty Minis assemble!

Original: Reynn:Ugh... Can we go with a different name, please?
Dialogue: Ugh... Can we go with a different name, please?

Original: Kimahri:Kimahri joins Mighty Minis too.
Dialogue: Kimahri joins Mighty Minis too.

Original: Eight:You're more than welcome. Alright everyone, time to get training!
Dialogue: You're more than welcome. Alright everyone, time to get training!

Original: Cater:Ah, looks like everyone's getting along like pigs in a blanket.
Dialogue: Ah, looks like everyone's getting along like pigs in a blanket.

Original: Cater:I'm glad you made some new friends, Eight, hehe...
Dialogue: I'm glad you made some new friends, Eight, hehe...

Original: Eight:Phew, I'm glad everyone's okay.
Dialogue: Phew, I'm glad everyone's okay.

Original: Seven:You kept a cool head, as always.
Dialogue: You kept a cool head, as always.

Original: Cinque:You know, it might be fun to see you get in a tizzy every once in a while. Give it a try!
Dialogue: You know, it might be fun to see you get in a tizzy every once in a while. Give it a try!

Original: Eight:You still only see the bright side of things, huh?
Dialogue: You still only see the bright side of things, huh?

Original: Deuce:What is it?
Dialogue: What is it?

Original: Eight:Machina seems...different somehow.
Dialogue: Machina seems...different somehow.

Original: Machina:You...remember me?
Dialogue: You...remember me?

Original: Eight:Of course. You transferred to Class 0 at the same time as Rem.
Dialogue: Of course. You transferred to Class 0 at the same time as Rem.

Original: Machina:Anything else?
Dialogue: Anything else?

Original: Eight:Uh...not really. I can't remember much after meeting you.
Dialogue: Uh...not really. I can't remember much after meeting you.

Original: Machina:I see...
Dialogue: I see...

Original: Rem:But even you can tell that he's different somehow.
Dialogue: But even you can tell that he's different somehow.

Original: Ace:He's trying to hide it. He knows something we don't.
Dialogue: He's trying to hide it. He knows something we don't.

Original: Deuce:Not something we don't know... Something we've forgotten.
Dialogue: Not something we don't know... Something we've forgotten.

Original: Eight:What? What do you mean by that?
Dialogue: What? What do you mean by that?

Original: Rem:Well...all of us were called here by Materia. All of us except Machina.
Dialogue: Well...all of us were called here by Materia. All of us except Machina.

Original: Seven:And the warriors called here by Materia don't have all of their memories intact.
Dialogue: And the warriors called here by Materia don't have all of their memories intact.

Original: Eight:What!? Are you serious?
Dialogue: What!? Are you serious?

Original: Cinque:Yeah. We're here to fight, fight, fight!
Dialogue: Yeah. We're here to fight, fight, fight!

Original: Rem:And apparently our memories would only weigh us down.
Dialogue: And apparently our memories would only weigh us down.

Original: Deuce:Yeah, but there is a way to recover our lost memories: by finding brilliance.
Dialogue: Yeah, but there is a way to recover our lost memories by finding brilliance.

Original: Ace:More than a few of our new allies have recovered their memories that way.
Dialogue: More than a few of our new allies have recovered their memories that way.

Original: Ace:But they don't always remember good things. We aren't afraid of that, thoughwe're ready for whatever they show us.
Dialogue: But they don't always remember good things. We aren't afraid of that, though—we're ready for whatever they show us.

Original: Cinque:Even if the memories make us want to cry our eyes out.
Dialogue: Even if the memories make us want to cry our eyes out.

Original: Ace:You should keep that in mind, so you can prepare yourself.
Dialogue: You should keep that in mind, so you can prepare yourself.

Original: Eight:I understand. Even if our past is full of suffering...
Dialogue: I understand. Even if our past is full of suffering...

Original: Eight:It was the past we chose. We can't look back on it with regret. We have to face it head-on.
Dialogue: It was the past we chose. We can't look back on it with regret. We have to face it head-on.

Original: Seven:That's right.
Dialogue: That's right.

Original: Cinque:Denying who we are would be more sad than anything I can imagine.
Dialogue: Denying who we are would be more sad than anything I can imagine.

Original: Rem:Machina always looks so sad...
Dialogue: Machina always looks so sad...

Original: Deuce:I can understand why. He must feel so alone right now.
Dialogue: I can understand why. He must feel so alone right now.

Original: Eight:That's just another reason we can't run from our past. We can't leave him by himself.
Dialogue: That's just another reason we can't run from our past. We can't leave him by himself.

Original: Eight:We're classmates. We're a team. We're friends.
Dialogue: We're classmates. We're a team. We're friends.

Original: Eight:I think we can all agree on that.
Dialogue: I think we can all agree on that.

Original: Rem:The ground here is uneven, so we should tread carefully.
Dialogue: The ground here is uneven, so we should tread carefully.

Original: Edge:Don't worry. If you fall, I'll take care of you!
Dialogue: Don't worry. If you fall, I'll take care of you!

Original: Vanille:Monsters! Would you take care of those, too, Edge?
Dialogue: Monsters! Would you take care of those, too, Edge?

Original: Warrior of Light:No, we'll fight it together. Let's go!
Dialogue: No, we'll fight it together. Let's go!

Original: Vanille:Whew! Glad that's over.
Dialogue: Whew! Glad that's over.

Original: Edge:Wait. There's someone there.
Dialogue: Wait. There's someone there.

Original: Edge:Do you think he's someone's friend? He doesn't look like an enemy...
Dialogue: Do you think he's someone's friend? He doesn't look like an enemy...

Original: Gau:You! You bully Gau before!
Dialogue: You! You bully Gau before!

Original: Vanille:He seems upset at us!
Dialogue: He seems upset at us!

Original: Rem:Were you attacked by our dark manikins?
Dialogue: Were you attacked by our dark manikins?

Original: Gau:Gau no know you! You, go!
Dialogue: Gau no know you! You, go!

Original: Vanille:Is he angry?
Dialogue: Is he angry?

Original: Rem:Can't we talk this out?
Dialogue: Can't we talk this out?

Original: Edge:I wonder. I don't think it's the dark manikins at fault. I think we've invaded his territory.
Dialogue: I wonder. I don't think it's the dark manikins at fault. I think we've invaded his territory.

Original: Rem:Please listen to us! We promise not to harm you.
Dialogue: Please listen to us! We promise not to harm you.

Original: Vanille:Yes! We want to be friends.
Dialogue: Yes! We want to be friends.

Original: Gau:Gau, gau!
Dialogue: Gau, gau!

Original: Warrior of Light:A peaceful resolution may be out of the question...
Dialogue: A peaceful resolution may be out of the question...

Original: Warrior of Light:That was no ordinary attack. We won't escape unharmed at this rate.
Dialogue: That was no ordinary attack. We won't escape unharmed at this rate.

Original: Gau:You want fight? Gau is strong!
Dialogue: You want fight? Gau is strong!

Original: Warrior of Light:......
Gau:Uwao... Me so hungry...
Dialogue: Uwao... Me so hungry...

Original: Galuf:What a rascal. You're gonna be a handful.
Dialogue: What a rascal. You're gonna be a handful.

Original: Vanille:Please, listen to us!
Dialogue: Please, listen to us!

Original: Gau:Gau no lose!
Dialogue: Gau no lose!

Original: Galuf:Good grief...
Dialogue: Good grief...

Original: Sabin:Are you guys alright? ...Gau!?
Dialogue: Are you guys alright? ...Gau!?

Original: Gau:You...Sabin!? Me no fool!
Dialogue: You...Sabin!? Me no fool!

Original: Gau:You fake! Sabin, fake!
Dialogue: You fake! Sabin, fake!

Original: Sabin:You're calling me a fake!? Are you sure you're not just hungry?
Dialogue: You're calling me a fake!? Are you sure you're not just hungry?

Original: Gau:Dried meat!? Gau! Gau!
Dialogue: Dried meat!? Gau! Gau!

Original: Gau:Tasty meat! Me happy!
Dialogue: Tasty meat! Me happy!

Original: Gau:Sabin, real! Gau miss you!
Dialogue: Sabin, real! Gau miss you!

Original: Sabin:Haha! I'm happy to see you're as lively as ever.
Dialogue: Haha! I'm happy to see you're as lively as ever.

Original: Warrior of Light:So he's a friend of yours, Sabin?
Dialogue: So he's a friend of yours, Sabin?

Original: Sabin:Yeah. His name is Gau. He's not a bad guy.
Dialogue: Yeah. His name is Gau. He's not a bad guy.

Original: Vanille:He recognizes you as being the real deal, but what about us?
Dialogue: He recognizes you as being the real deal, but what about us?

Original: Vanille:I think he was attacked by our dark manikins and doesn't trust us...
Dialogue: I think he was attacked by our dark manikins and doesn't trust us...

Original: Sabin:I see. That's why he called me a fake.
Dialogue: I see. That's why he called me a fake.

Original: Sabin:Gau, these people are our friends. They're not the ones who attacked you. Do you understand?
Dialogue: Gau, these people are our friends. They're not the ones who attacked you. Do you understand?

Original: Gau:Smell...not same. Gau make mistake.
Dialogue: Smell...not same. Gau make mistake.

Original: Galuf:Ho ho, what an honest child.
Dialogue: Ho ho, what an honest child.

Original: Warrior of Light:What is it?
Dialogue: What is it?

Original: Gau:Shiny! Shiny, shiny!
Dialogue: Shiny! Shiny, shiny!

Original: Gau:Gau...?
Dialogue: Gau...?

Original: Gau:Me see you raggedy now.
Dialogue: Me see you raggedy now.

Original: Gau:But shiny before.
Dialogue: But shiny before.

Original: Warrior of Light:What do you mean?
Dialogue: What do you mean?

Original: Vanille:Perhaps he noticed something while fighting?
Dialogue: Perhaps he noticed something while fighting?

Original: Warrior of Light:Shiny...? Like a light...?
Dialogue: Shiny...? Like a light...?

Original: Gau:You amazing! Gau strong, but you also strong!
Dialogue: You amazing! Gau strong, but you also strong!

Original: Gau:Gau was surprised. Me think together be fun.
Dialogue: Gau was surprised. Me think together be fun.

Original: Warrior of Light:If you're a friend of Sabin, you're a friend of ours.
Dialogue: If you're a friend of Sabin, you're a friend of ours.

Original: Gau:Gau! Me go together!
Dialogue: Gau! Me go together!

Original: Onion Knight:Now that I think about it, didn't Gau tell us to leave when we first met?
Dialogue: Now that I think about it, didn't Gau tell us to leave when we first met?

Original: Onion Knight:Has this area always been your territory?
Dialogue: Has this area always been your territory?

Original: Gau:Where is here? Me no know this place.
Dialogue: Where is here? Me no know this place.

Original: Edgar:Were you lost?
Dialogue: Were you lost?

Original: Gau:Gau meet Materia, then come here.
Dialogue: Gau meet Materia, then come here.

Original: Balthier:Well, that certainly sounds like the goddess.
Dialogue: Well, that certainly sounds like the goddess.

Original: Balthier:Then what happened? What did Materia say?
Dialogue: Then what happened? What did Materia say?

Original: Gau:Gau forget!
Dialogue: Gau forget!

Original: Edgar:It's no matter. There are a lot of things we don't know.
Dialogue: It's no matter. There are a lot of things we don't know.

Original: Edgar:Materia should understand as much...
Dialogue: Materia should understand as much...

Original: Edgar:I'm sure she said the same to you as she did to our other comrades: that you can help us fight.
Dialogue: I'm sure she said the same to you as she did to our other comrades that you can help us fight.

Original: Tidus:We're happy to have you on the team!
Dialogue: We're happy to have you on the team!

Original: Gau:Gau strong! Me help you!
Dialogue: Gau strong! Me help you!

Original: Onion Knight:I'm sure you will.
Dialogue: I'm sure you will.

Original: Tidus:Your intuition in the wild must be something else!
Dialogue: Your intuition in the wild must be something else!

Original: Tidus:You really are...something else...
Dialogue: You really are...something else...

Original: Gau:You! Get food!
Dialogue: You! Get food!

Original: Tidus:Why me!?
Dialogue: Why me!?

Original: Balthier:I'm rather famished myself. While you're out, could you grab me something fresh as well?
Dialogue: I'm rather famished myself. While you're out, could you grab me something fresh as well?

Original: Tidus:You've got to be kidding me! Is there even anything to eat around here?
Dialogue: You've got to be kidding me! Is there even anything to eat around here?

Original: Onion Knight:Alright, that's enough. We've got plenty of food on the ship.
Dialogue: Alright, that's enough. We've got plenty of food on the ship.

Original: Gau:Food!? Gau!
Dialogue: Food!? Gau!

Original: Balthier:...I hope he doesn't eat it all.
Dialogue: ...I hope he doesn't eat it all.

Original: Yuffie:Alright! Recon team in action!
Dialogue: Alright! Recon team in action!

Original: Kain:"Recon team"? I suppose that means us...?
Dialogue: "Recon team"? I suppose that means us...?

Original: Layle:It's hard to get our footing here. Must be why the most nimble of us were chosen.
Dialogue: It's hard to get our footing here. Must be why the most nimble of us were chosen.

Original: Kain:Then let us carry out our duty.
Dialogue: Then let us carry out our duty.

Original: Bartz:No need to be so glum about it! Hey Gau, break through that boulder!
Dialogue: No need to be so glum about it! Hey Gau, break through that boulder!

Original: Gau:Gau! Me won't lose!
Dialogue: Gau! Me won't lose!

Original: Yuffie:Just one sec! No distractions! This isn't play time, you know!
Dialogue: Just one sec! No distractions! This isn't play time, you know!

Original: Kain:Indeed. We should focus on the task at hand.
Dialogue: Indeed. We should focus on the task at hand.

Original: Yuffie:Yeah! I don't know what you guys thought we were doing before, but keep your eyes on the prize.
Dialogue: Yeah! I don't know what you guys thought we were doing before, but keep your eyes on the prize.

Original: Yuffie:The prize being treasure. Treasure which, need I remind you, I've called first dibs on.
Dialogue: The prize being treasure. Treasure which, need I remind you, I've called first dibs on.

Original: Layle:I thought you said no distractions?
Dialogue: I thought you said no distractions?

Original: Yuffie:And I meant it! Anyways...where to next?
Dialogue: And I meant it! Anyways...where to next?

Original: Layle:There's a cliff just up ahead. I can get us down to the bottom.
Dialogue: There's a cliff just up ahead. I can get us down to the bottom.

Original: Layle:But if there's nothing there, then...I suppose we go back.
Dialogue: But if there's nothing there, then...I suppose we go back.

Original: Yuffie:And if something is there?
Dialogue: And if something is there?

Original: Layle:That's up to you. Don't venture off too far, though.
Dialogue: That's up to you. Don't venture off too far, though.

Original: Layle:I'm the one who'll have to watch your back, after all.
Dialogue: I'm the one who'll have to watch your back, after all.

Original: Yuffie:Hey, who do you think you're talking to!? The legendary ninja Yuffie needs no protection!
Dialogue: Hey, who do you think you're talking to!? The legendary ninja Yuffie needs no protection!

Original: Kain:Whether the cliff be high or low, we'll find our way to the bottom easily enough.
Dialogue: Whether the cliff be high or low, we'll find our way to the bottom easily enough.

Original: Bartz:You seem pretty confident about that...
Dialogue: You seem pretty confident about that...

Original: Gau:Gau scared...
Dialogue: Gau scared...

Original: Kain:Scared? Of what?
Dialogue: Scared? Of what?

Original: Bartz:Of heights, of course. He's scared of heights! Too bad...
Dialogue: Of heights, of course. He's scared of heights! Too bad...

Original: Yuffie:Wow, I would've never thought...
Dialogue: Wow, I would've never thought...

Original: Gau:Gau scared, but...Gau try!
Dialogue: Gau scared, but...Gau try!

Original: Bartz:Wh-what!? But...it looks so high...
Dialogue: Wh-what!? But...it looks so high...

Original: Layle:There's no need to do something you're not comfortable with.
Dialogue: There's no need to do something you're not comfortable with.

Original: Layle:It might take a bit of effort, but if heights are that difficult for you, then we can look for a way down that doesn't involve jumping.
Dialogue: It might take a bit of effort, but if heights are that difficult for you, then we can look for a way down that doesn't involve jumping.

Original: Gau:Gau! Thank you!
Dialogue: Gau! Thank you!

Original: Gau:But Gau must try! If Gau no try, Gau no learn!
Dialogue: But Gau must try! If Gau no try, Gau no learn!

Original: Yuffie:You said it, Gau! And you'll have me right by your side at every step!
Dialogue: You said it, Gau! And you'll have me right by your side at every step!

Original: Yuffie:It's settled then! Let's go, Gau! Bartz, you too!
Dialogue: It's settled then! Let's go, Gau! Bartz, you too!

Original: Bartz:M-me...? Uh...I'll pass.
Dialogue: M-me...? Uh...I'll pass.

Original: Gau:If Gau no fear heights, then Gau get stronger! Bartz should get stronger too!
Dialogue: If Gau no fear heights, then Gau get stronger! Bartz should get stronger too!

Original: Bartz:R-right! Okay, I'll give it a shot!
Dialogue: R-right! Okay, I'll give it a shot!

Original: Gau:Gau happy! Let's learn together!
Dialogue: Gau happy! Let's learn together!

Original: Yuffie:Let's! Now this is the kind of partnership that can lead to great thingsand great treasure!
Dialogue: Let's! Now this is the kind of partnership that can lead to great things—and great treasure!

Original: Kain:I've no doubt this will be fruitful for you as well, Bartz. Let us see each other through this trial together.
Dialogue: I've no doubt this will be fruitful for you as well, Bartz. Let us see each other through this trial together.

Original: Gau:Thou! Thou!
Dialogue: Thou! Thou!

Original: Cyan:Thou art in characteristically high spirits, my friend.
Dialogue: Thou art in characteristically high spirits, my friend.

Original: Gau:Spirits? Where?
Dialogue: Spirits? Where?

Original: Steiner:Your spirit, lad. He means to say you're as lively as ever.
Dialogue: Your spirit, lad. He means to say you're as lively as ever.

Original: Gau:Yes! Gau lively! Mr. Thou has high spirits too!
Dialogue: Yes! Gau lively! Mr. Thou has high spirits too!

Original: Quistis:Gau seems to find your way of speaking highly entertaining.
Dialogue: Gau seems to find your way of speaking highly entertaining.

Original: Cyan:As he did when we first met. I don't believe he'll ever tire of it.
Dialogue: As he did when we first met. I don't believe he'll ever tire of it.

Original: Cyan:I can't help but wonder if that's all he remembers about me.
Dialogue: I can't help but wonder if that's all he remembers about me.

Original: Yang:Regardless, meeting you seems to have put his mind at ease.
Dialogue: Regardless, meeting you seems to have put his mind at ease.

Original: Gau:Gau was lonely. Gau's friends gone.
Dialogue: Gau was lonely. Gau's friends gone.

Original: Steiner:It must have been frightening for you. Luckily you were able to find your allies.
Dialogue: It must have been frightening for you. Luckily you were able to find your allies.

Original: Quistis:It's only natural to be afraid. No one can really prepare for being thrust into an unknown world.
Dialogue: It's only natural to be afraid. No one can really prepare for being thrust into an unknown world.

Original: Gau:Was Quistis scared too? Lonely without friends?
Dialogue: Was Quistis scared too? Lonely without friends?

Original: Quistis:Hmmm... I wonder.
Dialogue: Hmmm... I wonder.

Original: Gau:Quistis doesn't know? Then Gau ask Squall!
Dialogue: Quistis doesn't know? Then Gau ask Squall!

Original: Quistis:There's no need for that. Okay, I admit it...I was scared.
Dialogue: There's no need for that. Okay, I admit it...I was scared.

Original: Gau:Gau happy you find your friends.
Dialogue: Gau happy you find your friends.

Original: Quistis:Yes, I am as well.
Dialogue: Yes, I am as well.

Original: Cyan:I waited too long before coming to meet thou. I am truly sorry, Gau.
Dialogue: I waited too long before coming to meet thou. I am truly sorry, Gau.

Original: Gau:Don't worry, Mr. Thou! Gau is happy now!
Dialogue: Don't worry, Mr. Thou! Gau is happy now!

Original: Yang:His respect for you is plain to see. A trustworthy friend is an invaluable ally.
Dialogue: His respect for you is plain to see. A trustworthy friend is an invaluable ally.

Original: Cyan:We art in agreement there. Gau, thy presence warms my heart.
Dialogue: We art in agreement there. Gau, thy presence warms my heart.

Original: Gau:Thy! Thy!
Dialogue: Thy! Thy!

Original: Laguna:Whoa! What's going on!?
Dialogue: Whoa! What's going on!?

Original: Cid:I hope there aren't any numbskulls up on deck! If there are, hold on tight!
Dialogue: I hope there aren't any numbskulls up on deck! If there are, hold on tight!

Original: Laguna:Careful, Cid! Both hands on the wheel!
Dialogue: Careful, Cid! Both hands on the wheel!

Original: Setzer:Don't blame this one on the pilot.
Dialogue: Don't blame this one on the pilot.

Original: Cecil:No question, that's the cause there.
Dialogue: No question, that's the cause there.

Original: Laguna:Where? Is that...a giant Torsion!?
Dialogue: Where? Is that...a giant Torsion!?

Original: Setzer:It seems someone wants our company. Talk about tacky invitations.
Dialogue: It seems someone wants our company. Talk about tacky invitations.

Original: Cid:Exactly! At this rate, we'll be sucked in!
Dialogue: Exactly! At this rate, we'll be sucked in!

Original: Cid:I can't shake it! If we're gonna be swallowed, it might as well be nose first!
Dialogue: I can't shake it! If we're gonna be swallowed, it might as well be nose first!

Original: Cid:I'm takin' her in!
Dialogue: I'm takin' her in!

Original: Laguna:Hey, hey! You can't be serious!
Dialogue: Hey, hey! You can't be serious!

Original: Cecil:Is this really someone's trap? There aren't even any monsters around...
Dialogue: Is this really someone's trap? There aren't even any monsters around...

Original: Setzer:Kam'lanaut... You were waiting for us? Do you enjoy kidnapping people by the airshipful?
Dialogue: Kam'lanaut... You were waiting for us? Do you enjoy kidnapping people by the airshipful?

Original: Cid:Airships're full of delicate instruments, y'know! You're paying for anything broken!
Dialogue: Airships're full of delicate instruments, y'know! You're paying for anything broken!

Original: Laguna:Yeah! And I was outside! You almost broke my neck!
Dialogue: Yeah! And I was outside! You almost broke my neck!

Original: Cid:Aww, you're tough. You can take a bump or two.
Dialogue: Aww, you're tough. You can take a bump or two.

Original: Setzer:Let's not make this any more complicated. Just keep quiet for a bit, please.
Dialogue: Let's not make this any more complicated. Just keep quiet for a bit, please.

Original: Laguna:Oh, right. It can wait. Let's find out what he wants.
Dialogue: Oh, right. It can wait. Let's find out what he wants.

Original: Cecil:Eald'narche isn't with you?
Dialogue: Eald'narche isn't with you?

Original: Kam'lanaut:I have come to you to discuss a matter.
Dialogue: I have come to you to discuss a matter.

Original: Setzer:"Come" to us? That's a funny way to put it when you dragged us in like that.
Dialogue: "Come" to us? That's a funny way to put it when you dragged us in like that.

Original: Setzer:I've about had it up to here after what you did to our airship. Care to explain?
Dialogue: I've about had it up to here after what you did to our airship. Care to explain?

Original: Kam'lanaut:I need not answer you. Let us do battle.
Dialogue: I need not answer you. Let us do battle.

Original: Laguna:Well this is going nowhere. Talk about an unreasonable yahoo...
Dialogue: Well this is going nowhere. Talk about an unreasonable yahoo...

Original: Kam'lanaut:......
King:...He's still standing, even after all we've thrown at him.
Dialogue: ...He's still standing, even after all we've thrown at him.

Original: Lion:That just shows how desperate he is.
Dialogue: That just shows how desperate he is.

Original: Snow:If you're tired, rest up in the back. I'll cover you!
Dialogue: If you're tired, rest up in the back. I'll cover you!

Original: Sabin:As will I. You won't see me lose in a battle of endurance.
Dialogue: As will I. You won't see me lose in a battle of endurance.

Original: Kam'lanaut:...That's enough.
Dialogue: ...That's enough.

Original: Snow:What's that?
Dialogue: What's that?

Original: Kam'lanaut:Continuing the fight is pointless. As long as there are traces of our fight, there will be no doubts.
Dialogue: Continuing the fight is pointless. As long as there are traces of our fight, there will be no doubts.

Original: Kam'lanaut:Take my coordinates. Use them as you see fit.
Dialogue: Take my coordinates. Use them as you see fit.

Original: King:What was the point of antagonizing us? Was this some sort of charade?
Dialogue: What was the point of antagonizing us? Was this some sort of charade?

Original: Kam'lanaut:Say whatever you will.
Dialogue: Say whatever you will.

Original: Lion:You made fools of us... We were trying our hardest to defeat you!
Dialogue: You made fools of us... We were trying our hardest to defeat you!

Original: Kam'lanaut:It would have been a problem had you not. If you had gone easy on me, I would have crushed you completely.
Dialogue: It would have been a problem had you not. If you had gone easy on me, I would have crushed you completely.

Original: Snow:But why do you want to join us?
Dialogue: But why do you want to join us?

Original: Kam'lanaut:How presumptuous. I am simply lending you a hand. I am not "joining" you.
Dialogue: How presumptuous. I am simply lending you a hand. I am not "joining" you.

Original: King:Then why help us?
Dialogue: Then why help us?

Original: Kam'lanaut:To put it simply...
Dialogue: To put it simply...

Original: Kam'lanaut:To discern the intentions of Spiritus and his warriors, I must see things from Materia's side.
Dialogue: To discern the intentions of Spiritus and his warriors, I must see things from Materia's side.

Original: King:Spiritus's warriors... Including your brother Eald'narche.
Dialogue: Spiritus's warriors... Including your brother Eald'narche.

Original: Kam'lanaut:Yes. All of his warriors.
Dialogue: Yes. All of his warriors.

Original: Kam'lanaut:I opened this Torsion with my own hands...
Dialogue: I opened this Torsion with my own hands...

Original: Kam'lanaut:Only those existences I permit may enter.
Dialogue: Only those existences I permit may enter.

Original: Snow:Does that mean you secretly wanted to become our ally? In that case, there was no need to fight.
Dialogue: Does that mean you secretly wanted to become our ally? In that case, there was no need to fight.

Original: Kam'lanaut:I suppose such lowly humans wouldn't understand.
Dialogue: I suppose such lowly humans wouldn't understand.

Original: Kam'lanaut:People will be suspicious if you emerge unharmed from a Torsion.
Dialogue: People will be suspicious if you emerge unharmed from a Torsion.

Original: King:You don't want Spiritus's other warriors to suspect...
Dialogue: You don't want Spiritus's other warriors to suspect...

Original: King:No. You want to avoid Eald'narche's suspicion.
Dialogue: No. You want to avoid Eald'narche's suspicion.

Original: Sabin:You really don't trust him? Even though he's your brother?
Dialogue: You really don't trust him? Even though he's your brother?

Original: Kam'lanaut:It is because I trust him that I am being used.
Dialogue: It is because I trust him that I am being used.

Original: King:So now you want to use us.
Dialogue: So now you want to use us.

Original: Kam'lanaut:Think of it as using each other.
Dialogue: Think of it as using each other.

Original: King:And what will Eald'narche think if he saw you fighting beside us?
Dialogue: And what will Eald'narche think if he saw you fighting beside us?

Original: Kam'lanaut:It matters not. It is enough that I could contact you first.
Dialogue: It matters not. It is enough that I could contact you first.

Original: Kam'lanaut:If not, it would have been difficult for us to talk.
Dialogue: If not, it would have been difficult for us to talk.

Original: Kam'lanaut:...That is all. Do as you please.
Dialogue: ...That is all. Do as you please.

Original: Lion:We don't trust you.
Dialogue: We don't trust you.

Original: Kam'lanaut:The feeling is mutual.
Dialogue: The feeling is mutual.

Original: Eald'narche:You failed, didn't you? I expected as much, but useless nevertheless.
Dialogue: You failed, didn't you? I expected as much, but useless nevertheless.

Original: Eald'narche:They hardly looked hurt. You should have tried harder.
Dialogue: They hardly looked hurt. You should have tried harder.

Original: Kam'lanaut:Choosing who will be of use is not easy.
Dialogue: Choosing who will be of use is not easy.

Original: Eald'narche:No matter. I care not as long as you stay out of my way.
Dialogue: No matter. I care not as long as you stay out of my way.

Original: Kam'lanaut:I have no intention of hindering you. But, in that case, I would like to hear everything from you.
Dialogue: I have no intention of hindering you. But, in that case, I would like to hear everything from you.

Original: Kam'lanaut:Why are you working with me, whom you once tossed aside?
Dialogue: Why are you working with me, whom you once tossed aside?

Original: Eald'narche:Trust in me, my little brother.
Dialogue: Trust in me, my little brother.

Original: Kam'lanaut:...I do.
Dialogue: ...I do.

Original: Lyse:Just taking Kam'lanaut's coordinates isn't easy.
Dialogue: Just taking Kam'lanaut's coordinates isn't easy.

Original: Lyse:He used our dark manikins for his own purposes, after all...
Dialogue: He used our dark manikins for his own purposes, after all...

Original: Mog:I know how you feel, kupo. I hate it when people mess with my pompom!
Dialogue: I know how you feel, kupo. I hate it when people mess with my pompom!

Original: Sabin:It's hard to just accept it. You have a connection to him, right, Lion?
Dialogue: It's hard to just accept it. You have a connection to him, right, Lion?

Original: Lion:...He's someone I could never trust.
Dialogue: ...He's someone I could never trust.

Original: Lyse:I don't quite understand, but...if we toss these aside just because we don't understand, we'll never know.
Dialogue: I don't quite understand, but...if we toss these aside just because we don't understand, we'll never know.

Original: Lyse:This might be our chance.
Dialogue: This might be our chance.

Original: Lion:Chance to what?
Dialogue: Chance to what?

Original: Lyse:To talk to him, properly. We might be able to learn something from him.
Dialogue: To talk to him, properly. We might be able to learn something from him.

Original: Lion:Gosh... You're a gutsy one, Lyse...
Dialogue: Gosh... You're a gutsy one, Lyse...

Original: Lyse:I've been around all kinds of people, so I'm sure I've gotten it from them.
Dialogue: I've been around all kinds of people, so I'm sure I've gotten it from them.

Original: Lyse:You're curious about him, too, aren't you, Sabin?
Dialogue: You're curious about him, too, aren't you, Sabin?

Original: Sabin:Yeah... Though I haven't thought it out as far as you.
Dialogue: Yeah... Though I haven't thought it out as far as you.

Original: Sabin:Kam'lanaut said he believed in Eald'narche, didn't he?
Dialogue: Kam'lanaut said he believed in Eald'narche, didn't he?

Original: Lyse:It sounded a bit cynical if you ask me. Maybe it was his way of saying it.
Dialogue: It sounded a bit cynical if you ask me. Maybe it was his way of saying it.

Original: Sabin:I think that's probably right. But I think he truly believed in him before.
Dialogue: I think that's probably right. But I think he truly believed in him before.

Original: Sabin:He believed in him, but something happened that changed that.
Dialogue: He believed in him, but something happened that changed that.

Original: Sabin:I can't imagine what that's like. If I were betrayed by my brother...
Dialogue: I can't imagine what that's like. If I were betrayed by my brother...

Original: Lyse:Edgar would never do something like that! You know that, right?
Dialogue: Edgar would never do something like that! You know that, right?

Original: Sabin:Of course. But that's why I feel bad for him...
Dialogue: Of course. But that's why I feel bad for him...

Original: Sabin:Not that that excuses anything he's done. I'm not clear on it all anyway.
Dialogue: Not that that excuses anything he's done. I'm not clear on it all anyway.

Original: Sabin:And while I have no desire to understand Kefka...
Dialogue: And while I have no desire to understand Kefka...

Original: Sabin:Kam'lanaut's from a different world, and I wonder if we might be able to understand and save him, is all.
Dialogue: Kam'lanaut's from a different world, and I wonder if we might be able to understand and save him, is all.

Original: Lyse:What do you think, Lion? You don't need to agree with us. We'll respect your opinion.
Dialogue: What do you think, Lion? You don't need to agree with us. We'll respect your opinion.

Original: Lion:...I just can't think anything good of him.
Dialogue: ...I just can't think anything good of him.

Original: Lion:But, like you two said...something happened to him. If we have the chance to talk to him, maybe we can understand each other, and maybe he can change.
Dialogue: But, like you two said...something happened to him. If we have the chance to talk to him, maybe we can understand each other, and maybe he can change.

Original: Sabin:It would be great if he could.
Dialogue: It would be great if he could.

Original: Shantotto:How naive you are to believe that change comes with such ease! Shall I teach you a simpler way to sway your prey?
Dialogue: How naive you are to believe that change comes with such ease! Shall I teach you a simpler way to sway your prey?

Original: Lyse:A simpler way?
Dialogue: A simpler way?

Original: Shantotto:If you wish his change to actualize, a pecking order you should devise.
Dialogue: If you wish his change to actualize, a pecking order you should devise.

Original: Shantotto:I care not what you do, just that he's alive once you're through.
Dialogue: I care not what you do, just that he's alive once you're through.

Original: Shantotto:His existence will be of great assistance to my research. Ohohoho!
Dialogue: His existence will be of great assistance to my research. Ohohoho!

Original: Sabin:I'm so glad she's on our side...
Dialogue: I'm so glad she's on our side...

Original: Bartz:What's taking so long? Kam'lanaut said he'd handle the monster over there, but I don't see him anywhere.
Dialogue: What's taking so long? Kam'lanaut said he'd handle the monster over there, but I don't see him anywhere.

Original: Edge:He probably found an excuse to get away from us and took it.
Dialogue: He probably found an excuse to get away from us and took it.

Original: Cyan:Regardless, the hour is late. Perhaps he has already slain the beast and returned.
Dialogue: Regardless, the hour is late. Perhaps he has already slain the beast and returned.

Original: Deuce:Or he might be in over his head. In that case, we better help him!
Dialogue: Or he might be in over his head. In that case, we better help him!

Original: Edge:Hold on! We don't need to all go!
Dialogue: Hold on! We don't need to all go!

Original: Edge:Leave it to me. Don't worry, I won't be long.
Dialogue: Leave it to me. Don't worry, I won't be long.

Original: Bartz:Will you really be alright alone?
Dialogue: Will you really be alright alone?

Original: Cyan:If you require assistance, you know where we are.
Dialogue: If you require assistance, you know where we are.

Original: Deuce:Take care, Edge.
Dialogue: Take care, Edge.

Original: Edge:Don't worry about me. Take a nap or something until I get back.
Dialogue: Don't worry about me. Take a nap or something until I get back.

Original: Edge:How far out did he go? Maybe he really did go back already.
Dialogue: How far out did he go? Maybe he really did go back already.

Original: Edge:Who's there!?
Dialogue: Who's there!?

Original: Edge:Thancred?
Dialogue: Thancred?

Original: Kam'lanaut:Monster hunting provided me the perfect excuse.
Dialogue: Monster hunting provided me the perfect excuse.

Original: Kam'lanaut:His scent may be faint, but it is unmistakable. My brother is nearby.
Dialogue: His scent may be faint, but it is unmistakable. My brother is nearby.

Original: Kam'lanaut:It is time to seek him out.
Dialogue: It is time to seek him out.

Original: Edge:So this is where he got to.
Dialogue: So this is where he got to.

Original: Thancred:It appears that whatever he's planning, he wishes to do so without Eald'narche's knowledge. He hasn't done anything nefarious as of yet...
Dialogue: It appears that whatever he's planning, he wishes to do so without Eald'narche's knowledge. He hasn't done anything nefarious as of yet...

Original: Edge:You're spying on him?
Dialogue: You're spying on him?

Original: Thancred:Well, he did use the dark manikins for his schemes.
Dialogue: Well, he did use the dark manikins for his schemes.

Original: Thancred:Something that doesn't quite inspire trust, wouldn't you agree?
Dialogue: Something that doesn't quite inspire trust, wouldn't you agree?

Original: Edge:Hope you know what you're doing. I'm sure some people wouldn't approve you putting yourself in danger.
Dialogue: Hope you know what you're doing. I'm sure some people wouldn't approve you putting yourself in danger.

Original: Thancred:There isn't always a safe path to take. It would be more dangerous to leave him to his own devices.
Dialogue: There isn't always a safe path to take. It would be more dangerous to leave him to his own devices.

Original: Edge:Even so, we can still be cautious.
Dialogue: Even so, we can still be cautious.

Original: Edge:You have a ninja of unequaled skill by your side, after all. Spying is what I do best.
Dialogue: You have a ninja of unequaled skill by your side, after all. Spying is what I do best.

Original: Thancred:Many thanks.
Dialogue: Many thanks.

Original: Alphinaud:If I may, could I ask your opinions on a certain matter?
Dialogue: If I may, could I ask your opinions on a certain matter?

Original: Hope:Of course. What's up?
Dialogue: Of course. What's up?

Original: Alphinaud:I am curious to know everyone's thoughts on Kam'lanaut's motivations.
Dialogue: I am curious to know everyone's thoughts on Kam'lanaut's motivations.

Original: Cait Sith:It's hard to have any thoughts at the moment. We've only known him for a bit. I think we should wait and see.
Dialogue: It's hard to have any thoughts at the moment. We've only known him for a bit. I think we should wait and see.

Original: Paine:He can do what he wants. But if he gets in our way, then I'll take him down.
Dialogue: He can do what he wants. But if he gets in our way, then I'll take him down.

Original: Hope:No way I'd be able to trust him completely. I wouldn't be surprised if he attacked us sooner rather than later.
Dialogue: No way I'd be able to trust him completely. I wouldn't be surprised if he attacked us sooner rather than later.

Original: Ashe:It's useless to try and understand what drives him. We are simply too different.
Dialogue: It's useless to try and understand what drives him. We are simply too different.

Original: Alphinaud:It is as I thought... It appears we all view the issue differently.
Dialogue: It is as I thought... It appears we all view the issue differently.

Original: Alphinaud:Too differently to say there is any general consensus among us, in fact.
Dialogue: Too differently to say there is any general consensus among us, in fact.

Original: Alphinaud:Regardless, I believe we can all agree that Kam'lanaut's goals in this world are elusive at best.
Dialogue: Regardless, I believe we can all agree that Kam'lanaut's goals in this world are elusive at best.

Original: Cait Sith:Well, he's one of Spiritus's warriors. Even if we told him to get lost, we'd only be putting out a fire with gasoline.
Dialogue: Well, he's one of Spiritus's warriors. Even if we told him to get lost, we'd only be putting out a fire with gasoline.

Original: Alphinaud:Indeed. 'Twould afford neither us nor him any benefit.
Dialogue: Indeed. 'Twould afford neither us nor him any benefit.

Original: Hope:He's at least putting in an effort to seem like an ally. It's only understandable that he can't cut ties to his old world completely.
Dialogue: He's at least putting in an effort to seem like an ally. It's only understandable that he can't cut ties to his old world completely.

Original: Alphinaud:Of course. However, I cannot shake the feeling that there is something we have overlooked. We must needs take a different perspective on the matter.
Dialogue: Of course. However, I cannot shake the feeling that there is something we have overlooked. We must needs take a different perspective on the matter.

Original: Alphinaud:Dimensional coordinates permit Spiritus's warriors to grasp our strength, but we have no means to gauge theirs. This puts us at a distinct disadvantage.
Dialogue: Dimensional coordinates permit Spiritus's warriors to grasp our strength, but we have no means to gauge theirs. This puts us at a distinct disadvantage.

Original: Alphinaud:I have pondered how exactly to make up for this shortcoming, but I am afraid our options are somewhat limited.
Dialogue: I have pondered how exactly to make up for this shortcoming, but I am afraid our options are somewhat limited.

Original: Alphinaud:That being said, I have not exactly been treating the matter as urgent.
Dialogue: That being said, I have not exactly been treating the matter as urgent.

Original: Paine:And...? So what are you planning?
Dialogue: And...? So what are you planning?

Original: Alphinaud:I am of a mind to agree with Lyse, Sabin, and the others who would show a willingness to reconcile our differences.
Dialogue: I am of a mind to agree with Lyse, Sabin, and the others who would show a willingness to reconcile our differences.

Original: Alphinaud:However, we must proceed with caution.
Dialogue: However, we must proceed with caution.

Original: Alphinaud:There is a wealth of experience among usexperience which we can use to our advantage.
Dialogue: There is a wealth of experience among us—experience which we can use to our advantage.

Original: Alphinaud:Should Kam'lanaut and the others act in rashness or violence, we must be prepared to react in kind.
Dialogue: Should Kam'lanaut and the others act in rashness or violence, we must be prepared to react in kind.

Original: Alphinaud:And we should prepare now, ere our reservations are justified.
Dialogue: And we should prepare now, ere our reservations are justified.

Original: Cait Sith:It's hard to disagree with that. Leave the prep to me. Working in the shadows is what I do best.
Dialogue: It's hard to disagree with that. Leave the prep to me. Working in the shadows is what I do best.

Original: Hope:That's not a bad approach. We can be friendly without leaving ourselves open to trickery.
Dialogue: That's not a bad approach. We can be friendly without leaving ourselves open to trickery.

Original: Ashe:A delicate task, but one I shall help with in any way I can.
Dialogue: A delicate task, but one I shall help with in any way I can.

Original: Paine:I know a summoner who might just fit the buddy-buddy bill, too.
Dialogue: I know a summoner who might just fit the buddy-buddy bill, too.

Original: Alphinaud:Thank you, everyone.
Dialogue: Thank you, everyone.

Original: Materia:That is correct.
Dialogue: That is correct.

Original: Materia:And I wish for you to fight as one of my warriors.
Dialogue: And I wish for you to fight as one of my warriors.

Original: Ciaran:Fight? But I already have work to do...
Dialogue: Fight? But I already have work to do...

Original: Materia:You possess a strong will.
Dialogue: You possess a strong will.

Original: Materia:You held fast to your memories on your long journey. We need that will.
Dialogue: You held fast to your memories on your long journey. We need that will.

Original: Ciaran:There are lots of strong people out there. Does it have to be me?
Dialogue: There are lots of strong people out there. Does it have to be me?

Original: Materia:...The crystal guided you to me.
Dialogue: ...The crystal guided you to me.

Original: Ciaran:The crystal...?
Dialogue: The crystal...?

Original: Materia:A different one from that in your world. It is one that wishes for the warriors' respite.
Dialogue: A different one from that in your world. It is one that wishes for the warriors' respite.

Original: Materia:We, the gods, created this world as a land of respite...
Dialogue: We, the gods, created this world as a land of respite...

Original: Materia:It was once a place where battle-weary warriors from other worlds could rest.
Dialogue: It was once a place where battle-weary warriors from other worlds could rest.

Original: Materia:I took away their tragic memories to give them peace of mind.
Dialogue: I took away their tragic memories to give them peace of mind.

Original: Ciaran:You took away...their memories?
Dialogue: You took away...their memories?

Original: Materia:I once thought depriving them of such painful memories would bring them tranquility.
Dialogue: I once thought depriving them of such painful memories would bring them tranquility.

Original: Materia:But reality was different. They now seek those lost memories.
Dialogue: But reality was different. They now seek those lost memories.

Original: Materia:They claim that, no matter how painful those memories are, they are what strengthen their wills.
Dialogue: They claim that, no matter how painful those memories are, they are what strengthen their wills.

Original: Ciaran:...I feel the same way. You were mistaken, Materia.
Dialogue: ...I feel the same way. You were mistaken, Materia.

Original: Materia:I couldn't understand... But I regret what I did.
Dialogue: I couldn't understand... But I regret what I did.

Original: Ciaran:You can't hold on to all of your memories. Some spill out here and there.
Dialogue: You can't hold on to all of your memories. Some spill out here and there.

Original: Ciaran:But having them stolen is...sad.
Dialogue: But having them stolen is...sad.

Original: Materia:This world is no longer one of respite. It is being threatened by monsters and those harboring ill will.
Dialogue: This world is no longer one of respite. It is being threatened by monsters and those harboring ill will.

Original: Materia:Please, lend us your strength.
Dialogue: Please, lend us your strength.

Original: Materia:Your journey has been unlike the others.
Dialogue: Your journey has been unlike the others.

Original: Materia:Those experiences will be a new guiding light to my warriors.
Dialogue: Those experiences will be a new guiding light to my warriors.

Original: Ciaran:Alright. I'll give it my best shot.
Dialogue: Alright. I'll give it my best shot.

Original: Ciaran:I'm nothing like those heroes that appear in tales, so there might not be much that I can do...
Dialogue: I'm nothing like those heroes that appear in tales, so there might not be much that I can do...

Original: Ciaran:But this is a journey of hope for the future?
Dialogue: But this is a journey of hope for the future?

Original: Ciaran:If that's what they're traveling for, then I hope I can help them.
Dialogue: If that's what they're traveling for, then I hope I can help them.

Original: Mog:Kupo! I sense a new friend over that way!
Dialogue: Kupo! I sense a new friend over that way!

Original: Ciaran:Hey there!
Dialogue: Hey there!

Original: Ciaran:Thanks for finding me. I thought I was lost.
Dialogue: Thanks for finding me. I thought I was lost.

Original: Warrior of Light:Are you one of Materia's warriors, too?
Dialogue: Are you one of Materia's warriors, too?

Original: Ciaran:Seems that way.
Dialogue: Seems that way.

Original: Ciaran:My name's Ciaran. Materia told me to come here.
Dialogue: My name's Ciaran. Materia told me to come here.

Original: Chelinka:I think you're right, Yuri.
Dialogue: I think you're right, Yuri.

Original: Layle:So we're the same tribe. He doesn't look like a bad guy to me.
Dialogue: So we're the same tribe. He doesn't look like a bad guy to me.

Original: Rem:A friend of yours?
Dialogue: A friend of yours?

Original: Yuri:No. But he might come from a similar world to ours.
Dialogue: No. But he might come from a similar world to ours.

Original: Layle:Just like me and these twins here. Our worlds have some tribes in common.
Dialogue: Just like me and these twins here. Our worlds have some tribes in common.

Original: Ciaran:So you're also Clavats. What a relief... I thought I'd be the only one.
Dialogue: So you're also Clavats. What a relief... I thought I'd be the only one.

Original: Yuri:Maybe from our past or our future...somewhere in the infinite possibilities, no doubt you're out there somewhere.
Dialogue: Maybe from our past or our future...somewhere in the infinite possibilities, no doubt you're out there somewhere.

Original: Rem:Just hearing "Clavats" is enough to put your mind at ease?
Dialogue: Just hearing "Clavats" is enough to put your mind at ease?

Original: Chelinka:As the tribes go, Clavats are said to have very peaceful temperaments.
Dialogue: As the tribes go, Clavats are said to have very peaceful temperaments.

Original: Yuri:We're often called the tribe of unity and friendship.
Dialogue: We're often called the tribe of unity and friendship.

Original: Sazh:No kidding. That apply to you, too?
Dialogue: No kidding. That apply to you, too?

Original: Layle:Can't say. I'm just one Clavat.
Dialogue: Can't say. I'm just one Clavat.

Original: Layle:There are plenty of argumentative ones, short-tempered ones...
Dialogue: There are plenty of argumentative ones, short-tempered ones...

Original: Yuri:Right. Rather than focusing on tribes, it's more important to look at the way we each live our lives.
Dialogue: Right. Rather than focusing on tribes, it's more important to look at the way we each live our lives.

Original: Chelinka:There are bad Clavats out there, and lots of kind and warmhearted people from other tribes.
Dialogue: There are bad Clavats out there, and lots of kind and warmhearted people from other tribes.

Original: Layle:Exactly. And you can usually tell just by looking if a Clavat is up to no good. And he doesn't look it at all.
Dialogue: Exactly. And you can usually tell just by looking if a Clavat is up to no good. And he doesn't look it at all.

Original: Yuri:If anything, he's got good-guy vibes just gushing outta everywhere!
Dialogue: If anything, he's got good-guy vibes just gushing outta everywhere!

Original: Chelinka:I know what you want to say, Yuri, but pick your words better...
Dialogue: I know what you want to say, Yuri, but pick your words better...

Original: Warrior of Light:Very well. We believe you. Let us fight together to save the future.
Dialogue: Very well. We believe you. Let us fight together to save the future.

Original: Ciaran:Oh, um... Gotcha, so it is that kind of journey.
Dialogue: Oh, um... Gotcha, so it is that kind of journey.

Original: Ciaran:It might be some time until I get the hang of things. I'll take it slow for now.
Dialogue: It might be some time until I get the hang of things. I'll take it slow for now.

Original: Sazh:Easy-going fella.
Dialogue: Easy-going fella.

Original: Rem:Hehe. But it's good to have someone like that around.
Dialogue: Hehe. But it's good to have someone like that around.

Original: Warrior of Light:Indeed. I can tell that there is a comforting warmth about you.
Dialogue: Indeed. I can tell that there is a comforting warmth about you.

Original: Layle:You seem pretty skilled. You must have plenty of experience under your belt.
Dialogue: You seem pretty skilled. You must have plenty of experience under your belt.

Original: Ciaran:I don't know... I've spent some time on the road, but I don't know if that makes me "skilled."
Dialogue: I don't know... I've spent some time on the road, but I don't know if that makes me "skilled."

Original: Ciaran:Still, I'll do what I can. It's a pleasure to meet you all.
Dialogue: Still, I'll do what I can. It's a pleasure to meet you all.

Original: Yuri:Great! Welcome to the team!
Dialogue: Great! Welcome to the team!

Original: Sazh:I can't believe Materia's dragging more kids into this fight.
Dialogue: I can't believe Materia's dragging more kids into this fight.

Original: Layle:Kid? He's older than me.
Dialogue: Kid? He's older than me.

Original: Sazh:Geez, my bad. I thought I could tell, but I guess it's different in other worlds.
Dialogue: Geez, my bad. I thought I could tell, but I guess it's different in other worlds.

Original: Ciaran:Don't worry about it. There are lots of things I don't understand, either.
Dialogue: Don't worry about it. There are lots of things I don't understand, either.

Original: Ciaran:I hope you'll all take your time telling me about yourselves, too.
Dialogue: I hope you'll all take your time telling me about yourselves, too.

Original: Cecil:What did you hear from Materia, Ciaran?
Dialogue: What did you hear from Materia, Ciaran?

Original: Ciaran:Why do you ask?
Dialogue: Why do you ask?

Original: Cecil:We are warriors that were summoned by Materia, but we no longer move according to her orders.
Dialogue: We are warriors that were summoned by Materia, but we no longer move according to her orders.

Original: Cecil:Her way of thinking and ours are somewhat different, so we want to know what's on her mind.
Dialogue: Her way of thinking and ours are somewhat different, so we want to know what's on her mind.

Original: Ciaran:I heard that you're confronting the memories that you lost.
Dialogue: I heard that you're confronting the memories that you lost.

Original: Tidus:We forgot a lot of important things, so we're trying to get them back.
Dialogue: We forgot a lot of important things, so we're trying to get them back.

Original: Ace:...Those who've forgotten can't even discern what they've lost.
Dialogue: ...Those who've forgotten can't even discern what they've lost.

Original: Ashe:...Yes. I...may not have all my memories either.
Dialogue: ...Yes. I...may not have all my memories either.

Original: Vivi:It's sad to think of forgetting something, so we're taking our memories back little by little.
Dialogue: It's sad to think of forgetting something, so we're taking our memories back little by little.

Original: Ciaran:I see... Hmm...
Dialogue: I see... Hmm...

Original: Ciaran:It seemed like a part of Materia was afraid of you facing your memories.
Dialogue: It seemed like a part of Materia was afraid of you facing your memories.

Original: Ciaran:She seemed unsure if losing them was a bad thing, or if those painful memories would weigh you down too much.
Dialogue: She seemed unsure if losing them was a bad thing, or if those painful memories would weigh you down too much.

Original: Ciaran:I think I was chosen because of that.
Dialogue: I think I was chosen because of that.

Original: Vivi:Really? Why?
Dialogue: Really? Why?

Original: Ciaran:There were beings in my world who ate memories.
Dialogue: There were beings in my world who ate memories.

Original: Tidus:Ate memories!? That's terrible...
Dialogue: Ate memories!? That's terrible...

Original: Ciaran:...But people eventually forget things, don't they?
Dialogue: ...But people eventually forget things, don't they?

Original: Ciaran:They would feed off of people's fading memories as part of the world's natural cycle.
Dialogue: They would feed off of people's fading memories as part of the world's natural cycle.

Original: Ciaran:You can't hold onto every single memory. It's natural to forget things.
Dialogue: You can't hold onto every single memory. It's natural to forget things.

Original: Ace:You mean that memories can sometimes be a burden...
Dialogue: You mean that memories can sometimes be a burden...

Original: Ciaran:One of those beings taught me that memories are like a pack we carry into the future.
Dialogue: One of those beings taught me that memories are like a pack we carry into the future.

Original: Ciaran:If it becomes too heavy, it can weigh you down.
Dialogue: If it becomes too heavy, it can weigh you down.

Original: Ciaran:If it's too light, your journey will end before you've gained anything.
Dialogue: If it's too light, your journey will end before you've gained anything.

Original: Ciaran:A traveler's journey into the future nurtures his or her heart, and becomes a source of new life.
Dialogue: A traveler's journey into the future nurtures his or her heart, and becomes a source of new life.

Original: Ashe:Memories can be a burden... I wonder if that is the case for me...
Dialogue: Memories can be a burden... I wonder if that is the case for me...

Original: Cecil:There may come a day when I can also think that way, that it's natural to forget some things...
Dialogue: There may come a day when I can also think that way, that it's natural to forget some things...

Original: Ace:...We believe that forgetting is a divine blessing. That for everyone else, memories are something they dwell on trying not to forget.
Dialogue: ...We believe that forgetting is a divine blessing. That for everyone else, memories are something they dwell on trying not to forget.

Original: Ciaran:I heard a bit aboutyour worldandyour crystal...
Dialogue: I heard a bit about your world and your crystal...

Original: Ciaran:But I can't give you answers. What's right probably depends on the world you're in.
Dialogue: But I can't give you answers. What's right probably depends on the world you're in.

Original: Ciaran:But if you feel warmth from your memories, I think you should cherish them.
Dialogue: But if you feel warmth from your memories, I think you should cherish them.

Original: Ciaran:Even if you forget a lot of things, having warm memories close to your heart is what makes a journey wonderful.
Dialogue: Even if you forget a lot of things, having warm memories close to your heart is what makes a journey wonderful.

Original: Ace:Warm memories...close to my heart...
Dialogue: Warm memories...close to my heart...

Original: Ace:I see... Even if the future is uncertain, they'll light the way.
Dialogue: I see... Even if the future is uncertain, they'll light the way.

Original: Ciaran:No matter what memories you have, you're on a journey with hope for the future, right?
Dialogue: No matter what memories you have, you're on a journey with hope for the future, right?

Original: Cecil:Right. Without getting caught up in the past...we believe that there is light in the future.
Dialogue: Right. Without getting caught up in the past...we believe that there is light in the future.

Original: Ciaran:Then what's say we get a move on?
Dialogue: Then what's say we get a move on?

Original: Ciaran:Even if the light is faint, you'll reach your destination as long as you keep going forward.
Dialogue: Even if the light is faint, you'll reach your destination as long as you keep going forward.

Original: Ciaran:Yeah, but it fell a long time ago. All that's left now are ruins.
Dialogue: Yeah, but it fell a long time ago. All that's left now are ruins.

Original: Ciaran:What I wouldn't give to see it bustling with people of all different tribes.
Dialogue: What I wouldn't give to see it bustling with people of all different tribes.

Original: Sherlotta:Ohhh, are you guys talking about your homes? Mind if I butt in?
Dialogue: Ohhh, are you guys talking about your homes? Mind if I butt in?

Original: Layle:Me too. Sounds like an interesting conversation.
Dialogue: Me too. Sounds like an interesting conversation.

Original: Ciaran:Of course, the more the merrier. Well...have you guys ever had a striped apple?
Dialogue: Of course, the more the merrier. Well...have you guys ever had a striped apple?

Original: Sherlotta:One of my Lilty friends just loved her tales of glory.
Dialogue: One of my Lilty friends just loved her tales of glory.

Original: Layle:And theSelkieare fleet of foot, while theYukehave heads too large for their bodies. I imagine we all have similar stories.
Dialogue: And the Selkie are fleet of foot, while the Yuke have heads too large for their bodies. I imagine we all have similar stories.

Original: Ciaran:Haha, you're right. Our worlds really are mirror images of each other, aren't they?
Dialogue: Haha, you're right. Our worlds really are mirror images of each other, aren't they?

Original: Ramza:My apologies, but I cannot help but ask...
Dialogue: My apologies, but I cannot help but ask...

Original: Ramza:Does it not bother you that different worlds share such fundamental similarities?
Dialogue: Does it not bother you that different worlds share such fundamental similarities?

Original: Ciaran:Huh? What do you mean?
Dialogue: Huh? What do you mean?

Original: Ciaran:I suppose...a little?
Dialogue: I suppose...a little?

Original: Layle:Yeah...well, if a Yuke or Lilty were here, they'd be making a fuss about it.
Dialogue: Yeah...well, if a Yuke or Lilty were here, they'd be making a fuss about it.

Original: Sherlotta:"Fuss" is an understatement. A Yuke would set up a whole institution to study and pore over ancient documents to get to the bottom of it.
Dialogue: "Fuss" is an understatement. A Yuke would set up a whole institution to study and pore over ancient documents to get to the bottom of it.

Original: Ramza:You seem to be taking it in stride, all things considered.
Dialogue: You seem to be taking it in stride, all things considered.

Original: Yuri:There is more to the world than what we can see in the present. It's filled with limitless possibilities.
Dialogue: There is more to the world than what we can see in the present. It's filled with limitless possibilities.

Original: Ciaran:I mean, if this really were important, then I guess I could come up with a reason to let it bother me...
Dialogue: I mean, if this really were important, then I guess I could come up with a reason to let it bother me...

Original: Ciaran:But the differences between the worlds that were born by our journeys don't really matter, do they?
Dialogue: But the differences between the worlds that were born by our journeys don't really matter, do they?

Original: Ramza:Perhaps...personally, the sole fact that the worlds share the same name would bother me.
Dialogue: Perhaps...personally, the sole fact that the worlds share the same name would bother me.

Original: Vaan:Ciaran is right, though. If you think too hard about something you can't understand, then you'll just end up with a headache.
Dialogue: Ciaran is right, though. If you think too hard about something you can't understand, then you'll just end up with a headache.

Original: Ramza:Of course you would say that, Vaan.
Dialogue: Of course you would say that, Vaan.

Original: Mog:It's so hot, kupo!
Dialogue: It's so hot, kupo!

Original: Mog:Kupo? What is it?
Dialogue: Kupo? What is it?

Original: Bartz:Did you spot something?
Dialogue: Did you spot something?

Original: Ciaran:Ah...sorry, it's nothing. That just reminded me of someone from a long time ago.
