Original: Prompto:I didn't want anyone to think I wasn't taking things seriously, so I didn't say anything, but I'm totally with you guys!
Dialogue: I didn't want anyone to think I wasn't taking things seriously, so I didn't say anything, but I'm totally with you guys!

Original: Prompto:I'm glad you're here, Jack! It's nice to know I'm not alone.
Dialogue: I'm glad you're here, Jack! It's nice to know I'm not alone.

Original: Prompto:I know the world's in trouble, but I'm still happy it brought me to you guys.
Dialogue: I know the world's in trouble, but I'm still happy it brought me to you guys.

Original: Jack:Same! We gotta take it easy once in a while and there's no better time than the present!
Dialogue: Same! We gotta take it easy once in a while and there's no better time than the present!

Original: Jack:Awww, I hadn't thought about that. Poor Mother...
Dialogue: Awww, I hadn't thought about that. Poor Mother...

Original: Deuce:We might even get lectured for leaving...
Dialogue: We might even get lectured for leaving...

Original: Jack:I hate lectures... But we'll cross that bridge when we get there, yo!
Dialogue: I hate lectures... But we'll cross that bridge when we get there, yo!

Original: Cecil:Haha, ever the optimistic one. You never wallow long in despair, do you?
Dialogue: Haha, ever the optimistic one. You never wallow long in despair, do you?

Original: Jack:How can I? We have a star pupil with us and we're all gonna get scolded together! I'm counting on you to smooth things over, Machina.
Dialogue: How can I? We have a star pupil with us and we're all gonna get scolded together! I'm counting on you to smooth things over, Machina.

Original: Machina:Usually people dread getting scolded, but knowing we'll be together...I can't find it in myself to mind.
Dialogue: Usually people dread getting scolded, but knowing we'll be together...I can't find it in myself to mind.

Original: Jack:Seriously? Mother's gonna rip us a new one! Wait... Don't tell me you like getting scolded.
Dialogue: Seriously? Mother's gonna rip us a new one! Wait... Don't tell me you like getting scolded.

Original: Prompto:Whoa! We've been traveling together all this time and I had no idea!
Dialogue: Whoa! We've been traveling together all this time and I had no idea!

Original: Machina:W-wait, hold on! It's not like that!
Dialogue: W-wait, hold on! It's not like that!

Original: Jack:Say no more! Your secret is safe with us, Machina.
Dialogue: Say no more! Your secret is safe with us, Machina.

Original: Deuce:I won't tell a soul! Not even Rem!
Dialogue: I won't tell a soul! Not even Rem!

Original: Machina:You got it all wrong! I don't like getting scolded!
Dialogue: You got it all wrong! I don't like getting scolded!

Original: Cecil:You seem to enjoy each others' company.
Dialogue: You seem to enjoy each others' company.

Original: Machina:...I get it now.
Dialogue: ...I get it now.

Original: Deuce:I think Jack wants you to be more positive, Machina.
Dialogue: I think Jack wants you to be more positive, Machina.

Original: Jack:Nahhh. I just want him to enjoy this a little more, yo.
Dialogue: Nahhh. I just want him to enjoy this a little more, yo.

Original: Jack:But if you wanna read that deeply into it...you're not wrong.
Dialogue: But if you wanna read that deeply into it...you're not wrong.

Original: Machina:Haha! You're in for a long lecture when we get home, Jack.
Dialogue: Haha! You're in for a long lecture when we get home, Jack.

Original: Jack:No! You traitor!
Dialogue: No! You traitor!

Original: Machina:Besides, you guys are getting off easy. Rem and I will probably be punished by thecommandantanddivision head.
Dialogue: Besides, you guys are getting off easy. Rem and I will probably be punished by the commandant and division head.

Original: Jack:Oof, tough break.
Dialogue: Oof, tough break.

Original: Machina:But we'll be fine. They're bound to be lenient when I tell them we were kidnapped by Class Zero.
Dialogue: But we'll be fine. They're bound to be lenient when I tell them we were kidnapped by Class Zero.

Original: Jack:You wouldn't dare! They'll definitely believe the teacher's pet!
Dialogue: You wouldn't dare! They'll definitely believe the teacher's pet!

Original: Machina:I doubt it. I can't imagine anyone believing we went to a different world.
Dialogue: I doubt it. I can't imagine anyone believing we went to a different world.

Original: Snow:If they don't, I'll gladly testify as your otherworldly friend.
Dialogue: If they don't, I'll gladly testify as your otherworldly friend.

Original: Prompto:Same here! I gotta see this Orience place myself.
Dialogue: Same here! I gotta see this Orience place myself.

Original: Jack:Thanks! I'll keep that in mind.
Dialogue: Thanks! I'll keep that in mind.

Original: Jack:But it's not time to go home yet. We've still got plenty of time to have fun in this world!
Dialogue: But it's not time to go home yet. We've still got plenty of time to have fun in this world!

Original: Jack:This airship is huge! Thank goodness there's so many of us or I'd definitely get lost.
Dialogue: This airship is huge! Thank goodness there's so many of us or I'd definitely get lost.

Original: Jack:On the other hand, it does make it pretty hard to get any time alone...
Dialogue: On the other hand, it does make it pretty hard to get any time alone...

Original: Jack:Hey, guys. What're you gossiping about?
Dialogue: Hey, guys. What're you gossiping about?

Original: Tidus:Uh oh...
Dialogue: Uh oh...

Original: Sherlotta:Hold it. I get the feeling Jack is one of us. Let's let him in on the secret.
Dialogue: Hold it. I get the feeling Jack is one of us. Let's let him in on the secret.

Original: Reynn:I suppose... But you better not betray us, Jack.
Dialogue: I suppose... But you better not betray us, Jack.

Original: Lann:You're scaring me, Reynn...
Dialogue: You're scaring me, Reynn...

Original: Jack:Well this sounds like fun! Tell me more, yo.
Dialogue: Well this sounds like fun! Tell me more, yo.

Original: Lann:This is a top-secret meeting to exchange information on the best napping places in the ship.
Dialogue: This is a top-secret meeting to exchange information on the best napping places in the ship.

Original: Sherlotta:The deck is one of my favorites, though the wind can get a little strong at times.
Dialogue: The deck is one of my favorites, though the wind can get a little strong at times.

Original: Lann:Hey, you scolded me for being up here last time! It's not fair if only you get to use it!
Dialogue: Hey, you scolded me for being up here last time! It's not fair if only you get to use it!

Original: Sherlotta:You were interrupting my nap. But don't let my little scolding bother you, Lann.
Dialogue: You were interrupting my nap. But don't let my little scolding bother you, Lann.

Original: Reynn:Something tells me it wasn't very "little"...
Dialogue: Something tells me it wasn't very "little"...

Original: Lann:The engine room is usually empty, so there's no one to catch you napping there.
Dialogue: The engine room is usually empty, so there's no one to catch you napping there.

Original: Tidus:And it's warm too... Sometimes too warm, though.
Dialogue: And it's warm too... Sometimes too warm, though.

Original: Lann:That's when I treat myself to one of these secret popsicles from the pantry!
Dialogue: That's when I treat myself to one of these secret popsicles from the pantry!

Original: Reynn:...How did you find that?
Dialogue: ...How did you find that?

Original: Lann:Did you want one too? Sorry, but this is the last one.
Dialogue: Did you want one too? Sorry, but this is the last one.

Original: Reynn:Well enjoy it because it'll be the last thing you ever eat!
Dialogue: Well enjoy it because it'll be the last thing you ever eat!

Original: Lann:What the honk! I didn't realize they were yours!
Dialogue: What the honk! I didn't realize they were yours!

Original: Tidus:Speaking of the pantry, it's not a bad place to nap.
Dialogue: Speaking of the pantry, it's not a bad place to nap.

Original: Sherlotta:True. It is nice and cool in there.
Dialogue: True. It is nice and cool in there.

Original: Jack:Come on! Get serious, you guys!
Dialogue: Come on! Get serious, you guys!

Original: Reynn:...Oh no. Are you not one of us after all!?
Dialogue: ...Oh no. Are you not one of us after all!?

Original: Jack:Listen, you've gotta get serious if you want a good nap. I used to line up books on my desk to make it look like I was studying!
Dialogue: Listen, you've gotta get serious if you want a good nap. I used to line up books on my desk to make it look like I was studying!

Original: Jack:And the text would put me right to sleep! If you rest your chin in your hands, you'll even look like you're awake!
Dialogue: And the text would put me right to sleep! If you rest your chin in your hands, you'll even look like you're awake!

Original: Lann:That's it! You're a genius!
Dialogue: That's it! You're a genius!

Original: Reynn:Should you really be praising him for that...?
Dialogue: Should you really be praising him for that...?

Original: Basch:What are you all doing here? Having a strategy meeting?
Dialogue: What are you all doing here? Having a strategy meeting?

Original: Tidus:Basch!? Uh oh...
Dialogue: Basch!? Uh oh...

Original: Reynn:We can't let him know...
Dialogue: We can't let him know...

Original: Lann:We, uh, were definitely talking about strategy! Yup! You'd never catch us napping on the job! Right, Reynn?
Dialogue: We, uh, were definitely talking about strategy! Yup! You'd never catch us napping on the job! Right, Reynn?

Original: Reynn:You are terrible at this!
Dialogue: You are terrible at this!

Original: Jack:We were talking about the importance of getting a good nap in! Care to join us, Basch?
Dialogue: We were talking about the importance of getting a good nap in! Care to join us, Basch?

Original: Sherlotta:That's a bold strategy... Do you really think he'd join?
Dialogue: That's a bold strategy... Do you really think he'd join?

Original: Basch:I see. It's certainly an intriguing topic worth discussing. Getting sufficient rest throughout the day is important.
Dialogue: I see. It's certainly an intriguing topic worth discussing. Getting sufficient rest throughout the day is important.

Original: Basch:Naps could help us recharge before battle. I'll propose it to the others. I think they would agree to sleeping in shifts.
Dialogue: Naps could help us recharge before battle. I'll propose it to the others. I think they would agree to sleeping in shifts.

Original: Jack:Yeah! Glad you have you on board, Basch!
Dialogue: Yeah! Glad you have you on board, Basch!

Original: Lann:Still, it won't feel like a real nap if I can't do it when I want...
Dialogue: Still, it won't feel like a real nap if I can't do it when I want...

Original: Jack:We'll leave it to you, then!
Dialogue: We'll leave it to you, then!

Original: Jack:Now we can have on-the-clock naps too!
Dialogue: Now we can have on-the-clock naps too!

Original: Sherlotta:"Too"? Oho, Jack, you scoundrel!
Dialogue: "Too"? Oho, Jack, you scoundrel!

Original: Reynn:You really are a genius!
Dialogue: You really are a genius!

Original: Rem:Cough, cough...
Dialogue: Cough, cough...

Original: Aerith:Are you okay, Rem? You've been coughing for a while now.
Dialogue: Are you okay, Rem? You've been coughing for a while now.

Original: Rem:I...I'm fine. It's just a little coughing fit...
Dialogue: I...I'm fine. It's just a little coughing fit...

Original: Rem:Cough! Cough, cough!
Dialogue: Cough! Cough, cough!

Original: Lenna:There's nothing little about it. Doesn't it hurt?
Dialogue: There's nothing little about it. Doesn't it hurt?

Original: Yuna:Stay still. I'll heal you!
Dialogue: Stay still. I'll heal you!

Original: Rem:Cough, cough! Cough...!
Dialogue: Cough, cough! Cough...!

Original: Aerith:I'll help!
Dialogue: I'll help!

Original: Rem:Cough, cough... Huff...
Dialogue: Cough, cough... Huff...

Original: Lenna:It's okay... It's okay now.
Dialogue: It's okay... It's okay now.

Original: Yuna:Magic doesn't seem to work... Maybe it's ineffective against sicknesses from other worlds...?
Dialogue: Magic doesn't seem to work... Maybe it's ineffective against sicknesses from other worlds...?

Original: ???:Please, use this!
Dialogue: Please, use this!

Original: ???:This thyme moss should help suppress the cough. Quickly now!
Dialogue: This thyme moss should help suppress the cough. Quickly now!

Original: Aerith:Thyme moss...?
Dialogue: Thyme moss...?

Original: ???:How do you feel?
Dialogue: How do you feel?

Original: Rem:Better, thank you...
Dialogue: Better, thank you...

Original: Aerith:Thank goodness, Rem!
Dialogue: Thank goodness, Rem!

Original: Lenna:It looked like that medicinal herb helped calm your cough.
Dialogue: It looked like that medicinal herb helped calm your cough.

Original: Yuna:By the way, who are you?
Dialogue: By the way, who are you?

Original: ???:Oh, how rude of me. I'm
Dialogue: Oh, how rude of me. I'm—

Original: Lenna:That voice...!
Dialogue: That voice...!

Original: Aerith:Monsters! We'll have to do introductions later, I suppose...!
Dialogue: Monsters! We'll have to do introductions later, I suppose...!

Original: Rem:Thank you for earlier. I feel much better now.
Dialogue: Thank you for earlier. I feel much better now.

Original: Cater:I appreciate you helping my friend!
Dialogue: I appreciate you helping my friend!

Original: ???:I'm glad I could help.
Dialogue: I'm glad I could help.

Original: Arciela:My name is Arciela V. Adoulin.
Dialogue: My name is Arciela V. Adoulin.

Original: Arciela:From one of the Twelve Orders in the Sacred City of Adoulin.
Dialogue: From one of the Twelve Orders in the Sacred City of Adoulin.

Original: Lion:Sacred City of Adoulin...? Would that by any chance be to the far west of the Middle Lands?
Dialogue: Sacred City of Adoulin...? Would that by any chance be to the far west of the Middle Lands?

Original: Lion:I heard that they were recruiting adventurers to help develop Ulbuka.
Dialogue: I heard that they were recruiting adventurers to help develop Ulbuka.

Original: Arciela:Oh? Then you must be in this forest as pioneers...
Dialogue: Oh? Then you must be in this forest as pioneers...

Original: Cid:It seems like this lady doesn't have a clue what's going on.
Dialogue: It seems like this lady doesn't have a clue what's going on.

Original: Auron:Then we had better explain it.
Dialogue: Then we had better explain it.

Original: Arciela:...I see. I thought it was strange that I couldn't see the spirits.
Dialogue: ...I see. I thought it was strange that I couldn't see the spirits.

Original: Rem:Everyone here was summoned from a different world by a god.
Dialogue: Everyone here was summoned from a different world by a god.

Original: Lion:I'm also from Vana'diel. I passed through a Torsion just like you did.
Dialogue: I'm also from Vana'diel. I passed through a Torsion just like you did.

Original: Arciela:...I'm not sure I understand. Why is thyme moss growing here if we're in a different world?
Dialogue: ...I'm not sure I understand. Why is thyme moss growing here if we're in a different world?

Original: Cid:Probably because this world was made to look like ours.
Dialogue: Probably because this world was made to look like ours.

Original: Auron:Or perhaps because your world and this one are connected by a Torsion.
Dialogue: Or perhaps because your world and this one are connected by a Torsion.

Original: Arciela:Is it because I came here...?
Dialogue: Is it because I came here...?

Original: Cater:No, no! It's not your fault!
Dialogue: No, no! It's not your fault!

Original: Rem:You saved me, Arciela. I can't thank you enough.
Dialogue: You saved me, Arciela. I can't thank you enough.

Original: Auron:It's not easy to judge whether to help complete strangers or not.
Dialogue: It's not easy to judge whether to help complete strangers or not.

Original: Cid:In short, we like you, miss!
Dialogue: In short, we like you, miss!

Original: Arciela:Th-thank you! I'm happy to hear that.
Dialogue: Th-thank you! I'm happy to hear that.

Original: Lion:As you can see from these woods, Vana'diel is in trouble...
Dialogue: As you can see from these woods, Vana'diel is in trouble...

Original: Rem:In order to save our worlds and get back home, we need to gather brilliance.
Dialogue: In order to save our worlds and get back home, we need to gather brilliance.

Original: Cid:So will you help us? Rejection would be hard for us to stomach at this point.
Dialogue: So will you help us? Rejection would be hard for us to stomach at this point.

Original: Arciela:I can't stop here. I have a duty to the people of Adoulin...
Dialogue: I can't stop here. I have a duty to the people of Adoulin...

Original: Arciela:Please, let me come with you. I want to help!
Dialogue: Please, let me come with you. I want to help!

Original: Cid:Well, well! You look like a sheltered noble, but you've got guts, kid!
Dialogue: Well, well! You look like a sheltered noble, but you've got guts, kid!

Original: Zack:Alright, guys! We're almost out of the woods! Just follow me!
Dialogue: Alright, guys! We're almost out of the woods! Just follow me!

Original: Ace:Is it really a good idea to follow him...?
Dialogue: Is it really a good idea to follow him...?

Original: Quistis:Indeed. Having him lead makes me very nervous...
Dialogue: Indeed. Having him lead makes me very nervous...

Original: Arciela:There are poisonous plants growing over there. And I can sense monsters.
Dialogue: There are poisonous plants growing over there. And I can sense monsters.

Original: Zack:Wh-what!? How did you know that?
Dialogue: Wh-what!? How did you know that?

Original: Zell:Oh, brother...
Dialogue: Oh, brother...

Original: Arciela:Let's go this way instead. It's a safer route out.
Dialogue: Let's go this way instead. It's a safer route out.

Original: Quistis:You really saved our necks, Arciela. You're very well versed in the forest.
Dialogue: You really saved our necks, Arciela. You're very well versed in the forest.

Original: Zell:You know a ton about medicinal plants, too! Almost like you've lived in the woods before.
Dialogue: You know a ton about medicinal plants, too! Almost like you've lived in the woods before.

Original: Ace:Arciela? Is something wrong?
Dialogue: Arciela? Is something wrong?

Original: Arciela:...I just remembered how they used to call me a witch back home.
Dialogue: ...I just remembered how they used to call me a witch back home.

Original: Zack:A witch? But why?
Dialogue: A witch? But why?

Original: Arciela:I've had the power to be attune with nature ever since I can remember.
Dialogue: I've had the power to be attune with nature ever since I can remember.

Original: Arciela:Before I knew it, people started ridiculing me of being a witch protected by the woods.
Dialogue: Before I knew it, people started ridiculing me of being a witch protected by the woods.

Original: Arciela:This power has caused me unhappiness. I've even dragged in people around me...
Dialogue: This power has caused me unhappiness. I've even dragged in people around me...

Original: Quistis:That's terrible.
Dialogue: That's terrible.

Original: Zell:A witch, huh...
Dialogue: A witch, huh...

Original: Quistis:Sorceresses often used their great powers as a weapon to become dictators.
Dialogue: Sorceresses often used their great powers as a weapon to become dictators.

Original: Quistis:Because of that, people came to hate them. But not all sorceresses are evil...
Dialogue: Because of that, people came to hate them. But not all sorceresses are evil...

Original: Arciela:People hated them, too... Just like me.
Dialogue: People hated them, too... Just like me.

Original: Zell:What are you saying? You're completely different.
Dialogue: What are you saying? You're completely different.

Original: Zell:You're nothing like Ultimecia at all!
Dialogue: You're nothing like Ultimecia at all!

Original: Ace:You saved Rem, and you helped us avoid danger.
Dialogue: You saved Rem, and you helped us avoid danger.

Original: Zack:You do have a mysterious power, but how you use it is up to you.
Dialogue: You do have a mysterious power, but how you use it is up to you.

Original: Zack:So even if you're a witch, you're a good one!
Dialogue: So even if you're a witch, you're a good one!

Original: Zack:So, how about it?
Dialogue: So, how about it?

Original: Arciela:Thank you, everyone. You're right. I need to be more positive!
Dialogue: Thank you, everyone. You're right. I need to be more positive!

Original: Arciela:If I can save someone with this power, I don't care what people call me!
Dialogue: If I can save someone with this power, I don't care what people call me!

Original: Zack:That's the spirit! Now let's get going!
Dialogue: That's the spirit! Now let's get going!

Original: Arciela:Wait, Zack! Not that way!
Dialogue: Wait, Zack! Not that way!

Original: Edgar:Arciela, you mentioned before that your country was involved in colonization.
Dialogue: Arciela, you mentioned before that your country was involved in colonization.

Original: Edgar:As a king, I find the subject of how other nations are governed to be fascinating. I would like to hear more, if you would indulge me.
Dialogue: As a king, I find the subject of how other nations are governed to be fascinating. I would like to hear more, if you would indulge me.

Original: Arciela:Of course. The Sacred City of Adoulin consists of the capital city and its many surrounding islands, both large and small.
Dialogue: Of course. The Sacred City of Adoulin consists of the capital city and its many surrounding islands, both large and small.

Original: Arciela:Since its expansion as a mercantile city, the population has increased several times over.
Dialogue: Since its expansion as a mercantile city, the population has increased several times over.

Original: Cait Sith:That sounds like music to my ears. The more the merrier, I say.
Dialogue: That sounds like music to my ears. The more the merrier, I say.

Original: Ashe:Your home was built on trade, as was mine. I am sure they share much in common.
Dialogue: Your home was built on trade, as was mine. I am sure they share much in common.

Original: Edgar:All those people, and only so many islands. I think I see the reason its rulers would push for expansion.
Dialogue: All those people, and only so many islands. I think I see the reason its rulers would push for expansion.

Original: Onion Knight:So you guys ran out of land?
Dialogue: So you guys ran out of land?

Original: Arciela:That's right. The islands could not bear the burden of so many people.
Dialogue: That's right. The islands could not bear the burden of so many people.

Original: Arciela:So we have expanded into the west, through the forests, forming new colonies along the way.
Dialogue: So we have expanded into the west, through the forests, forming new colonies along the way.

Original: Barret:Did I hear that right?
Dialogue: Did I hear that right?

Original: Barret:Did you say "through the forest"? Does that mean you're cuttin' those trees down?
Dialogue: Did you say "through the forest"? Does that mean you're cuttin' those trees down?

Original: Arciela:Yes, unfortunately. There are those in Adoulin who would share in your surprise.
Dialogue: Yes, unfortunately. There are those in Adoulin who would share in your surprise.

Original: Barret:You got that right! Nothin' makes my blood boil like humans thinkin' they can trample over nature's gifts!
Dialogue: You got that right! Nothin' makes my blood boil like humans thinkin' they can trample over nature's gifts!

Original: Onion Knight:Whoa, calm down there. Seems like this hit a sore spot.
Dialogue: Whoa, calm down there. Seems like this hit a sore spot.

Original: Barret:So what if it did!?
Dialogue: So what if it did!?

Original: Barret:It's because of thoughtless bastards like that that my home...my friends...
Dialogue: It's because of thoughtless bastards like that that my home...my friends...

Original: Cait Sith:H-hey! Don't look at me like that!
Dialogue: H-hey! Don't look at me like that!

Original: Ashe:I understand how you feel, Barret.
Dialogue: I understand how you feel, Barret.

Original: Ashe:However, rulers have a responsibility to their subjects as well. They can't leave them without a place to live.
Dialogue: However, rulers have a responsibility to their subjects as well. They can't leave them without a place to live.

Original: Barret:Yeah, I know that. I just... I just...
Dialogue: Yeah, I know that. I just... I just...

Original: Onion Knight:It's not easy to balance your respect for nature with your peoples' prosperity. And the more there are, the harder it is.
Dialogue: It's not easy to balance your respect for nature with your peoples' prosperity. And the more there are, the harder it is.

Original: Arciela:In Adoulin, the debates between those who supported expansion and those who opposed it went on for ages.
Dialogue: In Adoulin, the debates between those who supported expansion and those who opposed it went on for ages.

Original: Arciela:Adoulin's previous attempt at pioneering had met with failure.
Dialogue: Adoulin's previous attempt at pioneering had met with failure.

Original: Arciela:Those who opposed the plan feared the wrath of the forests, and went to extreme lengths to make their opposition heard.
Dialogue: Those who opposed the plan feared the wrath of the forests, and went to extreme lengths to make their opposition heard.

Original: Cait Sith:"Extreme lengths"... Where have I heard that before?
Dialogue: "Extreme lengths"... Where have I heard that before?

Original: Barret:H-Hey! Don't look at me!
Dialogue: H-Hey! Don't look at me!

Original: Arciela:Expansion is possible, but we must let the voices of nature guide us along the way.
Dialogue: Expansion is possible, but we must let the voices of nature guide us along the way.

Original: Arciela:We are inextricably linked. We can't face the future in opposition, but must look to it in unity.
Dialogue: We are inextricably linked. We can't face the future in opposition, but must look to it in unity.

Original: Arciela:That should be what we strive for, in any case.
Dialogue: That should be what we strive for, in any case.

Original: Cait Sith:Sounds a bit over my head, but if she believes it, then I'm behind her!
Dialogue: Sounds a bit over my head, but if she believes it, then I'm behind her!

Original: Ashe:With someone like you to guide their way, I'm sure your people will see your ideals realized.
Dialogue: With someone like you to guide their way, I'm sure your people will see your ideals realized.

Original: Edgar:Well, I do have some experience in the matter of leading others.
Dialogue: Well, I do have some experience in the matter of leading others.

Original: Edgar:If you ever need advice, then I will offer what I can. You only need to ask.
Dialogue: If you ever need advice, then I will offer what I can. You only need to ask.

Original: Arciela:Thank you! It's reassuring to know I can depend on you.
Dialogue: Thank you! It's reassuring to know I can depend on you.

Original: Prishe:Aaargh! I can't take it anymore! I won't last another step at this rate!
Dialogue: Aaargh! I can't take it anymore! I won't last another step at this rate!

Original: Freya:Wh-what is it, Prishe?
Dialogue: Wh-what is it, Prishe?

Original: Prishe:I'm out of energy. If I don't have something sweet soon...
Dialogue: I'm out of energy. If I don't have something sweet soon...

Original: Agrias:And that concerns us how?
Dialogue: And that concerns us how?

Original: Arciela:I'm in agreement with Prishe! We need to find something sweet to eat, and quickly!
Dialogue: I'm in agreement with Prishe! We need to find something sweet to eat, and quickly!

Original: Relm:You can count me in, too! Sweets must be found!
Dialogue: You can count me in, too! Sweets must be found!

Original: Chelinka:What kind are you thinking of?
Dialogue: What kind are you thinking of?

Original: Arciela:Mmm, a chocolate crepe topped with white honey! Heaps of witch nougat made with maple sugar!
Dialogue: Mmm, a chocolate crepe topped with white honey! Heaps of witch nougat made with maple sugar!

Original: Relm:You know what I want? Fluffy pancakes smothered in maple syrup!
Dialogue: You know what I want? Fluffy pancakes smothered in maple syrup!

Original: Prishe:That sounds delicious! I want those too!
Dialogue: That sounds delicious! I want those too!

Original: Arciela:Just talking about sweets makes me feel so much better.
Dialogue: Just talking about sweets makes me feel so much better.

Original: Freya:You three are quite...enthusiastic.
Dialogue: You three are quite...enthusiastic.

Original: Arciela:Don't you have a sweet tooth at all? There's nothing you like to snack on?
Dialogue: Don't you have a sweet tooth at all? There's nothing you like to snack on?

Original: Freya:Something sweet? Well...
Dialogue: Something sweet? Well...

Original: Freya:Princess Garnet was partial to peach pudding, as I recall.
Dialogue: Princess Garnet was partial to peach pudding, as I recall.

Original: Arciela:Pudding? Ah, so Garnet is one of us!
Dialogue: Pudding? Ah, so Garnet is one of us!

Original: Arciela:A chocobon? Hmm...
Dialogue: A chocobon? Hmm...

Original: Arciela:That's a new one. I wonder what's in it.
Dialogue: That's a new one. I wonder what's in it.

Original: Prishe:Ahhh, I can't take this anymore! Someone, please! Maaake me something!
Dialogue: Ahhh, I can't take this anymore! Someone, please! Maaake me something!

Original: Yuri:How about it, Chelinka? We could have a go at it.
Dialogue: How about it, Chelinka? We could have a go at it.

Original: Chelinka:Maybe. I suppose if we had the ingredients and a little guidance, we could at least try.
Dialogue: Maybe. I suppose if we had the ingredients and a little guidance, we could at least try.

Original: Relm:You two can cook?
Dialogue: You two can cook?

Original: Yuri:Yup. We've had a lot of experience improvising, and got pretty good along the way.
Dialogue: Yup. We've had a lot of experience improvising, and got pretty good along the way.

Original: Yuri:So should we give it a shot? If we all put our heads together, what's the worst that can happen?
Dialogue: So should we give it a shot? If we all put our heads together, what's the worst that can happen?

Original: Chelinka:Well, now you've gotten everyone's hopes up. Alright, can we trouble you all to look for ingredients?
Dialogue: Well, now you've gotten everyone's hopes up. Alright, can we trouble you all to look for ingredients?

Original: Chelinka:We could recruit Ignis, too. If we're going to try it, we might as well do it right!
Dialogue: We could recruit Ignis, too. If we're going to try it, we might as well do it right!

Original: Relm:You got it! I'll put on my best gathering pants!
Dialogue: You got it! I'll put on my best gathering pants!

Original: Arciela:Now we have a quest! To make the perfect confectionary!
Dialogue: Now we have a quest! To make the perfect confectionary!

Original: Prishe:Nothing can stop us! Let's gooo!
Dialogue: Nothing can stop us! Let's gooo!

Original: Agrias:I have never seen them attend to any duty with such vigor. All because of sweets?
Dialogue: I have never seen them attend to any duty with such vigor. All because of sweets?

Original: Materia:Yes. This world draws ever closer to danger. Won't you lend us your strength?
Dialogue: Yes. This world draws ever closer to danger. Won't you lend us your strength?

Original: ???:Haha! Are you serious?
Dialogue: Haha! Are you serious?

Original: ???:You're asking the guy who refused a queen's request. As if a goddess would be much different.
Dialogue: You're asking the guy who refused a queen's request. As if a goddess would be much different.

Original: Materia:So you are in need of a different reason.
Dialogue: So you are in need of a different reason.

Original: Materia:I understand. I will open the way for you. Then you can judge this world with your own eyes.
Dialogue: I understand. I will open the way for you. Then you can judge this world with your own eyes.

Original: ???:Where does it lead?
Dialogue: Where does it lead?

Original: Materia:One of your comrades is ahead. He should be able to help you understand our world.
Dialogue: One of your comrades is ahead. He should be able to help you understand our world.

Original: ???:I feel like I've seen this before...
Dialogue: I feel like I've seen this before...

Original: ???:Well, no point in waiting around. Thanks, goddess Materia.
Dialogue: Well, no point in waiting around. Thanks, goddess Materia.

Original: Keiss:Never been here before... But that doesn't necessarily mean I'm in a different world.
Dialogue: Never been here before... But that doesn't necessarily mean I'm in a different world.

Original: Keiss:If I'm going to judge this place with my own eyes, I need to get my hands on some information.
Dialogue: If I'm going to judge this place with my own eyes, I need to get my hands on some information.

Original: Keiss:...Didn't that goddess say one of my comrades would be here?
Dialogue: ...Didn't that goddess say one of my comrades would be here?

Original: Keiss:Could she have meant Layle? I couldn't find him anywhere, but...
Dialogue: Could she have meant Layle? I couldn't find him anywhere, but...

Original: Keiss:(What's that guy up to? Is he setting a trap?)
Dialogue: (What's that guy up to? Is he setting a trap?)

Original: Keiss:(But judging from his demeanor, he's upper class. Perfect for getting information.)
Dialogue: (But judging from his demeanor, he's upper class. Perfect for getting information.)

Original: Keiss:(I'll trail him for a while. He won't notice me at this distance...)
Dialogue: (I'll trail him for a while. He won't notice me at this distance...)

Original: The Emperor:So you managed to evade my attack.
Dialogue: So you managed to evade my attack.

Original: Keiss:(He noticed me!? I underestimated him.)
Dialogue: (He noticed me!? I underestimated him.)

Original: The Emperor:A new face, I see... Who are you?
Dialogue: A new face, I see... Who are you?

Original: The Emperor:No... Tell me: who summoned you?
Dialogue: No... Tell me who summoned you?

Original: Keiss:(I see... So the goddess has enemies. I had better tread carefully.)
Dialogue: (I see... So the goddess has enemies. I had better tread carefully.)

Original: Keiss:You appear to be of noble blood. Could you please help me?
Dialogue: You appear to be of noble blood. Could you please help me?

Original: Keiss:I was suddenly thrown into this place and don't know what to do with myself.
Dialogue: I was suddenly thrown into this place and don't know what to do with myself.

Original: Keiss:But it appears this world has seen better days.
Dialogue: But it appears this world has seen better days.

Original: Keiss:Even if only for a little while, would you mind if I accompanied you?
Dialogue: Even if only for a little while, would you mind if I accompanied you?

Original: Keiss:You've seen how I can move. Why not let me work for you?
Dialogue: You've seen how I can move. Why not let me work for you?

Original: The Emperor:...Hmph. You bore me.
Dialogue: ...Hmph. You bore me.

Original: Keiss:Could you find it in yourself to help me?
Dialogue: Could you find it in yourself to help me?

Original: Maria:What is that man doing!?
Dialogue: What is that man doing!?

Original: Layle:(Huh? Is that...Keiss?)
Dialogue: (Huh? Is that...Keiss?)

Original: King:Scheming something, most likely. I guess it's up to us to cut it short.
Dialogue: Scheming something, most likely. I guess it's up to us to cut it short.

Original: Layle:(He's talking to the Emperor. Maybe he's trying to get information out of him...)
Dialogue: (He's talking to the Emperor. Maybe he's trying to get information out of him...)

Original: Keiss:Stop right there!
Dialogue: Stop right there!

Original: Layle:I get it. I won't go over there.
Dialogue: I get it. I won't go over there.

Original: Keiss:He's a long-time rival of mine... Why don't you leave this to me?
Dialogue: He's a long-time rival of mine... Why don't you leave this to me?

Original: The Emperor:...So you two hail from the same world.
Dialogue: ...So you two hail from the same world.

Original: Keiss:Let's settle this, crystal bearer!
Dialogue: Let's settle this, crystal bearer!

Original: The Emperor:There's no need for that.
Dialogue: There's no need for that.

Original: Keiss:Gck...!
Dialogue: Gck...!

Original: Maria:But...I thought you were friends!
Dialogue: But...I thought you were friends!

Original: The Emperor:I have no memory of such folly. He was just a worm wriggling where he didn't belong.
Dialogue: I have no memory of such folly. He was just a worm wriggling where he didn't belong.

Original: The Emperor:Did you really think I would believe you? What a pathetic spy...
Dialogue: Did you really think I would believe you? What a pathetic spy...

Original: Celes:Then who is he...?
Dialogue: Then who is he...?

Original: Layle:A fine performance as always, Keiss.
Dialogue: A fine performance as always, Keiss.

Original: Keiss:Seriously? That's how you greet me after all this time?
Dialogue: Seriously? That's how you greet me after all this time?

Original: Keiss:Well, I owe you one, crystal bearer.
Dialogue: Well, I owe you one, crystal bearer.

Original: King:I see. So Layle sent you flying before you could get caught in the trap.
Dialogue: I see. So Layle sent you flying before you could get caught in the trap.

Original: Layle:Pretty good teamwork, wasn't it? We've worked together before.
Dialogue: Pretty good teamwork, wasn't it? We've worked together before.

Original: Keiss:More importantly, Layle...
Dialogue: More importantly, Layle...

Original: Keiss:What are you doing here?
Dialogue: What are you doing here?

Original: Layle:It's not my fault. I was just brought here.
Dialogue: It's not my fault. I was just brought here.

Original: Keiss:Don't you know how worried everyone was about you!?
Dialogue: Don't you know how worried everyone was about you!?

Original: Keiss:I've had my hands full restoring the guild while looking for you!
Dialogue: I've had my hands full restoring the guild while looking for you!

Original: Layle:...Well, at least you got one thing squared away now.
Dialogue: ...Well, at least you got one thing squared away now.

Original: Layle:Since we've got some time here, why not come with us?
Dialogue: Since we've got some time here, why not come with us?

Original: Layle:This is Keiss. He's an old partner of mine.
Dialogue: This is Keiss. He's an old partner of mine.

Original: Celes:I'm sorry for my mistake earlier. You're one of Layle's friends, then.
Dialogue: I'm sorry for my mistake earlier. You're one of Layle's friends, then.

Original: Layle:He catches on quick, so don't go easy when teaching him about this place.
Dialogue: He catches on quick, so don't go easy when teaching him about this place.

Original: Keiss:(Layle sure is friendly with these people... And they don't seem afraid of his power.)
Dialogue: (Layle sure is friendly with these people... And they don't seem afraid of his power.)

Original: Keiss:(I thought something shady was going on, but I have no choice but to believe it if Layle says so... I've made up my mind.)
Dialogue: (I thought something shady was going on, but I have no choice but to believe it if Layle says so... I've made up my mind.)

Original: Keiss:Nice to meet you guys! It looks like I'll be in your capable hands from now on!
Dialogue: Nice to meet you guys! It looks like I'll be in your capable hands from now on!

Original: Freya:Interesting, isn't it? It makes one realize how diverse the worlds out there are.
Dialogue: Interesting, isn't it? It makes one realize how diverse the worlds out there are.

Original: Keiss:If there were this many races back home, I feel there would be fewer quarrels.
Dialogue: If there were this many races back home, I feel there would be fewer quarrels.

Original: Terra:There were wars in your world, too, weren't there?
Dialogue: There were wars in your world, too, weren't there?

Original: Keiss:Well...a certain tribe monopolized power.
Dialogue: Well...a certain tribe monopolized power.

Original: Keiss:So there was inequality between the four tribes.Selkieslike me created aguildto survive.
Dialogue: So there was inequality between the four tribes. Selkies like me created a guild to survive.

Original: Penelo:Inequality... I guess that exists anywhere.
Dialogue: Inequality... I guess that exists anywhere.

Original: Penelo:Themanwho looked after me was from adifferent tribe, but he was very popular and good at his job. So I was surprised.
Dialogue: The man who looked after me was from a different tribe, but he was very popular and good at his job. So I was surprised.

Original: Ramza:...But even people of the same tribe can experience inequality.
Dialogue: ...But even people of the same tribe can experience inequality.

Original: Barret:If there weren't, the slums wouldn't exist.
Dialogue: If there weren't, the slums wouldn't exist.

Original: Penelo:You're right... There's disparity even among us here.
Dialogue: You're right... There's disparity even among us here.

Original: Keiss:Right? In that case, you can't keep quiet. You need to take power back with your own hands.
Dialogue: Right? In that case, you can't keep quiet. You need to take power back with your own hands.

Original: Keiss:That's why I joined the army. To pull down those on top.
Dialogue: That's why I joined the army. To pull down those on top.

Original: Keiss:I was able to climb the ranks that way, but the stubborn Guild Master told me never to show my face around there again.
Dialogue: I was able to climb the ranks that way, but the stubborn Guild Master told me never to show my face around there again.

Original: Barret:Hahaha! You've got guts, kid!
Dialogue: Hahaha! You've got guts, kid!

Original: Ramza:But don't you feel uneasy without that support? It's like having no one at your back.
Dialogue: But don't you feel uneasy without that support? It's like having no one at your back.

Original: Keiss:Selkies tend to value our independence, so I wasn't too torn up about it.
Dialogue: Selkies tend to value our independence, so I wasn't too torn up about it.

Original: Terra:...Even still, you worked hard for your tribe?
Dialogue: ...Even still, you worked hard for your tribe?

Original: Penelo:You're very thoughtful of your friends, Keiss!
Dialogue: You're very thoughtful of your friends, Keiss!

Original: Keiss:Hah, that's a new one.
Dialogue: Hah, that's a new one.

Original: Freya:Perhaps you are fit to become a guildmaster yourself.
Dialogue: Perhaps you are fit to become a guildmaster yourself.

Original: Barret:She's right! That's right up your alley!
Dialogue: She's right! That's right up your alley!

Original: Keiss:You guys don't miss a thing. Actually, I'm doing something pretty similar now.
Dialogue: You guys don't miss a thing. Actually, I'm doing something pretty similar now.

Original: Penelo:Then your world will definitely change! As long as there's one person who wants it to change.
Dialogue: Then your world will definitely change! As long as there's one person who wants it to change.

Original: Terra:Right. Even if they're from a different tribe, you can join hands and work together.
Dialogue: Right. Even if they're from a different tribe, you can join hands and work together.

Original: Keiss:And she wanted me as High Commander. I don't think she has any intention of monopolizing power.
Dialogue: And she wanted me as High Commander. I don't think she has any intention of monopolizing power.

Original: Ramza:How nice... The beginning of a new age for your world.
Dialogue: How nice... The beginning of a new age for your world.

Original: Keiss:That's why I want to show it to Layle. He helped make it all possible and still doesn't know.
Dialogue: That's why I want to show it to Layle. He helped make it all possible and still doesn't know.

Original: Keiss:Yeah. He's the hero who saved our world.
Dialogue: Yeah. He's the hero who saved our world.

Original: Keiss:And after he saved the world...
Dialogue: And after he saved the world...

Original: Keiss:He disappeared without a word.
Dialogue: He disappeared without a word.

Original: Keiss:Almost like he was blown away by the wind. Like some kind of nomad.
Dialogue: Almost like he was blown away by the wind. Like some kind of nomad.

Original: Terra:Haha. He sounds like Bartz! Exploring the world, going wherever the wind takes him.
Dialogue: Haha. He sounds like Bartz! Exploring the world, going wherever the wind takes him.

Original: Penelo:That's right. I wonder why they stay here with us... They don't act like that at all around us.
Dialogue: That's right. I wonder why they stay here with us... They don't act like that at all around us.

Original: Keiss:Yeah. To be honest, I was quite surprised to see Layle staying in one place here.
Dialogue: Yeah. To be honest, I was quite surprised to see Layle staying in one place here.

Original: Keiss:...Oh, and he hates talk like this, so don't tell him I told you.
Dialogue: ...Oh, and he hates talk like this, so don't tell him I told you.

Original: Keiss:Hehe, thanks. Well, I guess it's off to our next destination!
Dialogue: Hehe, thanks. Well, I guess it's off to our next destination!

Original: Keiss:How weird...
Dialogue: How weird...

Original: Keiss:Maybe it was more comfortable for him being treated like a normal human here.
Dialogue: Maybe it was more comfortable for him being treated like a normal human here.

Original: Keiss:Tch. I probably gave him too much credit to think it didn't bother him.
Dialogue: Tch. I probably gave him too much credit to think it didn't bother him.

Original: Keiss:Well, he was treated like a heretic back home.
Dialogue: Well, he was treated like a heretic back home.

Original: Keiss:I wonder if he thinks the world still rejects him...
Dialogue: I wonder if he thinks the world still rejects him...

Original: Keiss:What an idiot. I have to drag him back home on the double and have everyone give him a piece of their mind.
Dialogue: What an idiot. I have to drag him back home on the double and have everyone give him a piece of their mind.

Original: Auron:You're a friend of Layle's, I hear.
Dialogue: You're a friend of Layle's, I hear.

Original: Keiss:Yeah, but he and i are nothing alike. I'm not a crystal bearer like he is.
Dialogue: Yeah, but he and i are nothing alike. I'm not a crystal bearer like he is.

Original: Porom:So are you two friends?
Dialogue: So are you two friends?

Original: Keiss:Friends? Not quite...
Dialogue: Friends? Not quite...

Original: Keiss:We're from different tribes and don't see each other much outside of jobs, but we're partners without a doubt.
Dialogue: We're from different tribes and don't see each other much outside of jobs, but we're partners without a doubt.

Original: Papalymo:Partners are truly a splendid thing. It seems Layle and I have more in common than I thought.
Dialogue: Partners are truly a splendid thing. It seems Layle and I have more in common than I thought.

Original: Keiss:It's far from splendid. That guy's nothing but trouble.
Dialogue: It's far from splendid. That guy's nothing but trouble.

Original: Tifa:Trouble? That sounds...unfortunate.
Dialogue: Trouble? That sounds...unfortunate.

Original: Keiss:You don't know the half of it.
Dialogue: You don't know the half of it.

Original: Keiss:He gets stuck fighting huge monsters that come out of nowhere and loses his way chasing Goldenrod.
Dialogue: He gets stuck fighting huge monsters that come out of nowhere and loses his way chasing Goldenrod.

Original: Keiss:And don't even get me started on vehicles. What goes up must come down!
Dialogue: And don't even get me started on vehicles. What goes up must come down!

Original: Keiss:You see? Being partners with that guy means putting up with all that!
Dialogue: You see? Being partners with that guy means putting up with all that!

Original: Tifa:I hate falling...
Dialogue: I hate falling...

Original: Quistis:How can someone without any responsibilities get into so much trouble?
Dialogue: How can someone without any responsibilities get into so much trouble?

Original: Porom:A fair question. doesn't it ever worry you?
Dialogue: A fair question. doesn't it ever worry you?

Original: Keiss:Not really. He's lived to tell the tale every time.
Dialogue: Not really. He's lived to tell the tale every time.

Original: Porom:It must be nice to trust your partner like that! I can't take my eyes off Palom for one second...
Dialogue: It must be nice to trust your partner like that! I can't take my eyes off Palom for one second...

Original: Porom:But I guess I can't compare the two. Palom's trouble is of his own making...
Dialogue: But I guess I can't compare the two. Palom's trouble is of his own making...

Original: Papalymo:...But I'm sure any trouble is more manageable with you at his side.
Dialogue: ...But I'm sure any trouble is more manageable with you at his side.

Original: Quistis:And even if you do cause trouble, I suppose it's fine as long as it doesn't affect others...
Dialogue: And even if you do cause trouble, I suppose it's fine as long as it doesn't affect others...

Original: Tifa:But even among friends...
Dialogue: But even among friends...

Original: Tifa:There's trouble that you will and won't tolerate being dragged into, right?
Dialogue: There's trouble that you will and won't tolerate being dragged into, right?

Original: Tifa:Sometimes trouble is inevitable, but if it's caused by your own greed I don't want any part of it!
Dialogue: Sometimes trouble is inevitable, but if it's caused by your own greed I don't want any part of it!

Original: Auron:And I don't want to pay for anyone's drunken mistakes.
Dialogue: And I don't want to pay for anyone's drunken mistakes.

Original: Keiss:All fine examples. But you can't just abandon them, right?
Dialogue: All fine examples. But you can't just abandon them, right?

Original: Tifa:Like they could make it without us! They're our friends because we go through these troublesome things together.
Dialogue: Like they could make it without us! They're our friends because we go through these troublesome things together.

Original: Keiss:He may be nothing but trouble, but Layle's reliable and tries to do the right thing. I could do worse than him for a partner.
Dialogue: He may be nothing but trouble, but Layle's reliable and tries to do the right thing. I could do worse than him for a partner.

Original: Layle:There you are, Keiss. We could use another set of eyes for the next patrol.
Dialogue: There you are, Keiss. We could use another set of eyes for the next patrol.

Original: Keiss:Alright, alright. I'm coming.
Dialogue: Alright, alright. I'm coming.

Original: Quistis:I thought he just said Layle was nothing but trouble.
Dialogue: I thought he just said Layle was nothing but trouble.

Original: Porom:Then it's up to Keiss to watch his back, right? Haha!
Dialogue: Then it's up to Keiss to watch his back, right? Haha!

Original: Keiss:Hey, quite the group you've got here.
Dialogue: Hey, quite the group you've got here.

Original: Keiss:I'm going to have a look around the area. Does anyone want to join me?
Dialogue: I'm going to have a look around the area. Does anyone want to join me?

Original: Sabin:I'd be happy to. Overflowing with curiosity for the new world, are you?
Dialogue: I'd be happy to. Overflowing with curiosity for the new world, are you?

Original: Keiss:Not really. I just want to know more about it.
Dialogue: Not really. I just want to know more about it.

Original: Keiss:I've got to see the outside with my own eyes, y'know?
Dialogue: I've got to see the outside with my own eyes, y'know?

Original: Fang:Quite the earnest adventurer, aren't ya?
Dialogue: Quite the earnest adventurer, aren't ya?

Original: Keiss:Is it really that strange to go exploring? The people back home thought it was too, but...
Dialogue: Is it really that strange to go exploring? The people back home thought it was too, but...

Original: Keiss:You'll never learn about the outside world by staying in one place.
Dialogue: You'll never learn about the outside world by staying in one place.

Original: Fran:Some things you learn only by leaving homethings you cannot learn through rumors alone.
Dialogue: Some things you learn only by leaving home—things you cannot learn through rumors alone.

Original: Keiss:Glad it turned out to be a false alarm! There are plenty of things you just have to see with your own eyes.
Dialogue: Glad it turned out to be a false alarm! There are plenty of things you just have to see with your own eyes.

Original: Eiko:You didn't think the outside world was scary, Keiss? I know I did...
Dialogue: You didn't think the outside world was scary, Keiss? I know I did...

Original: Keiss:I definitely felt more at ease at home with other Selkies, but you'll get left behind if you never leave the nest.
Dialogue: I definitely felt more at ease at home with other Selkies, but you'll get left behind if you never leave the nest.

Original: Eiko:Left behind? By who?
Dialogue: Left behind? By who?

Original: Keiss:The rest of the world.
Dialogue: The rest of the world.

Original: Keiss:I hated the Lilty for what they did to the Selkie. We got left behind and struggled just to survive.
Dialogue: I hated the Lilty for what they did to the Selkie. We got left behind and struggled just to survive.

Original: Fran:You wished to reclaim your pride.
Dialogue: You wished to reclaim your pride.

Original: Noct:Then you've got no choice but to fight.
Dialogue: Then you've got no choice but to fight.

Original: Eiko:So that's why you left home!
Dialogue: So that's why you left home!

Original: Sabin:You faced any fears you may have had to claim what you desired.
Dialogue: You faced any fears you may have had to claim what you desired.

Original: Fran:Even you left home for something you wanted, no?
Dialogue: Even you left home for something you wanted, no?

Original: Eiko:...Right. I wasn't sure what to do at first, but I really wanted to go with Zidane and the others.
Dialogue: ...Right. I wasn't sure what to do at first, but I really wanted to go with Zidane and the others.

Original: Keiss:Then you and I are the same. We both wanted to know more about the outside world.
Dialogue: Then you and I are the same. We both wanted to know more about the outside world.

Original: Keiss:The world is always changing, so it's important to know what's going on.
Dialogue: The world is always changing, so it's important to know what's going on.

Original: Keiss:So I'll ask one more time: I'm going to have a look around. Does anyone want to join
Dialogue: So I'll ask one more time I'm going to have a look around. Does anyone want to join—

Original: Eiko:Come on, Keiss! Let's go!
Dialogue: Come on, Keiss! Let's go!

Original: Fang:Hurry up now. Wouldn't want you getting lost on my watch.
Dialogue: Hurry up now. Wouldn't want you getting lost on my watch.

Original: Keiss:This is way more people than I expected, but I'm not complaining.
Dialogue: This is way more people than I expected, but I'm not complaining.

Original: Kam'lanaut:...Have you been waiting here for me?
Dialogue: ...Have you been waiting here for me?

Original: Eald'narche:You needn't be so wary of me. I merely want you to pass my dimensional coordinates onto Materia's warriors.
Dialogue: You needn't be so wary of me. I merely want you to pass my dimensional coordinates onto Materia's warriors.

Original: Eald'narche:Since you're traveling with them, it should be no problem. Right?
Dialogue: Since you're traveling with them, it should be no problem. Right?

Original: Kam'lanaut:I wonder. It's not as if we trust each other.
Dialogue: I wonder. It's not as if we trust each other.

Original: Eald'narche:That matters not. I'm sure they'll take it.
Dialogue: That matters not. I'm sure they'll take it.

Original: Eald'narche:...You think I want to see things for myself, don't you?
Dialogue: ...You think I want to see things for myself, don't you?

Original: Eald'narche:You're right, but make no mistake. That is but a means to an end.
Dialogue: You're right, but make no mistake. That is but a means to an end.

Original: Eald'narche:To undo the failures of the past and make the right choices to obtain the future.
Dialogue: To undo the failures of the past and make the right choices to obtain the future.

Original: Kam'lanaut:What are you talking about?
Dialogue: What are you talking about?

Original: Eald'narche:By using the principles of this world, I may be able to settle that time I cast you aside.
Dialogue: By using the principles of this world, I may be able to settle that time I cast you aside.

Original: Kam'lanaut:...What nonsense. The past cannot be changed.
Dialogue: ...What nonsense. The past cannot be changed.

Original: Eald'narche:Think what you want. I suppose arguing here was inevitable.
Dialogue: Think what you want. I suppose arguing here was inevitable.

Original: Eald'narche:Give them my coordinates. Understood?
Dialogue: Give them my coordinates. Understood?

Original: Kam'lanaut:Just what is he scheming...?
Dialogue: Just what is he scheming...?

Original: Kam'lanaut:Hmph... I suppose I'll do what he asks for now.
Dialogue: Hmph... I suppose I'll do what he asks for now.

Original: Kam'lanaut:I need only discern what to do once handing them these coordinates...
Dialogue: I need only discern what to do once handing them these coordinates...

Original: Kam'lanaut:You worms need only listen.
Dialogue: You worms need only listen.

Original: Sabin:Listen to what?
Dialogue: Listen to what?

Original: Kam'lanaut:Take these.
Dialogue: Take these.

Original: Mog:Dimensional coordinates, kupo!?
Dialogue: Dimensional coordinates, kupo!?

Original: Firion:But we've already got yours, Kam'lanaut.
Dialogue: But we've already got yours, Kam'lanaut.

Original: Mog:...These aren't Kam'lanaut's. They're Eald'narche's!
Dialogue: ...These aren't Kam'lanaut's. They're Eald'narche's!

Original: Sabin:Eald'narche!? You mean the one you betrayed...?
Dialogue: Eald'narche!? You mean the one you betrayed...?

Original: Kam'lanaut:He betrayed me first. And he asked me to give you those.
Dialogue: He betrayed me first. And he asked me to give you those.

Original: Kam'lanaut:Use them as you see fit. It is no concern of mine.
Dialogue: Use them as you see fit. It is no concern of mine.

Original: Firion:What is Eald'narche thinking...?
Dialogue: What is Eald'narche thinking...?

Original: Kam'lanaut:He saw me lending you a hand...and decided to cooperate.
Dialogue: He saw me lending you a hand...and decided to cooperate.

Original: Sabin:Does he want to help for the same reason as you? To understand our motivations?
Dialogue: Does he want to help for the same reason as you? To understand our motivations?

Original: Kam'lanaut:You have a praiseworthy memory for a primate. Now you two can use each other.
Dialogue: You have a praiseworthy memory for a primate. Now you two can use each other.

Original: Kam'lanaut:His strength is absolute. He will no doubt be a worthy comrade in battle.
Dialogue: His strength is absolute. He will no doubt be a worthy comrade in battle.

Original: Firion:But we can't trust him!
Dialogue: But we can't trust him!

Original: Kam'lanaut:Trust... Hmph. There is a chance he'll throw you away as easily as he did me.
Dialogue: Trust... Hmph. There is a chance he'll throw you away as easily as he did me.

Original: Kam'lanaut:But for a moment, see how the scales balance.
Dialogue: But for a moment, see how the scales balance.

Original: Kam'lanaut:A great power like Eald'narche's against fragile sentiments like trust...
Dialogue: A great power like Eald'narche's against fragile sentiments like trust...

Original: Kam'lanaut:Which will be more beneficial to you in the end?
Dialogue: Which will be more beneficial to you in the end?

Original: Firion:...Could it be he can't trust him, either?
Dialogue: ...Could it be he can't trust him, either?

Original: Sabin:Let's talk with the others, Mog.
Dialogue: Let's talk with the others, Mog.

Original: Mog:Right... We can't decide this on our own, kupo.
Dialogue: Right... We can't decide this on our own, kupo.

Original: Eald'narche:So you didn't throw my coordinates away. Perhaps you fools are worthy of being saved after all.
Dialogue: So you didn't throw my coordinates away. Perhaps you fools are worthy of being saved after all.

Original: Lion:We don't need your saving, thanks.
Dialogue: We don't need your saving, thanks.

Original: Eald'narche:No matter. I did not come here to discuss something so pedantic.
Dialogue: No matter. I did not come here to discuss something so pedantic.

Original: Eald'narche:I will be your ally. It will be to our mutual benefit.
Dialogue: I will be your ally. It will be to our mutual benefit.

Original: Quistis:What made you change your mind? I thought we were enemies.
Dialogue: What made you change your mind? I thought we were enemies.

Original: Eald'narche:Enemies...? I was merely cleaning up my brother's mess.
Dialogue: Enemies...? I was merely cleaning up my brother's mess.

Original: Eald'narche:One cannot create a fake Paradise. There was no need to make things worse than they were.
Dialogue: One cannot create a fake Paradise. There was no need to make things worse than they were.

Original: Eald'narche:As a result, we became enemies. That's all there is to it.
Dialogue: As a result, we became enemies. That's all there is to it.

Original: Edge:You want us to believe you, even though you tried to destroy Lion's world!?
Dialogue: You want us to believe you, even though you tried to destroy Lion's world!?

Original: Eald'narche:Destroy? I was trying to make a paradise for the chosen. It's the same as the gods of this world.
Dialogue: Destroy? I was trying to make a paradise for the chosen. It's the same as the gods of this world.

Original: Lion:The same? How...?
Dialogue: The same? How...?

Original: Eald'narche:Then tell me: what's different? Not that I expect us to understand each other, but...
Dialogue: Then tell me what's different? Not that I expect us to understand each other, but...

Original: Eald'narche:Our goal is the same, isn't it?
Dialogue: Our goal is the same, isn't it?

Original: Quistis:Goal? What do you mean?
Dialogue: Goal? What do you mean?

Original: Eald'narche:By using the principles of this world, we may be able to return to our respective homes without the help of the gods.
Dialogue: By using the principles of this world, we may be able to return to our respective homes without the help of the gods.

Original: Kam'lanaut:(To fix the past, we must return to our world. I should have known Eald'narche would think that far ahead.)
Dialogue: (To fix the past, we must return to our world. I should have known Eald'narche would think that far ahead.)

Original: Eald'narche:To that end, it became necessary for me to see things through your eyes.
Dialogue: To that end, it became necessary for me to see things through your eyes.

Original: Eald'narche:Returning home is your goal, is it not?
Dialogue: Returning home is your goal, is it not?

Original: Eald'narche:So adding me to your ranks helps us both. Don't you agree?
Dialogue: So adding me to your ranks helps us both. Don't you agree?

Original: Lion:...Just because we have the same goal doesn't mean I'll work with you.
Dialogue: ...Just because we have the same goal doesn't mean I'll work with you.

Original: Eald'narche:How annoying... All I did was rid the world of its scum, and yet you say that!?
Dialogue: How annoying... All I did was rid the world of its scum, and yet you say that!?

Original: Eald'narche:As long as you have value to me, I won't harm you. You can share in the profits of others.
Dialogue: As long as you have value to me, I won't harm you. You can share in the profits of others.

Original: Eald'narche:To simplify for you fools: I will let you know once I figure out a way to return to our home worlds.
Dialogue: To simplify for you fools I will let you know once I figure out a way to return to our home worlds.

Original: Eald'narche:...You won't be won over, you say? How about you? Your heart seems to be wavering.
Dialogue: ...You won't be won over, you say? How about you? Your heart seems to be wavering.

Original: Edge:That's true, but...I won't be so easily drawn in by you!
Dialogue: That's true, but...I won't be so easily drawn in by you!

Original: Quistis:Exactly. There's too great a risk in making you our ally.
Dialogue: Exactly. There's too great a risk in making you our ally.

Original: Eald'narche:...Hmph. Very well then.
Dialogue: ...Hmph. Very well then.

Original: Eald'narche:Let me tell you something interesting. Something Kam'lanaut hasn't even heard...
Dialogue: Let me tell you something interesting. Something Kam'lanaut hasn't even heard...

Original: Eald'narche:There are some perculiar things occurring in this world.
Dialogue: There are some perculiar things occurring in this world.

Original: Eald'narche:Those who have died in our home worlds can be brought back here.
Dialogue: Those who have died in our home worlds can be brought back here.

Original: Eald'narche:The time you'd wish to return to varies before and after reclaiming your brilliance.
Dialogue: The time you'd wish to return to varies before and after reclaiming your brilliance.

Original: Eald'narche:Do you not think it strange? If we return to our original worlds, when do you think we will go back to?
Dialogue: Do you not think it strange? If we return to our original worlds, when do you think we will go back to?

Original: Chelinka:You don't mean...
Dialogue: You don't mean...

Original: Yuri:We might be able to return to whatever time we want?
Dialogue: We might be able to return to whatever time we want?

Original: Galuf:Is that possible!?
Dialogue: Is that possible!?

Original: Eald'narche:How perceptive of you. In this hypothesis, we can fix the mistakes of our past.
Dialogue: How perceptive of you. In this hypothesis, we can fix the mistakes of our past.

Original: Kam'lanaut:(I see... So one could both return home and start over.)
Dialogue: (I see... So one could both return home and start over.)

Original: Lion:I understand what you're thinking, but...we'll still stop you no matter how many times you try!
Dialogue: I understand what you're thinking, but...we'll still stop you no matter how many times you try!

Original: Yuri:Wait, Lion. I don't think that's it...
Dialogue: Wait, Lion. I don't think that's it...

Original: Yuri:If you go back home, you two might not have to fight. You'll return to different worlds.
Dialogue: If you go back home, you two might not have to fight. You'll return to different worlds.

Original: Eald'narche:...I see. I thought you knew something, but you speak from experience.
Dialogue: ...I see. I thought you knew something, but you speak from experience.

Original: Eald'narche:Thanks to which, I have confirmed my hypothesis.
Dialogue: Thanks to which, I have confirmed my hypothesis.

Original: Eald'narche:It is as he says. To put it in simpleton's terms: there will be parallel worlds.
Dialogue: It is as he says. To put it in simpleton's terms there will be parallel worlds.

Original: Eald'narche:You will each be given a fair chance to fix your past mistakes.
Dialogue: You will each be given a fair chance to fix your past mistakes.

Original: Eald'narche:What do you think?
Dialogue: What do you think?

Original: Chelinka:But if you go back to that world, will you still hurt lots of people?
Dialogue: But if you go back to that world, will you still hurt lots of people?

Original: Eald'narche:And if I do?
Dialogue: And if I do?

Original: Eald'narche:...I see. We could not be allies, then. Despite how much I've explained...
Dialogue: ...I see. We could not be allies, then. Despite how much I've explained...

Original: Lion:If you can read our minds, you understand. We don't need your power.
Dialogue: If you can read our minds, you understand. We don't need your power.

Original: Eald'narche:I know. But your understanding is pitifully shallow.
Dialogue: I know. But your understanding is pitifully shallow.

Original: Eald'narche:You've been so focused on me that you haven't noticed the benefits for yourselves.
Dialogue: You've been so focused on me that you haven't noticed the benefits for yourselves.

Original: Lion:There's nothing I want to fix in my past. No matter what it is, it's made me who I am today.
Dialogue: There's nothing I want to fix in my past. No matter what it is, it's made me who I am today.

Original: Eald'narche:I wasn't talking about you. Or have you forgotten since coming here?
Dialogue: I wasn't talking about you. Or have you forgotten since coming here?

Original: Eald'narche:If you do as I say, those who should have perished can still live.
Dialogue: If you do as I say, those who should have perished can still live.

Original: Ignis:...Do not underestimate us.
Dialogue: ...Do not underestimate us.

Original: Eald'narche:Ahaha! Those eyes!
Dialogue: Ahaha! Those eyes!

Original: Eald'narche:But what about the others? If they knew of the possibility...
Dialogue: But what about the others? If they knew of the possibility...

Original: Eald'narche:I welcome you at any time. We can work together for a better future.
Dialogue: I welcome you at any time. We can work together for a better future.

Original: Lion:If we can prevent some from dying, I want to save them, but...
Dialogue: If we can prevent some from dying, I want to save them, but...

Original: Ignis:No. It's as you said. Everything in our pasts has made us who we are.
Dialogue: No. It's as you said. Everything in our pasts has made us who we are.

Original: Lion:I thought about throwing away his coordinates, but...it wouldn't change anything.
Dialogue: I thought about throwing away his coordinates, but...it wouldn't change anything.

Original: Lion:And I can't just leave them here. Maybe I'll give them to Mog until my heart is ready...
Dialogue: And I can't just leave them here. Maybe I'll give them to Mog until my heart is ready...

Original: Yuri:I think you should do what you want. Don't think you have to shoulder this alone.
Dialogue: I think you should do what you want. Don't think you have to shoulder this alone.

Original: Chelinka:I understand a little of how Eald'narche feels... But if lots of sacrifices need to be made, I'll do whatever it takes to stop him.
Dialogue: I understand a little of how Eald'narche feels... But if lots of sacrifices need to be made, I'll do whatever it takes to stop him.

Original: Lion:Yeah... Thank you, everyone.
Dialogue: Yeah... Thank you, everyone.

Original: Kam'lanaut:Do you really intend to do things over?
Dialogue: Do you really intend to do things over?

Original: Eald'narche:Of course. And this time, everything will go according to plan.
Dialogue: Of course. And this time, everything will go according to plan.

Original: Eald'narche:You understand what you must do, don't you? Do not betray my expectations.
Dialogue: You understand what you must do, don't you? Do not betray my expectations.

Original: Kam'lanaut:So that we do not fail this time...?
Dialogue: So that we do not fail this time...?

Original: Eald'narche:What boring opponents.
Dialogue: What boring opponents.

Original: Yuna:Thank you...for helping us.
Dialogue: Thank you...for helping us.

Original: Eald'narche:Don't thank me if you don't mean it. Empty gestures disgust me.
Dialogue: Don't thank me if you don't mean it. Empty gestures disgust me.

Original: Eald'narche:Why thank me if you don't believe you can trust me? Or if you only think I helped you out of self-interest?
Dialogue: Why thank me if you don't believe you can trust me? Or if you only think I helped you out of self-interest?

Original: Yuna:I... Uh...
Edgar:Don't you think it's a little rude to be reading people's thoughts without telling them?
Dialogue: Don't you think it's a little rude to be reading people's thoughts without telling them?

Original: Eald'narche:And it's considered polite not to say what you mean? I have no interest in false friends.
Dialogue: And it's considered polite not to say what you mean? I have no interest in false friends.

Original: Edgar:Don't take it personally, Yuna. Some people are just...rough around the edges.
Dialogue: Don't take it personally, Yuna. Some people are just...rough around the edges.

Original: Lion:I know you like to try your best to put everyone at ease, but there's nothing to be done with Eald'narche.
Dialogue: I know you like to try your best to put everyone at ease, but there's nothing to be done with Eald'narche.

Original: Basch:He might've been the one to come to us, but that doesn't mean we have to trust each other.
Dialogue: He might've been the one to come to us, but that doesn't mean we have to trust each other.

Original: Yuna:I just wanted to make him feel welcomed.
Dialogue: I just wanted to make him feel welcomed.

Original: Yuna:But I could feel the way he looked down on us and just couldn't do it...
Dialogue: But I could feel the way he looked down on us and just couldn't do it...

Original: Yuna:I'm sure he was able to sense that feeling too.
Dialogue: I'm sure he was able to sense that feeling too.

Original: Lion:We'll have to be satisfied with the fact that he cooperated with us at all. It's not like Spiritus's warriors are clamoring to help us out.
Dialogue: We'll have to be satisfied with the fact that he cooperated with us at all. It's not like Spiritus's warriors are clamoring to help us out.

Original: Lion:Just imagine if it were Seymour instead. Would you still want to make him feel welcome?
Dialogue: Just imagine if it were Seymour instead. Would you still want to make him feel welcome?

Original: Yuna:Hmm... I see your point.
Dialogue: Hmm... I see your point.

Original: Edgar:He joined up with us because he's looking for a way back to his world. We don't need to expect anything else from him.
Dialogue: He joined up with us because he's looking for a way back to his world. We don't need to expect anything else from him.

Original: Edgar:He might have information we can use, and we might have information he can use. It's better than being enemies.
Dialogue: He might have information we can use, and we might have information he can use. It's better than being enemies.

Original: Basch:It certainly is... However, it doesn't seem he has much in common with Kam'lanaut.
Dialogue: It certainly is... However, it doesn't seem he has much in common with Kam'lanaut.

Original: Yuna:Even though they're brothers, or so they say. Judging by how they treat each other, you'd never guess.
Dialogue: Even though they're brothers, or so they say. Judging by how they treat each other, you'd never guess.

Original: Edgar:Take it from me: siblingseven twins have their differences as much as anyone else.
Dialogue: Take it from me siblings—even twins— have their differences as much as anyone else.

Original: Edgar:But even so, those two are different. There's not an ounce of brotherhood between them.
Dialogue: But even so, those two are different. There's not an ounce of brotherhood between them.

Original: Lion:Indeed. I have no doubt Eald'narche would do anything to achieve his goals. Even in this world.
Dialogue: Indeed. I have no doubt Eald'narche would do anything to achieve his goals. Even in this world.

Original: Basch:Kam'lanaut claimed to have trusted him, but I wonder what he believes now. Once broken, trust cannot easily be mended.
Dialogue: Kam'lanaut claimed to have trusted him, but I wonder what he believes now. Once broken, trust cannot easily be mended.

Original: Yuna:It must be frightening to even consider trusting someone who has betrayed you before.
Dialogue: It must be frightening to even consider trusting someone who has betrayed you before.

Original: Basch:And doubly so with someone who possesses such an uncanny ability. Even your slightest vulnerability can be laid bare.
Dialogue: And doubly so with someone who possesses such an uncanny ability. Even your slightest vulnerability can be laid bare.

Original: Lion:That's right. I can understand why Kam'lanaut would be worried.
Dialogue: That's right. I can understand why Kam'lanaut would be worried.

Original: Edgar:I can't imagine what it'd be like to have a sibling you couldn't trust...
Dialogue: I can't imagine what it'd be like to have a sibling you couldn't trust...

Original: Edgar:But then again, I'm not inclined toward evil acts. To them, trying to see eye to eye is probably more trouble than it's worth.
Dialogue: But then again, I'm not inclined toward evil acts. To them, trying to see eye to eye is probably more trouble than it's worth.

Original: Yuna:I suppose they're a special case... I guess I shouldn't let it get to me. I have you guys to worry about, after all!
Dialogue: I suppose they're a special case... I guess I shouldn't let it get to me. I have you guys to worry about, after all!

Original: Basch:Indeed. The stronger our bonds, the harder it will be for Eald'narche to find and exploit a weak link between us.
Dialogue: Indeed. The stronger our bonds, the harder it will be for Eald'narche to find and exploit a weak link between us.

Original: Lion:I agree, but I don't think we have much to worry about. If he tries something funny, he won't stand a chance against us!
Dialogue: I agree, but I don't think we have much to worry about. If he tries something funny, he won't stand a chance against us!

Original: Lion:As long as we trust each other, there's nothing we can't stand against.
Dialogue: As long as we trust each other, there's nothing we can't stand against.

Original: Warrior of Light:We've made contact with one of Spiritus's warriors. They've asked to join forces for the fights ahead.
Dialogue: We've made contact with one of Spiritus's warriors. They've asked to join forces for the fights ahead.

Original: Materia:You speak of Eald'narche.
Dialogue: You speak of Eald'narche.

Original: Onion Knight:So you know about him already. Good. We don't have to waste time explaining.
Dialogue: So you know about him already. Good. We don't have to waste time explaining.

Original: Onion Knight:Something was off. I think he's up to something.
Dialogue: Something was off. I think he's up to something.

Original: Onion Knight:He wants to know more about how this world works, and it seemed like he had it in mind to come visit you.
Dialogue: He wants to know more about how this world works, and it seemed like he had it in mind to come visit you.

Original: Warrior of Light:If his intention is nefarious, we will protect you.
Dialogue: If his intention is nefarious, we will protect you.

Original: Materia:Thank you, my warriors. Having you by my side sets my heart at ease. However...
Dialogue: Thank you, my warriors. Having you by my side sets my heart at ease. However...

Original: Materia:Lest you forget, I am a god. You needn't worry about me so much.
Dialogue: Lest you forget, I am a god. You needn't worry about me so much.

Original: Onion Knight:Don't forget what happenedlast time! I don't ever want to feel so powerless again.
Dialogue: Don't forget what happened last time! I don't ever want to feel so powerless again.

Original: Materia:You are too kind.
Dialogue: You are too kind.
