Dialogue: Yeah, me too.

Original: Gladio:Sorry to have kept you waiting.
Dialogue: Sorry to have kept you waiting.

Original: Noct:No worries. It's not like you had a choice.
Dialogue: No worries. It's not like you had a choice.

Original: Prompto:So what're we gonna do to celebrate?
Dialogue: So what're we gonna do to celebrate?

Original: Ignis:Don't be so hasty. As happy as this reunion is, we should introduce Gladio to our new allies first and foremost.
Dialogue: Don't be so hasty. As happy as this reunion is, we should introduce Gladio to our new allies first and foremost.

Original: Noct:Ignis is right. And since he volunteered, he can do the honors.
Dialogue: Ignis is right. And since he volunteered, he can do the honors.

Original: Prompto:Ah, delegating responsibility, the princely thing to do!
Dialogue: Ah, delegating responsibility, the princely thing to do!

Original: Noct:Shut up.
Dialogue: Shut up.

Original: Gladio:Alright, then, shall we?
Dialogue: Alright, then, shall we?

Original: Ignis:Gladio, do you...?
Dialogue: Gladio, do you...?

Original: Gladio:Have my memories? Yeah, and so do you, from what Materia told me.
Dialogue: Have my memories? Yeah, and so do you, from what Materia told me.

Original: Ignis:I see. And you look like us, too.
Dialogue: I see. And you look like us, too.

Original: Gladio:Yup. Could you imagine if I was the only one of us who was older?
Dialogue: Yup. Could you imagine if I was the only one of us who was older?

Original: Gladio:Anyways, Ignis... You know it's only a matter of time before Noct remembers too, right?
Dialogue: Anyways, Ignis... You know it's only a matter of time before Noct remembers too, right?

Original: Gladio:But I'm sure you don't need me to tell you that. I'm just saying we'd better be ready when he does.
Dialogue: But I'm sure you don't need me to tell you that. I'm just saying we'd better be ready when he does.

Original: Gladio:And we'd better be ready to protect him.
Dialogue: And we'd better be ready to protect him.

Original: Gladio:Because that's what we do, right?
Dialogue: Because that's what we do, right?

Original: Ignis:Indeed. "At all costs."
Dialogue: Indeed. "At all costs."

Original: Ignis:I meant those words when I said them, and I mean them now.
Dialogue: I meant those words when I said them, and I mean them now.

Original: Gladio:When you forget about all the monsters, this place definitely has its charms.
Dialogue: When you forget about all the monsters, this place definitely has its charms.

Original: Gladio:Really. Nothing beats eatin' with the boys. Right, Ignis?
Dialogue: Really. Nothing beats eatin' with the boys. Right, Ignis?

Original: Ignis:Noct might not see it, but I agree. There's something special about sharing a meal outdoors.
Dialogue: Noct might not see it, but I agree. There's something special about sharing a meal outdoors.

Original: Prompto:Special? Well, we've been eating outside plenty since we've gotten here, and I haven't felt anything special.
Dialogue: Special? Well, we've been eating outside plenty since we've gotten here, and I haven't felt anything special.

Original: Gladio:That's cause we don't have our camping equipment. If we did, then you'd see.
Dialogue: That's cause we don't have our camping equipment. If we did, then you'd see.

Original: Palom:How much camping equipment did you need in your world?
Dialogue: How much camping equipment did you need in your world?

Original: Gladio:Well, we had chairs, tables, tents, tools for cooking... And that's just for starters.
Dialogue: Well, we had chairs, tables, tents, tools for cooking... And that's just for starters.

Original: Palom:But who needs all that stuff?
Dialogue: But who needs all that stuff?

Original: Gladio:All that stuff is what makes it special. Sets it apart from the day to dayturns it into an adventure.
Dialogue: All that stuff is what makes it special. Sets it apart from the day to day—turns it into an adventure.

Original: Gladio:You go out and search for ingredients, then you cook those up with your gear.
Dialogue: You go out and search for ingredients, then you cook those up with your gear.

Original: Tidus:So you guys have tools that are made just for camping?
Dialogue: So you guys have tools that are made just for camping?

Original: Gladio:Yup, and I try to never leave home without 'em. Most are small enough to be folded up, but they do their jobs better than anything else.
Dialogue: Yup, and I try to never leave home without 'em. Most are small enough to be folded up, but they do their jobs better than anything else.

Original: Tidus:No way! I'd like to see some of those!
Dialogue: No way! I'd like to see some of those!

Original: Gladio:Now you're gettin' into it. Settin' everything up is the most exciting part.
Dialogue: Now you're gettin' into it. Settin' everything up is the most exciting part.

Original: Gladio:Doin' regular things in special waysthat's the spirit of camping. At least from my perspective.
Dialogue: Doin' regular things in special ways—that's the spirit of camping. At least from my perspective.

Original: Prompto:Gladio's always been the outdoorsy type.
Dialogue: Gladio's always been the outdoorsy type.

Original: Selphie:Oh, I know what you mean! It's like the excitement I feel when trying on new clothes or a new piece of equipment!
Dialogue: Oh, I know what you mean! It's like the excitement I feel when trying on new clothes or a new piece of equipment!

Original: Palom:So it's excitement you want? Leave that to me!
Dialogue: So it's excitement you want? Leave that to me!

Original: Tidus:Excitement? Not sure I'd call your "tricks" exciting.
Dialogue: Excitement? Not sure I'd call your "tricks" exciting.

Original: Gladio:You never know. Sometimes a trick can spice things up a little.
Dialogue: You never know. Sometimes a trick can spice things up a little.

Original: Palom:Hehe, they sure can!
Dialogue: Hehe, they sure can!

Original: Gladio:But let me give you some advice: if you wanna spice things up with the ladies, then tricks won't cut it.
Dialogue: But let me give you some advice if you wanna spice things up with the ladies, then tricks won't cut it.

Original: Gladio:Bring 'em flowers when they least expect it. Show up suddenly with a present they've been wanting. That's how you should catch them off guard.
Dialogue: Bring 'em flowers when they least expect it. Show up suddenly with a present they've been wanting. That's how you should catch them off guard.

Original: Selphie:Oooh! I like the sound of that!
Dialogue: Oooh! I like the sound of that!

Original: Gladio:Don't overdo it, though.
Dialogue: Don't overdo it, though.

Original: Palom:That doesn't seem very fun... I don't get it.
Dialogue: That doesn't seem very fun... I don't get it.

Original: Tidus:Oh man, I better write this down!
Dialogue: Oh man, I better write this down!

Original: Yuna:Ah, we're back at last.
Dialogue: Ah, we're back at last.

Original: Balthier:That was a harder fight than expected. The sun will soon be upon us.
Dialogue: That was a harder fight than expected. The sun will soon be upon us.

Original: Gladio:Hyah! Yeah!
Dialogue: Hyah! Yeah!

Original: Gladio:Oh, you guys are back. Good job finishing up the night patrol.
Dialogue: Oh, you guys are back. Good job finishing up the night patrol.

Original: Firion:Do you always train this early?
Dialogue: Do you always train this early?

Original: Gladio:Of course. What else would the King's shield do?
Dialogue: Of course. What else would the King's shield do?

Original: Squall:(Right, this guy's a bodyguard. Still...)
Dialogue: (Right, this guy's a bodyguard. Still...)

Original: Gladio:Can't argue with that. I bet it's pretty strange in this line of work.
Dialogue: Can't argue with that. I bet it's pretty strange in this line of work.

Original: Gladio:But I'm just the youngest in along lineof royal guards.My dadandNoctis's dadwere childhood friends.
Dialogue: But I'm just the youngest in a long line of royal guards. My dad and Noctis's dad were childhood friends.

Original: Gladio:Noctis and I grew up as close as brothers.
Dialogue: Noctis and I grew up as close as brothers.

Original: Yuna:I see. So you were put upon the same path as your father.
Dialogue: I see. So you were put upon the same path as your father.

Original: Kain:You take your responsibilities more seriously than you appear to.
Dialogue: You take your responsibilities more seriously than you appear to.

Original: Kain:Do you wish to become as your father did?
Dialogue: Do you wish to become as your father did?

Original: Gladio:Not really. I'll do things my own way.
Dialogue: Not really. I'll do things my own way.

Original: Balthier:As you should. A child should always be encouraged to walk a path of his own making.
Dialogue: As you should. A child should always be encouraged to walk a path of his own making.

Original: Balthier:A father's footsteps are not always suited to his offspring.
Dialogue: A father's footsteps are not always suited to his offspring.

Original: Gladio:Haha, good point! I could never be part of the council like him.
Dialogue: Haha, good point! I could never be part of the council like him.

Original: Squall:Maybe not, but I'm sure Ignis could.
Dialogue: Maybe not, but I'm sure Ignis could.

Original: Gladio:You're right on that count.
Dialogue: You're right on that count.

Original: Gladio:My father died without fulfilling his duty. In that respect, too, I don't want to be like him.
Dialogue: My father died without fulfilling his duty. In that respect, too, I don't want to be like him.

Original: Gladio:If I'm gonna protect Noct until he becomes king, I need to be stronger than anyone else out there.
Dialogue: If I'm gonna protect Noct until he becomes king, I need to be stronger than anyone else out there.

Original: Firion:That's why you train earlier and harder than anyone else.
Dialogue: That's why you train earlier and harder than anyone else.

Original: Gladio:You got it.
Dialogue: You got it.

Original: Firion:Then let me help you.
Dialogue: Then let me help you.

Original: Firion:I'll spar with you any day.
Dialogue: I'll spar with you any day.

Original: Gladio:Alright, you're on!
Dialogue: Alright, you're on!

Original: Galuf:Hmm. We must tread carefully here.
Dialogue: Hmm. We must tread carefully here.

Original: Selphie:At least there aren't any monsters around. Let's check over there!
Dialogue: At least there aren't any monsters around. Let's check over there!

Original: Gladio:Selphie, slow down. What if there's a trap ahead?
Dialogue: Selphie, slow down. What if there's a trap ahead?

Original: Selphie:It'll be fine!
Dialogue: It'll be fine!

Original: Gladio:Saying it doesn't make it so.
Dialogue: Saying it doesn't make it so.

Original: Selphie:Doesn't it? You worry too much, Gladio.
Dialogue: Doesn't it? You worry too much, Gladio.

Original: Gladio:That's not the point. You're being reckless.
Dialogue: That's not the point. You're being reckless.

Original: Selphie:Reckless? What're you, my big brother?
Dialogue: Reckless? What're you, my big brother?

Original: Lulu:You bicker like siblings, anyways.
Dialogue: You bicker like siblings, anyways.

Original: Edge:I get it. You can't help but worry. It's a trait you've acquired.
Dialogue: I get it. You can't help but worry. It's a trait you've acquired.

Original: Selphie:But I'm not your little sister, Gladio. You don't need to worry so much.
Dialogue: But I'm not your little sister, Gladio. You don't need to worry so much.

Original: Lightning:Don't be too hard on him. He can't help it.
Dialogue: Don't be too hard on him. He can't help it.

Original: Edge:You would know, Lightning. You worry a lot, too.
Dialogue: You would know, Lightning. You worry a lot, too.

Original: Lightning:Yeah, but it's different. I just don't want to see you guys get hurt or feel sad.
Dialogue: Yeah, but it's different. I just don't want to see you guys get hurt or feel sad.

Original: Lulu:Oh, the burdens of old age.
Dialogue: Oh, the burdens of old age.

Original: Galuf:I can't help but feel responsible for you younglings.
Dialogue: I can't help but feel responsible for you younglings.

Original: Gladio:Anyways, sorry about lumping you in with Noct and my sister.
Dialogue: Anyways, sorry about lumping you in with Noct and my sister.

Original: Selphie:No problem, all is forgiven.
Dialogue: No problem, all is forgiven.

Original: Galuf:You might use this chance to put yourself in each other's shoes.
Dialogue: You might use this chance to put yourself in each other's shoes.

Original: Galuf:You obviously care about her, or else you wouldn't worry. If Selphie gets that, maybe she'll be more careful.
Dialogue: You obviously care about her, or else you wouldn't worry. If Selphie gets that, maybe she'll be more careful.

Original: Galuf:But you also have to trust her to be able to hold her own.
Dialogue: But you also have to trust her to be able to hold her own.

Original: Galuf:No matter how fragile she looks, you do not know the struggles she's faced to get here. She is stronger than you know.
Dialogue: No matter how fragile she looks, you do not know the struggles she's faced to get here. She is stronger than you know.

Original: Lightning:Right. Just like Serah.
Dialogue: Right. Just like Serah.

Original: Lulu:It doesn't matter how close you are, you can't read your sibling's mind.
Dialogue: It doesn't matter how close you are, you can't read your sibling's mind.

Original: Lulu:But you can speak with each other. It would be a shame if you went your separate ways due to a mere misunderstanding.
Dialogue: But you can speak with each other. It would be a shame if you went your separate ways due to a mere misunderstanding.

Original: Gladio:I just don't want to see my friends in danger. Seeing Selphie in front makes me nervous.
Dialogue: I just don't want to see my friends in danger. Seeing Selphie in front makes me nervous.

Original: Selphie:There's a simple solution to that! You go in front, Gladio!
Dialogue: There's a simple solution to that! You go in front, Gladio!

Original: Selphie:But if we see any cool vehicles then I get to go first.
Dialogue: But if we see any cool vehicles then I get to go first.

Original: Gladio:Hmph. I really should stop trying.
Dialogue: Hmph. I really should stop trying.

Original: ???:She said it was "another world." But I still don't believe it.
Dialogue: She said it was "another world." But I still don't believe it.

Original: ???:That goddess was fishy, too... Even if I did believe her, this is nothing more than a fantasy.
Dialogue: That goddess was fishy, too... Even if I did believe her, this is nothing more than a fantasy.

Original: ???:I don't even wanna think about it.
Dialogue: I don't even wanna think about it.

Original: ???:We need to find a way back.
Dialogue: We need to find a way back.

Original: ???:And by any means necessary. But first, we need to find out where we've been taken to.
Dialogue: And by any means necessary. But first, we need to find out where we've been taken to.

Original: ???:What's that?
Dialogue: What's that?

Original: ???:Let's split up.
Dialogue: Let's split up.

Original: ???:I'll leave that one to you, then.
Dialogue: I'll leave that one to you, then.

Original: ???:Now where could this lead... I hope it's a way outta here.
Dialogue: Now where could this lead... I hope it's a way outta here.

Original: ???:Just as I thought. I have no idea where this is, but at least I got out of that weird place.
Dialogue: Just as I thought. I have no idea where this is, but at least I got out of that weird place.

Original: ???:Huh? A fight?
Dialogue: Huh? A fight?

Original: Lion:Careful! It's wounded and desperate!
Dialogue: Careful! It's wounded and desperate!

Original: Onion Knight:Let's keep a safe distance! There's no telling what it'll do!
Dialogue: Let's keep a safe distance! There's no telling what it'll do!

Original: ???:Are those the warriors summoned by the goddess?
Dialogue: Are those the warriors summoned by the goddess?

Original: Lion:Oh no! There's someone over there!
Dialogue: Oh no! There's someone over there!

Original: Cecil:Run! It's dangerous!
Dialogue: Run! It's dangerous!

Original: ???:What a drag. This wasn't in the job description.
Dialogue: What a drag. This wasn't in the job description.

Original: Onion Knight:That speed... He's no ordinary guy.
Dialogue: That speed... He's no ordinary guy.

Original: Lion:Who are you...?
Dialogue: Who are you...?

Original: ???:Just passing through. In any case...
Dialogue: Just passing through. In any case...

Original: ???:I'm the least of your worries right now.
Dialogue: I'm the least of your worries right now.

Original: Cecil:...It appears you're right. We haven't the leisure of talking now.
Dialogue: ...It appears you're right. We haven't the leisure of talking now.

Original: Onion Knight:Just wait right there! We have something we want to ask you!
Dialogue: Just wait right there! We have something we want to ask you!

Original: ???:Sure thing.
Dialogue: Sure thing.

Original: Onion Knight:Don't go anywhere!
Dialogue: Don't go anywhere!

Original: ???:Sorry, but...this is above my pay grade.
Dialogue: Sorry, but...this is above my pay grade.

Original: Cater:Hey, you! Wait right there!
Dialogue: Hey, you! Wait right there!

Original: Reno:Already finished with that monster, huh... That was fast.
Dialogue: Already finished with that monster, huh... That was fast.

Original: Vanille:We asked you to wait. Why did you leave?
Dialogue: We asked you to wait. Why did you leave?

Original: Wakka:This area is dangerous. You could get ambushed walking around all alone.
Dialogue: This area is dangerous. You could get ambushed walking around all alone.

Original: Reno:I don't work with others unless it's a joint op.
Dialogue: I don't work with others unless it's a joint op.

Original: Cater:Work? A joint op? What are you talking about?
Dialogue: Work? A joint op? What are you talking about?

Original: Reno:It's top secret until I know I can trust you guys.
Dialogue: It's top secret until I know I can trust you guys.

Original: Wakka:That doesn't answer our question...does it?
Dialogue: That doesn't answer our question...does it?

Original: Vanille:We understand if you can't trust us yet.
Dialogue: We understand if you can't trust us yet.

Original: Vanille:But some of your friends might be with us. Why don't you come along?
Dialogue: But some of your friends might be with us. Why don't you come along?

Original: Reno:I'll pass. I know my partner is here already. And I can handle myself no matter what happens.
Dialogue: I'll pass. I know my partner is here already. And I can handle myself no matter what happens.

Original: Wakka:Would it kill you to be a little more friendly...?
Dialogue: Would it kill you to be a little more friendly...?

Original: Cloud:What's going on here?
Dialogue: What's going on here?

Original: Cloud:Reno!
Dialogue: Reno!

Original: Vanille:Is he your friend, Cloud? He wouldn't answer any of our questions.
Dialogue: Is he your friend, Cloud? He wouldn't answer any of our questions.

Original: Wakka:Enemy!? You mean he...!
Dialogue: Enemy!? You mean he...!

Original: Cloud:It depends on his mission.
Dialogue: It depends on his mission.

Original: Reno:You can rest easy. I don't have any business with you...for now.
Dialogue: You can rest easy. I don't have any business with you...for now.

Original: Reno:(So he's one of the goddess's warriors. The chance of getting dragged into trouble with him around is too high.)
Dialogue: (So he's one of the goddess's warriors. The chance of getting dragged into trouble with him around is too high.)

Original: Reno:(I need to regroup with Rude...)
Dialogue: (I need to regroup with Rude...)

Original: Reno:It's nice to see a familiar face, but I still have my doubts.
Dialogue: It's nice to see a familiar face, but I still have my doubts.

Original: Reno:And I'd rather not get into a fight in some other world. See you around.
Dialogue: And I'd rather not get into a fight in some other world. See you around.

Original: Cater:Hold up!
Dialogue: Hold up!

Original: Cater:He's so suspicious. Maybe we should keep an eye on him if he's an enemy agent.
Dialogue: He's so suspicious. Maybe we should keep an eye on him if he's an enemy agent.

Original: Wakka:He mentioned a partner, so I guess it means he's not alone.
Dialogue: He mentioned a partner, so I guess it means he's not alone.

Original: Cloud:...Right. And I can't imagine those two acting blindly.
Dialogue: ...Right. And I can't imagine those two acting blindly.

Original: Cloud:Sorry, Reno, but you're coming with us. It's for your own good.
Dialogue: Sorry, Reno, but you're coming with us. It's for your own good.

Original: Reno:That's fine with me.
Dialogue: That's fine with me.

Original: Vanille:What should we do, then?
Dialogue: What should we do, then?

Original: Cloud:Those agents are a violent lot. But since he was summoned by Materia, he could help us fight.
Dialogue: Those agents are a violent lot. But since he was summoned by Materia, he could help us fight.

Original: Reno:(Well, this'll make a fine stepping stone. Don't mind if I poke around.)
Dialogue: (Well, this'll make a fine stepping stone. Don't mind if I poke around.)

Original: Reno:A goddess and her warriors, with Cloud among them...
Dialogue: A goddess and her warriors, with Cloud among them...

Original: Reno:Huh? What was that sound?
Dialogue: Huh? What was that sound?

Original: Lulu:Did no one tell him that it's dangerous to go out alone?
Dialogue: Did no one tell him that it's dangerous to go out alone?

Original: Layle:He probably just stepped out for some air.
Dialogue: He probably just stepped out for some air.

Original: Edge:He seems pretty confident in his abilities. He should be fine as long as he hasn't strayed too far.
Dialogue: He seems pretty confident in his abilities. He should be fine as long as he hasn't strayed too far.

Original: Zack:Still, I can't help but worry. I'll help you find him. What did he look like again?
Dialogue: Still, I can't help but worry. I'll help you find him. What did he look like again?

Original: Reno:Leave me alone, will you!?
Dialogue: Leave me alone, will you!?

Original: Zack:Hey, I recognize that guy.
Dialogue: Hey, I recognize that guy.

Original: Layle:And he's brought company. Like we needed more trouble around here...
Dialogue: And he's brought company. Like we needed more trouble around here...

Original: Edge:No point in complaining now! We've got some saving to do!
Dialogue: No point in complaining now! We've got some saving to do!

Original: Reno:I appreciate it!
Dialogue: I appreciate it!

Original: Zack:I'll help, too! Uh...Reno!
Dialogue: I'll help, too! Uh...Reno!

Original: Reno:...Maybe this is a dream after all.
Dialogue: ...Maybe this is a dream after all.

Original: Lulu:There are still lots of unknowns here. It's dangerous for a newcomer like you to wander around.
Dialogue: There are still lots of unknowns here. It's dangerous for a newcomer like you to wander around.

Original: Layle:You don't strike me as the type who can wait patiently, though.
Dialogue: You don't strike me as the type who can wait patiently, though.

Original: Reno:This was my bad. I'll be more careful from now on.
Dialogue: This was my bad. I'll be more careful from now on.

Original: Edge:Well, looks like he's learned his lesson. Let's head back!
Dialogue: Well, looks like he's learned his lesson. Let's head back!

Original: Reno:Hey, Zack... Sorry for the trouble.
Dialogue: Hey, Zack... Sorry for the trouble.

Original: Zack:No worries! We're all in the same boat here.
Dialogue: No worries! We're all in the same boat here.

Original: Reno:Are you okay? I mean, your body and...
Dialogue: Are you okay? I mean, your body and...

Original: Zack:Worried about me? You were the one getting the runaround by a monster just now.
Dialogue: Worried about me? You were the one getting the runaround by a monster just now.

Original: Zack:I bet the Turks would've laughed themselves silly if they heard...but they won't.
Dialogue: I bet the Turks would've laughed themselves silly if they heard...but they won't.

Original: Zack:...It's okay, though. I know about everything.
Dialogue: ...It's okay, though. I know about everything.

Original: Zack:I appreciate the concern, but I've got all my thoughts in order.
Dialogue: I appreciate the concern, but I've got all my thoughts in order.

Original: Zack:I want to do what I can here and I'd be happy to have your help, Reno.
Dialogue: I want to do what I can here and I'd be happy to have your help, Reno.

Original: Reno:...That's fine with me.
Dialogue: ...That's fine with me.

Original: Zack:Woohoo! That means the Turks will be helping out.
Dialogue: Woohoo! That means the Turks will be helping out.

Original: Zack:Let's talk over dinner! I can't wait!
Dialogue: Let's talk over dinner! I can't wait!

Original: Reno:So this really is a different world...
Dialogue: So this really is a different world...

Original: Reno:I can't believe the guy we looked high and low for is alive and well here.
Dialogue: I can't believe the guy we looked high and low for is alive and well here.

Original: Reno:So if this place is really real, then could I atone for the past?
Dialogue: So if this place is really real, then could I atone for the past?

Original: Reno:In any case, it looks like I've gotta face the truth.
Dialogue: In any case, it looks like I've gotta face the truth.

Original: Reno:Alright, looks like we're done for the day. Feels nice to have solid earth under our feet.
Dialogue: Alright, looks like we're done for the day. Feels nice to have solid earth under our feet.

Original: Snow:Tell me about it. You can only see so much from up in the sky.
Dialogue: Tell me about it. You can only see so much from up in the sky.

Original: Snow:I prefer to do my investigating up close.
Dialogue: I prefer to do my investigating up close.

Original: Gau:Gau thinks so too! Gau no like sky!
Dialogue: Gau thinks so too! Gau no like sky!

Original: Snow:You really are a man after my own heart, Gau.
Dialogue: You really are a man after my own heart, Gau.

Original: Reno:It's honest work, if anything.
Dialogue: It's honest work, if anything.

Original: Reno:I miss all the perks of Shinra technology sometimes, though.
Dialogue: I miss all the perks of Shinra technology sometimes, though.

Original: Reno:Hey, you got something to say, Rude?
Dialogue: Hey, you got something to say, Rude?

Original: Reno:We did the rounds and cleaned up the monsters. The way I see it, you have no right to complain.
Dialogue: We did the rounds and cleaned up the monsters. The way I see it, you have no right to complain.

Original: Rude:Sounds like you had a rough go. Our patrol was cake.
Dialogue: Sounds like you had a rough go. Our patrol was cake.

Original: Tidus:Sure was! Cute, cuddly animals everywhere!
Dialogue: Sure was! Cute, cuddly animals everywhere!

Original: Rinoa:We even had our share of fruits and nuts. I haven't eaten anything that good in a long time!
Dialogue: We even had our share of fruits and nuts. I haven't eaten anything that good in a long time!

Original: Tidus:Yeah, Rude picked the fruit from the tallest trees for us!
Dialogue: Yeah, Rude picked the fruit from the tallest trees for us!

Original: Reno:You guys are making me jealous.
Dialogue: You guys are making me jealous.

Original: Gau:Gau want fruit! Gau want nuts!
Dialogue: Gau want fruit! Gau want nuts!

Original: Snow:I'll grab some for you later. You want some too, Reno?
Dialogue: I'll grab some for you later. You want some too, Reno?

Original: Rinoa:Hehe, actually...
Dialogue: Hehe, actually...

Original: Tidus:Ta da! We brought some for everyone! Let's head back so we can feast!
Dialogue: Ta da! We brought some for everyone! Let's head back so we can feast!

Original: Gau:Gaaau! Gau hungry! Gau hungry!
Dialogue: Gaaau! Gau hungry! Gau hungry!

Original: Snow:Nice, let's go. I could use a pick-me-up.
Dialogue: Nice, let's go. I could use a pick-me-up.

Original: Reno:You aren't settling down here, are you?
Dialogue: You aren't settling down here, are you?

Original: Rude:Ask yourself that question.
Dialogue: Ask yourself that question.

Original: Rude:Anyways, I don't think I've seen these animals and plants before.
Dialogue: Anyways, I don't think I've seen these animals and plants before.

Original: Reno:Me neither. It's all new to me. Their powers are a mystery as well.
Dialogue: Me neither. It's all new to me. Their powers are a mystery as well.

Original: Rude:We also have Aerith, Zack, and Sephiroth walking around.
Dialogue: We also have Aerith, Zack, and Sephiroth walking around.

Original: Reno:Well, it's a different world, so I guess we can't be too surprised. Can't contact the rest of the crew, either.
Dialogue: Well, it's a different world, so I guess we can't be too surprised. Can't contact the rest of the crew, either.

Original: Reno:From this point on we're practically civilians.
Dialogue: From this point on we're practically civilians.

Original: Rude:Don't make me laugh.
Dialogue: Don't make me laugh.

Original: Rude:Even so, those guys are doing all they can to protect their world by fighting in this one.
Dialogue: Even so, those guys are doing all they can to protect their world by fighting in this one.

Original: Reno:Seems like a lot of trouble with no end in sight, but they're trying their best.
Dialogue: Seems like a lot of trouble with no end in sight, but they're trying their best.

Original: Reno:Gotta admire them somewhat. I don't see any harm in sticking with them for a bit.
Dialogue: Gotta admire them somewhat. I don't see any harm in sticking with them for a bit.

Original: Reno:Another hard day's work squared away. Let's grab a bite to eat, huh?
Dialogue: Another hard day's work squared away. Let's grab a bite to eat, huh?

Original: Reno:It's on me! ...Or well, that's what I would say, if we were back home. Doesn't really work here, does it?
Dialogue: It's on me! ...Or well, that's what I would say, if we were back home. Doesn't really work here, does it?

Original: Gilgamesh:Hah hah hah! My disappointment is immeasurable! There's nothing I like more than a free meal!
Dialogue: Hah hah hah! My disappointment is immeasurable! There's nothing I like more than a free meal!

Original: Reno:I used to go out with my buddies all the time. It's my duty to make newcomers feel welcome.
Dialogue: I used to go out with my buddies all the time. It's my duty to make newcomers feel welcome.

Original: Squall:(Newcomers? Is he talking about us?)
Dialogue: (Newcomers? Is he talking about us?)

Original: Eight:You sure like looking after others.
Dialogue: You sure like looking after others.

Original: Kain:I wonder. Is it all an act? Perhaps we should ask Rude.
Dialogue: I wonder. Is it all an act? Perhaps we should ask Rude.

Original: Reno:Go ahead. You think I'd lie to you?
Dialogue: Go ahead. You think I'd lie to you?

Original: Eight:Seeing you like this, I can't help but wonder.
Dialogue: Seeing you like this, I can't help but wonder.

Original: Eight:Why were you guys fighting against Cloud and the others?
Dialogue: Why were you guys fighting against Cloud and the others?

Original: Eight:It doesn't seem like you guys have anything against each other now.
Dialogue: It doesn't seem like you guys have anything against each other now.

Original: Squall:What happened in your world?
Dialogue: What happened in your world?

Original: Reno:What happened? Nothing. We were just doing our job.
Dialogue: What happened? Nothing. We were just doing our job.

Original: Reno:The Turks follow orders, that's all. Sometimes those orders involve kidnapping and roughing people up.
Dialogue: The Turks follow orders, that's all. Sometimes those orders involve kidnapping and roughing people up.

Original: Reno:Sometimes we were on opposite sides, sometimes we weren't. That's just the way things go.
Dialogue: Sometimes we were on opposite sides, sometimes we weren't. That's just the way things go.

Original: Eight:I see. I guess in times of conflict, allegiances can be fluid, depending on who is giving the orders.
Dialogue: I see. I guess in times of conflict, allegiances can be fluid, depending on who is giving the orders.

Original: Eight:All because of orders.
Dialogue: All because of orders.

Original: Desch:But, if you knew another would come to harm because of your orders, you would still follow them?
Dialogue: But, if you knew another would come to harm because of your orders, you would still follow them?

Original: Kain:There are people who will. If there wasn't, then organizations would collapse.
Dialogue: There are people who will. If there wasn't, then organizations would collapse.

Original: Kain:But there are also people who will turn their back on orders, and choose a different life.
Dialogue: But there are also people who will turn their back on orders, and choose a different life.

Original: Gilgamesh:Hah hah hah! Indeed, indeed!
Dialogue: Hah hah hah! Indeed, indeed!

Original: Reno:Work is work, it isn't always fun. And you can't only choose the fun parts.
Dialogue: Work is work, it isn't always fun. And you can't only choose the fun parts.

Original: Desch:I see. I suppose that makes sense.
Dialogue: I see. I suppose that makes sense.

Original: Reno:I'm glad I ended up here, though. It sucks to be separated from your partner.
Dialogue: I'm glad I ended up here, though. It sucks to be separated from your partner.

Original: Desch:Indeed. Being among friends is a precious experience.
Dialogue: Indeed. Being among friends is a precious experience.

Original: Reno:I understand why some people might view the work we did with skepticism. But we were fighting against something terrifying.
Dialogue: I understand why some people might view the work we did with skepticism. But we were fighting against something terrifying.

Original: Reno:Cloud and his friends simply got in our way. They were on the other side of things.
Dialogue: Cloud and his friends simply got in our way. They were on the other side of things.

Original: Reno:We didn't fight them out of any sense of malice.
Dialogue: We didn't fight them out of any sense of malice.

Original: Squall:(Maybe, but I bet both sides think they're the good guys.)
Dialogue: (Maybe, but I bet both sides think they're the good guys.)

Original: Reno:Anyways, there's no reason for us to fight anymore. It's all water under the bridge.
Dialogue: Anyways, there's no reason for us to fight anymore. It's all water under the bridge.

Original: Desch:Good. I wouldn't want an enemy like you.
Dialogue: Good. I wouldn't want an enemy like you.

Original: Kain:Indeed. But it may be best to keep one eye on him just in case.
Dialogue: Indeed. But it may be best to keep one eye on him just in case.

Original: Eight:Yeah, in case his boss shows up.
Dialogue: Yeah, in case his boss shows up.

Original: Reno:Hah. Whatever floats your boat.
Dialogue: Hah. Whatever floats your boat.

Original: ???:IfTsengfinds out...
Dialogue: If Tseng finds out...

Original: Reno:I don't even wanna think about it.
Dialogue: I don't even wanna think about it.

Original: ???:We need to find a way back.
Dialogue: We need to find a way back.

Original: Reno:And by any means necessary. But first, we need to find out where we've been taken to.
Dialogue: And by any means necessary. But first, we need to find out where we've been taken to.

Original: Reno:What's that?
Dialogue: What's that?

Original: ???:Let's split up.
Dialogue: Let's split up.

Original: Tifa:Everything seems fine around here.
Dialogue: Everything seems fine around here.

Original: Aerith:Well, since we came all this way, why not stay and play a bit?
Dialogue: Well, since we came all this way, why not stay and play a bit?

Original: Prompto:Great idea! I love the sea!
Dialogue: Great idea! I love the sea!

Original: Firion:This is no time to let our guard down. Who knows what's lurking around here?
Dialogue: This is no time to let our guard down. Who knows what's lurking around here?

Original: ???:What a walk...
Dialogue: What a walk...

Original: Tifa:Rude!?
Dialogue: Rude!?

Original: Rude:Tifa? ...Aerith!?
Dialogue: Tifa? ...Aerith!?

Original: Prompto:He looks pretty tough! You guys know each other?
Dialogue: He looks pretty tough! You guys know each other?

Original: Aerith:I guess you could say that...
Dialogue: I guess you could say that...

Original: Rude:What are you doing here? What's going on?
Dialogue: What are you doing here? What's going on?

Original: Firion:He seems confused. Since he's been summoned like us, we should explain the situation.
Dialogue: He seems confused. Since he's been summoned like us, we should explain the situation.

Original: Aerith:Right... I never thought his passion for work would extend this far.
Dialogue: Right... I never thought his passion for work would extend this far.

Original: Rude:...I work hard when I'm on the job.
Dialogue: ...I work hard when I'm on the job.

Original: Prompto:Is he like your bodyguard? He looks like VIP security.
Dialogue: Is he like your bodyguard? He looks like VIP security.

Original: Tifa:Good guess, but...not quite.
Dialogue: Good guess, but...not quite.

Original: Rude:Another unexpected turn... I suppose it's time to roll with the punches.
Dialogue: Another unexpected turn... I suppose it's time to roll with the punches.

Original: Firion:What's the meaning of this!?
Dialogue: What's the meaning of this!?

Original: Prompto:Is he not your friend?
Dialogue: Is he not your friend?

Original: Tifa:No. He's part of a group that tried to kidnap Aerith.
Dialogue: No. He's part of a group that tried to kidnap Aerith.

Original: Rude:That was our job.
Dialogue: That was our job.

Original: Aerith:Please, give up already. You didn't need to follow me all the way here.
Dialogue: Please, give up already. You didn't need to follow me all the way here.

Original: Rude:I may not know anything about this place, but I can still fulfill that old mission.
Dialogue: I may not know anything about this place, but I can still fulfill that old mission.

Original: Rude:I lost...
Dialogue: I lost...

Original: Vincent:Did you pull your punches?
Dialogue: Did you pull your punches?

Original: Aerith:Maybe you're just shaken from being in an unknown world. I can understand that.
Dialogue: Maybe you're just shaken from being in an unknown world. I can understand that.

Original: Rude:So you've just accepted the fact that you're in a different world?
Dialogue: So you've just accepted the fact that you're in a different world?

Original: Vincent:This place doesn't really give you a choice, no matter how hard you deny it.
Dialogue: This place doesn't really give you a choice, no matter how hard you deny it.

Original: Zidane:And we won't go easy on you if you keep chasing after Aerith!
Dialogue: And we won't go easy on you if you keep chasing after Aerith!

Original: Rude:...Relax. All that's in the past.
Dialogue: ...Relax. All that's in the past.

Original: Aerith:I thought as much when you called it your "old" mission.
Dialogue: I thought as much when you called it your "old" mission.

Original: Aerith:So now what? Am I free?
Dialogue: So now what? Am I free?

Original: Rude:...I can't say.
Dialogue: ...I can't say.

Original: Zidane:Well that doesn't inspire much confidence. You mean that your stance might change depending on your mission?
Dialogue: Well that doesn't inspire much confidence. You mean that your stance might change depending on your mission?

Original: Vincent:That's what life's like for a Turk. Orders are absolute.
Dialogue: That's what life's like for a Turk. Orders are absolute.

Original: Vincent:...Which is why he can't give a straight answer.
Dialogue: ...Which is why he can't give a straight answer.

Original: Vincent:But as long as his boss isn't around to give orders, I don't think he'll be a problem.
Dialogue: But as long as his boss isn't around to give orders, I don't think he'll be a problem.

Original: Terra:That puts me at ease.
Dialogue: That puts me at ease.

Original: Aerith:In that case, then...
Dialogue: In that case, then...

Original: Aerith:Do you want to come with us?
Dialogue: Do you want to come with us?

Original: Zidane:Wh-what!? Are you serious?
Dialogue: Wh-what!? Are you serious?

Original: Terra:Wasn't he your enemy at one point?
Dialogue: Wasn't he your enemy at one point?

Original: Aerith:Even still, I know him. And I wouldn't be able to rest knowing we left him here alone.
Dialogue: Even still, I know him. And I wouldn't be able to rest knowing we left him here alone.

Original: Aerith:It'll be okay...I think.
Dialogue: It'll be okay...I think.

Original: Rude:...This feels like a dream.
Dialogue: ...This feels like a dream.

Original: Aerith:You still don't believe us? I'm sorry, but it's true: you're in another world.
Dialogue: You still don't believe us? I'm sorry, but it's true you're in another world.

Original: Rude:Maybe this is how we can atone...for Tseng, too...
Dialogue: Maybe this is how we can atone...for Tseng, too...

Original: Zidane:Did you say something?
Dialogue: Did you say something?

Original: Rude:No... I'll take you up on that offer, Aerith.
Dialogue: No... I'll take you up on that offer, Aerith.

Original: Zell:Alright, that should do it for today! We finished exploring the designated area.
Dialogue: Alright, that should do it for today! We finished exploring the designated area.

Original: Barret:What're you sayin'? We still got plenty of time!
Dialogue: What're you sayin'? We still got plenty of time!

Original: Fang:We can check out the rest tomorrow, right? Let's head back and get something to eat.
Dialogue: We can check out the rest tomorrow, right? Let's head back and get something to eat.

Original: Garnet:It looks like we're divided... What do you think, Rude?
Dialogue: It looks like we're divided... What do you think, Rude?

Original: Rude:...I don't work overtime.
Dialogue: ...I don't work overtime.

Original: Zell:That's what I'm saying!
Dialogue: That's what I'm saying!

Original: Barret:Hey! C'mon now! Don't walk away from me!
Dialogue: Hey! C'mon now! Don't walk away from me!

Original: Barret:If we'd gone a little further, we might've found somethin' back there.
Dialogue: If we'd gone a little further, we might've found somethin' back there.

Original: Barret:Plus, whatever we explore today, we don't gotta do tomorrow!
Dialogue: Plus, whatever we explore today, we don't gotta do tomorrow!

Original: Fang:What are you getting all fired up at Rude about? Zell's the one who said to go back.
Dialogue: What are you getting all fired up at Rude about? Zell's the one who said to go back.

Original: Barret:I haven't accepted you as one of our own yet, and here you are lookin' all smug like some kind of leader!
Dialogue: I haven't accepted you as one of our own yet, and here you are lookin' all smug like some kind of leader!

Original: Rude:...Scouting is part of my job, but it's not my whole life.
Dialogue: ...Scouting is part of my job, but it's not my whole life.

Original: Rude:Sacrificing everything for your job doesn't make you a pro.
Dialogue: Sacrificing everything for your job doesn't make you a pro.

Original: Rude:That's what Reno says, at least. But I agree.
Dialogue: That's what Reno says, at least. But I agree.

Original: Zell:You mean being able to switch modes is important.
Dialogue: You mean being able to switch modes is important.

Original: Rude:Pacing is important. There's no point in tiring yourself out.
Dialogue: Pacing is important. There's no point in tiring yourself out.

Original: Barret:I guess you got a point there.
Dialogue: I guess you got a point there.

Original: Barret:You've been actin' weird since we got here, so I had my doubts. My bad.
Dialogue: You've been actin' weird since we got here, so I had my doubts. My bad.

Original: Fang:Don't get quiet on us all of a sudden. It looks like you've got something on your mind.
Dialogue: Don't get quiet on us all of a sudden. It looks like you've got something on your mind.

Original: Garnet:If it's no trouble, why don't you talk to us about it?
Dialogue: If it's no trouble, why don't you talk to us about it?

Original: Rude:...I never thought I'd actually believe the goddess's story when I first came here.
Dialogue: ...I never thought I'd actually believe the goddess's story when I first came here.

Original: Rude:But then I met you guys and unbelievable things happened...
Dialogue: But then I met you guys and unbelievable things happened...

Original: Rude:So I had to acknowledge that this was some unknown world.
Dialogue: So I had to acknowledge that this was some unknown world.

Original: Rude:Being unnerved by that means I've failed as a pro.
Dialogue: Being unnerved by that means I've failed as a pro.

Original: Fang:Haha! So you can't tell whether you're on or off these days. Is that why you've been acting weird?
Dialogue: Haha! So you can't tell whether you're on or off these days. Is that why you've been acting weird?

Original: Garnet:I'm sorry to hear that... If there's anything we can help with, just let us know.
Dialogue: I'm sorry to hear that... If there's anything we can help with, just let us know.

Original: Rude:No, I've got my thoughts in order. I can handle anything when I'm on the job.
Dialogue: No, I've got my thoughts in order. I can handle anything when I'm on the job.

Original: Barret:I need to be sure: when you say "on the job," do you mean when we're fightin' together?
Dialogue: I need to be sure when you say "on the job," do you mean when we're fightin' together?

Original: Rude:For now, yes.
Dialogue: For now, yes.

Original: Rude:You'll need my help getting back home, too. I'll give you that as a bonus.
Dialogue: You'll need my help getting back home, too. I'll give you that as a bonus.

Original: Barret:Tch. Stop sayin' it like you're better than us!
Dialogue: Tch. Stop sayin' it like you're better than us!

Original: Rude:Sorry to keep you waiting.
Dialogue: Sorry to keep you waiting.

Original: Reno:Ah, no worries. What's got you so sweaty?
Dialogue: Ah, no worries. What's got you so sweaty?

Original: Rude:Sweaty? It's nothing.
Dialogue: Sweaty? It's nothing.

Original: Reno:Fine. If you don't wanna talk, suit yourself.
Dialogue: Fine. If you don't wanna talk, suit yourself.

Original: Quistis:Have you guys been here the whole time?
Dialogue: Have you guys been here the whole time?

Original: Reno:We just got here. You guys look pretty beat. Did you come here without healing up first?
Dialogue: We just got here. You guys look pretty beat. Did you come here without healing up first?

Original: Tifa:We caught sight of a mysterious shadow while we were fighting. We followed it here, but...
Dialogue: We caught sight of a mysterious shadow while we were fighting. We followed it here, but...

Original: Sabin:It should be around here somewhere. You guys haven't seen anything?
Dialogue: It should be around here somewhere. You guys haven't seen anything?

Original: Reno:Nothing. What'd it look like?
Dialogue: Nothing. What'd it look like?

Original: Tifa:It's a bit tough to describe since we didn't get a good look. It was big...and black as the night.
Dialogue: It's a bit tough to describe since we didn't get a good look. It was big...and black as the night.

Original: Rude:You sure it wasn't a monster?
Dialogue: You sure it wasn't a monster?

Original: Quistis:Not judging by the sounds of its footfalls. It moved like a human.
Dialogue: Not judging by the sounds of its footfalls. It moved like a human.

Original: Rude:That doesn't really mean much around here.
Dialogue: That doesn't really mean much around here.

Original: Sabin:Well, we found a dead monster while we were following it. You think they'd fight each other?
Dialogue: Well, we found a dead monster while we were following it. You think they'd fight each other?

Original: Quistis:I doubt it. I've never seen that before.
Dialogue: I doubt it. I've never seen that before.

Original: Rude:Y-yes. Good work on the investigation.
Dialogue: Y-yes. Good work on the investigation.

Original: Reno:It sounds like this shadow saved you a pain in the butt. You might even say it helped you.
Dialogue: It sounds like this shadow saved you a pain in the butt. You might even say it helped you.

Original: Tifa:We might...but still, it gives me the creeps.
Dialogue: We might...but still, it gives me the creeps.

Original: Quistis:Me too. It feels like someone is watching us. And not in a good way.
Dialogue: Me too. It feels like someone is watching us. And not in a good way.

Original: Sabin:That settles it, then! Next time we see that freak, I'm not gonna stop until I catch it. We can't have you guys feeling uncomfortable.
Dialogue: That settles it, then! Next time we see that freak, I'm not gonna stop until I catch it. We can't have you guys feeling uncomfortable.

Original: Quistis:Thank you. Then we can question it, and make it understand how rude it's been. Feel free to use your fists, Sabin.
Dialogue: Thank you. Then we can question it, and make it understand how rude it's been. Feel free to use your fists, Sabin.

Original: Reno:Yeah, I'll help you beat some sense into it too!
Dialogue: Yeah, I'll help you beat some sense into it too!

Original: Tifa:Thanks, Reno! I'll give it a few love taps of my own!
Dialogue: Thanks, Reno! I'll give it a few love taps of my own!

Original: Tifa:Are you gonna join in, Rude?
Dialogue: Are you gonna join in, Rude?

Original: Rude:I, uh... Of course.
Dialogue: I, uh... Of course.

Original: Quistis:Well then, we should return to rest up.
Dialogue: Well then, we should return to rest up.

Original: Rude:I give her the creeps...? Freak, huh?
Dialogue: I give her the creeps...? Freak, huh?

Original: Reno:Well, you are the one who's sneaking around like a creep.
Dialogue: Well, you are the one who's sneaking around like a creep.

Original: Reno:If you don't want them to think you're a weirdo, then stop acting like one!
Dialogue: If you don't want them to think you're a weirdo, then stop acting like one!

Original: Vaan:Hey, Rude, you said you needed something to repair your equipment, right? Will this work?
Dialogue: Hey, Rude, you said you needed something to repair your equipment, right? Will this work?

Original: Rude:Let me see.
Dialogue: Let me see.

Original: Rude:...Yeah, this'll do.
Dialogue: ...Yeah, this'll do.

Original: Rude:You have to maintain your equipment every day. The last fight did a number on it.
Dialogue: You have to maintain your equipment every day. The last fight did a number on it.

Original: Vaan:You don't have to tell me. We all look after our gear like our lives depend on it.
Dialogue: You don't have to tell me. We all look after our gear like our lives depend on it.

Original: Vaan:Sometimes I spend hours working out tiny kinks.
Dialogue: Sometimes I spend hours working out tiny kinks.

Original: Rude:Is that so? Surprising, coming from you.
Dialogue: Is that so? Surprising, coming from you.

Original: Vaan:Surprising? Why?
Dialogue: Surprising? Why?

Original: Edgar:Hey, what're you guys talking about?
Dialogue: Hey, what're you guys talking about?

Original: Vaan:Repairing our equipment. I got Rude one of these.
Dialogue: Repairing our equipment. I got Rude one of these.

Original: Ignis:That's quite a precise tool. They must be some delicate repairs.
Dialogue: That's quite a precise tool. They must be some delicate repairs.

Original: Edgar:I'm something of a gearhead myself. Do you guys need any help?
Dialogue: I'm something of a gearhead myself. Do you guys need any help?

Original: Rude:Thanks, but no. I only trust myself with this work.
Dialogue: Thanks, but no. I only trust myself with this work.

Original: Edgar:Sounds intense. I'll leave you to it, then.
Dialogue: Sounds intense. I'll leave you to it, then.

Original: Rude:While you're here, though, I can take a look at your stuff. Auron, Ignis, how about it?
Dialogue: While you're here, though, I can take a look at your stuff. Auron, Ignis, how about it?

Original: Auron:Thanks, but there's no need. Much like their owner, my gear is straight to the point.
Dialogue: Thanks, but there's no need. Much like their owner, my gear is straight to the point.

Original: Ignis:I've just finished repairs myself. There's no need to go to the trouble.
Dialogue: I've just finished repairs myself. There's no need to go to the trouble.

Original: Vaan:You can take a look at mine.
Dialogue: You can take a look at mine.

Original: Edgar:Mine too, if you don't mind. I've been too busy to give it the care it deserves.
Dialogue: Mine too, if you don't mind. I've been too busy to give it the care it deserves.

Original: Rude:Do you have it with you?
Dialogue: Do you have it with you?

Original: Vaan:Yup! Here you go.
Dialogue: Yup! Here you go.

Original: Rude:Whoa! Don't point your weapon at me!
Dialogue: Whoa! Don't point your weapon at me!

Original: Rude:I wasn't talking about repairing weapons. I was talking about glasses, sunglasses, things like that.
Dialogue: I wasn't talking about repairing weapons. I was talking about glasses, sunglasses, things like that.

Original: Edgar:That's what you needed those tools for!? Your sunglasses?
Dialogue: That's what you needed those tools for!? Your sunglasses?

Original: Vaan:All this time I thought you were talking about our weapons!
Dialogue: All this time I thought you were talking about our weapons!

Original: Rude:Why would I do that? It's the sunglasses that make the man, not his weapons.
Dialogue: Why would I do that? It's the sunglasses that make the man, not his weapons.

Original: Vaan:Are you messing with me!? You already have two pairs of those things!
Dialogue: Are you messing with me!? You already have two pairs of those things!

Original: Rude:Of course, I'm a pro. You don't go on a mission without a backup.
Dialogue: Of course, I'm a pro. You don't go on a mission without a backup.

Original: Rude:You have to be ready for anything. And that goes double for your sunglasses.
Dialogue: You have to be ready for anything. And that goes double for your sunglasses.

Original: Edgar:Huh, it all makes sense now. Sunglasses are your thing.
Dialogue: Huh, it all makes sense now. Sunglasses are your thing.

Original: Ignis:It appears you and I have something in common.
Dialogue: It appears you and I have something in common.

Original: Rude:Yeah. If you need any repairs on your gearyour real gearyou know who to ask.
Dialogue: Yeah. If you need any repairs on your gear—your real gear—you know who to ask.

Original: Onion Knight:Whew... That was a close one.
Dialogue: Whew... That was a close one.

Original: Desch:You think you'd be used to this kind of chaos by now, considering how it follows you everywhere.
Dialogue: You think you'd be used to this kind of chaos by now, considering how it follows you everywhere.

Original: Onion Knight:You're one to talk!
Dialogue: You're one to talk!

Original: Yuna:I'm glad everyone is okay.
Dialogue: I'm glad everyone is okay.

Original: Lulu:We can no longer depend on the order we once knew...
Dialogue: We can no longer depend on the order we once knew...

Original: Lulu:This is a place where the guiding hands of the gods have been forced away.
Dialogue: This is a place where the guiding hands of the gods have been forced away.

Original: Wakka:You guys have any idea what's going on?
Dialogue: You guys have any idea what's going on?

Original: Mog:Not me, kupo... This is all new.
Dialogue: Not me, kupo... This is all new.

Original: Paine:Our only choice is to move forward.
Dialogue: Our only choice is to move forward.

Original: Desch:Seems that way.
Dialogue: Seems that way.

Original: Yuna:I hope they're okay. Auron, Jecht, and...
Dialogue: I hope they're okay. Auron, Jecht, and...

Original: Desch:And Tidus, right? You're pretty easy to read.
Dialogue: And Tidus, right? You're pretty easy to read.

Original: Yuna:Of course I'm worried about Tidus. But there are others as well.
Dialogue: Of course I'm worried about Tidus. But there are others as well.

Original: Yuna:Zidane and Rem helped me when I felt lost in this world. I'd hate to see anything happen to them.
Dialogue: Zidane and Rem helped me when I felt lost in this world. I'd hate to see anything happen to them.

Original: Yuna:They may be strong, but this place is full of danger.
Dialogue: They may be strong, but this place is full of danger.

Original: Kimahri:Kimahri worries for children too.
Dialogue: Kimahri worries for children too.

Original: Wakka:They can fight, sure, but they're still just kids.
Dialogue: They can fight, sure, but they're still just kids.

Original: Paine:Yeah. They could get into trouble if one of the more unsavory characters were to catch them alone.
Dialogue: Yeah. They could get into trouble if one of the more unsavory characters were to catch them alone.

Original: Lulu:Like Seymour.
Dialogue: Like Seymour.

Original: Desch:Or the Cloud of Darkness.
Dialogue: Or the Cloud of Darkness.

Original: Onion Knight:Shealready tried to deceiveAce and the others.
Dialogue: She already tried to deceive Ace and the others.

Original: Desch:Then we should make it our primary goal to reunite with our allies.
Dialogue: Then we should make it our primary goal to reunite with our allies.

Original: Onion Knight:This'll come in handy for that.
Dialogue: This'll come in handy for that.

Original: Mog:Kupo! I sense a powerful presence.
Dialogue: Kupo! I sense a powerful presence.

Original: Kimahri:A friend?
Dialogue: A friend?

Original: Mog:That I don't know, kupo! We'll have to find out for ourselves!
Dialogue: That I don't know, kupo! We'll have to find out for ourselves!

Original: Mog:That's him, kupo! The presence from before!
Dialogue: That's him, kupo! The presence from before!

Original: Onion Knight:What!? You!
Dialogue: What!? You!

Original: Onion Knight:Xande! Didn't think we'd see you here.
Dialogue: Xande! Didn't think we'd see you here.

Original: Xande:I had sensed a faint glimmer of light in this world.
Dialogue: I had sensed a faint glimmer of light in this world.

Original: Xande:I am hardly surprised it was you. You, who joinedDogaandUneiin their vainglorious mutiny.
Dialogue: I am hardly surprised it was you. You, who joined Doga and Unei in their vainglorious mutiny.

Original: Kimahri:Kimahri senses danger!
Dialogue: Kimahri senses danger!

Original: Wakka:Wait... You told us about this guy, didn't you?
Dialogue: Wait... You told us about this guy, didn't you?

Original: Desch:Yes...Master Xande.
Dialogue: Yes...Master Xande.

Original: Desch:He brought our world to the brink of destruction. He's our enemy, to say the least.
Dialogue: He brought our world to the brink of destruction. He's our enemy, to say the least.

Original: Onion Knight:Is he still being controlled by the Cloud of Darkness?
Dialogue: Is he still being controlled by the Cloud of Darkness?

Original: Xande:Hah hah hah! You think I would submit to another!?
Dialogue: Hah hah hah! You think I would submit to another!?

Original: Xande:I am here of my own will, and my own will alone. This magnificent world was too ripe a fruit to resist.
Dialogue: I am here of my own will, and my own will alone. This magnificent world was too ripe a fruit to resist.

Original: Onion Knight:What!? Why!?
Dialogue: What!? Why!?

Original: Xande:A place where anything that one desires can be given form.
Dialogue: A place where anything that one desires can be given form.

Original: Xande:Here I can wish away death and grant myself eternal life.
Dialogue: Here I can wish away death and grant myself eternal life.

Original: Paine:Eternal life? I don't think that'll be as easy as you think.
Dialogue: Eternal life? I don't think that'll be as easy as you think.

Original: Xande:Perhaps not, but it will not be impossible. Those who you thought vanquished have been revived to stand against you once more, have they not?
Dialogue: Perhaps not, but it will not be impossible. Those who you thought vanquished have been revived to stand against you once more, have they not?

Original: Xande:Regardless, one matter is abundantly clear. Light will only impede my goals.
Dialogue: Regardless, one matter is abundantly clear. Light will only impede my goals.

Original: Xande:And so...
Dialogue: And so...

Original: Xande:It must be snuffed out!
Dialogue: It must be snuffed out!

Original: Onion Knight:As if the Cloud of Darkness wasn't enough of a pain in our sides.
Dialogue: As if the Cloud of Darkness wasn't enough of a pain in our sides.

Original: Yuna:Don't worry. We're by your side.
Dialogue: Don't worry. We're by your side.

Original: Lulu:It seems the ranks of our enemies grow. We should find our allies sooner rather than later.
Dialogue: It seems the ranks of our enemies grow. We should find our allies sooner rather than later.

Original: Kimahri:But first...we win here.
Dialogue: But first...we win here.

Original: Paine:You're in for a world of hurt!
Dialogue: You're in for a world of hurt!

Original: Desch:Allow me to assist.
Dialogue: Allow me to assist.

Original: Onion Knight:Thanks, guys! There'll be hell to pay if we let this one run amok!
Dialogue: Thanks, guys! There'll be hell to pay if we let this one run amok!

Original: Onion Knight:Alright! Let's take him down!
Dialogue: Alright! Let's take him down!

Original: Xande:Hah hah! Struggle if you wishit shall make your deaths all the sweeter!
Dialogue: Hah hah! Struggle if you wish—it shall make your deaths all the sweeter!

Original: Xande:Ugh... You worms...
Dialogue: Ugh... You worms...

Original: Onion Knight:You thought you could just come here and do whatever you want?
Dialogue: You thought you could just come here and do whatever you want?

Original: Xande:You are even more impudent than Seymour let on...
Dialogue: You are even more impudent than Seymour let on...

Original: Xande:Very well... In your last moments, gaze upon true strength!
Dialogue: Very well... In your last moments, gaze upon true strength!

Original: Kimahri:He comes!
Dialogue: He comes!

Original: Xande:What!? You!
Dialogue: What!? You!

Original: Desch:Another one... They're merciless.
Dialogue: Another one... They're merciless.

Original: Cloud of Darkness:Hahaha... As much as we'd savor the sight of you crushing these fools under your heel...
Dialogue: Hahaha... As much as we'd savor the sight of you crushing these fools under your heel...

Original: Cloud of Darkness:They are not the only source of light in this world.
Dialogue: They are not the only source of light in this world.

Original: Cloud of Darkness:Come with us. There is less...defiant prey to be had.
Dialogue: Come with us. There is less...defiant prey to be had.

Original: Xande:I have no intention of being your slave once again.
Dialogue: I have no intention of being your slave once again.

Original: Xande:But it seems our goals align for now. Very well, I shall make use of you.
Dialogue: But it seems our goals align for now. Very well, I shall make use of you.

Original: Cloud of Darkness:As before, our presence here is in heed to your desire.
Dialogue: As before, our presence here is in heed to your desire.

Original: Onion Knight:Hey, wait!
Dialogue: Hey, wait!

Original: Desch:Hold on! It's too dangerous!
Dialogue: Hold on! It's too dangerous!

Original: Cloud of Darkness:Hmmm... We tire of that petulant scowl. Here, perhaps this will bring a smile to your face.
Dialogue: Hmmm... We tire of that petulant scowl. Here, perhaps this will bring a smile to your face.

Original: Cloud of Darkness:Take it.
Dialogue: Take it.

Original: Mog:Kupo! It's Xande's dimensional coordinates!
Dialogue: Kupo! It's Xande's dimensional coordinates!

Original: Onion Knight:We don't need charity!
Dialogue: We don't need charity!

Original: Paine:You three have some history.
Dialogue: You three have some history.

Original: Onion Knight:You could call it that. Those two almost destroyed our world.
Dialogue: You could call it that. Those two almost destroyed our world.

Original: Onion Knight:Xande stole the power of the crystals in his pursuit of forbidden magic, snuffing out the world's light and flooding it with darkness.
Dialogue: Xande stole the power of the crystals in his pursuit of forbidden magic, snuffing out the world's light and flooding it with darkness.

Original: Onion Knight:We defeated him eventually, bringing a stop to his scheme and saving the world. But we lost friends along the way...
Dialogue: We defeated him eventually, bringing a stop to his scheme and saving the world. But we lost friends along the way...

Original: Lulu:I'm sorry...
Dialogue: I'm sorry...

Original: Onion Knight:Onedied protecting us, andtwootherswent beyond even the bounds of mortality to guide us...
Dialogue: One died protecting us, and two others went beyond even the bounds of mortality to guide us...

Original: Onion Knight:I can't let it all be in vain! Xande has to be stopped!
Dialogue: I can't let it all be in vain! Xande has to be stopped!

Original: Onion Knight:Ah, sorry... Got a little carried away there.
Dialogue: Ah, sorry... Got a little carried away there.

Original: Yuna:You don't have to apologize. We all understand what you've been through.
Dialogue: You don't have to apologize. We all understand what you've been through.

Original: Yuna:You don't have to bear those terrible memories alone.
Dialogue: You don't have to bear those terrible memories alone.

Original: Yuna:We all know how dearly you hold onto the memories of your allies. Both past and present.
Dialogue: We all know how dearly you hold onto the memories of your allies. Both past and present.

Original: Yuna:After all, you've guided us this far. Just as you were once guided.
Dialogue: After all, you've guided us this far. Just as you were once guided.

Original: Onion Knight:Thanks, Yuna.
Dialogue: Thanks, Yuna.

Original: Wakka:You can't hold stuff like that in, man! That's what friends are for!
Dialogue: You can't hold stuff like that in, man! That's what friends are for!

Original: Lulu:Xande mentioned Seymour. That is...unsettling.
Dialogue: Xande mentioned Seymour. That is...unsettling.

Original: Desch:It might be best for us to keep his dimensional coordinates.
Dialogue: It might be best for us to keep his dimensional coordinates.

Original: Onion Knight:You're right. They might hold the key to stopping him.
Dialogue: You're right. They might hold the key to stopping him.

Original: Onion Knight:Alright! Well, there's no need to put the brakes on this adventure. Let's find our friends!
Dialogue: Alright! Well, there's no need to put the brakes on this adventure. Let's find our friends!

Original: Xande:Hmmm... It seems the Cloud of Darkness is not so subservient as it appears.
Dialogue: Hmmm... It seems the Cloud of Darkness is not so subservient as it appears.

Original: Xande:It matters not. I shall keep a close eye on matters as they unfold.
Dialogue: It matters not. I shall keep a close eye on matters as they unfold.

Original: Xande:I have no dearth of time in this world, after all.
Dialogue: I have no dearth of time in this world, after all.

Original: Desch:I just don't know...
Dialogue: I just don't know...

Original: Desch:Xande seeks eternal life, while Seymour seeks the release of death.
Dialogue: Xande seeks eternal life, while Seymour seeks the release of death.

Original: Desch:How did those two meet?
Dialogue: How did those two meet?

Original: Yuna:When we met Seymour inthat tower, it didn't seem like he knew who Xande was.
Dialogue: When we met Seymour in that tower, it didn't seem like he knew who Xande was.

Original: Yuna:They must have met some time after that, while we were fighting with the Cloud of Darkness.
Dialogue: They must have met some time after that, while we were fighting with the Cloud of Darkness.

Original: Edgar:Well, our ranks have grown over our time here. It makes sense that the same would happen with the bad guys.
Dialogue: Well, our ranks have grown over our time here. It makes sense that the same would happen with the bad guys.

Original: Edgar:We're in a new world, with new principles. We need to pay special attention to what our foes are up to.
Dialogue: We're in a new world, with new principles. We need to pay special attention to what our foes are up to.

Original: Edgar:I don't wanna think about what would happen if someone as crazy as Kefka came along.
Dialogue: I don't wanna think about what would happen if someone as crazy as Kefka came along.

Original: Bartz:I haven't seen any signs of Exdeath yet.
Dialogue: I haven't seen any signs of Exdeath yet.

Original: Bartz:I don't think he'd be able to resist announcing his arrival.
Dialogue: I don't think he'd be able to resist announcing his arrival.

Original: Desch:Each one of them alone has the power to bring this world to ruin.
Dialogue: Each one of them alone has the power to bring this world to ruin.

Original: Desch:It makes my head hurt to think about it.
Dialogue: It makes my head hurt to think about it.

Original: Edgar:We fought against all types in our world, but Kefka was the worst of them.
Dialogue: We fought against all types in our world, but Kefka was the worst of them.

Original: Edgar:I can't imagine how much worse things can get than that, but I suppose this place is full of surprises.
Dialogue: I can't imagine how much worse things can get than that, but I suppose this place is full of surprises.

Original: Yuna:Warriors of darkness from other worlds have appeared before. Worlds that none of us know.
Dialogue: Warriors of darkness from other worlds have appeared before. Worlds that none of us know.

Original: Edgar:That's right. So that means...
Dialogue: That's right. So that means...

Original: Bartz:We still need to find our allies. And we should be quick about it.
Dialogue: We still need to find our allies. And we should be quick about it.

Original: Edgar:Yeah, let's keep moving forward.
Dialogue: Yeah, let's keep moving forward.

Original: Seymour:Well, well...
Dialogue: Well, well...

Original: Seymour:I'm pleased to see you unharmed. I was worried you had met your match.
Dialogue: I'm pleased to see you unharmed. I was worried you had met your match.

Original: Xande:Spare me your tedious provocations. I don't need your concern.
Dialogue: Spare me your tedious provocations. I don't need your concern.

Original: Xande:I've spoken with the Cloud of Darkness. It tells me you seek the release of death.
Dialogue: I've spoken with the Cloud of Darkness. It tells me you seek the release of death.

Original: Xande:Such a pitiful goal.
Dialogue: Such a pitiful goal.

Original: Seymour:Hmph. Speaking of tedious provocations.
Dialogue: Hmph. Speaking of tedious provocations.

Original: Seymour:It's clear to me that above all, you fear death.
Dialogue: It's clear to me that above all, you fear death.

Original: Seymour:You despise that which is not eternal. Is there something in your past that causes you to feel this way?
Dialogue: You despise that which is not eternal. Is there something in your past that causes you to feel this way?

Original: Xande:Cease your prattling and leave my sight.
Dialogue: Cease your prattling and leave my sight.

Original: Seymour:If you insist. Farewell.
Dialogue: If you insist. Farewell.

Original: Xande:This place is inhabited by useless fools.
Dialogue: This place is inhabited by useless fools.

Original: Xande:Still, if this world can be flooded with light, then that only means...
Dialogue: Still, if this world can be flooded with light, then that only means...

Original: Xande:...It can just as easily be drowned in darkness. And eternal life will be mine.
Dialogue: ...It can just as easily be drowned in darkness. And eternal life will be mine.

Original: Xande:Hahaha! And then I shall give Seymour the release he desires.
Dialogue: Hahaha! And then I shall give Seymour the release he desires.

Original: Onion Knight:Back together at last.
Dialogue: Back together at last.

Original: Sabin:I heard you guys had a rough time of it.
Dialogue: I heard you guys had a rough time of it.

Original: Celes:It seems the Cloud of Darkness wasn't your only enemy back home.
Dialogue: It seems the Cloud of Darkness wasn't your only enemy back home.

Original: Onion Knight:Yeah. To be honest, I'm not sure what to do with the dimensional coordinates.
Dialogue: Yeah. To be honest, I'm not sure what to do with the dimensional coordinates.

Original: Vaan:Hey, mind telling us about this new enemy? Xande, was it?
Dialogue: Hey, mind telling us about this new enemy? Xande, was it?

Original: Vaan:You were saying he seeks eternal life, right? What's the point of that?
Dialogue: You were saying he seeks eternal life, right? What's the point of that?

Original: Vaan:Just to live forever? What would you live for?
Dialogue: Just to live forever? What would you live for?

Original: Onion Knight:I think he just wants to prove that he's better than everyone else.
Dialogue: I think he just wants to prove that he's better than everyone else.

Original: Sabin:Why would he want to do that?
Dialogue: Why would he want to do that?

Original: Onion Knight:Xande studied under the Great MagusNoah, along with two other students namedDogaandUnei.
Dialogue: Xande studied under the Great Magus Noah, along with two other students named Doga and Unei.

Original: Onion Knight:When the Great Magus passed, he gifted Doga with great magical powers, and declared Unei would inherit the world of dreams.
Dialogue: When the Great Magus passed, he gifted Doga with great magical powers, and declared Unei would inherit the world of dreams.

Original: Onion Knight:Xande, however, was given the "gift" of a mortal life. He despised this, and went into seclusion.
Dialogue: Xande, however, was given the "gift" of a mortal life. He despised this, and went into seclusion.

Original: Golbez:I see. Instead of being granted a boon, he thought his teacher gave him shackles.
Dialogue: I see. Instead of being granted a boon, he thought his teacher gave him shackles.

Original: Golbez:However, although our lives may seem short, it is that brevity that allows us to achieve greatness.
Dialogue: However, although our lives may seem short, it is that brevity that allows us to achieve greatness.

Original: Golbez:But I suspect Xande failed to understand this.
Dialogue: But I suspect Xande failed to understand this.

Original: Onion Knight:Yeah. Unei tried to make him see that the gift of mortality was the greatest one of all.
Dialogue: Yeah. Unei tried to make him see that the gift of mortality was the greatest one of all.

Original: Onion Knight:But Xande refused to listen. Unei was despondent at his stubbornness.
Dialogue: But Xande refused to listen. Unei was despondent at his stubbornness.

Original: Gabranth:People desire to walk a path of their own making.
Dialogue: People desire to walk a path of their own making.

Original: Gabranth:His path was chosen for him. Perhaps that is why he could not see the value of it.
Dialogue: His path was chosen for him. Perhaps that is why he could not see the value of it.

Original: Sabin:It must've been hard for him, thinking that the other disciples were being favored.
Dialogue: It must've been hard for him, thinking that the other disciples were being favored.

Original: Sabin:He knew them well, and that made his envy even worse. I can see how that would cause him to go down the wrong path.
Dialogue: He knew them well, and that made his envy even worse. I can see how that would cause him to go down the wrong path.

Original: Gabranth:I am surprised that you sympathize with him.
Dialogue: I am surprised that you sympathize with him.

Original: Penelo:I wonder if it was because Xande was aware of his short lifespan that he was driven to go to such extremes.
Dialogue: I wonder if it was because Xande was aware of his short lifespan that he was driven to go to such extremes.

Original: Penelo:Every second he spent worrying about what to do was another second of his life gone. Rashness drove his decisions.
Dialogue: Every second he spent worrying about what to do was another second of his life gone. Rashness drove his decisions.

Original: Vaan:Yeah, but it's not like he couldn't tell the difference between right and wrong.
Dialogue: Yeah, but it's not like he couldn't tell the difference between right and wrong.

Original: Celes:I agree. There are some lines that must not be crossed.
Dialogue: I agree. There are some lines that must not be crossed.

Original: Onion Knight:...I think Doga and Unei knew that too.
Dialogue: ...I think Doga and Unei knew that too.

Original: Onion Knight:They worried about Xande until the very end. They even asked us to look after him once they were gone.
Dialogue: They worried about Xande until the very end. They even asked us to look after him once they were gone.

Original: Vaan:Hey... You okay?
Dialogue: Hey... You okay?

Original: Sabin:It sounds like he was in good company.
Dialogue: It sounds like he was in good company.

Original: Sabin:Even though he wouldn't listen to a word they said, they still cared about him. It takes a special kind of person to do that.
Dialogue: Even though he wouldn't listen to a word they said, they still cared about him. It takes a special kind of person to do that.

Original: Sabin:That's worthy of respect.
Dialogue: That's worthy of respect.

Original: Onion Knight:Yeah...you're right.
Dialogue: Yeah...you're right.

Original: Onion Knight:And to honor them, I have to stop Xande again in this world!
Dialogue: And to honor them, I have to stop Xande again in this world!

Original: Onion Knight:Another task to add to the list!
Dialogue: Another task to add to the list!

Original: Onion Knight:I hope you guys will help me out. You owe me a few favors, after all!
Dialogue: I hope you guys will help me out. You owe me a few favors, after all!

Original: Celes:Haha. You're back to your old self already.
Dialogue: Haha. You're back to your old self already.

Original: Gabranth:Indeed. Things felt amiss without your characteristic aplomb.
Dialogue: Indeed. Things felt amiss without your characteristic aplomb.

Original: ???:Everyone gone...
Dialogue: Everyone gone...

Original: ???:Did goddess lie?
Dialogue: Did goddess lie?

Original: ???:Little bird. Do you know where Firion is?
Dialogue: Little bird. Do you know where Firion is?

Original: ???:Guy understands. Thank you.
Dialogue: Guy understands. Thank you.

Original: ???:This way dangerous? Guy be careful.
Dialogue: This way dangerous? Guy be careful.

Original: ???:But Guy want meet everyone.
Dialogue: But Guy want meet everyone.

Original: ???:You come with Guy? Guy welcomes company.
Dialogue: You come with Guy? Guy welcomes company.

Original: ???:That smell... Blood...?
Dialogue: That smell... Blood...?

Original: ???:Fighting... Danger!
Dialogue: Fighting... Danger!

Original: Ace:That should be all of them. Looks like mission complete.
Dialogue: That should be all of them. Looks like mission complete.

Original: Sazh:They've finally stopped coming. I'd say we had our work cut out for us.
Dialogue: They've finally stopped coming. I'd say we had our work cut out for us.

Original: Firion:When I saw that flood of monsters heading toward us, I wasn't sure if we would make it.
Dialogue: When I saw that flood of monsters heading toward us, I wasn't sure if we would make it.

Original: Sazh:And here I thought this place looked peaceful. Hate to think about what's gonna happen in those woods.
